Ideally located to access central attractions and within 2 blocks of subway.Entrance is a little tricky to spot as tucked away off sidewalk.Clean comfortable rooms. Very friendly helpful staff.Would have given 5 rating, but wardrobe storage is very limited. OK if only stopping a couple of nights, but we were on a 3 week tour so had to live out of suitcases

The hotel is great. The location is central and close to all major attractions, bars, restaurants and the metro and train station. The rooms are a good size and very clean and there is a decent bar with outdoor area at the rear.Breakfast was very good and included within the price.The staff are very friendly, especially the bar manager.

My partner and I stayed here for 2 nights while in New York City. The location was amazing, walking distance to nearly everything we wanted to go to. We stayed at the other end of the city for the other two nights we were there as it was closer to some other attractions we wanted to visit. The room was fairly small, but we were not spending much time here so it was not a big deal. There was a small bar that had some good deals if you wanted to grab a quick drink before heading out. The main downfall was that the front desk called us about 5 times throughout our stay asking about payment, when they explained to me the first day I could pay cash when we checked out. I was feeling really sick and finally fell asleep around 9:45 PM one night and the front desk called our room at 10 PM. We were very disappointed they called so late and spoke to the front desk at checkout. We were told the manager would call us that day and we never heard from them. Besides this mishap, I would go back to this hotel merely for the great location.

Location is central and within easy walking distance to major attractions and Broadway shows! Clean (small) rooms, friendly and cordial staff and very good breakfast offerings. Very comfortable rooms (no view but we were out all day anyway) however, would of liked a fridge in our room. Quaint bar at the rear (main floor) which is convenient after a long day touring with happy hour. One of our best experiences at a BW location. Overall a great stay, thank you BW and New York!

Just did four nights in this hotel with my wife. Ideal location, ten minute walk to Times Square, Penn Station or Empire State Building. Very friendly and supportive staff. The breakfasts here are to die for: every day was a different menu and done to a very good standard. Hot and cold drinks available in the lobby 24 hours and a nice little bar to go and relax away from the Manhattan insanity. Adequate but small gym but does the trick. All good points. However this is Manhattan and getting comfortable rooms at a reasonable price in mid-Town is impossible. The standard room here is small - forget about swinging the proverbial cat. We had a king size bed that worked width wise but my feet were often dangling over the side of the bed! But again this is Manhattan and it’s all about location, locatioon, location. All in all this is terrific value for the mid range traveller who is either by themself or with a partner. All in all, a thumbs up from me.

The location is perfect for everything, close to Macy's and Time Square, easy walk to all tourist places. Rooms are comfortable, huge beds. Breakfast was great, all sorts of choice and just perfect to start the day. Would highly recommend

Our group stayed here for four nights and five days. The staff were all friendly, helpful and genuine. The hospitality was real, not put on. The breakfast buffet was full of both hot and cold choices, homemade and varied from day to day. While the rooms were small the beds were very comfortable. The Mid-town location was perfect for both catching the metro about a block and a half away or walking. The daily happy hour was also excellent and very affordable. Better than in our home town in the Midwest. There are lots of little restaurants, sourvenir shops within blocks. The deli type place next door was also a gem.

My husband and I stayed here for 8 nights to celebrate my birthday and our anniversary. The room was small like most NYC rooms but appointed nicely and the housekeeping service did a nice job. Although the breakfast area was a little cramped, it was presented nicely and we were taken care of well when we had breakfast each morning. Ayman was always there to great us with a smile and a "good morning". He kept a watchful eye on everything and even came to help when my pepper shaker got stuck in the holder! We will definitely stay here again when we return for our spring visit.

We were a great location for the subway access, Time Square, Broadway, Empire State Building, etc. The staff were super friendly and helpful. Every time we in the elevator, at the breakfast, or lobby - if we were near 'any staff' - we would smile and ask how was our stay and if they could do anything for us. The breakfast changed everyday and was excellent. We were very pleased with the food. Ayman was so kind and helpful.The room was small but the bathroom was excellent. The bed was comfortable, pillows great.

My mom and I traveled to NYC for the first time. I scoured hotels to stay at while we were going to be in the city. We couldn't have found a better hotel. The staff, the facility, the breakfast, the beds were all great! The hotel is close to many major attractions but far enough away that you didn't hear much noise. We didn't have a room with a great view, but we were only in our rooms to sleep and rejuvenate for our next day of sight seeing. Close to the subway stations, Times Square, Empire State Building, Macys, and the Theatre district. I would definitely stay here again if given a choice.

The rooms at this hotel are what we expected for New York small but yet clean and comfortable. It is close walking distance to many places including Time Square.The staff are very friendly and helpful but the huge plus for this hotel was the complimentary breakfast. All though it was busy most mornings the staff kept the area clean and well stocked with a huge variety to choose from. The quality was also good.Having the breakfast included at the hotel made the morning a lot more manageable traveling with young children.My only negative was I noticed some towels and linen needed to be replaced as they were showing excessive wear with holes in bathroom towels.

We are from Louisiana and went to New York to see the sights. When we arrived in the city we were afraid that all of the stuff you see on TV was the way it was. We were greeted by friendly staff that helped to waylay our worries. The staff was very helpf ull and gave us great help and directions. We will definitely stay their again.

The Best Western Hearld Square was one of the finest hotels. Their customer service is superior. Rachael and Robert provided customer service that sets this hotel abover the rest. The breakfast was great. The rooms were great. Location was great. I can find no fault or criticism.

We are a family of 4 and booked the Best Western Herald for the final night of our 2 week American road trip via booking.com. Having just arrived back in NYC from Washington DC we discovered that the hotel had cancelled our booking citing ‘invalid credit card’. When we contacted the hotel we were initially told they had no details of my booking and was placed on hold long enough for me to learn the words to their terrible music! Subsequently I rang back to be told that I did have a booking and that my card was declined therefore it had been cancelled. When I attempted to rebook directly I was informed that they had no availability... strange that as I had thought I had a room a few moments earlier. Booking.com could not help as the payment is handled by the hotel. When I checked my credit card not only had they taken the payment for the room they cancelled, my partner received a notification from his bank that they had attempted to take a payment from his card without any authorisation. Luckily this was declined. I am now waiting patiently for my refund. Luckily we were able to find an alternative at a reasonable price. Based on our experience I would not recommend this hotel to fellow travellers and be wary that hotel bookings don’t necessarily guarantee you a room. We strongly recommend that you keep a close eye on your emails to avoid this happening to you!

Kingsize room was shockingly small - I have no idea how 2 people would be able to share that room without stumbling over each other and everything, but for one person, it’s okay. Clean hotel, friendly and attentive staff and a great breakfast variety. Great centrally located hotel with access to many amenities whether you want to walk, bus or subway.

This is my first stay at this Best Western hotel and I am happy to say that it's been an awesome one.I had a room with a view of the entrance and it was ok, but then I found out they have rooms with a view to Empire State building and I made a request for that and it was actioned next morning, very happy with this!!Pros:- Friendly staff- Good breakfast.- make sure to come nice and early because the breakfast area is small and there are queues near to the end of the breakfast time i.e. 9:30am. It starts at 6:30am.Things to note:- Rooms are smaller size than other Best Western units around US- If you're taller than 6 feet 2 inches then your feet might go out of the mattress. The mattresses are 6 feet 1 inch or 1.5 I think- Wallpaper in rooms need changing to make it brighter- Walls and doors allow a bit of noise to pass through, so if someone talks loudly in the next room then you might hear it

I have been trying to find a reasonable place to stay in Manhattan that was in close proximity to Times Square and the Theater District. The Best Western Herald Square far surpassed my expectations. Upon arrival, I was greeted warmly by the front desk crew, who were terrific helpers. The morning breakfast was equivalent to any 5-star hotel, with an incredibly professional staff. All this and at worst a 16 minute walk to the theaters and Times Square!! By the way, Macy's is just around the block. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone on a budget that is still looking for a little class in their New York City stay.

We have just arrived back from a family holiday to New York and stayed in two rooms in this hotel for 5 nights. The staff were so friendly and always happy to help this includes front of house, housekeeping and breakfast room staff - so everyone really! Our rooms were on the 14th floor and were compact, clean, quiet and had everything you needed for a comfortable stay. Breakfast was plentiful with a variety of foods on offer over the 5 days.You cannot beat the location of this hotel with many attractions within walking distance and subways close by. I would not hesitate to recommend The Best Western Premier Herald Square and will certainly be staying here again!

A clean hotel with an excellent location, within a walking distance from famous sights such as Empire State building. Friendly staff, especially Robert from reception always greeted us with a smile. Breakfast with a lot of different options. We stayed for five nights and the breakfast even changed a little every morning.

This amazing hotel is right beside Empire State building. The rooms are small but comfortable. The staffs Robert, AL were great and the stay is relaxing. I would most likely choose this hotel again!!!!

We just came back from New York city. We went to there 3 days for a family vacation and stayed in this hotel for two nights. Overall it was a very pleasant experience. The hotel is located at the heart of Manhattan and this makes it very easy to get around. In addition the hotel has a nice wifi and a free breakfast. Most importantly, the staff was extremely nice and helpful. Whenever we asked them for anything, they were very kind and enthusiastic. I would highly recommend this place for anyone looking for a very good yet also a relatively cheap hotel.

This hotel is situated in a great location central to sights and transport links. We spent 3 nights here during the week. The room, although smallish was clean and quiet and the shower was a walk in type, which was welcoming after having many over bath ones in Greece. Breakfast was great with a good selection. We would definitely return to this hotel!

My hubby and I stayed here On a Wednesday and Thursday night. We were in a room in the back of the hotel and never heard a peep from anything outside… No sirens, no traffic, no nothing did we hear. Our view was of another building, but we prefer quiet over a view. Our room was very small, but as they say, this is New York City so that is the norm and it was fine with us. It was very clean and had all the amenities that we needed such as coffee and very nice toiletries. Breakfast each morning was very good and just added to the overall enjoyment of the hotel. There is a lounge area in the back of the hotel, the drinks are reasonably priced and you can sit outside if you want to. Every staff member that we encountered were very courteous. I would highly recommend this hotel as a very nice hotel to stay in and the best bang for your buck considering all of the amenities in the room and the breakfast each morning. If you want a room with a view, you would need to get a room in the front but it will be noisy. If you want a quiet room, get a room in the back . We would definitely stay here again on our next trip to New York City.

This an amazing hotel and i deffinetley reccomend staying there the pool and workout room out very nice. Henry and steven were very nice and if u can find them u should deffinetley talk to them. The pool is 4’6 all around and the workout room is full or olymticals and has one bench. The rooms were very nice and had an amazing tv i would 100%recommend this hotel

Had an amazing time with my friends. The bartender was absolutely outstanding! Very attentive and skilled. Felt like family...could've stayed all night!I will be back for sure! Ask for Stephen next time you go!

Great hotel the staff are all caring and nice, the rooms are very nice. I cant complain about this hotel at all. The WIFI, fitness center and breakfast are all top notch as well. It is in a great location as well.

Clean, update hotel. Comfortable beds, friendly staff and good amenities. I've been staying here for the past year and keep coming back because of the staff, comfort and location of the hotel. Close to all my meetings. Best, hands down!

We have just started at this hotel for five nights it was brilliant the hotel is right in the middle of everything very clean cool the little touches make this hotel free tea coffee water twenty four seven. The front desk crew were fantastic the breakfast was very good each day free. The staff in the restaurant was amazing could not do enough for you. All the staff in the hotel was great just apart from the misery who run the bar but that was a small price to pay for a fantastic stay we will be back.

The hotel is in a great location but still very quiet and probably has good soundproofing, we responded several times to how it could be so quiet in the middle of NY.Incredibly helpful and happy staff who really seem to enjoy their work and did everything for us to make our stay a perfect one.Nice and clean everywhere, nice decor in all areas of the hotel, not just the rooms and a very good and fresh breakfast.Nice room with comfortable beds, spotless bathroom and every accessory you might need.The AC in the room was very easy to handle and cooled perfectly without being weaned.We have found our hotel in New York and will stay here in the future!

Location: felt safe wasn't too far to walk to Time Square and lots of the sights you want to see in NY. We walked almost everywhere from here and it was the middle of winter so in summer i imagine even easier. Our room was extremely small but that is to be expected in NY unless you are paying top dollar. However it was clean and a good home base with a comfortable bed. Breakfast was good but the room is way too small and cant accommodate the amount of people they have wanting breakfast. we often had to line up and wait, lucky for us there were only 2 so we sometimes got to skip in front of larger groups. All in all this was an affordable hotel in a good location, clean and comfortable.

First time in New York with the family. Staff at the hotel helped tremendously. All were very kind, welcoming and went out of way to help. Beds were very comfy. Waffles at breakfast were amazing, wish they were served every day. Little disappointed that the vending machines were not working was not able to get bottle of water. Would for sure stay again. Also wished they had valet parking, but there was a garage right down the street so it worked out.

Everything was great. Locating in the heart of Manhattan easy parking instructions and prices were reasonable. Room looks clean while size is very small but whatever we need is provided. Robert was genuine and knowledgeable with location around hotel. Will visit again

Over all they might my expectation. Stayed their last year also. Staff is very helpful, rooms are very clean and good value for the price and location. Walking distance to the RW subways. Would recommend this location.

We had a two double bed room at the Best Western in Herald Square. The rooms are up to date and well designed, but small. That's to be expected in Midtown. The hotel itself is the narrowest hotel I've ever seen, but they maximized the space. The breakfast was nice to be able to start the day without going off property. It's busy later in the morning, but the staff does a decent job of keeping things moving. The people at the front desk are friendly and competent and helpful if you have questions. Is it cheap? No, but it's Midtown Manhattan near a couple major subway lines and that location with decent rooms doesn't come cheap.

Location was superb. Close by to central park. But also easy to reach lower manhattan with the subway. The hotel itself was fair. Great service and friendly staff. But a very small room if you are with a party of more than 2. We also were bothered by the noise of the fans kn the ground floor though we were on the 9th floor. If you have ear plugs, you wont notice. So overall great stay for the money paid. Because new york is location, location, location.

Hotel was in the heart of New York City. Walking distance to Macy's, eateries and public transportation.The Hotel was amazing with friendly staff. The check-in was quick and the check out was even quicker. The room was beautiful and the bed was very comfortable. I really enjoyed my stay. I wish I could have stayed longer.

Small room with very little floor space, only 1/2 of the closet usable due to presence of the ironing board, no good place to put/use suitcases (emptied into dresser or full, they still took up the limited floor space!!). The room was clean, room service daily was good, a good shower and wonderful towels but no good place to hang them to dry other than a single hook on the back of the door.Location is excellent - Midtown - for those people wanting a midtown experience.

The location of this small hotel is excellent, four blocks from Times Square, a block from Macy’s and two blocks from the Empire State Building. There is an unloading area immediately outside the hotel on the street although this is often abused by other motorists and delivery vehicles. Once unloaded there is a parking garage for a fee, less than 100 yards up the street. All very convenient.Check in was swift in the tiniest lobby I’ve ever seen! We were allocated a room on the 17 floor (the top) and had a fantastic view of the Empire State over nearby rooftops and water storage tanks. The room was compact, just enough space to walk around the bed and very little extra, but this is Manhattan and space is at a premium everywhere!! The bathroom was great, lovely shower but very little water pressure, but enough for our 4 day visit. The breakfast was great each day and served in the basement, some days there was a short wait but it was the July 4th time period. The hot ingredients for breakfast were varied each day and quantity was not an issue, tables were cleared and cleaned quickly and not too cramped. The breakfast room staff were lovely and very helpful. The bar on the lobby level was well fitted with a small, cosy outdoor patio. Slightly odd opening hours, from 4pm daily, but totally manageable. Tea, coffee and cold water is available in the lobby 24/7. I would use this hotel again and would recommend it.

ThIe location, staff and hotel were a wonderful find for our stay. Hafsa, Bebe, Rob and Jay were very helpful and friendly during our time there. This hotel is walking distance from many of the top venues in Manhattan and a short Uber ride to everywhere. I will definitely stay here again!

If I could, I would give them 10 stars. This is a small hotel with a big heart. They are ready to accommodate all your reasonable requests. We were early and they gave us an early check-in. Not only that, since the room wasn't ready at 9 am(!!) when we arrived, they offered us breakfast which as you know on the day of your check-in isn't included!! We were travelling to Chicago on our fourth day in NYC and then coming back to the hotel for one day - could we leave our luggage for 2 days, we asked. No problem. Then our Chicago flight gets cancelled and we call back literally from the airport that we want to check back in. Not only do they give us a check-in, they also give us a free room upgrade! Also, just to mention their breakfast, the area is small but the spread is by no means average, they keep a more than decent variety throughout the week and their service staff is always smiling, always ready to help. We were especially impressed with the kind lady in the kitchen (sorry forgot her name). Also, Salman (Hope I'm getting the name right) at the front desk was super helpful when our Chicago plans got cancelled. In addition, small things like 24-7 Tea/ Coffee dispensers at the reception, ice vending machines and extended happy hours make a big difference. But it's really the brilliant staff service that sets this place apart. We're gonna stay here every time we are in NYC!

My daughter and I can’t say enough positive things about this property! Clean, efficient, accommodating. We were able to check in early and our luggage was stored perfectly for our late departure.They even arranged our car to the airport. Great job Robert at the front desk and Ryan our amazing porter!!I would highly recommend this property for location and convenience.

Booked this hotel basically because of the cost and the reviews on trip advisor and it didn't disappoint.Yes the rooms are pretty small, with 3 adults on a girls shopping trip with all our luggage it was pretty cramped but we literally just slept/showered/stored our clothes in there. The beds are comfy, bathroom was clean we did have a great view of the Empire state building though.The breakfast was fab and really set us up for the day, the ladies who run the breakfast room are lovely as well.The location was just brilliant pretty much easy access to everywhere.I am staying there again in the summer with my family.

Great hotel with good breakfast options. City skyline views. Convenient location for shopping, entertainment, eating and the subway.Staff always helpful, Our upper floor room was amazing and always serviced well.Loved the bar/lounge area after a long day of sightseeing.Tea/coffee/ice water available 24/7

My daughter and I stayed here because we are familiar with the great service. Again I was very pleased. During the stay we were greeted by very professional employees. The location was perfect. A special thanks also to the cafeteria staff

My daughter and I had a wonderful early July stay at the Best Western Premier in Herald Square - New York City.The hotel is a short walk to all shopping, Times Square, Broadway shows, and restaurants.The hotel is clean, modern, and quiet with a complimentary hot and fresh breakfast each morning. The rooms are somewhat small but with a spacious, artistic, loft feel with large windows and a bathroom with a glass enclosed rain shower.The staff are friendly, knowledgeable, quick and helpful with recommendations and general assistance.This hotel is a special gem and we are looking forward to staying there again!

Stayed here in July with my wife and son. This hotel is very close to both Penn Station and Herald Square giving excellent access to wider New York. We stayed on the tenth floor in room with two twin beds and bathroom. The room was clean and serviced daily. Yes the rooms are smallish, but hey you're in Manhattan. The staff were friendly. Breakfast was served downstairs and included a hot buffet. There is also a small gym on that level. Near reception there is a small bar.A good choice in New York - enjoyed my stay here. Would go back.

We stayed here the first week of July. The staff were great. They stored our luggage while we started seeing the city. Breakfast was yummy and different day by day. The workers at breakfast worked hard to keep the place clean and get people seated quickly (which was great to see someone seat people, better organized).The rooms were decent size. (I have had smaller and bigger in the city). But great for the price. The beds are comfy and the shower had great pressure. My only complaint was when you enter the lobby it's nice and cold. The rooms wouldn't go below 67 degrees. I'm used to sleeping in 59 degrees. So coming back from a day where it's 95, it would have been nice to have a cooler room.Even with that I would easily book this hotel again. Good location to take in Times Square and Empire State building.

This hotel is conveniently located less than a half mile from Times Square (about a 7 minute walk) with great restaurants and shops near by. Staff is friendly and rooms are clean. Free wifi and breakfast and there are two parking garages open 24 hours on the block. They have a bar/lounge that offers happy hour from I believe 4pm-9pm (the bartender was somewhat rude but, whatever). They also have outdoor lounge chairs and tables in front of the hotel in case you want to smoke/relax. Other than that, the whole hotel is non-smoking. We had a very enjoyable stay and are planning a trip in September to stay here again.

A hotel very central to everything in New York. Overlooking Empire State Building. We booked two rooms Quenn for my wife and myself and double for son and daughter with two beds.The double room was great plenty of room but was not impressed with our room. They said it was a Queen bed but it looked more like a normal double.Thete was only a single wardrobe and nor chest of draws .We had to use our cases to store our clothes. We brought this to the attention of reception but nothing was done .This was also a disabled room on 15th floor which we has phoned from home two months before to change but we still got the room.Staff were plesent enough but could have sorted out our problem. Breakfast is included and is a basic American but will fill you if you wanted. Tea coffee is available all day in room and lobby .Rooms were clean and bedding and towels changed everyday if you wanted. Grand place to stay but only for our room all was prefect.

This was my second visit to this hotel. I would stay here every time I come to NYC, but their prices are not always as good as other similar places. Our room was small, but clean and modern and very nice. Coffee maker in the room, Wi-Fi and great breakfast room. My only negative comment is that it would be nice if breakfast room served until 10 or 10:30. I really like this hotel, but I have to shop price too.

Great place to stay! Great location! Great staff! Good breakfast! Many different selections of foods! Family of 3. Very Clean! Loved the happy hour! Great selections of drinks! Good price! Accommodating for baggage holding! Would stay again with pleasure!

Excellent price for such location and breakfast option close to Time Square! The room is small but the bathroom is very clean, with a big shower. Prefer floors from 13 and above to avoid noise, also at the back to see part of the Empire State Building!

Stayed at the end of January for 8 nights and was very happy with the hotel. Yes the rooms are small, but we hardly used it and it had everything we needed in it and was very clean. No mini fridge, however there was a bucket which you could get ice from one of the lower floors so this was convenient for storing drinks. The breakfast was great and included a selection of hot and cold food. The hot food varied each day. There was something to suit all tastes (juices, cereals, toast, pastries, sausages, eggs, etc.). The breakfast room was small so I imagine it would get quite crowded and you may need to wait for a table. We were usually there between 7 and 8 30 and it wasn't a problem. We had an executive room which was located on the top floor of the hotel and had a nice city view. It was worth the extra money for the city view. I didn't have any problems with noise/sleeping at night. The location is great, it was approximately a 10 minute walk to Times Square. Will definitely be returning when we are back in New York.

My family and i have just got back from an 8 night stay in the hotel, we had a fabulous time, room was modern and clean and breakfast was excellent, complimentary coffee, tea and wáter 24hrs in reception. we stayed on the 12th floor and no complaints from us about noise. Walking distance to times square, empire state, we even walked to central park afew times. Subway is just a couple minute walk away. Excellent hotel, would definatly go back and reccomend to Friends and family.

Friendly staff (Robert and Jackie were really nice) excellent and varied breakfast. The hotel has a bar at the back with patio really good and not expensive.The bedroom, it’s small but clean.The only issue is that the carpet smells bad... I had to put the ac on 69 to avoid humidity. Check in starts at 3, but if you arrive early they can storage your luggage . Same with check out, 11 am but they storage your luggage if needed, i did that on both and it helped me a lot .More pros than cons .... I’ll choose this hotel again if needed

Fantastic hotel in a perfect location. The staff were really friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and perfect for our needs. Had a view of the Empire state building which was great. Tea, coffee and water is available in reception which is a nice touch. The breakfast room, although small is run very smoothly by the effecient, friendly staff. We really enjoyed our breakfast before heading off sightseeing. Would definitely recommend this hotel. Also, head on over to the keg room across the road, the food is amazing!

Very helpful staff on the desk and at breakfast. Went well out of there way to help us with directions, places to eat etc. Got the 17th floor looking up at the Empire State Building couldn't have got a better spot. Breakfast was very good and the cleaning staff are excellent. This is a great spot for Times Square, two underground stations , Grand Central Station and a lot more.

I just stayed at the Best Western Premier Herald Square hotel in NYC. The hotel was spotless, very comfortable bed and very good breakfast. The staff was very friendly and kind. Jackie and Rachel, at the reception, were very professional and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel!

Very easy to get around. Room is not big but comfortable enough. Elevator takes awhile if busy time but everything was good during our stay. Very satisfied with our stay. Thank you Jackie and Rachel for being accommodating and doing a good job. Will definitely recommend and stay in the future.

This hotel was perfect for our stay while in New York. It was just a 10 minute walk to Times Square. Macy’s was just down the next block. The rooms were very clean. Bed was very cosy & comfortable. The shower was pretty good also. Breakfast was included in our booking & it was lovely every morning. Reception staff were very helpful & always friendly. We dealt with Rachael a few times & found her most pleasant & helpful to us. I would highly recommend this hotel for a stay in New York.

I was visiting the city for my nephew's first trip to NYC. Jackie was a total pleasure and assisted usp promptly with our luggage storeage so we couldngeg back to the sightseeing. Thanks for being so quick and friendly!

The Best Western Premier Herald Square was just what we hoped for: a safe place to spend the night in between 2 very busy days. The hotel staff is friendly, accommodating, and efficient. We experienced no hassles or disappointments during our stay. Our room was clean and quiet and full of natural light from the wall of windows overlooking the street. There are outdoor spaces in the front and back where guests can sit and visit or wait for rides. We had breakfast plans, so we did not take advantage of the free breakfast, however, we made several trips to the super convenient, well maintained, coffee, tea and ice water set up in the lobby. This hotel has customer convenience in mind.

We travelled as a family of three for three nights at the Herald Square - Best Western. We arrived early and left late - no problem either day. We used their secure locked storage room. The concierge was very helpful on the travel systems available for getting around the city and we used him to book a limo for the return journey to JFK. The hotel rooms are not over large but we are all over six foot tall and managed OK. The breakfasts are varied each day. Again there may be a short wait for food but its a nice time to chat to other visitors and get ideas for the day ahead. Being in Mid Manhattan you are conveniently located for most things and far away enough not to be disturbed by too much noise. I would definitely look at booking this hotel for our next visit to the Big Apple

Stayed six nights with two of my friends. Loved the beds. Okay bathroom, the usual. The view from the room is nothing special if you don’t have a room at the top floors. We ate breakfast almost everyday. A variaty of choices so you don’t have to eat the same thing every day. The staff at the hotel were very friendly. Especially the barmanager Stephen. We were at the hotel bar every day because of him. Great service from him and the reason why I maybe someday would return to this particular hotel.

I will review this hotel very honestly. As a group of three friends celebrating my birthday, we were disappointed when we arrived and found that we had not been given the room we requested. They rooms were very small for three of us and we did considering moving hotels. Well that would have been a huge mistake let me tell you we are so glad we didn’t do it. The staff at the hotel are amazing the lady on reception is so friendly and helpful (I think her name is B.B.) she met almost every request we gave her with professionalism and a smile this included facilitating a room change the following day that afforded us a most spectacular view of the Empire State Building, absolutely mind blowing. She also sent a bottle of bubbly to our room. We requested fridge and this was in the room in less that ten minutes. Very efficient staff. One thing that let them down and I did mention this time and time again was that only towels for two people were left in the room by house keeping and drinks for two also, not a major issue but like I said it’s an honest warts and all review. The breakfast staff were fantastic always saving us our same table daily and the food was way above the standard we had expected, it was delicious and plentiful. We had an amazing time here and were very sad to leave. I have booked to return to New York in December with my family this time however I was so disappointed not to be able to book this hotel this time but it was way out on my price range so I settled for the one next door as the area is close to everything yet far enough away from the madness of it all. There was a lovely Market there on Sunday and Macey’s and other shops are just a few minutes stroll away. The area felt very safe and we walked around at all hours without any problems. One thing that I will have to complain about is the hotel booked a car for us recommending a firm that charge a flat rate. We were quoted $70 and despite feeling that we would not make it to the airport in one piece because of his dangerous driving we still gave the driver $75 he chased us down into the airport terminal and was very rude and intimidating. He demanded more money and as three woman travelling together we felt he was very threatening and aggressive towards us and we felt we had no choice but to hand over the cash and that really soured the trip for us. We would all return here no problem at all (except price) but we would certainly not use the car service again. Thank you so much for making my birthday a very memorable one. New Yorkers are fabulous Love and best wishes to you all Trudi x

Husband and I drove up to NYC from Pennsylvania for a quick one night trip to see Billy Joel at Madison Square Garden. This hotel is great as it was the perfect location for our last minute trip - just a short 2-3 blocks away from MSG. Since Penn Station is right there as well, it would would also be a great place if you were taking the train into the city.Upon arrival, we were greeted warmly by the front desk - the girl was so helpful and sweet. Other reviews have said that the rooms are small, but we didn’t feel that at all. Just normal for the city. The room was clean and well designed with all of the necessary toiletries (and then some).Free hot breakfast was good too and better than your average hotel breakfast. If we’d have been there longer, we would have liked to have enjoyed the happy hours at the hotel bar which was an awesome deal for the city with $4 beers and $6 wines AND it lasted until 9pm, even on the weekend.We also grabbed late night bites and drinks at a spot called Ragtraders down the street and highly recommend.We come up to NYC several times a year to see Broadway shows and will certainly be back to this hotel, as we love that it isn’t right in all of the tourist hubbub that is Times Square but you can easily walk to the theatre district. At $190/night (taxes and all - through Trip Advisor!) for Manhattan in the summer on a weekend, it was an excellent value for the price we paid.

Positives: Every staff member we interacted with was friendly, helpful, very welcoming. Breakfast room was often busy, but extremely well cared for, kept clean and food selections, were always well stocked, We especially appreciated the linen napkins, real flatware and plates (not plastic ). Food was better quality than most other hotel complimentary breakfasts. Many choices too. Room was nicely decorated. Everything was in excellent condition. Well lit. Small desk area and good plugs for charging things. Good AC unit.Negative- Room not very large.

Great location with access to transportation. I have stayed here on numerous occasions. The staff is very cordial and accommodating to needs. From Robert at night to Bebe and Jay in the morning.Will definitely be back!

As I have reviewed this hotel in the past, it is a great FIND in NYC. The location is within a 1/2 block walk to public transportation to anywhere in Manhattan. Several good restaurants and a parking garage on the same block. The service is exceptional. The breakfast is the best we have ever experienced at a BW. Only negative would be the size of the room. (typical NYC hotel)

We stayed in this hotel in May 2018 as a family with two teens for 7 nights. The location is fantastic. Subway station and Empirer Sate Building around the corner and right on Fifth Avenue.Rooms are new, very clean and are cleaned every day.Coffee is available at any time for free in the lobby.The rooms are quite small for 4 people - but that is normal for NYC.Highlight is the free breakfast, which is included in the room - this is not normal in New York, saving at least $ 15 per person per day.We would book here again at any time.

This hotel was in a perfect location. Within a few Minutes walk from Penn Station and Empire State Building. One of the few hotels we found that offered 2 double beds in a room and included breakfast. Very helpful staff. Spotlessly clean and complimentary iced water, tea and coffee in the lobby.Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone considering it

Great small hotel. Rooms facing the front have full-glass walls, giving a more spacious feeling than rooms in the back. The staff are incredibly friendly, helpful and accommodating. Rooms were immaculately clean, breakfast is very good- although very American (not a fresh vegetable in sight...). Excellent location for touring NY.

From the moment my wife and I arrived we were welcomed by a great staff. The location is great to many attractions. The rooms are extremely clean and comfortable with very nice decor and the lounge was great to relax in after a busy day of sight-seeing.

So many times we judge a hotel room by its size and the quality of the room. This little gem of a hotel is steps from Macy’s Hearld square. I arrived about midnight and found the front desk person so welcoming! As I entered my room I thought “hmm a little on the small side”. But the quality of thing in the room rivals any hotel that costs twice the money. The bed was so comfy I was a sleep within minutes. The shower had great water pressure, the shampoo etc was perfect. The best part. HOT FREE breakfast!! Many places offer breakfast but it is only a toaster and frozen waffles. There were approximately 5 people working to ensure the eggs were hot, the bacon pan was full and any question you had was answered. I was impressed with the staff at this hotel I called my mom and told her I found our new NYC hotel!!

We went to NYC for my son's graduation from college. "We" included my wife and myself, my daughter and my 85 year old father. We only expected to be in town for a day and had no planned sightseeing. I had called a day before to see if we could get early check-in since graduation was at 3:00pm and we were using cabs for transportation. Robert took my request and, despite the hotel being sold out, would see if he could hold 2 of the rooms as soon as they were available.We arrived early at Penn Station via Amtrak and quickly got a cab at the taxi stand in front of Madison Square Garden which sits atop the station. Total fare was $11 with generous tip. When we arrived at the hotel, Robert was indeed able to save us rooms so we were able to freshen up before heading to graduation.The rooms, both with 2 double beds, were small but comparable to other hotels in the area. Grandpa was able to navigate with his cane and walker even though it was a little tight. Everything was in good repair, the rooms were clean along with the public areas. Everyone said they were able to get a good night's sleep and I didn't hear any street noise at night (we were on the 9th floor).The first floor includes the front desk and sitting area, a 24 hour coffee/tea area and a rest room. In the back there is a small bar with stools and a couple tables and padded bench seating. Enough room for about 10-15 people. Behind this is a small "patio" with 4 tables and seating for about 20 to enjoy your drinks outdoors. In front is a little seating area separated from the sidewalk by some planters so you can people watch.Below ground level are the service areas and also the dining room for the complimentary breakfast. The breakfast area is a little small and, while we were there, the crowd showed up between 8 and 9 so get there a little early if you don't want to wait. Breakfast was comparable to what I've usually seen at other hotels offering a "complimentary" breakfast; spinach in scrambled eggs, breakfast burritos, pancakes, oatmeal, sausage and toast & bagels on the hot side. Cold cereal, yoghurt, sweet breads and fruits on the cold side. The staff running it kept the hot food refreshed and kept it as clean as possible despite the crowd.The area is convenient to many destination sites in NY including Macy's and my favorite park for watching the world go by, Herald Square, right around the corner. It was a $10 cab ride, including tip, to Radio City Music Hall where graduation was located. There are plenty of dining places within a block of the hotel including a "Pure & Fresh" two doors down where we were delighted with the food.Overall, our stay was quite satisfactory. Thanks to Bebe & especially Robert at the front desk for helping us get in and out quickly, answering our questions and for cheering for my graduating son when he met us in the lobby. They are great staff and hope management rewards their customer service.

Definitely I’d go to this place again without a doubt! It has a very good location, is very clean, the bed super soft and comfortable, the staff are very friendly and helpful! The price also is convenient!

For New York city, this hotel is worth the price, it is close to subways, Times Square, Theatres, Radio City Music Hall - all within 15 minute walk.Rooms and bathrooms were clean and updated, small like all NYC hotels. Ear plugs were provided but I didn't notice the noise.The breakfast area did get busy but the staff kept it organized. My favourite was the back bar that had a little courtyard and a daily happy hour.

Great midtown location, about 5 blocks from NY Penn Station (we arrived on Amtrak) and 7 blocks from Times Square.Friendly and efficient service from the front desk and the breakfast staff. Better than average hot breakfast, including hash brown potatoes and omelettes with cheese and other ingredients (not the usual plain versions).Rooms are small (~ 9' x 19') but have comfortable beds and quality items. Only 6 rooms per floor, but 17 floors. We were on the 15th, which was very quiet (better than expected in the 'city that never sleeps'), and had a view of the top third of the Empire State Building - a nice bonus! We liked the complimentary "to go" bags in the lobby with fruit, cookies and water to fuel your day's adventures.Prices vary day to day - we paid 63% higher for Saturday than for Sunday.

Clean, compact and friendly, knowledgeable staff.Within easy walking distance of the theatre district, Time Square and many of the other attractions a tourist would be heading for. It's in the Garment District and just around the corner from Don't expect scenic views from any room - we could see the very top of the Empire State Building a few blocks away if we craned our necks.The room was adequate with a very comfortable bed, hot beverage maker, safe, hairdryer, ice bucket, A/C, alarm clock and tvBreakfast was included in the price, which was self service buffet style, with limited choice of cereals, fruits, yoghurts, breads, cakes and hot food. There was a different style of egg and meat each day.Space is at a premium in New York and the breakfast area was a relatively small room in the basement.Be prepared to wait for a table during busy times such as weekends.There is also a small bar area with an outside patio, again with no scenic views, which was nice to sit and chill in for an hour or so after a hectic sightseeing day before getting ready for the evening.Overall, good value for money, given the location and would stay again but, as we have been to NY twice now, we are familiar with the subway so will book somewhere out of the main area. Definitely Best Western if possible.hmm hmm

Realize it is the noise problem when it is too lateMy room was on the 3rd floor overlooking the back patio and had noise from Central air conditioning exhaust fan. tiny room sizes i can understand but the noise i need notify in advance

After taking a red eye flight, we arrived at our hotel much before check-in time. Robert, who was managing the front desk at the time was wonderful. He allowed us to leave our bags at the hotel until we could check-in, and even invited us to have complimentary breakfast at the hotel. The breakfast was nice with offerings of omelette, bacon, bagels, toast, pastries, juice, fruit and other items. After a filling breakfast and with our bags safely stowed, we were out on the town for adventure. Robert was able to give us an early check-in (probably around 1 p.m.) and even called our room to verify that everything was as needed. Although the room was small, it was comfortable and met our needs. I appreciated the complimentary toiletries including a makeup remover towelette, shower cap and ear plugs (among other things). We had a good view and the location was fantastic as we were central to so many attractions. We took the subway a couple of times, but were able to walk everywhere else. I would definitely stay here again.

We stayed at the BW for 1 night stopover on our way to Ireland. Bebe at the front desk was awesome, she put us in a high room away from traffic so we could get a good nights sleep, and we did! Room was small, but most rooms are in NY are . Bed was comfortable, shower was hot. Every staff member we encountered was very nice and helpful! We will be back! Thanks

I loved staying at the Best Western Premier at Herald Square. The service and amenities were exemplary. Staying only a few blocks from Times Square was amazing. Definitely great value for the price. Definitely recommend staying here if you're going to be in Manhattan.

Great location, helpful staff, these guys know the city, and are always there for you, whether you need transport, advice, book a table, things to see and do. The Hotel is clean, breakfast is good. I stayed there with my son, and we walked all over. The location, the staff, the rooms, everything was more than I expected. I highly recommend this place.

We were really pleased with this hotel. We were a group with four rooms and they had two of the rooms ready early when we arrived at noon, so we could put our things away. (They also have luggage storage at the hotel.) The rooms were small, but as expected in NYC. They were clean and the walk-in shower was nice. The beds were very comfortable too. It was 34 degrees when we were there and the air conditioning worked very well. The breakfast is included and it exceeded my expectations. It’s not anything fancy, but there is toast, cereal, bagels, yogurt, tea & coffee, and hot food too such as eggs, sausage, hash browns, and French toast. The breakfast room is a bit small and we had to wait a few minutes one day, but not any other day. The location is terrific - we walked to everything - and the subway is a block away. The hotel is very close to lots of shopping as well, and to the Empire State Building. The only drawback is a bit of noise, not from outside but from in the hallways and the room next door. We could hear the hairdryer going. No one was partying though so it wasn’t a huge deal to us to periodically hear other people. All in all I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it. I would specifically single out Bebe at the front desk and Ryan our bellhop for superb service. They were both excellent, and Ryan went above and beyond to help us with a taxi the day we were leaving. Great stay!

Great location. Small room for 2 people. AC did not work and was not fixed. Lights had blown out in room but were fixed. Sunday the room was not made up till 3:30pm after we had been out all day. Room next to elevator shaft......noisey!

Great convenient location, comfortable (small) room, unbelievably friendly service. We arrived well before check-in time to make the most of our day in NYC, and stopped by the hotel to store our bags. They were very welcoming and organized and made it seem like it was no inconvenience at all. Further, since the continental breakfast was still going, they invited us to eat! They were definitely nicer than they had to be.

If possible I would avoid this hotel. They foundered our reservations so I had to sleep on the floor the first night, on a makeshift bed. One should thinks that they might have a futon bed or even a military style field bed ready in case of these situations, but alas. We used pillows and bead spreads. Had to contact the reception several times since the door card didn’t work, and neithers did my neighbours and my travel companions. In spite of this the staff seemed to be equally surprised every time we had to come down to have it fixed. The rooms were a bit dirty, especially the windows, and the breakfast a bit stressful since there obviously were not enough seats compared to the guest number. First night, when I had to sleep on the floor, we got a bottle of inexpensive wine, but I am sorry, that does not cut it…

This hotel is very clean, peoples are very kind.Rooms are little bit small but beds and amenities are very satisfied.Also, Breakfast are very good and tasty.I would definitely visit again this hotel when I come to NY.

Coming with the Greyhound early but check in is at 3 pm I asked if the hotel could hold our lagguage what was nice because it was raining all day. I also asked if we could get a room high up because it was my friends first visit to thw USA. When we came back in the afternoon and got the room keys we were fortuned to be in the 17th floor and we saw the Empire State Bldg from our window. This was for sure the best service and hotel I ever had in NYC. And I also was surprised not to get paper plates/plastic cups in the breakfast room. Thx so much for an exzellent service!

Great location, 70 restaurants in walking distance. Italian Restaurant on premises had a private party, unable to have dinner there.Standard, but good and plentiful breakfast included. Rooms, somewhat small but clean. Staff very accommodating. Some street noise, nothing that kept us awake or disturbed our sleep on 2nd floor. Worth a visit if you are in town.

Visited NYC with my sister. Immaculate room and common areas, fantastic location near Herald Square, easy access to subway, smart, friendly and helpful staff. Great stay. We would definitely stay here again.

Extremely satisfied with my stay here. No problems at all and the price was very good compared to other hotels in the area. The room was very clean, the staff was friendly and the internet wifi was fast and reliable.

Lovely hotel and friendly staff. Room was clean and modern but a little small for 3 adults. Not a huge problem though as with so much to do and see we were out and about most of the time. Perfect location with most of the sights within walking distance. Very handy having breakfast included. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

From the moment we walked in, everything was better than we expected. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. The rooms were great! The views...perfection. I will be staying here on my next trip back to NYC - the location is great.

Great location, easy transport via subway just around the corner, nice clean rooms (if a bit small for 3 adults) and very pleasant and helpful staff. Lovely breakfast efficiently serviced. Highly recommend! Also happy hour at the bar!

My visit this week was just the second time I was there, but the girl at the desk remembered me from my visit there 2 weeks ago. When I asked for a higher level floor, she immediately accommodated my request and gave me a room on the 17th floor! Bebe at the front desk was also very helpful, answering questions about directions and gave me a subway map. They also held my luggage until 1:30 on the day I left.

My daughter and I stayed for 5 nights, and this hotel served us very well. GREAT location - within walking distance to most places and very close to subway line for the rest - comfy beds, good shower, good restaurants in the area (The Keg Room!), free breakfast so we could fuel up every day before exploring Manhattan, and friendly staff - especially Steve in the bar. (Stop in and say hi for us!) The only inconvenience is that the vending machines were not working for us to get some bottled water, but the staff took care of us when we asked them. Would definitely stay here again.

This is a very nice hotel conveniently located in Mid-Town Manhattan indeed and it is virtually impossible to find anything better for the price. The hotel can be very easily accessed from Lincoln Tunnel, which will help you avoid most of the Manhattan traffic. There is a parking garage 1 minute away (you need to pass the hotel entrance when you arrive), and the hotel offers a sizable discount to use it. Two subway stations are within a walking distance too.The rooms are clean, the Internet is stable and fast, and the full breakfast is served. The staff is always helpful. We have stayed at this hotel several times and it is the first New York hotel I would check when I go there next time.

We got a terrific welcome from Robert at the reception when arriving. Everyone is kind and helpful. Breakfast area is very well attended and the breakfast is above expectations. Rooms are clean./peter

My husband and I stayed at the BW Premier Herald Square for 10 nights in April. We were in a studio room on the top floor (17th).Right from arrival this hotel is amazing for the price. Location is fantastic - 2 mins walk to the subway, 5th Avenue, and the giant Macy’s Department Store in Herald Square. 5 mins to the Empire State Building. 5 mins to Broadway and Times Square. We walked everywhere, but there are boundless options for public transport, taxis, Uber, and hop-on-hop-off buses within a very short walking distance.The hotel itself is very tidy, with new fittings, comfy beds and linen, TV with an excellent range of channels (we like to catch up on HBO when in the US). Our room was small, but very comfortable and lots of dresser drawers and a wardrobe to put things out of the way. The bathroom was proportionately very spacious however! Our room looked out at offices across the road. Blackout curtains and ear plugs supplied by the hotel made for a great night’s sleep.Breakfast is free daily - a reasonable selection of cereals, hot dishes that change daily, yoghurts, bread and filter coffees. If this doesn’t appeal, there are delis galore in the neighbourhood to fill up before heading out for the day or get supplies. A 24 hr deli is 2 mins walk. (Wholefoods is also nearby at Bryant Park - 10 mins walk max).Free copies of the NY Times and USA today are also available.There is a small bar onsite, with a happy hour that seems to last from opening to 9pm. Free coffee, water, and tea is also available in the lobby. The only negatives I could point to (and they are pretty small really) are that the water pressure in the shower was virtually non existent, and air in the pipes meant the flow of hot water could be inconsistent in both shower and bathroom sink. The air conditioning unit was similarly a little quirky - it works well generally but can sometimes blow cool air for no apparent reason, so if you get cold at night like me, ask for extra duvets - the hotel is very happy to supply these. To make it absolutely perfect, a small fridge would have been great so we could keep things like yoghurt and drinks in our room, but with so many things available nearby it was only ever a matter of minutes to pick up supplies. All in all, this hotel is perfect for couples looking to stay in the heart of NYC. I can’t recommend Premier Herald Square enough.

My family and I only stay at this hotel while traveling to NYC for business or pleasure, as it is ideally located, has a great and friendly staff, particularly at the front desk and in the breakfast area, has quality rooms and amenities, and is a great value. Jay (Front Desk Manager), Bebe, Zuleka, and Robert at the front desk, along with Debbie and Gina in the breakfast area. consistently go out of their way to make us feel welcome and make our stay a memorable one. We always recommend this hotel to family and friends too!

Great hotel right in the heart of New York but still nice and quiet on an evening. Staff are very helpful and friendly especially Stephen the barman - great company, useful tips and a great knowledge of NY. Rooms very clean and well equipped. Lovely big beds and comfy pillows. Tea and coffee in the room and in reception. Ideal for all areas of NY. Subway just around the corner. Several bars and restaurants on the street. Told all my friends this is one of the best hotels I've stayed in. Highly recommended.

Stayed here three nights in late March for a business trip. Booked this hotel based on glowing reviews all over the internet. However, I felt it was just alright. Room was very small. My room was on the second floor overlooking the back patio and had noise from people at night. Could not stand directly in front of my bathroom sink because the bathroom door wouldn't swing open all the way; it hit the counter. Some device on the ceiling over the bed blinked every few seconds all night. Had a lot of noise from neighbors; I would hear them waking their children up in the morning, etc. Desk staff was helpful and let me stow my bag before check in and after check out. My biggest disappointment was that I hung one blouse in the room closet, and forgot to pack it when I left. After I spent a week and a half trying to find it at home, I realized what I had done. I called, and the head of housekeeping checked the lost and found for me, but said they didn't have it. I know this was my mistake but it seems like when they came to clean my room, someone would have found it and they could have called me based on the booking information. I was in NYC for several hours after checking out; I could have returned for it. I'm sure someone is really enjoying my favorite shirt now. I have to return for another business trip soon but don't plan to stay here again.

My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights. Location is excellent - close to theaters , Penn station but also 30 minute walk to Greenwich Village.Our room was certainly small but it was very functional and well appointed. The included breakfast was very good. Staff was friendly. The luggage storage with a ticket system was very convenient. The price was good given all the hotel's attribute.

Our key cards kept failing at the door at all times of day. It got really annoying after the third and fourth time. I think it was the door and not the keys. However the thing that made me most unsatisfied was the fact that the concierge didn’t verify my identity when we asked for a new key. He just asked for the room number, no name or ID. So someone could do this and say whatever room number they want and get access. Hotel Security 101 people. The maid also came in when we had the Do Not Disturb sign on the door. Too many small things added up and made this Poor rating. The breakfast was a wide variety but just ok quality.

Great location (walking distance to many NYC attractions), staff, and breakfast! Rooms were very nice, clean, and comfy. Staff was helpful in allowing early check in and late check out, and also held out luggage and got us a cab!

Background: We chose this hotel since we had a 2 night layover before we were heading down to Florida. Arriving on a flight from Newark means that the NJ Rail into Penn Station and then a nice 10-15 minutes walk to the hotel. This was the main reason that we chosee this hotel. Bedrooms: We had a standard queen room that comes with a 160 cm bed. Apart from the normal ameneties the hotel offers very comfy beds. Free wifi is of course include in the room rate. Breakfast: Finally we found a hotel that use regular cutlerys and plates instead of the paper/and plastic ones that too many other hotels in the US use. The breakfast included a selection of breads, danish, yoghurt and hot items. For sure one of the best breakfast I've had in the U.SI would recomend this hotel to those that are looking for a central located in the very heart of Midtown. One good thing is that you can walk from the Penn Station to this hotel without to use the metro.

Great location, walkable to almost all popular attractions. But attitude of front desk staff was bad. Felt like they just wish guests don't approach them except to check in and out. Rooms poorly maintained. One of the bathroom lock was fixed on the wrong way, so you can't lock it when you are in the bathroom but someone can lock you in the bathroom instead. Reported it immediately but nothing done throughout our 3 nights stay. Found nose snoot stuck on the sink in the other room's bathroom. Had to scrap it off as it was stuck there too tightly to just sprayed off.

Tight modern clean rooms , no fridge . Great central location 50 metres from Macys , we walked to all sites , Ground Zero , Times Square , United Nations , China town etc.Staff were all polite and helpful

Close to most of the action in Manhattan. Great service. Very helpful with an early check in and holding bags on checkout since my flight was much later than checkout time. Will definitely stay here again on my next trip.

I would have given this a 5 star rating. The only drawback was the size of the room. It was TINY! But other than that it was excellent as far as staff, breakfast, internet, cleanliness, location, etc.

Great location and very clean room. Staff are very helpful. The size of the room is reasonable for the location. Close to most of the attraction. Breakfast is included. Good variety and very handy for a quick start. Lobby is little small

I can't remember ever staying in a hotel with employees as nice and helpful as the staff at Best Western Herald Square. The front desk, the breakfast room, the housekeeping and other staff were incredible! We would definitely return there.

When I first arrived, I was greeted by the welcoming staff. Even though we were early, they let us check in and they were really accommodating. There is always coffee, tea and hot water in the lobby and this was good considering that New York just had a storm. The room looked really great in fashionable NY style. I needed to do work on my computer so the free unlimited WiFi was a plus. The continental breakfast was a not bad either and had different food on different days but it gets a little packed. They allowed us to store our luggage on check out day and that was a plus. Overall perfect stay.

fantastic location and a very good deal for NYC. Hotel room was small, as absolutely expected for mid-town NYC, but very clean and comfortable. location is absolutely fantastic, close to major landmarks and public transportation. our room overlooked 36th street and was quiet. staff was courteous. there is free coffee and tea 24 hours per day in the lobby. Breakfast quality was good, but it took a bit of waiting each day to get a table (5 minutes at best, 15 the longest) but we were a family fo 4 who went to eat towards the end of the breakfast sessions, so we expected this. breakfast staff was quick and accommodating, making sure all guests were well taken care of. would definitely recommend this hotel to others!

Dear travelers and city explorers, if you are not a 5 Star spoiled and you want clean, neat, friendly hotel in NYC this is the one to go to. We arrived at 9:30 and by 9:45 we have been checked in and our luggage safely put away. We went for a walk and come back after 3 PM and our room on a 15th floor was ready and our luggage was taken up by Ryan who also explained us everything about the room and hotel amenities. Room was clean and kept clean by staff on a daily basis. Room and bathroom had all amenities expected. ( I wish there was a bar fridge in the room - that is the only miss). Bed was comfortable. Breakfasts were great plenty of choices for anyone's taste, timely replenished and fresh. Shout out to the kitchen/breakfast room staff who kept everything clean and flowing. This hotel's location is great 2 minutes to Macy's, H&M or Target( Works till midnight) if you need something in a hurry the same time is needed to hop on subway. Madison Square Garden , Times Square, Broadway Empire State Building, Rockefeller center are all 15 min walking distance. If you are a "walker-explorer" this is a place to stay. Staff is friendly, courteous and helpful. Prices are reasonable for the type and quality of hotel you get. Definitely coming back.

We stayed in this hotel for one night,the full breakfast was great, check in and check out was so easy,We left our bags and walked the city and they were returned to us promptly,A great hotel in a great location, use this hotel for your next visit!

We chose this hotel for our first trip to NYC based on the reviews, the fact it was a small hotel & location in the city.First impression was that the hotel looked a bit non descript from the outside and not in the nicest of locations. However our fears soon disappeared once we went inside & received a warm welcome.We arrived late in the evening on St Patricks Day & despite being busy check-in was fast, efficient & we were in our room on the 5th Floor within minutes of arriving.Our room 503 faced the street, and despite being small it was comfortable, well equipped with tea/coffee facilities, wifi, safe & lovely bathroom full of amenities. Ear plugs were supplied for those light sleepers like me, however they were not required as I slept fitfully in the comfy bed. Room was immaculate and cleaned daily.We had breakfast in the hotel daily as it was included in our rate. There was a great selection of hot items as well as pastries, fruits, yogurts & cereal. The ladies who worked in the restaurant always welcomed you with a warm smile & friendly hello - a credit to the hotel.Location on 36th Street meant that the subway was a two minute walk to Herald Square, ESB again with a few minutes walk & 5th Ave TOTR within 15 minutes.If you are looking for a luxury hotel then look elsewhere, if you want a hotel that provides comfortable rooms & friendly & personable service then I would highly recommend. We will definitely stay here again.

My two teenagers and I spent Spring Break in NYC. We needed a no-frills hotel convenient to all of the popular Manhattan tourist sites, and Best Western Premier Herald Square fit the bill. Our room was small and somewhat expensive, but less so than most other similar places I checked out. The room was spotless, the beds were very comfortable, and the decor was nice enough. My one complaint is that there was no mini fridge to store bottled water or restaurant leftovers. We drove our own car and parked it at one of the two public lots that are located very close to the hotel, only half a block away. We didn't use it again until the day we drove home. The Empire State Building is two blocks away from this hotel, Times Square and Broadway are walking distance, and Museum Mile is a short, easy subway ride from Herald Square. This location really is great! Breakfast is included in the price of the room, and was good each morning we tried it. Hot food including eggs, meats and pancakes were available, as well as fruit, pastries, coffee, juice and so on. The dining room is just as tiny as the hotel and the rooms, but the friendly staff makes it work for everyone.The staff was probably the best part of our experience. Everyone from the front desk clerks to the housekeepers was friendly and happy to answer questions, provide service, give directions and suggestions, or get whatever you need. The folks in the breakfast area were especially nice.If you are looking for a luxury experience, pony up the big bucks and look elsewhere. If you just want somewhere nice to sleep at night after a long day of sightseeing, come here. They'll take good care of you.

This hotel is an excellent choice for business or pleasure . We stayed on a family trip but lots of business people staying in hotel aswell . Rooms are small but location is excellent. Macy’s is 2 min walk & time square 10 mins . Subways are also very close ... location brilliant. Staff in this hotel are also excellent on a daily basis they provide excellent customer service , cleaning , reception & breakfast staff cannot do enough for guests ... “Sharif” in reception is extremely helpful & will to whatever he can to help guests have an excellent stay at this hotel breakfast is also brilliant. I will definitely return to this hotel & will also recommend to my friends & family ... overall great hotel & excellent customer service & location

I would recommend this hotel to anyone headed to NYC. The rooms were immaculate, the breakfast was fantastic, and the location made them easy for travel to anything you might like to do. The subway station was only approximately a block and a half away from the hotel. This hotel is well appointed with amenities. I would definitely stay here again the next time I travel to NYC!

First of all, it checked all the boxes of free wifi, breakfast included and near a metro station, but above and beyond that it was an amazingly quiet, friendly hotel. We stayed six nights and actually looked forward to the amazing breakfast buffet each morning. The 1 block walk to a main metro station at Herald Square made getting around so easy. The only slight problem we had all week was a contrary card reader on our door, but the good far, far outwieghed the bad. We know where we will call if we come this way again.

Travelled to NY with 3 friends and as I had stayed in a B.W. hotel before, recommended we stay with this chain for our 4 night break.I or they were not disappointed with the lovely clean bedroom, super shower with toiletries, great breakfast and excellent location. Unfortunately, we did not take the name of the lady in the dining room who was extremely pleasant and greeted us each morning with a big smile.Front of house staff were very helpful and always ready to help with our queries/requests but in particular "Robert" went above and beyond the call of duty to sort out anything asked of him by us - e.g. dashing next door to get a menu for us.Location was super and subway very close by.Should we return (hopefully) to NY, we certainly would not consider staying in any other accommodation other than this BW.

This hotel and it's staff exceeded what I expect from the Best Western brand. Clean and cozy rooms to the restaurant quality breakfast service. Shameza at the front desk was AWESOME!! I will definitely return! Keep up the great work!!

We spent two nights at the Best Western Herald Square and were very satisfied with the incredible value this hotel provides: updated comfortable rooms, breakfast, excellent service and a perfect location - simply in the heart of everything NYC. We have visited this hotel before and will definitely return for both business and leisure.

clean, comfortable and convenient. This was a great property for exploring the city. I would stay here again. Breakfast was a little crowded some mornings but plenty of food options. Great option for exploring Midtown and even the rest of the city.

We were early for check-in. We stood their for several minutes while one girl was on her phone and another on the computer. Zero acknowledgement. No one looked up. No one said, "just a moment". Nothing. Asked for early check-in and got a no based on a cursory look on the system. She seemed disinterested. It was a turn-off right away.Nice man handled the luggage and it is a great location. The room was clean and tidy. Did like the fact they disinfected/cleaned the remote control. Shows attention to detail.The elevator had a very strong smell. Upon investigation, it was coming from the lower level where perhaps they did laundry. Whatever it was, it wasn't very nice to smell everytime we came in.Each time we came and went, all but one of the staff was pretty indifferent. I didn't catch his name but he always had a smile at minimum and a positive greeting. It's a good basic hotel in a great location. Just think the people working their could show some consistency around customer service.

Perfect location, a good room and nice breakfast.Good service, polite and discrete.Amenities at the lounge.Large variety at breakfast time.Clean and with a good service daily.Door men always there, place to leave your luggage before flight time

One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in in terms of customer service & attention to detail. All staff were so genuinely friendly & welcoming. Basic bedroom with all amenities, good tv channel selection, bathroom necessities & really comfortable bed! Included breakfast was fantastic, varied every day & delicious. Location was ideal, able to walk everywhere. Particular mention & gratitude to Stephen in the hotel bar, would go above and beyond to accommodate, made great recommendations for sightseeing & socializing. Maintained a lovely atmosphere in the bar & endeavoured to look after his customers. Looking forward to booking with The Best Western again in the future!

The hotel is easy walking distance to Times Square. The breakfast was surprisingly abundant, hot and cold foods, different selections the 3 mornings we ate there. The room itself wasn't large, but it and the bathroom were very nice, very clean. The staff was helpful and friendly. The hotel was recommended by my AAA agent and I will pass the recommendation on to friends. It's on a side street, so it was quiet and there is a parking garage close by with a discount for hotel users.

This is an excellent location near Herald Square.,They have a great (included ) hot buffet breakfast. Staff was wonderful and accommodating. Very clean and ladies, you should know they provide earplugs! Along with all the other toiletries.

Too short span on their breakfast for me, so I never got to check it out. No vending machines were working during my visit, though the ice machines luckily did as they don’t provide a fridge or minibar.They are also lacking when it comes to dry cleaning service.All that aside; the staff are very friendly, and the rooms are clean and very sizable for New York

As soon as we entered the best western we were greeted by the friendly staff. We were checked in very quickly and given the keys to our room. Our room was clean and comfortable, with a tv and coffee maker. The toiletries in the bathroom were very nice and the shower had excellent pressure. It was also nice and big. The location is great. Highly recommend!

We stayed here for 6 nights as family of four with two teenagers. Arrived late Saturday night to quick check in. Room at the back (204) small with limited view. Got moved up to 901 at the front which was inches bigger but much brighter. Rooms were almost identical. Enough space to manage. Breakfast is hot/cold buffet in the cellar, with enough variety for everyone. Staff were all excellent and helpful advice. Location is great with ESB and Macy's just around the corner. Times Square 15 mins walk and between 5th and 6th avenues.

Excellent hotel .... Front desk staff and other staff was very friendly and welcoming.One of the best thing of the hotel is that its near by Time Square.Close to the prime locations,restaurants,Shopping malls. Breakfast Menu was great, fresh fruits (Oranges, apples, and bananas) in addition to all the other hot and cold items with scrambled eggs and Donuts.I actually stayed here on the weekend.Rooms were cleaned and comfortable.I would prefer staying here again in my next visit and would recommend to others.

Really fantastic stay and utterly zero complaints from check in to check out. We had the perfect stay. Ryan is a jewel whom went above and beyond in his service, even bringing up a mini fridge for our leftovers. The king size room (705) was small but cozy and very comfortable.
