The thermostat came in handy depending on if we were hot and cold, and being able to crack open the window if we were warm or if was a little stuffy was great, too. We also used it to check the weather lol. You can hear people in the hallway, but I didn’t hear anyone in their room, and with our room location not facing a street it was very quiet and nestled in (it faced a smaller alley, which wasn’t bad and had its own atmosphere, but probably wouldn’t be great for people below the fifth or sixth floor). With breakfast, there was a lot to choose from, with exception to the eggs which were nothing to write home about. We wound up eating breakfast around the area a few times. Everyone from the house cleaners to kitchen staff to front desk are very kind and hospitable. You can even bring your food up to your room as the dining room fills up fast. On our first day, they held our luggage and let us have breakfast as we had a red eye flight. The location of the hotel was central to everything. Herald Square is just around the corner. Times Square and Broadway a five minutes away. 34th Street subway stations will take you anywhere you want to go. Can’t recommend this place enough. Depending on rates, we’ll consider this place again.

The room was clean and had plenty of space for us. We were permitted to check in to one of our two rooms early and were allowed to check out late from both rooms. The staff could not have been friendlier.

The room was small but perfectly formed It was clean and well maintained. Close to Macy's and Times Square. Lots of restaurants around. Friendly staff. Good variety at breakfast. Room was slightly cold but otherwise no issues.

Perfect location near Times Square if you wish to enjoy NYC tourist attractions. Very close to the subway station as well. Looks a bit disappointing from the outside but the room is nice and has enough space for 2. The room is clean and the bed is very comfortable. Good Wi Fi throughout the hotel. Plenty of choices for breakfast (although we really missed some vegetables). Staff is friendly and helpful.Shower could be better - almost impossible to adjust the water temperature without getting wet and we could also use some more space for toiletries. We really enjoyed our stay and will most likely come again

Ideally located in Manathan, right on 36th street, with the famous Empire State Building right around the corner! The hotel itslef is nice, bed comfortable. Would only complain about breakfast as options were quite limited.

A small and nice hotel not to far from Penn station when you get in from Newark. Try and getting a room on the higher floors to get away from the street noise. The room was not to big, but nice and clean.

I asked for a quiet room and was given a room on a higher floor away from the elevator. Unfortunately I can hear every noise in the hallway. I’m listening to a plastic bag rustle out there as I type. I think someone is cleaning. I can hear the couple talking in the room next to me, even when they are talking at a normalvolume. Unfortunately for me they are not talking a a normalVolume. They are going out. They are very happy. I’m sure I will know when they arrive later tonight. The doors closing are LOUD. So is the sound of the people closing their curtain on the other side of me. None of this bodes well for my sleep tonight. The room is clean. It’s a small room but typical for NYC. I met friends in the lounge downstairs. It’s conducive to talking. If you need quiet, don’t stay here. If you don’t mind noise, it’s fine.

Myself and my husband stayed at this hotel for 5 nights from 16th November 2017 for my 40th birthday visit to New York. We found the location of the hotel to be very good as it was easy walking distance to Times Square etc. I'd booked the hotel on the strength of the good reviews, and it was a good price too, and included breakfast. We were not disappointed. The staff are very friendly, and although the room was a little small, it was perfectly adequate, clean, nice decor and a good sized bathroom. We were facing the front of the hotel. The breakfast was excellent with plenty of choice and tasty food. The staff again were very friendly. The only negative with this hotel is that the lift is noisy - we could hear it every night from our room. And you could hear noise from outside until around 4am. But it's NYC and that's to be expected. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel if on a budget. PS, the irish bar/restaurant (the keg room) straight across the road from the hotel is brilliant - good atmosphere, friendly waiting & bar staff and great food. We visited a few times and loved it in there :)

This hotel is nice and well-kept. Great location to all major attractions. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The breakfast is decent and there is always coffee and tea available to go, which is a nice bonus. The rooms are a bit small (but this is typical in Manhattan) and the lobby and breakfast areas can get quite crowded. Overall, it was a positive experience and a reasonable price.

Had a very nice time at this hotel. The staff was very nice and helpful. I wanted a room on a higher floor but was not given one sadly. The breakfast was decent with a variety of items to choose from. All and all I would stay here again.

Loved this hotel for our recent get away weekend. It was four of us two adults and two teenage boys. We have a double queen room and it was small but compact and held everything we needed. The staff are amazing and really went above and beyond to be sure we had a very memorable experience. The location of the hotel was perfect close enough to get to everything and it included breakfast, and in NYC this was a treat as it would have been very expensive to grab a breakfast for the four of us. Parking located in nearby parking deck was not included but reasonable. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Loved the location, looking up to the Empire State on the 15th floor. Room was spacious (for NYC) and bathroom was huge (compared to other hotels). Very modern and quiet room (unless someone slams the door, which happened). Food for breakfast was adequate yet I still question what that jiggly thing was in midst of eggs (horrible). Please just do scrambled eggs and regular hard boiled, not pickled, eggs. Staff was nice and welcoming. Bar has outside terrace too, very quaint. Overall, I will stay here again for location, comfort, and the A/C-heating system was fantastically quiet. Great sleep!

Unfortunetly i've stayed in this hotel for only one night. I was at the 16th floor in the executive room. It was amazing! The bed with a huge window in the front with such an incredible view. The room was big to be in New York, the bathroom was little, but the shower was probably bigger than it! The bed was so so so comfortable, it was hard to wake up!! Such an amazing experience, if you wanna spend a few more dolars for a room, the view while you are in bed deserves it! Breakfast in the hotel was very good and you can have free coffee and water!

The rooms are a bit small, but you are in the heart of New York, steps away from the subway and the Empire State Building. The breakfast line can be a bit slow, but that's because breakfast is pretty good.

Great location - close to Macy's, Madison Square Garden, and Broadway Theatres. very helpful and friendly staff Very comfortable beds!! Use of a free computer on the lower level. Very enjoyable breakfast served in the morning.

My wife and I stayed here from the 27th till the 3rd. Our room (905) was ok but a bit small we struggled to fit 2 suitcases in. Breakfast was good the staff there were very nice and very helpful trying to find everyone a table without having to wait too long. Staff at front desk were very welcoming each time we passed through the lobby. We were happy with how close it was to everything and a nice walk to Times Square. Will stay here again if we are ever in NYC

The location is perfect. It's in the heart of Manhattan. All the main sightseeing places are within 5-10 minutes, no need to take a metro or a cab. The room is small, but who cares given you come back late at night just to sleep. It's perfect for a short trip. Breakfast was good too, with some waiting time as in the morning is pretty crowded. The Penn Station is about 10 minute walk.The staff is nice and friendly. I will definitely recommend this place for a sole travelers and for short trips.

Spacious rooms, comfortable beds, ample and high quality breakfast, cheerful staff and a fabulous location will bring us back to this Best Western. Our rooms were quiet and surprisingly large for a Manhattan hotel; the towels were soft and the staff could not have been more gracious.

Four of us stayed at this hotel between 7th-12th December. Booked this hotel as the reviews were great. I even asked in advance if it was possible to have a room with a view and to our amazement we were given a room with a view of the Empire State Building. It took my breath away, there are not enough words that can express my gratitude to the staff of Best Western for this. The hotel is in a fantastic location with plenty of shopping, bars, restaurants and the subway close by. The staff here are amazing and work extremely hard and always with a pleasant smile and greeting. Breakfast was included which was a great start to each morning. We had hash browns one morning which were amazing. Again, the breakfast staff were helpful and polite. Free wifi and business centre was also great to have. I have always wanted to go to New York at Christmas and The Best Western Premiere Herald Square made the trip that extra special.

Great family vacation. Stayed at the BW Premier during June with other family members...we LOVED IT! Great location and the staff are very caring and friendly. During both stays our rooms were ready when we returned from sight seeing! I make it a point to recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Very nice Hotel, close to everything. The staff was very friendly and helpful.The room was clean although a litte small. The breakfast had a nice array of food and was tasty, the room was really small but the staff made sure we were seated as quick as possible.

Shukla, our waitress for breakfast, was amazing. Always cheery and helpful in the morning. She was very pleasant. Also, the soda/water machine was not working properly and while it was being fixed, the manager asked an employee to get me a couple of bottles of water for free. Very much appreciated. Good customer service.

We stayed five nights, with hot breakfast every morning. Walked to shopping, shows, and concerts. Courteous, helpful staff with one exception, but we made do. Overall we would definitely stay there again

we highly recommmend the Best Western Herald Square hotel for its quality and value for money, in a location convenient to all midtown sights and to both Grand Central and Penn Station. The hotel is quite new and very nicely appointed.

Modern and comfortable room with large windows, a true NYC experience for an amazing price. Very well stocked with all necessary toiletries, tea & coffee. We ended up visiting a second time around and we will be back. Great location, right in the heart of the city!

This hotel is situated right in the heart of New York but just down a side street so not too noisy. It’s close to the Empire State Building, Macy’s and Times Square, to name just a few.The room was nice and clean, a bit compact but that was fine, we weren’t there that much so that didn’t matter.The breakfast was good, always several choices of hot food plus the usual cereals, cakes etc, a great start to a busy sightseeing day.If I had one slight moan!! The lifts were a bit noisy when you were in bed at night.Small and cosy bar was looked after by a nice man called Stephen, always available for some advice on how to do things the American way :)

I've stayed at this hotel in the past for business trips. Hotel and room are clean. Staff is helpful and friendly. Location is great for my business appointments in the area. Easy parking just down the street. Would definitely stay here again.

This location can't be beat, especially if you are doing anything in mid-Manhattan or wanting to be in that area. It is walking distance to pretty much every site in mid-Manhattan and nearby. There are also some great little pubs and restaurants nearby if you aren't wanting to go that far or need to grab something real quick (shake shack). This hotel leaves water and tea out for guests, is clean and also serves breakfast. There is a small workout room as well. The rooms are very small, so be prepared. However, they are comfortable and updated. Some of them even have views of the empire state building. The only downside of this hotel was sometimes the front desk staff. They weren't the friendliest staff to work a front desk and it really depended on who was on shift. But, that is New York for you. If you are facing street side, it can be a little loud at night.

Sister got ahead of me. Lady who took her in did not offer temp WiFi in the beginning so she can access reset I emailed to her. Lady did not ask to call me. Bob/Robby (not sure name) was excellent with me when I arrived past 12 midnight! Thanks you.

I have found Best Western hotels to be a reasonable compromise between affordability and quality. I found this to be reasonably priced (at the rate I paid for one night, including WiFi and free breakfast). But having stayed at a Berlin BW Premier I have to say this is not worthy of the Premier tag. Very courteous front desk and wait staff at breakfast. Hotel bed was clean and comfortable as was the bath. The pillows were a little too fat for my comfort but not lumpy. I would stay here again. IMRAN

A very good hotel with good service near Empire State Building and Rockefeller centerand much more, from here you can walk to the places you have to see.Good breakfast and 24 hours selvservice with good Coffey, and you can say hallo to Ryan how runs it.Thank you Ryan for your good Coffey and to all of you on the Hotel for splendid service.I wish you a Merry Christmas.With Best Regards,Rannveig and Hans from Norway

Stayed at the Best Western at the beginning of December. Welcoming reception desk and easy and quick to check in. Room was ideal for us with the bonus of Breakfast being included which sets you up for the morning. Good choice of hot food and pastries.Hotel location is ideal for seeing the sights. The Empire State Building a couple of blocks away and with 5th Avenue at the end of the road you can walk up to central park and look in the shops on the way.We also walked down to the World Trade Center (we like to walk as you get to see so much more of the city), this took about an hour. Easy check out, with no hidden costs. They allowed us to leave our bags in a locked room while we went out for the day as our flight was not until the evening.Overall we enjoyed our stay at the hotel and will book again when we come back to New York.

We had a mother daughter trip to see a show and had a wonderful stay at the best western. Service was great,the room was a good size and comfortable, and it is in a great location. We will definitely try to stay here again!

A group of 4 of us stayed in early December. The location is great , far enough from the maddening seasonal crowds of Times Square and Rockefeller Plaza, but within convenient walking distance of most of the things that you would want to see in Manhattan. Hotel service was exceptional, rooms were surprisingly large by NYC standards, Breakfast was really good and an added bonus was the small Bar area with great Happy hour prices. Only complaint would be the street noises that can be heard all night long if your room faces 36th St., but ear plugs quickly fixed that. Would definitely stay in this hotel again

We chose Best Western for our first visit to New York City. The location at w 36 the st was perfect for our 4 day visit. It was walking distance to most of our chosen sites and close to the metro for any more distant sites. Included breakfast was very important to us. It was a great value. The room was clean, the bed comfortable and the small cocktail longer had Stephen, a great, personable bartender who made great drinks and was an ambassador for his city and his employer. Would definitely stay here again.

Always stay here when in NYC. Very convenient to train/bus stop. View of Empire State Building(rooms ending in4-6). Staff lovely. Good happy hour. Rooms are clean, simply decorated,updated and have very comfortable beds.

We spent a long weekend here in early December and were completely satisfied with our experience.The hotel is within easy walking distance of many landmarks, restaurants, theaters, and parks, Public transportation, including Grand Central Terminal and Penn Station, is also easily accessible. Our room was clean and comfortable, and even afforded a view of the top of the Empire State Building. We most appreciated the staff! Every staff member was friendly, courteous and helpful, but we particularly appreciated the help we received from Sade at the front desk. We will definitely stay here again.

Four days in NYC, BW Herald Square was a great place to stay. Centrally located for subway access. Near plenty of shops and restaurants. Easy walking distance to sights. Rooms on the small side but no complaints there. Very friendly and helpful staff, including Sharif. Breakfast was fine each morning, different hot dishes each day. All in all, nice enough that we’ll definitely consider staying here on our next NYC trip.

We stayed at this hotel this past weekend for a long weekend getaway. The location is great - walking distance to so much! The hotel rooms were small - which is expected in NYC, but very clean and all the amenities. There was also enough room for 3 of us. Our room was at the front of the hotel - which could be a bit noisy from the street noise, but didn’t really cause a problem. The person who we usually saw at reception (I wish I grabbed her name) was fantastic - so friendly, professional and quick! Breakfast was what I thought it would be so I wasn’t disappointed - a mix of hot & cold food with all beverages. All in all I would totally recommend this hotel for its location, cleanliness & service!

The hotel is spot on for being in the heart of Manhattan. The room was very clean and spacious enough New York terms.Breakfast served in the floor below front desk, served buffet style and a good variety to choose from if you do not want to go to a diner.Good comfortable beds and pillows for the head to sink into a good sleep after long walks.Staff very helpful from front desk to bar, can arrange transfers at a cost back to airport and keep baggage secured if your flight is later after checkout.A good hotel all round and perfect location, would would recommend and will return hopefully in the near future as the love of New York gets stronger with each visit.

We spent 3 night at the Best Western Premier in NYC is was fantastic, BEBE at the front desk was the greatest she was so helpful the entire time and the bartnder made our stay extra special with his great service. We will stay again next year.

My daughter and I travelled to NYC for a shopping expedition and I wanted to ensure we stayed somewhere convenient to the shopping.The hotel is a quick 5-7min walk from Penn Station and literally around the corner from Macy's and Lord and Taylor. On top of this, there is a Metro station about 3 min away which made it easy to get to shops in other parts of NYC.We have travelled a lot over the States and found this Best Western to be a good mid range hotel...that also provided an ok breakfast.We stayed in a King room.The room was a good size by NYC standards and we had plenty of space for our bags.The bathroom was very clean, both toilet, basin and shower.We booked the hotel via Expedia and check in/out was super easy and hassle free.In the foyer entrance there is free tea and coffee provided.Usually when we travel, we have 6 in our party, 2A and 4C. I'm not sure the rooms would cater for that size group but I am comfortable in recommending the rooms are suitable to 2A and 2C without much squash.There are many restaurants in the vicinity so you are not short on eating choices.

I have absolutely nothing but good things to say about our stay here. It was clean, perfect location and the staff went above and beyond to make our stay a pleasant one. We will stay here every time we visit New York.

Great central location for Midtown, with easy walking to all of the Midtown attractions. For the cost, I expected a nicer hotel, but maybe that is just what you deal with in NYC! Our room was cramped but was bigger than I expected. The small breakfast area is far too tight to accommodate the amount of people. After 2 mornings (out of 5), we avoided it altogether. Our room felt dingy and stuffy. The front desk staff were all very nice. If this is a premier location, I would hate to see what the other hotels are like!

We stayed at this hotel for three nights; It's an affordable hotel for NYC standards; rooms are not too small, everything looks new and very clean. Our room was in the 17Th floor, had a nice view, but was bit noisy because the elevator system was just on top. Staff is very attentive. Overall was a very good experience. Will be back.

Great staff very helpful. Quick check in, deposit required either on card or $100 cash.Comfortable beds & pillows. Lots of variety with at the hot/cold breakfast. Housekeeping was very good replaced towels/toiletries/tea/coffee daily.Small fitness centre. Free Tea/Coffee/Water in reception area also included free Wi-Fi.Plus computer & printer also available.The bar is nice with a patio area out back, drinks at reasonable prices. Also had seating at front of hotel ideal for smokers.Good location being in midtown/Empire State area. Close to Macys, Time Square, Empire State Close to subway station, very easy to get around close to shops & places to eat. Would recommend for all types of travellers

This was one of the friendliest hotels that I have ever stayed at. Our room had a beautiful of the Empire State Building. The hotel was extremely clean, staff courteous and breakfast was amazing. Could not beat the location, centrally located and very easy to get around the city. Thank you for a great visit!!

pillows very poor quality. Double bed very small. Nice bathroom. Steve bar man wonderful service. No bar service at weekend.Hotel good value . Stayed here last week November. Near Macy's and plenty restaurants in area. Good breakfast with good staff.

I stayed here for 2 nights and was very impressed by the kindness of the staff (Sade, in particular). The location is wonderful- close to transportation and a lot of places to eat nearby. I had a view of the Empire State Building from my room, which was a nice surprise. The bed was comfortable and the room overall was small, but what I expect in NYC. Breakfast was simple, both hot and cold foods, and the nice thing is that it begins at 6:30 am for those needing to be up and about early. I would definitely stay here again. My only complaint is that I called the front desk for a wake-up call the night before I left and the nice gentleman who answered told me he would put in 2 calls a few minutes apart, just in case. I never got either call. Fortunately, I had also set my phone alarm and the wake-up call was a back-up. Still, for those needing to catch early flights, it's good to be aware that you should not depend on the call coming through- always set your phone alarm.

The hotel is very well located, very near to Macy's and Empire State and a few blocks of Times Square. Nice rooms, clean and well equipped. Rooms could be a little bigger, anyway it's ok. The breakfast is good. I recommend!

Our family of four stayed for three nights. The check in was quick when we arrived at 11pm on Wed. The front desk team member was nice enough to bring two grab and go bags to our room for my young boys. When we arrived to our 13th floor room, the room was warm and clean. There were earplugs on the nightstand but we didn't need them. We didn't hear much noise throughout our stay. We loved being able to walk to the train from our hotel.

Before going to New York I looked (and booked) at loads of different hotels but I settled on this one based on the reviews and on the whole it didn't disappoint. The staff on reception were really welcoming on arrival and we quickly settled into our room. The room was a decent size, big enough for 2 queen beds with enough room to walk around and came with a desk, chest of drawers and a single wardrobe. The room also has a coffee machine (or hot water boiler) and a bathroom with toilet, sink and huge shower. There was a huge range of toiletries provided including face wipes, body lotion, ear buds and even shoe shine wipes. Be aware that the wardrobe space is largely cosmetic as it houses the safe, iron and ironing board. The bar area is small and there are only a few chairs but the barman Steve is a brilliant guy and looks after you really well. Drinks are reasonably priced and are not watered down and I'm sure in the summer its a really lovely space but one wall is made of glass doors and it was quite chilly overall. One thing to note is that the bar is NOT open on a Saturday so if you want a drink you'll have to go elsewhere.One of the reasons I chose this hotel was for the breakfast, for me this was where the hotel really fell short of expectations. On our first visit it seemed like there was plenty of choice but as the week went on we realised it eas actually quite basic. There was plenty of continental choice but the hot food was weak and although they were advertised, not once in 6 days did we see any waffles and when we asked for them we were told that the hotel couldn't get hold of them. Seriously? You can't get hold of a waffle in New York? Total let down. On the last day we chose to go out and pay for breakfast as that was the only way we were going to get a waffle at all. The staff in the breakfast room were also less than helpful and one in particular gave off a definite air of wanting to be somewhere or anywhere else! If all you want is a quick bite, I'd recommend the brioche loaf but wear a coat - the room is freezing.....Overall I would stay again and I would recommend the hotel but I'm not convinced that it's as good as it could or should be.Final note : check under your bed, ours had a thin layer of mould growing which we didn't notice until the last day.

My husband and I have just returned from a 4 night stay in the hotel as a 60th birthday treat from him and our children. The room was spotlessly clean and was cleaned every day of our stay. I noticed some comments about the size if the rooms but a( the footprint of the hotel is tiny and b) I didnt travel all the way to New York from the UK to stay in my room: I only needed to sleep in it, which I did extremely well in a huge, comfortable, clean bed. A bonus was the view from the window of The Empire State Building.Breakfasts were tasty and varied every morning and all the staff we encountered were pleasant and helpful. We were able to use hotel facilities to access and print boarding passes for our return home.The location is perfect for exploring the city and the hotel contributed a great deal to a wonderful experience.

This hotel is great. Great bar with happy hour, breakfast which is different each morning. The room was great and was on floor 17 with full empire view!!! All the staff were lovely and really friendly. It is really good hotel with TimeSquare only 2 min away. Thanks, Nick & Kerry - England

Best Western Premier Herald Square is a hidden gem - great value, easy walking distance to Penn Station (and trains to Newark), and various subways. Rooms are very clean and comfortable, albeit somewhat small (think typical Parisian hotel rooms but slightly larger). My main problem was with the lights in the room. I am not a fan of the current fashion to put in the dim bulbs, especially in the bathroom. Breakfast is nothing to write home about. If you really want a decent cup of coffee, walk a block to 5th avenue and enjoy Maison Kayser. For very good bagels, look up Best Bagels.

My family stayed at this hotel for a 3 day trip to NYC. The property is perfectly located to experience the sights and sounds of Manhattan ( 2 blocks from the ESBO ). One caveat would be the size of the rooms, which were small, but the team at the hotel was amazing and I would say Jay ( front desk supervisor ) might be the most helpful and attentive of them all...Jay helped in many ways including transportation and location recommendations. Also, this hotel has a great breakfast included in the room rate. If we go back to NYC, will definitely stay here thanks to Jay.

I had the pleasure of staying @ the Best Western in Herald Square New York for a period of one week.I checked out only just last week,Thursday November 16th and I was sad to leave as I had got to like the hotel and its brilliant staff @ the front reception,but when its time to go home its time to go.On my day of arrival a week earlier I must have looked a sorry sight after such a long journey from Ireland,but within the space of 10 minutes I was in my room.The view I had was NOT the empire state building but of an office block,so close I could see their computer screens!! The room I had was very clean,especially the bathroom,and housekeeping coming in each day kept it that way.The bed sheets were also very clean and no complaints at all.They were whiter than white in other words.The breakfast room was opened each morning @ 6.30am.I never have a cooked breakfast so everything I wanted was here.Just as at home I did not do without my daily bowl of porridge during my stay here + a few slices of toast and tea I was ok for the day.There were also 3 types of cereals to choose from,as well as brown or white bread + yoghurts in the fridge.You selected your own.Cooked breakfast was also available to anyone who wanted one.I can't make any comment about the lounge as I never frequent them,and can't comment about their evening menu as I generally always eat out when I am away from home.However their menu on display @ reception looked fine to me.There is only one small negative point I need to make and that is the tea/coffee making device{I can't recall its proper name now}in my room.I couldn't quite get my head round it after I had checked in,but I finally managed to produce for myself a cup of tea.Due to it being a fiddly little device it was the only cup I had.I think I may be right in saying that people from the UK prefer a kettle.Now there are available on the market small plastic kettles which are only big enough for 1 or 2 cups of tea/coffee. which I think most people would find more useful.Outside the hotel there are plenty of shops,as well as an Irish pub which I called into most days as I was able to have dinner from home.Macy's department store is just around the corner,and Penn station where you can get your NYC transporter bus back to JFK,is only 3 streets away.About a 10 minute walk.I couldn't finish off this review without saying something about my room which some people might think funny,and I suppose it is comical,althought its not supposed to be, and that is that everytime I switched on my TV set it would automatically retune itself to my favorite channel CNN.What better reminder of home could I have than that!!

Wow- this hotel was great! Super clean and convenient to everything. Breakfast was everything you need it to be! Brought my mom and thirteen yr old daughter for some NYC fun and this was a wonderful hotel for us. The room was typical size for NY- but if you are here for fun you will not care that it is small because you will not be on it much. Overall we felt this hotel was great for the price. Would definitely stay here again!

Awesome location. Clean. Friendly and welcoming staff. Breakfast was great. Good value for the money given you're staying in midtown Manhattan. My room was on the 2nd floor and I was initially nervous that the street noise would keep me up at night. Surprisingly 36th St wasn't terribly noisy .. and the hotel provided earplugs which further helped. If you're looking for a fancy hotel this probably isn't for you. But if you're looking for an affordable option which is centrally located (and clean) this is the place for you.

Nice clean and tidy hotel.Fantastic location close to everything!We felt the rooms were small. We weren’t impressed with the breakfast selection.Be careful when booking with hidden charges and tax. We booked on booking.com for 2 nights and ended up paying an extra $200. In Ireland those charges are included when booking and hotel and we didn’t realise. When we looked back on Booking.com we realised it is highlighted in small print.

Let me just say, I would definitely stay here again! We went to NYC to see a musical and shop at Macys. Hotel is in a great location, nice room, comfy bed, pleasant staff, delicious (free)breakfast. We couldn't ask for anything more!

I'm a diamond select member at Best Western and currently staying here. I'm having a great experience so far. The bartender ,Stephen, is great. He's super nice and very informative. Even gave us a few places that we should check out. Locals advise is always the best!

The little hotel that could. Although it has a small footprint, the customer service was 1st class from the front desk, Ryan (bell hop), to the breakfast staff. Everyone always greeted me warmly. The rooms have been updated and the amenities are fantastic. They even offered earplugs for the light sleepers. If there is anything to improve, I say the lighting in the bathroom. It's a bit dingy green, but still doable. Great stay!

We stay here for two night because we were.going to a gig at madison sq gardens it’s close to venue, easy to get to via subway , clean hotel tea n coffee in room there is a bar not sure of opening hours, good breakfast good selection different each day , we had mixed help from front desk one girls attitude was if I must yes I would stay here again overall good little hotel

This is small hotel with a big heart. We stayed for 4 nights and were very impressed with the hospitality from all the staff and especially the very professional and friendly bar manager. The room was well appointed and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel is in an excellent location in mid Manhattan and we thoroughly enjoyed a short walk to shopping at nearby Macy's apartment store and experiencing Broadway at night. We also stayed at a larger more expensive hotel in Manhattan and the Best Western Premier beat it easily for service, comfort and value for money! We highly recommend this hotel to other travelers. Make sure you take advantage of the wonderful hotel breakfasts each morning.

My wife and I spent two nights in the BWPHS. Even though we arrived several hours before check-in time, we were checked in right away. The room was small but clean, with a three-drawer bureau and a narrow wardrobe for coats. Space for luggage was limited. The bedside lamps were not bright enough for easy reading; the room had one chair. Breakfast and in-room wifi were free as were the shower cap and earplugs, which we didn't need. Every staff person we encountered was cheerful and helpful. The front desk staff stored our luggage after check-out and mailed letters for us. We left very satisfied with this property.

Superb location in central Manhattan close to Bryant Park, subway, cafes and major shopping areas. The staff was really friendly and professional. Our room was not very big but quite a reasonable size for two adults, modern, clean and comfortable. I was very pleased with the bathroom and especially with the reasonable lighting. Surprisingly, for the first time in my life, I see a hotel offering make-up remover; what a treat since I didn't have any with me on my first night.Breakfast was a buffet with a good choice between savoury and sweet. At times, it could get super busy with a long queue later in the morning so I would recommend getting there very early on to grab a table.On the whole, we had a very pleasant stay for 3 nights at the Premier Herald Square.

The room was extremely beautiful, but small. The service was excellent. I greatly appreciated the staff responding: "It is my pleasure" when I said thank you. When I reached the room (my husband was parking the car), I found that I had only two bucks for the tip. I apologized and said we would come back a little while later to add money to the tip. The man was extremely gracious. He made me feel very good. High cost. No refrigerator.

Nice place, rooms are nice and very well kept and clean. Especially the cleaning ladies and breakfastservice is very nice! Good breakfast with quite some choice, everyday some kind of egg and sweets.But for this amount of money I would love to have some extra (small) services. Like the availability of umbrellas for guests, or someone who helps you getting a cab. Not exactly what i expected from a “premier” hotel.

Fabulous location with the most fantastic view of the Empire State Building. The front desk agents went above and beyond to make out stay great. Their big smiles and happy demeanor was refreshing when you come in from walking all day in NYC where people are in a rush and not too happy.I highly recommend this hotel. The rooms are very comfortable, impeccable and functional. Well done BWPHS!

Excellent location in mid town Manhattan. Close to public transport - subway is nearby. Staff are excellent - very friendly and helpful. Like most hotels in NYC the rooms are small but they are clean and tidy and are well maintained. The hotel is non smoking which is a plus. The bar downstairs is great - the bar manager Stephen is a wonderful host and very helpful about what’s what locally. Close to good bars and grills as well.

This is a great NYC hotel. The staff are professional, friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and bright. Air conditioner is a little noisy and the pillows are not the best but everything else was outstanding. Free breakfast was a nice bonus. Within walking distance to many attractions and Herald square subway is just around the corner. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Hotel exceeded expectations. Centrally located to everything we wanted to see while in NY. Hotel was clean and we found the room was plenty spacious for 2. The staff was super friendly and there was a nice happy hour in the lounge area.

Very friendly staff - responsive to requests, very clean, excellent location close to several subway stops and Penn Station. The only negative, the room 1505 is very small. and the closet is extremely.

I stayed here this past weekend for the NYC marathon and the location was perfect for all my needs. It was a 15-20 minute walk to the expo, very close for catching the bus from midtown and easy to get back from the finishing line as well. The staff was very friendly and motivating me for the race when I checked in.Only tip is that the walls are a bit thin but they left ear plugs for us in the room so this worked just fine for us.At the moment, I think I will never run this race again but if I do go back, I would definitely stay here again!

Short getaway, platinum BW member. Stayed with points, great value for this area. Walking distance to Times Square, Theater District and transportation. Staff very pleasant and helpful all shifts. Breakfast area kept clean, replenished and flowing during a busy time. Clean and comfy room (very small, but NYC space is at a premium!), partial view of Empire State Bldg. Will definitely return!

This hotel is in a row with other "chain" hotels. The exterior of the BEST WESTERN should be updated as the others look more inviting. The lobby is very small but there was ALWAYS coffee and tea in the lobby. That's a nice touch!

This hotel has the best location. Times Square; Empire State Building; 5th Avenue; Macy’s, Central Park are all within walking distance. It is close to Penn station and the Bus station. We had booked the room with 2 double beds and it was very comfortable for the 3 of us ( couple& teenage kid). The staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast is good- tasty and filing. Overall the experience was satisfying and is recommended.

A wonderful location and great service. Their recommendations for places to eat, visit and car service were excellent. The view of the Empire State Building was an absolute plus. During check in we were given a lower level room, upon our request we were given a room close to the top level. We recommend this hotel to anyone who plans a trip to New York City and surrounding cities.

Spent 2 nights at this hotel with my son and daughter-in-law. Although the room was small (as expected in NYC) it was quite comfortable for three adults, very clean and with all the amenities we could want. When I requested an extra blanket, it was brought to our room immediately. We were able to leave our bags at the hotel after check-out and retrieve after another day of sightseeing! Location is excellent, walking distance to Penn Station, Macy's, Empire State Bldg., subway stations, eateries! Breakfast choices were plentiful, although some of the hot choices seemed to be pre-packaged. A waffle maker would be a nice addition! Overall, a great choice and I would definitely stay here again!

We enjoyed our premium room that we were offered as Best Western Reward Diamond members, it is bigger allthough not huge. All rooms in NYC are on the smaller side. Very good breakfast and excellent location! Would come back!

The rooms are clean, which is, for us, the most important part of a hotel. Some hotels have fancy entrances but horrible rooms. This hotels appears to be recently renovated and the rooms and bathrooms are clean. The elevator is a little slow, but not a big problem. The main problem here is the breakfast area, which feels very crowded all the time. Breakfast food quality could be improved. The location of the hotel is ideal, a few blocks from Broadway and Times Square. Staff is very friendly and always attentive. Overall a good choice.

10/8/17 through 10/14/17. I arrived a little early but was allowed to check in right away. Standard Queen room was about the size I've come to expect from NYC hotels, certainly not large but it didn't feel cramped at all. All the necessities were provided including a small safe. The only addition that would have been appreciated was a mini-fridge but, in my experience, those are rare. I got along just fine for my six night stay but I would say a couple or even just a single lady might find the drawer and closet space lacking. One small bedside "Bible" drawer and a skinny closet was all there was. The bathroom probably wouldn't satisfy a woman's counter space requirements either but again, it was fine for me.I love this location on 36th street. Stayed next door during Columbus Day week last year as well. The Herald Square subway station is very close and Penn Station is easily reachable as well. It's safely away from the chaos of Times Square and there's plenty of food options nearby.The staff was amazing. From the front desk to housekeeping to the breakfast room employees, I've never experienced a friendlier or more efficient group, at any hotel.I was initially a little disappointed with the view from my 12th floor room overlooking an alley until I glanced up. (see attached photo)Can't wait to return to New York and I wouldn't hesitate to stay at BWHS again. Terrific experience from start to finish.

This hotel is within a few minutes' walk to all the mid-town attractions, including Grand Central Terminal, which can get you everywhere else. Very comfortable bed, ultra-clean room, tasty breakfast -- how can you lose?

We spent 4 nights in the best western premier Herald square for our 1st visit to New York. We are a family of two adults and a 12 year old kid. 1st impressions of the hotel were good. Check in was easy and our room was nice. The room wasn't massive but totally fine for our needs, lovely bathroom and very comfy beds. It is a smaller hotel but I think that is a good thing. We never waited on lifts and all the staff were very friendly. Breakfast was included and was very good. A great range of hot and cold food. Very attentive staff who constantly replenished food and cleared tables. On our last night we visited the hotel bar..... wished we had visited before. Lovely outdoor space, very friendly bar staff and very nice range of beers with a very good value happy hour. This hotel doesn't outwardly seem super fancy but it suited all our needs and really grew on us. It had a fantastic location for exploring New York. Only 5 minutes from the subway and loads of nice restaurants nearby. There is so many hotels in New York but I would definitely be happy to return to this hotel.

This hotel is behind the Empire State Building. We could see it out our window. The rooms are small and the beds appear to be full not queen, in a 2 bed room. The breakfast is good, but not easy to find a table. We could walk to Times Square. Very close to Subway. Easily take Uber or Lyft.

This BW is in a fantastic location. No more than 5 minutes walk to the Empire State Building and less than that to the nearest subway. Macy's is just around the corner. From start to finish the staff, of which there were many, were friendly and helpful.Our room was very comfortable with a quality large bed, safe, good tv, and plenty of storage space. The bathroom was very good with a superb showerIt has a small fitness centre although I didn't actually use itBreakfast was really good with an extensive choice of very nice food and drinks and coffee was constantly available at reception All the staff deserve big credit for their attitude to customer service. We would certainly go back

This was a great hotel as far as location and set up for the four of us. We all stayed in one room and it was the most fun even though a little crowded at times....We just made the most of it and enjoyed our fun time together in a clean, comfortable environment. The hotel staff was particularly friendly and fun as well.

We enjoyed our stay very much at this hotel. Our room was big & roomy. McDonald's & Shake Shack are nearby to eat at. Good location & within walking distance of everything. I don't believe we caught the subway anywhere but walked to where we wanted to go to.

We enjoyed our stay. They let us check in early which we appreciated. The room was typical for NYC and everyone was very friendly. The location was a good home base, we could get anywhere we wanted to go quite easily. Good restaurants on the block also. We would definitely stay here again.

Our family of 4 (2 adults, 2 kids) stayed here for 3 nights. The location was spot on. Very close to Times Square, a few blocks away from Empire State Building, and within walking distance to a subway station. You turn around the corner and there's the H & M shopping mall and Macys, and on the other side, you have McDonalds and pharmacy for all your meds and grocery needs. Was on the quiet side too so we all had good nights rest. As for the hotel, free breakfast was great, has a gym (which was very useful), free coffee and tea on the lobby, in house restaurant, and beds are most of all firm and comfy. The rooms are small, but I think it is the same for all other hotels in town, even with the 5 stars one. A local friend of mine visited us while we're here and actually liked it, and so will recommend it to others.

Very pleased that I booked this Best Western in Midtown Manhattan. Convenient parking garage, which I reserved on-line, virtually across the street. Perfect location midway to Lower Manhattan & again north to Central Park area. We walked everywhere!! W. 36th is not a busy main thoroughfare & hence room quiet at night. Excellent air conditioning/heating system. No rattles. Controlled by thermostat in the room. Updated large bathroom. Top of the line equipment fitness room. 24 hr coffee, tea, water in the lobby. Buffet breakfast, superb choice & quantity. Highly recommend this hotel!!

The hotel is located in a very good location, close to shopping and restaurants. However, the room we got was very small with 2 double beds. There is no space to put the luggage on the floor. The room is clean and although the hotel is located on a busy street and we got a room facing the street on 10th floor, there was no street noise.

From the moment you walk into this hotel, you are enamored by the meticulous detail for cleanliness and hospitality!! The lobby looked great as the staff took time to set up a spooky Halloween display which was fun for the upcoming holiday!!The bar manager Stephen was especially attentive, he managed to provide service with speed and with a smile!! Not to mention the house-made Sangria - delicious!!! This is definitely the bar you want to be in for happy hour, if you are looking for a cozy and quaint place with terrific service and a clean bathroom! They even offer you toiletries! Now that is what I call top notch service.

Excellent location—Times Square and theater districtHotel staff extremely friendly and helpfulRooms were nice, modern and cleanNice options to eat near the hotel, even if you want to grab something quickWould certainly stay again

Very very clean, excellent location, the room was big for NYC,great helpful staff, great breakfast, enjoyed it very much (and i am not easy with hotels....) I will defiantly use this hotel on my next visit to NYC!

From calling for reservations, to checking out, we were very pleased with the friendliness of staff, close proximity to NYC attractions, complimentary breakfast was wonderful. Rooms were clean and comfortable and average size for a room in the city. Price was reasonable. Valet parking worked well for us.

Down town New York, clean and comfortable with the kindest most helpful staff you could ever find! Hotel was clean, and well taken care of in every aspect. The staff from the front desk to the custodial were friendly and happy, and provided the best experience I have had traveling.

Had a wonderful stay at the Best Western Premier in NYC last week. The hotel is located in the heart of midtown Manhattan 2 blocks from Macy's Herald Square and walking distance from the top Broadway shows, Museums and Attractions that NYC has to offer. The staff was helpful and courteous from the moment of check-in and the room were perfect for us! We received a complimentary breakfast and the General Manager asked how we were enjoying our stay and if there is anything that we needed, don't hesitate to ask. With his help, we discovered a few amazing restaurants in the neighborhood and they also had information available to discover everything NYC has to offer...with discounts! :) Will come back every time we visit...perfect stay!!

Spent 6 nights here with my wife and two kids during our stay in New York. The hotel is comfortable enough and the breakfast is a bonus. Staff are friendly and there is coffee/tea making facilities in the lobby and a water fountain. I guess I can only confirm the comments form most other reviews. The rooms are small which is expected. Breakfast gets very crowded and there are often queues. The staff there do a great job but it gets annoying having your table cleaned for the next person while your still eating.The other negative was the lifts. You can easily be left waiting 5-10min and then it comes full so you have to wait for the next one. The lift stops far too many times on the way down which wastes time as the lift is already full.Overall it is a good base close to Times Square (approx 20min walk) with a nice breakfast.

We didn't spend a lot of time here but the time we spent here was great. Breakfast was varied and plentiful. The staff worked hard to keep the crowds of breakfast goers moving along. Try the waffles! Room was typical, shower was roomy and nice. Loved the water in the lobby. Staff is super friendly and helpful. A little pricy but it is NYC and a good location.

Overall a decent hotel if you want to be based in midtown. Rooms are typical NYC room sizes, meaning small but who spends any time in their room in NYC? There were some issues that I didn’t mind as much because I was on a work trip, but I think if I had paid for the room myself, I likely would’ve minded about a few of the cons below.First the pros:• Decent breakfast selection of hot and cold items, and a staff that kept the food and beverages replenished;• Lobby has 24-hour iced water and hot water for tea, a nice welcome after a long day of being out and just needing a quick drink upon returning to the hotel;• Comfortable bed;• Fairly good sized bathroom with a nice shower with good water pressure; and• Lots of HBO channels available.Now the cons:• Rooms are not cleaned sufficiently – when I walked into the room after checking in, I noticed stuff on the carpet that clearly had not been vacuumed, and housing keeping did not vacuum during my stay as the trash remained on the carpet;• Four pillows were provided and all four were pretty bad – I’m not picky about my pillows much, but these pillows did not keep their shape and were weirdly lumpy, so when laid on them, they would instantly deflate from under your head; and• The gym is tiny with one elliptical, one treadmill, one recumbent bike, one bench that is bolted to the floor, dumbbells, and a weight machine. Although it would have been nice had the gym been bigger, the size of the gym is not why I marked it as a con. The con came from the treadmill. I used the treadmill one morning for a warmup, and even just walking on it, my feet were slipping when I increased the speed. It was noticeable enough that I didn’t feel comfortable jogging or running for fear that I might really slip and break my face. It’s not a brand of treadmill I’ve seen before, Hotel Fitness brand or something to that effect, and it was a Green Series. I wondered if being “green” made the treadmill belt more slippery than regular treadmills.

Situated in not too bad a location. Room was small and cramped, not much room to place your suitcases or personal items on the bathroom counters. If your just one person and on business it would be ok.

The staff was very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was good and filling to start our day. Rooms was clean, beds comfortable. Very quite and relaxing hotel. Will definitely recommend this hotel to all my friends!

Stayed weekend in hotel, king bed room. Small hotel run by bestwestern but has modern boutique feel. Rooms are very small (must step back for roommate to move) but very clean, modern with good amenities. Hotel has exercise room and a computer station they call a business center. Breakfast included: hot and cold options, with coffee/water station in lobby all day and night. Great location, few blocks from train station, up a side St from Broadway so not as crowded or loud. Good if u r going to something at MSG. Close to empire state building, Macy's, Lord and taylor. No problem with Elevator as they have 2. Overall, very good stay and plan to stay again.

The location of the hotel is very convenient. The breakfast room is way too small for the number of guests. The room was quite small for a party of four but clean at a reasonable price for the location. The staff was very friendly.

I enjoy visiting and staying over in NYC. Best Western is a great hotel to stay, if you are coming into the city. Nice friendly staff, good location and great breakfast. We enjoyed our stay at Best Western Premier Herald Square and we will stay again in the future.

In addition to an excellent location for Manhattan sightseeing adventures, the BWP Herald Square provides superior accommodations along with a terrific staff--from the front desk to the housekeepers to the breakfast attendants. Of special note is Ryan, who performs any number of tasks both in the lobby and outside on the patio. What a hard worker and so friendly, courteous, and helpful (luggage, directions, keeping the patio area clean and tidy, etc.) This hotel is fortunate to have such a dedicated employee.The complimentary breakfast offers a variety of choices--a good way to start one's day. I appreciated the availability of water,tea, and coffee in the lobby. The rooms are clean and comfortable with high quality linens, towels, and bath products. Overall, I am totally delighted to have chosen the Best Western Premier Herald Square for my first trip to NYC--many thanks!

This was my first NYC visit, and I feel grateful for having booked my stay at the BWP Herald Square. The location is superb, and the hotel accommodations are clean and comfortable with all the useful room amenities of high quality. The breakfast buffet offers a vast and satisfying assortment. The coffee/tea/water set-up in the lobby is much appreciated (as are the mints!) All of the staff are professional, efficient, friendly, helpful, warm, and welcoming--from the front desk employees to the breakfast attendants. Particularly, I was impressed by the all-around-handy-person RYAN, who performed a variety of tasks both inside and out in the patio. He was in perpetual motion--always busy cleaning, assisting with luggage, giving directions, etc. and always cheerful and patient--truly an asset to the hotel. Thanks to the BWP Herald Square for adding to the enjoyment of my first trip to NYC. I hope to be back!

What a great experience! Great value when you consider that it included a hot breakfast. The staff makes it a 5* rating. Very helpful and friendly. The check-in and check-out were easy. They were great at helping us get around in an unfamiliar city. The rooms were very clean as well as the hotel lobby and front courtyard. Very centrally located and close to subway system. Very knowledgeable staff and well as friendly.

First time in NY, could not ask for better location, close to the subway, Empire State Building not far from Museums. The room was excellent, clean, comfy, great décor and best of all great rates.Their breakfast had a nice variety of choices and it was convenient. The staff was attentive and friendly.

Fantastic location, very central hotel perfect for 1st time holiday in NY. Good bedding and breakfast. Small waredrobes. Quiet road. Good views onto the city and at less than 10 minutes walking from Time Square, 1 minute from Broadway road, between Empire State Building and Rockfeller centre.

Good value. Great location. Employees friendly and helpful. Hotel very clean and we loved the little intimate bar in the back of the hotel. Breakfast was o.k. We ate there cause we wanted to spend more money on lunch and dinner in NYC. We will stay there again and again.

The hotel has a great location, only minutes away from all the main attractions and very easy to get to everywhere - path, subway, walk. Room rate included breakfast and free WI-FI which was a bonus feature. However, the rooms are really tiny and the double room bed is very short, so if you are a tall person you will find your feet sticking out. Also, there is not a lot of space around the room so if you are a traveler with a two or three large suitcases, be warned, you may not have a lot of space to turn around. I was here with a friend and it was fine, but staying in two double bed room with more then two people sharing may be tricky.

We only stayed for one night in late September. On the down side, the lounge\restaurant was closed - but we had other plans anyways. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We had to store our luggage early in the morning before check-in and they were very accommodating. The room was clean and good quality. We had a very nice stay.

Perfect location for good shopping and nice restaurants. Good service and helpful staff. The rooms is not very bil, but have a cityview. Breakfast was included and has a good mix of hot and cold food.

The hotel is located at 36th St. and 5th Ave, a few yards from Empire State Building.It was quiet at 14th floor, not sure how it was at lower floors, but at night the old air conditioner equipment from other buildings could be heard from the height, so I guess the hotel is noisy below a given height.

Love this hotel! Always clean and beautiful rooms and breakfast is very good with a nice selection of food. Friendly staff and centrally located. Never disappointed. Will continue to stay there when going to NYC.

I was casually walking and noticed this little hidden gem had a bunch of signs outside for happy hour. So we walked on in and took a seat at the bar. Our glass of wine quickly turned to a bottle and then followed by a round of shots courtesy of our AMAZING bartender Stephen. He truly is a kind man and has lots of great advice about the city. Ended up having a great time hanging with him and other folks at the bar. Definitely recommend this hotel whether you want to stop by for a drink or stay for a trip. The location is great too!

Conveniently situated mid town. Reasonably sized rooms with good facilities that all worked. Excellent shower. We were on the third floor at the front but the street noise was not excessive. Really good breakfast with changing options each day. We never had to wait for a table. Staff were quick to clear tables for the next guests and kept the food topped up. The free wifi worked well throughout the hotel, even in the elevator. A very comfortable hotel with friendly staff - obviously a well run establishment which we have already recommended to other people.

This was just a great hotel for me. I'm not comfortable in 5 star. I like hotels that are clean, un-pretentious and comfortable. That is exactly what this hotel was for me. I was a single female business traveler in a King sized room on the 13th floor. I had a view over the walls of buildings but also the Empire Stare building, iconic and changing colour every night. The room was a good size for Manhattan and well stocked with coffee maker and t-bags (I don't like coffee), iron and board, hairdryer and T.V. with multiple channels, my only complaint is the difficulty in finding news channels The breakfast was fine, absolutely perfect for me! Cooked eggs, hot meat, porridge, toast, bagels, yogurt, fruit, cereal, butter, jam, fruit juice, tea, coffee etc. In the foyer you could also find tea and coffee on tap 24hrs per day. The fitness room was in the basement but all equipmemt clean and in good condition. Nearby in the basement you also found PC and printer for surfing or printing out boarding passes.The staff were all great and helpful, through them I booked a car to Newark airport $90.20, yes it is more than a shuttle or booking a car independently but it was straight forward and reliable and you pay the fee to the driver, not the hotel. The car arrived 30mins early, which was great because I was ready and waiting and mid afternoon took about 1hr to reach the airport.The hotel was in a perfect location for me wandering about Manhattan, within easy reach of Penn station and the subway. I absolutely recommend it and if I have the opportunity, I will be back.

Loved my stay, great view of Empire State Building from the hotel room. The staff were friendly and guided me in the right direction which included the subway. Great location where one gets to feel NYC.

This was our first time to New York. The hotel was wonderful! Very clean and the staff was extremely friendly. They helped us navigate around the city. The room was very clean and the bed and pillows were comfortable! The continental breakfast was very good! We would definitely stay here again!!

Talk about a hidden gem! Literally, this best western premier in Herald Square midtown manhattan even looks like a tall glass gem building from the exterior. Modern comfortable rooms, delicious breakfast buffet, amazing location, and the best staff I've ever met! I can go on and on about this hotel but you got to go experience it to believe it. I'll definatly be back and I can't wait!

We rarely stay at Best Western hotels (Marriott fans), but needed another option for this trip due to room shortages arising from the UN Assembly. The Premier band lived up to its name. This was unlike any BW we have ever stayed in before. This is a small boutique hotel (6 rooms on our 11th floor). The rooms (and the entire hotel) is modern, clean, and quiet. The included breakfast had a fuller menu than most hotel breakfasts and was more than adequate. The staff was outstanding, from the front desk to the bellhop Ryan. Ryan is enthusiastic, positive bellhop/concierge/friendly fan; possibly the best I have ever encountered. We normally stay on Times Square, but found this location to be quieter and just as convenient, especially if you are comfortable using the subway. In less than 20 minutes we were having dinner in Little Italy, the next day a 20 minute ride north to the Bronx for a Yankees game. This will be our new hotel choice when visiting NYC.

This is a small hotel several blocks from Penn Station. It's so small, you nearly miss it as you walk by. The room was tiny, but all we needed. We had a beautiful bathroom with plenty of hot water and all amenities (could use a bit more water pressure), 2 double beds, television, closet, safe, coffee maker and outside our window, the Empire State Building (we were on the 17th floor)!! It has a patio in front and one out back with a bar. We never had a chance to visit the bar/patios, but they all looked nice. There is a small gym (we had our own exercise routine walking NYC), and a large breakfast room with great staff. The selection was good and the food was decent. I heard one guest ask for something not on the table and a staff member asked how long she was staying. The staff member said she would get the requested item for the guest. Pretty good service if you ask me! Depending on the price, will definitely consider for next trip. Unfortunately, for us, we went when the UN was meeting so all hotel prices were up. It was all new and shiny and beautiful and the staff were all very, very nice. This is my 3rd stay in a BW in the past 12 months and I have to say, I've been very surprised and pleased by all my stays. I will definitely check out BW first for my next trip wherever it might be.

Definitely was pleasantly surprise with this hotel. Well situated, clean, great breakfast included, nice bar in the back with a small patio and great service and staff. Front staff were extremely knowledgeable and helpful for providing information on getting to locations.

Highly recommend this hotel!Staff was friendly and helpful, going out of their way to make everything about our stay as enjoyable as possible. Room was clean, comfortable and had many amenities. Location was awesome! I'd stay there again in a heartbeat!

We were so impressed with the staff at this hotel, in particular, Joshua at the front desk, the maintenance man and the man cleaning our rooms on September 3rd, 2017. My sister lost a very important ring getting ready to leave the hotel, the maintenance man took her back to the room to check, it was being cleaned the two gentleman and my sister checked everywhere but couldn't find it. The maintenance man went through the garbage cans in the ladies rooms off the lobby and Joshua was coordinating all the efforts and assured us that they would continue looking and contact us if they found it. As we were waiting to take off my phone rang and it was Joshua who excitedly told me the man cleaning the room found the ring that had dropped into the towels. He made arrangements to have a family member who had not yet checked out bring the ring home. The staff at this hotel is just amazing, every single person we encountered was friendly, pleasant and engaged with every guest, they couldn't be more helpful with directions and assistance getting a car to the airport. A staff of this caliber reflects back on the management, which in the case of this hotel must be top notch, they all represent Best Western well. My family and I would stay here again without hesitation!

My wife and I stayed at this Best Western Premier for a weekend getaway to NYC. The property is newer and well maintained, its staff is fantastic and provided great service, and it is ideally located in midtown Manhattan. It also offers a full breakfast buffet each morning, which is very convenient before starting your day in the city. We had a great stay and highly recommend it!

Our experience was wonderful. The Best Western Premier Herald Square is a perfect location! Breakfast was included and had a variety of choices. After a long day sight-seeing it was a treat to return and have a cocktail(s) at the bar. The bar had both indoor and outdoor seating. Outdoors was a mini oasis. Our bartender, Stephen was so personable. He is so both friendly and attentive. We found the prices to be very reasonable. There is no doubt in our minds that we would return.

Stayed 2 nites. Hotel is reasonably priced for New York and in a great location. Subway is a block away and Time Square about 4 blocks. Staff was friendly and helpful. Sign up for their Reward Club. They match status from other rewards clubs. Room was clean and roomy for New York standards. They provide a free buffet Breakfast every morning with eggs, meat and many other items. Overall, a nice clean hotel in a very good location and I would definitely stay again.

The hotel Staff was very helpful and personable. My room was new and clean. Having the breakfast included was very nice and plenty to eat. The location is very good for many of the sites and close to the subway.

Great location, friendly helpful staff, clean & safe. The hotel was a great location for my trip and surrounded by some nice restaurants. Most importantly, the hotel was clean and safe. I will definitely stay here again.

The Room is compact but has all the amenities I need.Clean towels and clean toilet.The walls are thin. You can hear neighbours coming and going.Breakfast spread is good. Overall, its a convenient location for moving around NYC.

Bad service. The person working the night shift called me at 12:40 am to ask me to come to the reception area to pay for my nights stay. One that should have been done when I registered the night before... the card had only been passed for one night and not 3. The manager was not made aware of the situation even though I asked the night reception person and the morning réception person. When I did discuss the issue with the manager, although he was apologetic, he did not offer any compensation, other than late check out. I would have expected a relate. Linens were stained. Location was great! Breakfast included was nice.

Can't stay more then 2 people in the romm. The noise from the street comes into the ,room,and if something brakes by night,like the aircondition,no one to fix No one tries to help you . We spent the night without aircondition working,and they couldn't care less.Never coming back

We arrived at 14:30 and they would not give us a room, even though check out time is at 11:00 with no margin of error. We finally got a Room at 15:45 and the butler opened the door to a used bedroom with a couple on the bed. After this there was a very simple apology by the receptionist. There is no room for anything inside the room. Very limited space in the bathroom. Breakfast hours are very limited with unbeatable food options. Overall this is undoubtedly the worst hotel I have ever stayed at in NYC and it's not even a close contest. Horrible price/value relationship.

Our first stay at this property was during Thanksgiving 2013. We were stunned by the room size but being so close to the parade route more than made up for it. Well, Macy's too! :)Since our initial stay, we made this our preferred property. The following Thanksgiving we had a huge room with a giant window. If we twisted our heads just right we could see the balloons in the parade. LOLThe staff has always been friendly.Rooms clean!If you like plenty of room ask for a larger room ... I believe they call it a presidential king.

Just arrived back from our second stay here, again absolutely perfect. This hotel has everything you would need: it's clean, in a central location, supplies breakfast and has great customer service. When we arrived, our flight was early so we went straight to the hotel to see if we could check in early. Once we were at the hotel I asked the gentleman for a view of the empire state. We were informed one wouldn't be ready for another 30 mins so we went to get some food and came back. Wow wasn't it worth the wait! Thank you for a faultless stay, we will definitely be back for a third time!

Convenient location,helpful staff, comfortable room We needed to stay an additional night and the front desk was wonderful. Easy walking to Times Square and theatres, as well as the subway stop nearby Room was relatively quiet for the location

We decided to spend our Fiftieth wedding anniversary in New York City. I checked on Best Western.com and found this great property walking distance to Times Square and Broadway, where we had show tickets. The price was very reasonable for New York and having breakfast provided daily was a great bonus. I had called a few day before we were to arrive to request a higher floor if available. At that time, I mentioned to the desk clerk that it was our 50th anniversary. We were so surprised at check in to find that Bebe and Stephen had provided us with a bottle of sparkling wine! How thoughtful!! Every staff member was so friendly and made us feel very welcome. Mustafeh even took time out of his busy day managing this property to help me print our boarding passes.We found our room on the 6th floor to be bright and cheerful with a big picture window that looked out on the street. The street noise was very minimal. We had a super comfortable king bed and large walk in shower. The room was a welcoming haven after a long day spent exploring the city. The subway entrance we used was right around the block which made it super simple to get to the Staten Island Ferry, Battery Park, The Tenement Museum, and Wall Street. It was a 20 minute walk to all 3 of the Broadway shows we saw during our stay. A great location.We would definitely stay here again and would feel very confident recommending this property to friends and family.

Very handy to subways, Times Square and many of the best restaurants in New York. Amazing service making for a worry free experience. All attractions are very easy to get to from this location. We felt safe and secure during our stay and had a wonderful time.

Great hotel in a prime location of NYC! Hotel staff is excellent, Front Desk Clerks are friendly and helpful. Bellhop was fantastic, super helpful and caring. Even the breakfast servers were very accommodating.The price was reasonable for NYC, the addition of breakfast is a nice bonus. The hotel is fresh, clean and quiet. Highly recommend staying here and we will be back!

I chose this hotel not only for the price but for the location! It is close enough to walk everywhere in NEW YORK but far enough away from Times Square that you can sleep.Not much of a view but beds were comfy and free breakfast makes it our go to place to stay in NY.

Could not want for a better location for a trip to NYC. Subway 2 blocks away, near Harold Square and the Empire State Building. Rooms are small, but typical of NY. Breakfast room was small and crowded but the breakfast staff worked hard to facilitate a flow. The breakfast items were hot, and were some of the best we have had for breakfast included hotels. Will definitely stay here the next time we are in NYC.

partner and I were very pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness and quietness of this hotel. Very friendly staff who allowed us to store our luggage there for 6 hours while we travelled around the city. I asked for a room with an awesome view and received one facing the Empire state building ...VERY PRETTY ! One of the younger girls at the front desk had an attitude, but not enough to discourage a great review of this hotel! will look into in the future!

Nothing but great reviews for the BW. We stayed at a Hilton the night before, in the Fashion District, and at less than half the price, the Best Western far exceed the Hilton in every area. I would highly recommend the Best Western Premier Herald Square.

Two night stay over the 4th of July.Good: - Location, easy hop over to the subway and surface buses, numerous restaurants around- Included breakfast - enough variety to hold you over and they have ample staff to keep things restocked and fresh- Fitness gym - not huge, but enough equipment for a short workout - Stylish and modern, doesn't feel run down or an afterthought- Self-serve water in the lobby to help cool you down in the New York heat- Front desk service was generally good and professional- Luggage storage for either coming in early to go exploring or checking out and then coming back to get your bagsBad:- Rooms on the small side, but hey it's New York so you're not going to spend a lot of time in the room so it's not a huge deal- Breakfast area can get very crowded and you might feel a little squished trying to squeeze through all the tables and chairs to get to your area- Only two elevators, you might wait a little while bit- Water pressure in the shower was a little weakBottom line:Great stay, good value for the price paid, superb location, would absolutely stay here again.

Hotel a bit difficult to see from the street. That is the only complaint we have.Employees friendly and helpfull. Room clean, enough towels.It is New-York so ther wil always be a bit of noise but really acceptable.We will be back !

Quiet, so comfy. It's on a one way street so there's not much traffic. The restaurant next door was perfect for breakfast and dessert at 10:30 pm. A few Irish pubs nearby to enjoy. I would definitely stay here again.

Very good hotel, has everything we needed, stayed there for a second time over last two years. Perfect for the theater outing. Early check and upgrade was offered, breakfast was excellent, room and bathroom was flawless, everything went smoothly. We will be back for sure. The only downside is a price hike by 70 dollars compare to last year stay. But it is worth it. Management is going to walk an extra mile to make your stay remarkable. Highly recommend.

I stayed in the hotel for Aug 17 - 22, 2017. Very good hotel, excellent location close to all attractions, good variety for daily breakfast, helpful and friendly staff, guest rooms are clean. I would definitely go back next time when I have to stay in Manhattan.

great location. Very friendly and accomodating staff. Free Wi-Fi. Breakfast was very good, very abundant and had a wide choice to choose from. It was included in the price and was a buffet for easy in and out.

A very convenient and well placed hotel. We had easy access to all outlets. The hotel is well positioned to walk and explore the surroundings. Staff were very friendly, especially Mustafa, Jai and Bebe made us feel like home! The bell boy was also friendly and helpful. Excellent internet coverage.

The location of this hotel is great. It is so close to Broadway, Times Square, Madison Square Garden, Empire State Building and shopping. The breakfast should be open longer than 9 am. Both mornings of the weekend there were lines to get into the breakfast room. Saturday morning we were offered a take out box to bring back to our room, but on Sunday they did not have boxes.
