When we got into the room, my husband and son only ate bacon as there was nothing else left that they liked. I enjoyed the spinach egg dish.

This hotel is the best deal in Manhattan. Consistently comfortable with great staff and a terrific location. It's the only place I ever stay in NYC. Breakfast room is a bit tight but it has a lot of variety.

Great central location. Extremely helpful front desk staff. Clean. Decent breakfast. Quaint lounge. Just a perfect hotel! Would definitely return and highly recommend. Oh, did I mention clean? What a find!!

Stayed here While on business in NY. The hotel rooms are clean and very accommodating! There was almost everything in the rooms!There was a wide variety of tastes for breakfast. The dinner is a bit small and sometimes a bit crowded. Nevertheless I would not consider it as a negative point to the whole experience.The staff is very hospitable and helpful. The hotel itself is in the middle of the city. It has good value for money!

First time at this hotel and will definitely return. Great location, plenty of variety in restaurants to choose from in the area, Helpful and friendly staff. Good selection for breakfast - served hot with an excellent breakfast room staff in attendance. Loved the patio bar! Great place to meet with business associates and good Happy Hour. Super quiet room, perfect for a good nights sleep. I look forward to my next visit!

Nice, clean hotel. Looked just like the online photos. We got in early and they were able to check us in which was great. Breakfast space was a bit small but nice variety of items to choose from. Room was a bit compact but space comes with a price!

Wonderful stay at a top rate hotel with friendly professional staff at all levels. Had king bed room on 13th floor with view of Empire state bldg. Room was great and shower the best! Other reviewers have hit on all the highlights of this hotel and especially the breakfast buffet that is a definite plus. We enjoyed the lounge for a cold one and liked sitting in the small courtyard out front to people watch. Location, Location, Location is spot on. Near subway, times square, tons of restaurants, etc. On way out in morning for day trips we grabbed complimentary grab n go bag with water, apple, banana, cookies or crackers!! Nice touch from Best Western. That with the 24/7 coffee and ice water in lobby adds to that little something extra for guests. Would highly recommend a stay here and would return in the future!

I thoroughly poured over reviews before choosing this hotel. I struck the jackpot! I will address some of the negatives I read in the reviews, and then list my review...My adult son and I stayed for a week in a room with 2 double beds on the 8th floor.The pillows were very comfortable, and there were many on each bed. The only time we had to wait an appreciable amount of time for an elevator was during morning rush as people were going to/from breakfast or checking out. We took the stairs a couple times, and it wasn't terrible. The breakfast area was small, but the staff was amazing at clearing tables and keeping food stocked. One time we loaded our plates and ate on their back terrace - it was actually relaxing and beautiful.There was traffic noise outside, but the hotel had ear plugs on the desk. My son used the earplugs, but I didn't. I did not find the noise offensive. There were a couple of times that the noise woke me up, but not often, and I quickly went back to sleep.My observations: The hotel is in a fantastic location. A quick walk to many attractions, and close to subway or other transportation. I felt very safe walking, and there were many times when we were out after midnight.The hotel staff was tremendously helpful. They recommended different restaurants, how to navigate transportation, and when we checked out, they called the cab, told us the rate to expect, and told us to sit and relax in their lobby until the cab arrived. They have a "hydration station" in the lobby that always had ice water, coffee, hot water for tea, etc.The room was small, but we had enough room. We didn't come to NYC to stay in the room. The beds were comfortable - firmness of mattress and linens. The climate control was great. The shower had great water pressure and plenty of hot water. It was a large walk-in shower. There was a small countertop, as well as a shelf over the toilet, so items could be left in the bathroom.The complimentary breakfast was wonderful. There were constant items (fresh fruit - Apples and bananas, yogurt, 3 or 4 different types of dry cereal, whole and 2% milk, hot oatmeal, breads and bagels, coffee/tea/juices). Other items that were rotated included pancakes, sausage, bacon, hard boiled eggs, French toast, omelets or scrambled eggs, etc. As I said, the staff was very efficient at clearing tables and insuring the food was stocked.The front patio and rear patio were relaxing. We enjoyed sitting out on a regular basis.If we travel back to NYC, I know where we will stay...in a heartbeat!!

First off I have to mention the cafeteria supervisor ,Debbie. Please give her a raise and bonus in pay. I asked who cooked the oatmeal and a worker kindly pointed her out. She politely thanked me for my appreciation for her cooking. Not only that but I noticed how meticulous she was about the condition of her dining room staying in a clean state. She professionally instructed staff to pay attention to certain details. I was really impressed at how clean and good the food was. I've stayed at many hotels in the same price level and their service and cleaniness don't compare to this hotel. Debbie is a gem and I hope corporate management realize how fortunate they are to have someone like her working for them. I will definenatly come back to this hotel.

The staff is responsive, professional, and excellent. The room decor was modern, everything was very clean. The hotel offers a wide range of delicious breakfast options. The location has convenient subway access and shopping just around the corner. It even has happy hour down stairs. For those of us who like to work out on vacation, it even has a small gym.

Family of 4 (incl 2 boys age 6 and 9) we were impressed with the overall stay. Room was clean, view on Empire State Building, modern bathroom and impressed with breakfast. With kids you dont want to start the day with going out for breakfast first... staff friendly and helpful plus great location. 10min walk from Time Square and close to subway.

This hotel was perfectly placed for a visitor to New York. Yes, as other reviewers have pointed out, the rooms are rather small - but it is situated in the midst of things and in fact not that small. The rooms are very well appointed with a comfortable bed and an excellent shower. They were kept perfectly clean by the staff. There is only one caveat.The breakfasts served was very good - a great selection with hot and cold dishes - but, when I stayed the queues were long each morning as the dining area is really too small. The staff did their very best to get guests seated but it remained a rather stressful start to the day. Aside from this small problem (which could be alleviated by formally opening the bar and small outside area for this meal) - an excellent place to stay in this great city.

Had a great time in NYC, thanks in part to BW Herald Square location. The hotel was clean and the staff friendly. The room and the breakfast area a little tight but hey, this is NYC. Overall family friendly and a great value. Hotel is in walking distance to a lot of NYC attractions, including Empire State next block south. Also close to 34th St Subway entrance for trips to Times Square, Broadway, Downtown (9/11, Statue of Liberty, etc). Definitely recommend a subway pass! We also walked a lot and felt safe even at night. Having breakfast bar available saves $ but there are lots of other options everywhere like Dunkin Donuts, Starbucks, McDonalds (all within 1-2 blocks). If you are thinking of a trip to NYC then BW Herald Square is a great option.

Initially special thanks to Shameza that make my stayed more confortable. Unfortunately the breakfast's area is small and ussually to crowed.untill 9:30am. Room is reasonable size and shower good to. Ask for king size bed

This was our first time at the hotel. The hotel staff are very helpful and they did an early check in for us even though we were scheduled for check in at 3 pm and they also provided us free breakfast as soon as we arrived at the hotel.The hotel room was nice, very clean and very comforting.

This hotel is perfectly located right between Herald Square and Times Square. Rooms are on the small side but clean. Hotel has coffee available 24/7 in the lobby and a nice seating area out front. Also has a nice patio bar located in the back. Staff here was very helpful and polite.

The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. It was my first time at hotel and I was so pleasantly surprised at the high level of service from the front desk folks to the porters to the cleaning folks. We will definitely stay again. Highly recommended.

This is really a solid Best Western. Prices were high but it's Manhattan. The staff were super friendly. They even provided toothpaste and razor because I had forgotten. Here's the thing about this hotel. The rooms are very small but in an ideal location. You are walking distance to Penn Station so if you take a flight into Newark, the New Jersey railroad works very well. The location to broadway is ideal. It's an easy walk to all shows but also walking distance to the downtown part of Manhattan. The rooms were clean and efficient. Only showers, no tubs. Not a ton of frills but solid. I will stay here again.

We stayed at the BW Premier Herald Square for two night. People at the reception were very professional and courteous. They had water and coffee at all time in the lobby and the breakfast room was well organized with a good selection of food. The room was on a small size but very confortable and very clean. The bathroom seemed to be renovated and hot water was plenty. Will return for sure.

Wonderful, helpful, courteous staff, the whole staff from front desk, to maid and especially the bell hop. Clean room, comfortable bed, quiet, good breakfast that's included! Great location. Could use an extra chair in room so don't have to sit on bed.

Stayed here for a week. First some good things; location is really good, a lot of TV channels and the bed was also okay. Room was very small, but I expected that. BUt I would never ever stay here again. I've never before been to such a noisy hotel. The elevator is something out of a nightmare. It makes the strangest noises I've ever heard. And you literally wake up from it (every floor seems to have around 5 rooms, and they are all near the elevator). Ours was just opposite the elevator doors. As I said, every time someone uses the elevator (which happens a lot, especially in the morning), it makes very loud clicking sounds. Hard to explain, but absolutely terrible. Then early in the morning housekeeping starts. They are extremely loud and the walls are really thin. You can hear everything. They vacuum early in the morning, it's like they vacuum in your room. I am having a hard time remembering a hotel where I had a worse' nights sleep. Of course I mentioned this multiple times to the front desk, they couldn't have cared less. One of them even asked me, in which room I was...she then said "ah, that room...". So not sure if mine was just especially awful, but especially the noise in the hotel couldn't just have been in my room. We even spoke about it with some other hotel guets, everyone heard it. Which is why I'm suprised about all the good reviews here. Another bad thing is the breakfast. Buffet is bad and the room is extremely small and always super crowded. We went there once, had to wait 20 minutes for a table and then never again.There are much better options in NYC, don't stay here.

Came into the City just for the weekend to celebrate my and my boyfriends birthday. Was walkable from Penn Station and Grand Central. New York Library was a couple blocks away as was Bryant Park where there was a free concert. Breakfast was good and everything was fresh and available. Staff was excellent and very attentive.

At heart of New York City, great hotel for business, family and friends. Room was small but setup was so excellent and organized didn't feel that way. Breakfast was good, adding some more options would be ideal..

Modern and chic this hotel is a short walk to most attractions in the city including Time Square. The rooms can be small, space in NYC is premium, but they are bright, vibrant, have great city views, and are clean. Staying here is an easy choice.

My family and I stayed here recently. Our stay was excellent. From location, to front desk, to room, and breakfast every morning. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone. The room was clean, and comfortable. The people at the front desk were helpful, and courteous. Hot breakfast every morning was delicious, and a large variety to choose from. The people who worked in the eating area, are hard working, and very clean. The location was perfect. Close to everything. A nice touch after walking all day site seeing was the cold iced water with lemon in the lobby. I highly recommend staying here.

The Best Western Herald Square was excellent. Great location, close to everything, Empire State Building, Times Square, MSG, subway, you name it. Hotel was very clean. Staff was wonderful during check in, check out, the entire stay. Robert was great, Mustafa, the manager, was great, Jay gave us helpful tips, and made sure we had his number and business card in case we got lost. Free breakfast was also a nice touch.A++++++. We will stay here again when ever we visit NYC!!!!!

The location was perfect, great for Madison Square Garden. NYC is crazy expensive compared to other cities in the USA but this hotel was great value for NYC prices. Room was great, no complaints at all. All sport channels available on the TV which does not seem to be common in other hotels. Breakfast had a lot of options, the breakfast room was a bit small so there was usually a 5 or so minute wait for a table. On check in, we received a 2 for 1 drink coupon for the hotel bar which could also be used during happy hour, which was incredibly reasonable. Bar snacks also complimentary. The bartender was very friendly. Had a great 5 night stay here, would be my first choice when returning to NYC.

This is a great, centrally located hotel found in the garment district making it very easy to walk to several attractions (Central Park, Times Square, Broadway, the High Line, Empire State Building, NYC Library, museums, etc.) The included breakfast buffet was very good with a wide variety of food to choose from. Our room was very clean and well decorated (bathroom fixtures were current and modern...powerful blow dryers and great makeup mirror too!). Highly recommend this hotel!

Couldn't believe that Best Western could have such an upscale hotel that too in Manhattan. Great decor, super friendly staff and excellent location. Blocks away from Times Square. Enjoyed the stay and will definitely come back again.

Hotel is 300m from Herald square metro station in a relatively quite area. Front desk staff has been outstanding and easy helping on anything we needed. Room is small but we didn't need anything bigger, shower and toiled fine as expected and clean. We had a very nice view of the empire state building from our window. Hotel bar with nice garden and very kind bar tender. Complimentary breakfast is complete, in peak hours you may need to wait few minutes for a table as breaskfast room at -1 is not enough, that's the only issue I had in my stay. Would come back again.

My son and I stayed here and loved it. The reception when we walked in was friendly and helpful, a kind of "welcome to our house" friendly. The lobby has complimentary coffee and a huge container of ice water with lemon. NY was hot when we visited so the ice water was much appreciated. Our room was not large but it was larger than some rooms I've had in NYC. It was clean and attractive. The air conditioner was not a noisy window shaker; it seemed to come out around the ceiling. The bathroom was actually bigger than the one in my home with a huge shower area. There is a free breakfast with dry cereal, fresh oatmeal, pancakes (my personal favorite), sweet rolls, bagels, coffee, tea, orange juice. There were 4 serving units and 2 of them were varied each day. It was great. I had to go back to the room to get my umbrella and the Housekeeper was working on our room. We talked a bit and as we left she said, "Thank you for staying at our hotel". The "our" says it all; the people who work there really want you to come back. It is on 36th Street so you're about 10 short blocks from Times Square. But, you are also away from the flashing lights and the noise. The nights were quiet (except for a minute when the garbage truck came through, but that's true everywhere, isn't it?) We were on the 6th floor and were very pleased with our whole experience. Oh, and the elevators are speedy so you won't wait 20 minutes for one to appear. Did I say how much I enjoyed staying here? I'm sorry I didn't write down names, but everyone at Best West. was great!

Staff very friendly and accomdating. Location is perfect to be out of the busy area but still close enough to Times Square. Staff accomdating of attractions and subway lines. Upgraded room at no extra cost!

My husband & I travelled to NYC to celebrate his 60th Birthday. We came in early morning, checked our bags & asked the desk clerk for some restaurant recommendations. Walked a half block to the cafe at 36th & 5th. Had our breakfast & did some people watching! On the way back stopped at Karako Suits a mens clothing/suit store with personalized service. We love our room! We booked the executive king,16th floor so no street noice, with a little more space, floor to ceiling windows, street view. It gives us a "penthouse" feel, well worth the extra cost. We love that we can walk to Times Square, enjoy all the hustle bustle and then come back to a nice quiet neighborhood. Many other things we will enjoy I'm sure like the streetside outdoor area, bar and inside patio courtyard. Tomorrow we try out the breakfast in the hotel that is included. Service has been great by staff they are very friendly, made us feel right at home. We also found a great deal from a guy representing TOP VIEW double decker tour bus.... 5 day pass with on & off priviledges $65, ($55 online) so if you are staying multiple days you may want to try them. When he approached us on the sidewalk we were skeptical, but checked them out & they are legit.

Suggest that when booking a hotel, especially in the Manhattan area, ensure the agent is familiar with the actual hotel (and not just a central/corporate reservation agency).When we arrived, front desk staff did try and make efforts to find us another accommodation (including other hotels) that could serve our family of 5 better. We didn't find anything, but in fairness, the hotel ended up working out ok for us for the week. Overall, we found the hotel a good place to stay.

Could not have been any better. Delicious breakfast, a lot of choices. Our room was very quiet, did not hear other room noise or street noise. Comfy beds. Kind and courteous staff. Perfect location. Customer service the way it should be! Will definitely stay here again:)

Loved the location, it was very central to areas that we wanted to visit. Room did not have a lot of room to move around but it was very clean and comfortable. The staff was helpful and friendly and the breakfast we had was one of the best we have had at a Best Western.

Stayed there for 14 nights as my wife and I wanted to explore the city in depth. The hotel was in a great location just 3 mins from the subway station. Was impressed by the nice and clean rooms and amenities that included a gym which we used. But most of all, we were impressed by the great service and sumptuous breakfast. The staff were friendly and helpful. And our room had a view of the Empire State Building!

Walking distance from penn station and of course even closer to 34 st herald square station. Location is simply excellent and is just a few mins to Empire State BLDG, Times Square etcReception was very friendly and let us check in early....around 12n!!!We stayed in 304 and room was small and I guess what you should expect in such a prime location in NYCMinor issues were :1. Long waits for the elevator.....since we were in the 3rd floor we just climbed the stairs2. Crowded breakfast room...but really you face this issue in pretty much ANY hotel that serves free breakfast Also, one of the nights the neighboring room was having a party and making too much noise...after a call to the reception they immediate came up and handled it well.... we had a great experience and certainly gave no hesitation in recommending this to families

Very clean, staff very friendly and amazing location. Will stay there ok my next trip to NYC. The subway is around the corner, Empire State Building you can see it from the room, Times Square is walking distance.

Great spot with convenient parking garage! Was within a couple of blocks from the Empire State Building. We were very pleased with the location and service. I would certainly consider using this location again.

What a great place to stay in NYC. Hotel was clean, staff were super nice (shout out to Robert!), breakfast was delicious and conveniently located. Close to Empire State Building, Macy's, Times Square and so much more. Would totally recommend this hotel to anyone going to NYC and would stay there again.
This bw is very nice and nice people and quiet and have free breakfast and I will it 5 star because it very nice place to stay and you can see the Empire State Building . The room are very small.

This was my first hotel stay in NYC and I do not regret this selection. From the nice and smiling staff to the clean rooms I was pretty satisfied. Just a few minutes away from the subway and dozens of stores it is great for shopping fans. I loved they always had fruits for breakfast and a variety of options. Getting early down for breakfast will make a more quiet breakfast time given the room can get a littler crowded.

Amazing how they fit such an excellent building into such a tidy-sized piece of real estate space. We tried to check in and were warmly greeted by Shameza and Sade, but at 11am, were a mite early. We were allowed to park our luggage, however while we did some site-seeing for a few hours. We sincerely want to thank Shameza and Sade for their many kindnesses and suggestions, and BW is lucky to have them on its staff.Upon checking in at about 1430, we found the room to be adequately-sized (we were only going to sleep there), and with a king bed.The only downsides of the stay were:No microwave or mini fridge, and our room key failed us, thereby necessitating a changeout of the lock mechanism.Breakfast was sufficient for our needs and the hotel's location was near to subway stations, as well as to every place else.Their 1500 to 1900 daily happy hour was well timed, although the mixed drinks were somewhat pricey. @ $12.50 for a Long Island Iced Tea.My wife and I used LYFT taxi for the first time and the convenience was amazing:When you request your ride, they arrive in 2-3 minutes! The cost was quite reasonable for the door-to-door ride service:$5 to take us to Gallaghers Steak house. The notification even lets you know Who is arriving to pick you up, as well as the Make/model AND license plate number! Excellent service.

We had a great experience at this location. It was clean, staff was helpful, and very curtious for the most part. We were scared about whether or not this was a good neighborhood and were happy to find that it was. It is in a perfect spot for site seeing as it is walking distance from Empire State Building, time square, Rockefeller Center, etc. It was our first time in NYC and were so happy with our experience here. Loved it.

Stayed here September 2016, fantastic location, next block to Empire State building.Staff were friendly and attentive. Breakfast was provided, but we did not eat there. Rooms were comfortable, spacious and clean.Would definately recommend this hotel and look forward to returning on our next visit to New York.

This is a very well maintained hotel in the heart of NYC within a block of the metro, an easy walk to Times Square, and with a great view of the Empire State Building (two blocks away) if your room is in the back. The staff was very courteous and helpful, the rooms were clean and modern, and the free breakfast was decent and gave a good start to the day. I'd definitely stay there again.

Happy and helpful staff, clean rooms, and affordable, all at a great location. The rooms are small but they have all the necessary amenities including Directv with HBO. They also offer a great daily breakfast.

This hotel is in a great location. Easy to get to subway and there is a parking deck three buildings down. They discount your parking if staying at hotel. The rooms are normal sized for Manhattan. Very helpful desk staff, and breakfast was very good, but can get crowded. We would stay here again!

Perfect spot to pop into NYC to see some shows and use as a home base. Easy access to cabs, easy walks to B-way ad 5th Ave. Accommodating staff a plus! Enjoyed the convenience of the cocktail bar and breakfast room.

Visited NYC for a 2-night stay. Stayed at the Best Western Herald Square because of such a positive visit in early 2016. Once again, the hotel did great in every aspect from start to finish. Ryan, bell hop, was friendly and helped with our luggage. Stephen, bartender, was quick, friendly and helpful with downtown information. Our room was clean, comfortable bed, delicious breakfast and NO NOISE!Thank you BW Herald Square!!!

My daughter and I spent 4 days in NYC in June at this hotel. The location was perfect. The size of the hotel was perfect. The hospitality was fantastic. The staff was helpful and friendly. I would stay in this hotel again.

Great location near shopping and restaurants. Easy access to subway. Caring and friendly and helpful staff. Immaculate facility, including all of the common areas and our room. Highly recommend. We will stay here again.

My family booked two rooms for two nights. We relied on trip advisor's review as we had never been to New York City before, and searched hundreds of hotels before booking. This hotel was everything it said it was and more. Very clean, wonderful breakfasts, friendly and helpful staff, and a great location. We couldn't be happier with our stay and will recommend it highly!

OverviewI am not sure why people like New York; it is noisy, crowded, dirty and expensive!! I only came to see several Klimt paintings.LocationThe best feature is the hotel’s location. Several interesting sites are within walking distance as are different subway lines.Back-Lobby BarThe back lobby bar – with happy hour to 8pm – is the other good feature. Nice beers and (limited) but tasty snacks. Free tea and coffee available in reception.InternetThis functioned well – although, you had to log-in again every day.Problems (General)High cost, lack of refrigerator and small rooms are probably the same across the city.Problems (Hotel Specific)There are a number of hotel specific problems:• A poor quality buffet breakfast for a “BW Plus” hotel or, indeed, any BW hotel;• A small room for breakfast;• Long wait for lifts; and• Doors slammed with great velocity (however, mine did have a handle which could be used to close it relatively quietly – something that my fellow guests failed to appreciate more often than not).StaffWere friendly and helpful and you can store baggage (free!) if you have a late flight.

Modern, clean, good elevators, helpful staff, rooms seem new, breakfast is excellent. Breakfast room is well staffed, organized and pleasant. Definitely worth the extra $50 a night compared to the two other Manhattan locations I stayed at. Fifteen minute walk on Fiftth Ave. to Grand Central Station. Easy to get Ubers/Taxi's since outside of Times Square congestion.

The BW on 33rd West on Manhatten is a gem. Easy access to subway, and within walking distance of Times Square and Broadway. Great bar, great staff. Looking forward to our next trip to NYC. We for sure will be staying at Best Western/ Thanks, Joe and Mo Shaw

Great hotel that is a good price although the room was a little small for 2 adults and 2 girls 11 and 13. It is close to shopping, restaurants , the subway and a short walk to Times Square. Breakfast was good and changed daily. Staff has helpful and hotel is clean with updated decor. Will definitely consider staying again when we visit NYC.

My sisters and I stayed here for the first time during our annual Summer Solstice/Yoga in Times Square trip. The service, staff, location, breakfast, rooms were all phenomenal!! We are still raving about our stay and are making plans to return in August for a longer visit. This place is a gem!!! We would not change a thing about our visit...well, only that we had time to stay longer!!!

Had the best stay for a first time visit at this hotel. Staff was super friendly, great chic rooms and an overall great experience. I highly recommend. Not bad a location either since you're in the middle of everything.

This hotel was reasonably priced and in a convenient location. Recent construction so everything was modern and in good shape. Our room was immaculate and quiet. Service was friendly and efficient. They even include breakfast!

Very nice hotel in a great location. Loved the beverage bar in the lobby! Clean rooms, comfy beds and great staff. The free breakfast was nice, always a plus. This hotel is also within walking distance from the Megabus stop.

A great hotel in a good location. Everything was clean, and the staff were always friendly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and I will be returning here when I'm back in the city again. Thanks for the great experience; my family and I had a wonderful vacation.

Room was spotlessly clean, breakfast was very good and friendly helpful staff. Excellent price/value. 1 block from subway.Easy to navigate to anywhere in manhatten.Lots of places to eat nearby.Quiet and bed very comfortable.

This BW is in a GREAT LOCATION. It is very near most of the places to see and not far to Central Park. The entire staff at the BW are very friendly and extremely helpful. Will definitely stay there again and will certainly recommend for friends to stay there.

This hotel was perfect for our trip. The hotel staff was wonderful to us and the morning breakfast was wonderful! It was so close to everything and we felt very safe! The hotel and room was very clean and neat. Before our last day they booked us a car to take us to the airport for a flat rate, it was very convenient. It is tucked away from all of the noise and centrally located.

the stay was great. The recieving staff excellent, the check out staff went out of their way to get us a limo instead of a regular UBER. was fast on responding. Made us feel welcome. Accomodated to kids. The keys got easily de-magnetized, to which staff immediately attended to every time.

Nice central location, and despite it being in the thick of it the room was wonderfully quiet. Not luxurious but comfortable and clean. Stayed five nights, no problems at all. Has a pretty good hot breakfast.

It's a small hotel in a very central location in Manhattan. The room and bathroom were very good - modern, clean and well equipped. Not much of a view out the window on the second floor, but I didn't care about that. The reception staff were very friendly. I will stay there again for sure.

We had one of the executive rooms which was located on 17th floor with a really nice view of Manhattan. The rooms were smaller compared to other best western, but very nice decorated. Location is perfect. Everything is really close by. First we booked 3 nights, then we decided to stay 2 more. Will definetely stay here again next time when we come back

My daughter forgot her iPad in the bed covers of our room. The front desk clerk called her immediately when the housekeeper discovered it. The daughter purchased a prepaid shipping label, mailed it to the hotel & Fed Ex delivered the iPad within the week. I am thankful for the honest housekeeper who didn't keep the iPad, plus the managers who contacted us & returned her property.

For someone who travels quite a bit for work I've been to a lot of hotels. So for my first time in New York I would definitely have to say that the people and atmosphere here have been amazing. I would definitely like to point out Stephen who was bartending at the lounge. He was more than helpful and friendly. He gave me some great advice on places to see to go along with his awesome service. I would say if you were to stay here to go down and say hello.

Excellent location, quiet and clean and the staff are very friendly and helpful. Spent 6 nights at the hotel and enjoyed every one of them. Great place to stay. Would definitely recommend to family and friends .

The location is very central close to Empire State Building and Macy's if you like shopping,walking distance to Times Square. The staff were really friendly and helpful in particular Bebe, Jay and the Day Porter. Our room from the 10th floor - decent size but kept clean always by the housekeeping department. Will definitely choose this hotel if we are back again in New York.

My son and I were extremely pleased with our stay in the Best Western Premier Herald Square, New York, New York hotel. The location of the hotel is excellent and so close to Times Square. Those staff members that we interacted with were very courteous, professional and helpful. They went out of their way to make suggestions for good places to eat. The rooms were clean, the hallways were clean and well lighted. The breakfast area was the nicest that I have ever witnessed in a hotel. Glass plates, real silverware, hot food served in beautiful covered containers. They served a good variety of breakfast items. The beds were so very comfortable. It was so nice to be close to everything. We could not hear any outside noise from our room.

Friendly staff, check in smooth. We were on the 15th floor the room was small but spotless clean and kept immaculate. Breakfast was different every day all cooked fresh although room could get busy, we always found a table. Staff very friendly. Excellent location walking distance to subway, Penn Station, Time Square lots of bars/restaurants close by. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Wonderful front desk people. Free breakfast was better than the usual free breakfast. Room clean and towels fresh. Small issue w drain clog however they were on it in seconds. I have them the high rating for their extraordinary and politeness. It's well deserved. Sold out. Great place to stay.

Very satisfied with my stay, staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast had many options that changed everyday. Overall great hotel. Only downside is no bathtub or refrigerator/microwave in room but staff held my leftovers for me in their fridge and I could heat them up downstairs. Needed a tub to soak my sore muscles in because you do a lot of walking in this city, but that's okay, I made the shower work. I definitely recommend this hotel.

If you are looking for a neat hotel at great location and free buffet breakfast, this is one is the ideal one..Go for it... Myself and husband stayed there last 2 nights in a King room. The hotel is a 5 mins walk to Times square. The room was small but definitely good for 2 people. Very neat and well arranged with LED tv, free wifi, coffee maker and a super clean and stylish toilet, They make your room everyday. The buffet breakfast was decent too. They have kept coffee and candy at the lobby. And the best part is they have a luggage room where you can keep your luggage and roam around the city after check-out. The staff were courteous and helpfulWe are totally happy with our stay and would definitely recommend

Great experience for our family vacation. Could be considered over-priced, but for us, it was a perfect location to access subway, reach great attractions by walking if we wanted, and a wonderful staff that was helpful and friendly.

The place was nice, but as overpriced as every place to stay in NYC. The staff was not exceptional, but did their jobs. Bummer no street parking overnight on weekdays. The lobby was kind of messy and was out of coffee. When I mentioned this to the front desk it was somewhat disregarded until the staff saw the look on my face.

I consistently stay at this hotel while traveling to NYC on business and vacation as it is well located and maintained, the staff provides EXCELLENT service, and the breakfast is a wonderful amenity. I highly recommend it!

Planning a first time trip to New York I relied on reviews and so glad I chose best western premier herald square. Perfectly located close to everything you want to see but not to close to be in the hustle and bustle of time square. A few minutes from Empire State Building and about a 10 minute walk from time square. Flatiron Building is also just up the street in the opposite direction about 10 minutes. Breakfast included helps to get you on your way first thing in the morning. A nice seating area outfront on the street side. The rooms are small from what I am use to but they are clean and that's what counts the most to me. The staff were very good to us from checkin to checkout. I don't have any complaints. We used uber to and from the airport and also to get us to battery park to take the Statue of Liberty tour. We walked everywhere else because it was easy to do so and you get to see more by walking. We were only there for two full days with two days of travel and we did lots. Planned our first day and sort of took the second day as it came. Didn't want to be too scheduled on a vacation and it worked out great for us. Looking forward to going back again and I will definitely stay at this place again.

The staff at BW Premier Herald Square is among the most accommodating group of employees that we ever experienced. Everyone from the front desk personnel to the cleaning staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome. The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in NYC.

This hotel is in a great location - just a few blocks from Broadway and Times Square. The room is small per New York standards but modern and well maintained. The front desk people were very friendly and helpful. The free breakfast saved us some money. Would definitely stay here again.

I live an hour outside of NYC, so when my sister came to visit and have her very first trip into the city, I wanted to treat her. We had tickets for Phantom and wanted to spend a good few days in the city to take in the sites and I wanted to find a hotel that was not only clean (a much more difficult task in NYC than you might assume) and in a safe spot, but also that gave her that incredible NYC experience. Cue the Best Western @ Harald Square! I purposefully booked one of the rooms at the top of the hotel so we could have those amazing views! The room was smaller than ones you'll find on lower floors, but still considered roomie for NYC standards, and if you're with someone you don't mind sharing a bed with, this is the room to book! A king bed with wall-to-wall floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking a lovely and classic NYC skyline view. It was spectacular! The room was also very quiet considering you're in the heart of the city. We heard very little street noise, and that includes trash pick-up! There was a bit of noise from the elevators going up and down, as we were on the top floor and nearest to the cables pulling the elevators up and down, but we were so tired from our busy day of sightseeing that we fell asleep regardless! They do provide you with ear plugs (like any good NYC hotel does!) for those of you who are sensitive to all sounds. We were presented with a BOGO free on drinks at the cute little bar they have at the back of the hotel and we enjoyed happy hour before getting ready to head out on the town that evening! I will admit that breakfast was a bit lack luster on the hot-food department, but they still provided all the basics (cereal, toast, bagels, fresh fruit, yogurt, and pastries) and it was sufficient enough to keep us full until a late lunch could be had. Finally, the hotel was very clean and comfortable, and every single staff member we came across, from the cleaning crew to the front desk were very very nice and accommodating! I highly recommend this hotel if you're coming to NYC!

Hotel's location is excellent; subways in either direction, handy for Maceys, Times square, theatres, 5th and 6th Ave, jazz clubs. Was expecting a room with full length windows, but as I asked for a quiet, high room, they put us in the back so we had a view of the Empire State Building instead!!, ventilation shaft noise could have been a problem - earplugs provided, but you cannot beat Boot's wax ear mufflers; my friend did not notice the noise though. Wi-fi worked. The bathroom roomy especially liked the heated mirror and magnifying mirror. Good that the hairdryer was not one that is attached to wall so you could use it in the bedroom. Breakfast, great selection of hot and cold food, replenished regularly, tables clean. ALL staff very helpful, esp. the breakfast room staff, the maintenance guy who mended the safe after I "broke" it, the porter who looked after bags ready for late check out; housekeeping and reception staff very friendly and helpful. Fantastic hotel. Absolutely loved our time in New York. Need a light bite look out for “Fresh leaf”.

Great hotel and very centrally located within easy reach of Time Square and many other attractions around New York City.The subway is just around the corner as well.Bonus is it serves a hot buffet style breakfast, very hard to find in New York.

Two blocks from The Empire State Building, 15 min to Highline and blocks from Central Station, New York Library, 10 min away from Time Square and all major shopping. Parking was 5 doors down, hotel validates so discounted to $38US/night without In/Out privileges (otherwise it's $52). Many restaurants within minutes, but more affordable ones available within 10-15 min. Public transportation (subway 34th Herald), convenient. Room was clean, quiet.

Very pleased. Great location not far from theatres. Small modern hotel. Staff very accommodating, outstanding breakfast, very clean, parking garages and restaurants on same block. Only minor negative; small rooms.

Great find: Four year old hotel in the heart of Manhattan. Walking distance from Penn Station. Rooms are small but immaculate. Bed/bath great. Staff is friendly and helpful. Nice lounge and outside garden.

We had a really rainy Saturday walking around, so we were soaked to the bone. By 2:30 we couldn't wait any longer and THANKFULLY the front desk let us check in a half hour early. Rooms were very clean, small but what you would expect for the size of the hotel. Sad that the bar/restaurant close for the weekend, but the breakfast was amazing. Best hotel breakfast I've ever had. My mother in law, grandmother in law, sister in law and mother were all pleased with our experience here.

One might think of BW as a quality motel before you would consider it as a quality hotel in NYC. I checked it out on a whim since I am a Platinum Rewards member of BW. The only slightly negative that can be considered is the small size of the room. The Herald Square site seems to be relatively new with excellent decor and services. The location is within 2 blocks of every possible mode of city transportation for uptown, downtown, crosstown access. Quality restaurants are in the same block. Parking garage is on the same block. Valet service is not available but a hotel discount is. BW generally offers a free breakfast and this hotel offers the best we have ever experienced in terms of quality of food, high quality service and a generally pleasant experience. Due to my problems with heath, the highest level of assistance was received upon a simple request. We will be back!!!

Stayed here first week of May for 5 nights with young kids. Searching for hotels in New York is like searching for one perfect needle in a whole stack of almost equally good needles. You will have lots of choices all over the place and no clear cut reason as to why you should chose one over the other. To make my search easier, I decided to go with the following requirements - in Manhattan, a known hotel brand, breakfast included, free Wifi and close to Metro/Subway. Best Western Herald Square stood out among the finalists! Rooms and the hotel itself is quite small and compact, but given it is Manhattan, this is acceptable. It was clean and the beds plush and comfortable. Bathroom was not too tight. The rooms do not have a kitchenette, so that is something you should take into account. I was worried of the vehicle noise factor, given that the hotels are right on the street, but surprisingly it was not an issue, even though we were in the 3rd floor. There was more people noise on a Friday evening as there are a few bars/restaurants close by. But nothing unbearable. But be aware that higher floors may have some motor noise from the water pump when it is running.Breakfast was ok, not great, but enough to fill your stomach till lunch - oatmeal, cereal, few assorted pastries, pancakes. The breakfast hall is a little small, so expect some wait time during peak hours.Service is excellent - at the lobby, breakfast hall, housekeeping. No issues there.34th Street/Herald Square Subway station is just 5 minutes walk away with good connections. Penn Street station is also close by. If you are new to New York Subway, there is a very good introduction to it right here on Tripadvisor - search for "The Idiot's Guide to the Subway".Empire state building is a 5 minute walk and so is Macys, the world's biggest store, right at Herald Square. Times Square is about 15 minutes walk. Many restaurants are nearby.If you have a car, parking in NYC is pretty expensive. Park in "Mayer's Parking", just a couple of buildings further down from the Hotel on the same street, on the right side. Validate the parking ticket at the lobby. You will get a discounted rate of $39 per night. Anywhere else, it will be $50 or more per night. If you don't need a car, I would say do not get it. You do not need it in NYC. Subway and the buses takes you where ever you want to go. They are well connected with very good frequency.All in all, this is a good place to stay in Manhattan. You will not regret it.

Excellent value - priced about 30% less then other places around, and nothing bad about this place. Breakfast is included too! Convenient location, Clean, Modern, Good service. I'm happy we got this hotel for our stay in Manhattan.

What an amazing room and an awesome staff. It was such a great experience in New York City and the proximity of the hotel to restaurants and landmarks was greatly appreciated. Would definitely recommend staying here for your trip to NYC if you get the chance.

I stayed at this hotel for one Friday evening. It wasn't too far of a walk to Times Square at all. As others have mentioned in their reviews, the rooms are very small and the elevator is clunky sounding. The clunky noise made by the elevator wasn't so loud that it woke me up in the middle of the night, but just annoying to hear as it passed by our floor. I wish the room had a fridge but I was happy with the other included amenities. I was impressed the bathroom amenities included a makeup remover towelette and Q-tips, as well as a makeup mirror. The complimentary breakfast in the morning was great. It included a few choices of cereal, hot oatmeal, hot sausage patties, hot scrambled eggs, and hot French toast. Also a choice of yogurt, fruit, bread, bagels, and breakfast pastries. All in all this property is a good value. It's not perfect but I would stay here again based on the price.

Location Location Location. Very helpful staff. Breakfast value for money. Extremely clean rooms. We would definitely recommend it! The idea with the iced water in the lobby with fresh lemon is very appreciated.

Just completed our 4 night stay. The hotel itself is updated, offers a mediocre breakfast, and has a good location. The room is clean and modern but even floor 15 had a lot of traffic noise. This can be expected of most New York hotels so not a huge deal. Only giving 2 stars due to the insanely annoying elevator noise. The elevator makes a loud banging noise every floor it passes, all day and night. The building is so narrow that the noise is heard in the rooms as it goes up and down. Other guests were also complaining and we had to use earplugs to sleep. Unless they fix this I would recommend staying some place else.

I am currently sitting in my hotel room, so my perspective on this is fresh. All of the reviews are spot on. Great location, clean and friendly staff. The only issue I am having is that the elevator is really old or there is something seriously wrong with it. I can hear each time it's in use and it makes this loud double knocking noise (I am assuming that the wires or the wheels are old and it cranks each time it is used). This is super unfortunate because without this loud disturbance I would have rated this hotel higher. I did call the front desk, but they said that I should use ear plugs if I am disturbed by the noise. I would think that someone would look at this issue since it could also be a safety problem.

Great hotel. Nicely situated in Midtown close to Subway station (Herald Square). Helpful staff and very clean. Small rooms but typical for NYC. Excellent breakfast. Overall and excellent hotel for a NYC vacation.

Stayed for a night in the heart of the city. For the location being Midtown, I didn't hear much noise which was a good thing. Very quiet location and comfortable rooms. Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone spending one night or spending a week in the city. Extremely friendly staff too!

Hotel was located right smack in middle of lots of attractions without it being in too busy and noisy a spot. We were able to walk everywhere to our destinations during our 3day visit to the city. Didn't need any public transportation at all.

Good receptionists. Special thanks to Shazeema for city tips and good check in check out. Nice rooms and cosy beds. Bathroom is nice too, many towels, good water pressure.Excellent location.Breakfast is medium.Would recommend it for short stays

This hotel was excellent, very central for many "tourist" spots. Very clean, rooms cleaned every day and no restriction on towel/bed linen changes. Staff very helpful at front desk - nothing was too much trouble and also gave some hints and tips to help us make decisions. Had good knowledge of subway, which saved us a lot of money on taxis. Enjoyed the breakfast, as the variety was good and plenty of hot dishes. Could be a little crowded at times, but a little patience and you soon found a seat. Lovely little lounge at the back of the hotel with an "open air" area. Great place to chill with a glass of wine after a hectic day!! Would certainly recommend and if I am every in N.Y. again would have no hesitation in booking. Also like the idea of free iced water and coffee/tea available 24/7 in the lobby.

My name is Sree Varanasi, I wanted to take the time to say how much I appreciate the staff and service at the Best Western Premiere Herald Square. I have had the pleasure of staying multiple times at this Outstanding Hotel and the staff is extraordinary. Commendation must be given to Front Desk Manager Jay Singh, Front Desk Agents Shamiza, Bebe, Sade, Isa, and Salman, and the lovely AM doorman. This excellent staff has made me feel at home every single time, providing me with the best room and service, especially when I had surgery on my Achilles' tendon. I cannot wait for the next opportunity to stay here!

Family of 8 doing the tourist thing. We couldn't be happier with the hotel. Breakfast was a bit crowded but good. Room quiet. Staff amazing. Location perfect. The price was fair and in line with other hotels. They gave us two rooms next to each other without any problem.

I had to take a quick overnight trip to NYC for work and found a good rate at Best Western Herald Square. I normally stay away from chain hotels in NYC, but took a chance with this. Location-wise, it worked out great. There are several subway lines nearby, and it is a short walk from Penn Station. The hotel itself seems very new. When you look at the hotel from the outside, it is very much a new meets old with the surrounding buildings. The check-in lobby is a bit small. The rooms are also a bit small. For an overnight stay, it wasn't much of a bit deal. But for a multi-night stay, you should ask for a larger room. Other points - good bathroom, nice bed, quiet, free wifi. Would stay again.

This hotel is in a great location in NYC. Everything within walking distance. Empire building is only few minutes away, Times Square about 10 mins away. Has many eating places around. Room was small but all that you need as you won't be spending your time in it much. Didn't have a chance to try breakfast. Overall would recommend for people who want to explore NYC on foot.

Everything was smooth from the time we arrived through our departure. Joshua at the front desk was instrumental in arranging to hold our baggage and arrange our return trip to the airport. My twin sister and I only had a few days to accomplish a great deal of work and were truly ready for happy hour at the end of the day.. Stephen and Tommy (new to the job) were excellent bartenders. We had a great time. Thanks

I have stayed in NYC a few times and it's always a struggle finding the right hotel without breaking the bank. My daughter and I stayed here for 4 nights and loved it. The location is perfect for shopping sight seeing and transport. The breakfast was far beyond my expectations offering fruit, cereal, eggs, bacon, sausage as well as toast, bagel, pastries, yoghurts so much choice and included in the price. We were even offered a takeaway on the last day as we were running to get a cab to the airport.The rooms are like most rooms in NYC compact, the beds were really comfortable, and there was no waiting time for the lifts.Would 100% book this hotel again.

My 5 year old daughter and I spent a few days in NYC for her Spring Break. The hotel staff couldn't have been any nicer to us! We especially enjoyed meeting Ryan. He treated us like royalty and made my daughter's trip so memorable.

This is a review of two halves – the good and the bad. The good half is that Best Western is located in a great central location, if you’re visiting New York for business or pleasure. The metro is just 5 mins away, along with Macy’s, the Gap and H & M among my other favourites. For any of you coffee addicts like me, good news there’s a Starbucks nearby, meaning you don’t have to go far for your daily caffeine hit. This was my second visit having previously visited last year and if I’m honest a last minute.com choice, as my other two first options were fully booked. Inside the lobby, I was welcomed by reception. I have to commend the reception staff, as for the second time I found them welcoming, friendly and professional. I double-checked that I’d been booked into a king executive room, having experienced the annoyance on my previous visit, of having a Queen room booked for me and arriving to find it was an accessible room, a fact not mentioned online.  My room was on the 17th floor, directly opposite the lift ensuring I was fully conversant with the sound of the hoover, slamming of room doors and any lively conversations that took place beside the lift. The absence of soundproofing was pretty shocking in an establishment of this rating level. My room was a decent size and as I entered the room I was greeted by a green croc topped size stool, which was directly beside wall mounted power points, alongside a desk and a great chair. Why mention a chair, well let’s just take this as my direct read to all those hotels out there, that have crappy chairs to go with their desks. It’s like being punished because you want to work in your room. All too often, comfort is sacrificed to keep room budgets in check, but to the comfort detriment of their customers. The Western’s chair was leather, comfortable with a decent back support meaning I had a place other than on my bed to take my morning calls and have my coffee while I worked. The table lamp was also winner with a decent bulb wattage and integrated power points. On the desk a hospitality tea tray – the selection was adequate but lacked fruit tea and no milk, just one powder creamer sachet, which I only discovered when I unwrapped one of the three multi packs of sugar and stirrer sets provided. I have to reinforce the lack of milk again – beyond annoying for any guest, but as a Brit who loves a nice afternoon cup of tea, it was frankly unacceptable and another sign of rash budget cutting. The TV didn’t disappoint large and the stations offered were beyond diverse allowing me to entertain myself with a hearty selection of guilty pleasure TV. My bed was so darned comfortable, I had little desire to leave it any time soon :)Best of all was the view like my own New York movie, up on the rooftops, allowing me to look down on this bustling metropolis. The bad half of my review right here. The eagled eyed among you, must be wondering why I didn’t mention the bathroom. For me unfortunately, this was scored by me with a crater sized black mark for several reasons. While the basics - a reasonable sized sink, space to put your toiletries and enough towels were clearly on show. The essential element to any bathroom  – decent water pressure was most definitely AWOL. I noticed it right away, when I went to brush my teeth. The water spat, sprayed and gurgled its way out of the tap violently, like it was being pushed out under duress. I had to run the water for several minutes to establish a decent water flow and the same unfortunate experience happened with the shower – diminishing the joy of morning wake-up !  Also absent was shower gel. Instead I was ‘treated’ to one boxed, soap tablet in the shower and a further two by the sink – talk about wasteful. The shower décor was just ish for me.  I noted that the bathroom cubicle door opened out, instead of in, the insulator protector at the bottom of the door was coming away and the bathroom floor was so dull and uninteresting, it really could have done with being replaced. Breakfast was a bleak affair, tired looking pastries and coffee - served downstairs in a room which had all the warmth of a hospital waiting room. I turned on my heel and straight out of the hotel for better offsite alternatives. While I know increasingly few NY hotels offer ‘free’ breakfast, if you can’t do it to a decent standard, then I my humble opinion, you shouldn’t do it at all. Location wise Best Western is definitely a great place to stay in New York. terms of value for money in my opinion, it’s too expensive for what it is. Either up your game guys or drop your prices which would be instantly manage guests’ expectations of what to expect from your establishment.

The hotel is greatly located, walking distance to many attractions. The room was maybe a little bit too small, but hey, it's New York! Personnel was kind, helpful and professional. Check-in and check-out processes were easy and fast. Good breakfast included.

Stayed here for a week in a twin room (two double beds) and a father and daughter week trip to New York. Firstly the location of the hotel was great, we didn't use the subway once as everywhere was in walking distance and we used the hop on hop of bus to go down and up town. The room was cleaned brilliantly every day, beds were really comfy, wonderful big shower in bedroom. The breakfast was great with different choices each day! The only criticism of breakfast would be the room is very small, and this meant we woke up early to make sure we could get a table and didn't have to que up and wait around for a free table. The staff were friendly and helpful in showing us how to get around town and back to JFK via penn station, so much cheaper than a taxi and very quick and easy! Another great feature is the tea/coffee/water in the foyer which you can help your self to at any time. The room was quiet throughout the night, our only complaint would be as we were on the second floor at times loud music would play from the hotel next door which was a bit annoying, but most of the time we didn't hear it as we were out/it wasn't playing. 100% would recommend. We had a brilliant time!!!

My husband and a great friend of ours went to NYC to attend the Sunset Boulevard on Broadway. The location of this hotel was perfect as we were in walking distance to the theatre and also Penn station as we took a train up from Philadelphia. The hotel staff were extremely professional and personable. We only stayed 1 night and our room was inviting, clean and beautiful. We are planning another trip to NYC in May and will be staying at this Best Western location.

A group of us were visiting NYC, and not staying at the Best Western Premier Herald Square, stopped in the lounge for a drink. BEST, BEST experience ever. Stephen, host/bartender, was the BEST. Cannot rave enough about our experience. Exceptionally clean. Stylish and welcoming. Although we usually stay at a different hotel when we are in NYC, we have decided to stay at Best Western Herald Square on our next visit. This decision is based solely on the hospitality of Stephen.

Such a great staff at this location. The bed was super comfy and the breakfast was great! Easy short walk to Herald Square subway station. Will certainly stay at this Best Western again on a future trip.

Just spent a week here and really enjoyed our stay, the staff was friendly and helpful from the front desk to Stephen at the bar .The bar has indoor as well as outdoor seating in a quaint patio . The room did not have much of a view, but it was clean and quiet for New York thats a win! The location of the hotel is perfect to get around town, you can walk, take the subway a block away or jump in one of the thousands of taxis driving by outside. Breakfast is included and usually crowded......( coffee, bagels, muffins and some fruit) if you want anything else there are countless places within walking distance to have a full breakfast. I would stay here again, for the convinience , price and friendly staff.

Very convenient to Empire State Bldg & subway, bit of a walk to Time Square & Theater, but we like walking.. Room & Bath is smallish as usual in NYC, but very clean and well kept. Breakfast is ok but crowded. "Business" room is a cubby with a screen & printer.

Quick weekend trip to NY. The hotel offers a great location and the front desk staff were very helpful making suggestions for restaurants and the subway system. Rooms are well appointed and the breakfast was good. Lots of shopping close by within walking distance.

This is a great centrally located hotel that's also easy on the wallet. We chose it due to its location and were impressed with the warm and courteous staff and overall cleanliness of the hotel. The rooms are small, but they are efficient and well designed. The only issue we had was from the loud street noise which can easily be alleviated by wearing the provided ear plugs.

In New York for the Half Marathon on March 19th and stayed at the BW Herald Square. Excellent welcoming staff and accommodations.Being so close to 5th Avenue thought we might have noise issues but all was quiet.Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

This hotel and its' staff made us feel like family from the minute we walked in. We travel a lot but never stayed overnight in NYC and didn't know what to expect but my goodness, this hotel not only has a great location, is very clean but the staff all made us feel like "family". I have already recommended it to many of my friends and family.

My first night in January was better than my night in March but I would still stay again in this hotel. This time the price was more expensive, the room was extremely hot even though we turned thermostat down and our neighbors were very loud. So much for the sound proof rooms. The staff for the most part was nice .....some more than others.

Your stay the staff were very courteous and helpful they went out of their way to make sure that we had everything we needed to explain to all the amenities they have let us help keep our lives there until we came back where we parked their car would recommend this hotel business or pleasure very very courteous and helpful

Needed a place to stay for a quick trip to New York with my young adult grandson that was located within walking distance to the theater district. Have had luck with other Best Westerns and decided to give this one a try. I was not disappointed. The location is ideal (easy walk to Penn Station, theater district, Times Square, etc) but on a quieter side street (36th Street between 5th and 6th Avenues). Met friendly and helpful staff throughout our stay. Rooms were New York tiny, but immaculate and provided all essentials. Beds were comfortable. Great views of the Empire State Building out 17th floor window. Expansive hot breakfast was complimentary and there was a bar in the back. Though I didn't use it, I was given a card for a free second drink. The only negatives I have were relatively minor and both involved the elevator..there was a very long wait for the elevator after breakfast (2 elevators, 17 floors and everyone going to and from breakfast at the same time) and a weird banging from the elevator shaft that other reviewers mentioned. The only time the banging was bothersome was early in the morning when the elevator was in frequent use going to breakfast. It sounded like someone was bouncing a ball against the wall outside our room. Once I realized where the noise was coming from, I could ignore it. My grandson slept through it and never heard it at all. Great "grab food" eat in/take out place a couple of doors down was helpful as well. Final tally-reasonable NYC price became better with breakfast savings and walkable location. Would definitely stay here again, even with the elevator noise.

Booked a last minute stay here on hoteltonite and we were so glad that we picked the best western! Only stayed one night but the rooms served its purpose very well. Yes the rooms are smaller, between the bed, small desk, and side tables theres not much space in the room, but hey its midtown. There was a little hallway into the room that makes it seem quite a bit bigger than your typical NYC room, and the bathroom was very nice- none of that shower/tub nonsense, it had a lovely stand up tiled shower. And of course- LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION! Everything cliche in NYC is walkable, but the hotel is off on a quiet side street, so you can barely hear the city at night. Best of both worlds.Above all, the staff were so kind and courteous. They made sure check in was a breeze and made friendly conversation any time we were waiting in the lobby. Overall a great experience.

Location: 2 blocks from Herald Sq subway (5 minute walk)The staff makes this place. Very pleasant, extremely accommodating. Every level from front desk to breakfast help to housekeeping. Good people trained well.Very clean.Very good breakfast with great, fresh choices. Breakfast room is somewhat small and there are lines for a table at peak times.Guest rooms are very small even by New York standards. (They are small by European standards.) Pillows hard and uncomfortable. The mattress soft and lumpy.Very loud from internal noise. All hall and next room noise is loud. The elevator shaft is VERY loud with a banging like being in an MRI machine. (Worst in rooms ending in 6-might as well be in the shaft).

I stayed here with 5 friends for 5 nights and we had a brilliant stay. Check in was a little slow as only 2 out of 3 rooms were ready but once we were all settled I couldn't fault the hotel. The rooms were cosy, clean and comfortable, complimentary tea and coffees in the room and reception as well as breakfast too. the staff were always friendly and helpful and we were allowed to stay an extra hour in our rooms after check in. All in all we had a great stay and I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the big apple

I have been fortunate to visit 6 times, I have to say this is the best hotel I have stayed in.The location is spot on, walking distance to everything. Macy's around the corner, tour bus stops close by and the subway a couple of blocks away.Everything was exceptional from the cleanliness, to the friendly and helpful staff on reception, housekeeping and at breakfast. (Shameeza could do with some customer service tips).Our room was on the 17th floor and had an amazing view, but the smaller touches made the stay, free water and tea and coffee in the lobby 24hrs, and the most important thing the breakfast. I have never stayed in a NYS hotel the breakfast before, it is not michelin star, but has everything you need to start your day and if you are on a budget it helps as the average decent breakfast is around $15, so this was perfect.I would definitely return and highly recommend.Thank you for a great stay.

Had a great experience at this hotel. So central, people that work there are so nice and the best breakfast ever. We ate so much that we lasted many hours of sightseeing afterwards. Different types of eggs everyday, pancakes sometimes and different desserts and yoghurt. What more can you ask for? I highly recommend this hotel.

Great stay with attentive staff who solve what ever problem that arises nearly instantaneously. The small exercise area is perfectly adequate for a morning work out. The hotel is well located. I travel frequently around the world and within the US and this hotel is truly a gem.

Literally just returned from my first trip to NYC and was pleasantly surprised by the location of this hotel.It's literally a few minutes walk to Macy's and Herald Square which is home to many stores for lots of shopping if that's your thing. Times Square is also within walking distance but it is a fair old trot but worth it if only to absorb the atmosphere of NYC itself. The room itself wasn't particularly big but it was all that was needed. A clean bed, clean bathroom and WARM! The staff were always on hand to help with any questions or queries and the breakfast was good enough to kick start your day, although the later you go down the busier it is, and the breakfast room isn't very big, although with plenty of places to eat this wasn't really a negative more an observation as we managed to get seated and eat plenty even if we had a short wait. There were 2 lifts operating within the hotel and the view from our particular room was amazing with the top of the Empire State Building being just over our shoulders and directly out of the window. We had a late flight home and our luggage was looked after whilst we ventured out for the remainder of the time we had left. The housekeeper always looked after anything we left in our rooms well putting it neatly down if it was on the bed. I couldn't find fault with the hotel and if it wasn't so expensive to return when I'm hoping to I would have booked again without hesitation! There's water, tea and coffee available 24 hours and the main hotel lounge was lovely and warm to be. A lovely little gem! Thanks for the lovely time!

We arrived for earlier than the 3 pm check in a weekend getaway weary from the trip and lugging our bags from penn station. We no way expected to be allowed to check into our room at 1:30, but the girl at the front desk was so accommodating... Smiled and said of course! The room we knew would be small but really we didn't need much room with only 2 of us. King bed was somewhat comfy (nothing beats Hampton inn beds thougH)... Coffee maker in room with premium coffee was delicious. Newly decorated, modern. Excellent lighting (am a stickler for that) and dreamy shower... Tons of hot hot water. If you can ask for higher floor . We were on 5th and noisy street especially on trash day. But the hotel even provided ear plugs and that did the trick. The lobby is small but free coffee, tea and water provided. Even a small bar in the back with nightly happy hour. Free breakfast is basic but hot. The real thing going for this hotel is the staff. They smile and look you in the eye and seem to genuinely like each other and their jobs. And that translates into an exceptional experience for everyone! Thanks we'll be back. Walk to Andrews coffee shop if want good diner breakfast that won't break the bank.. $7 bucks eggs and bacon . Oh and they will keep your luggage for you after check out no charge!

Excellent, central location. CLOSE to subway, Penn station,Macy's. A good walk to Central Park, an easier walk to theatres. The hotel is small but we'll fitted out. Virtually a new hotel. The room was small, but we were not entertaining. Bed was very comfortable, excellent WiFi reception. Workout room small, but useful. The bar is comfortable (too cold for the patio), full at happy hour.Complementary breakfast was very good, a mix of hot and cold.If the room had been larger I would have given 5 stars. We will stay here again. My wife loved the location. Lots of restaurants close by.

This review could have been much better but also much worse (the staff made it up to me)Stayed here with my mum for 4 nights, the room was lovely, great size and spotlessly clean. The maid cleaned one day and moved my SIM card and part of my phone which was a big problem (I was advised by Vodafone to take my sim out for a few hours as it hadn't been working) when I got back to the room the cleaner had cleaned and the sim and part of iPhone was missing and all our stuff had been moved, I found the sim on the floor but couldn't find that sim holder. The hotel looked for it too, but couldn't find it, it was on top on my phone and should never have been moved. I then had to spend part of my stay in the apple shop, they don't stock the parts so had to buy a cheap iphone as I need to make calls for work while away. The hotel paid for our cab back to JFK which while was a great gesture which I appreciated didn't cover the $200 phone. I had read other reviews before I booked and people mentioned the noisy lifts, they are a little noisy but I think I only noticed them as I had read the reviews as my mum didn't. The noise I did notice however was the ice machine been used at 5:30am EVERY morning on the dot! One morning I grumpily stormed out of bed to have a look and realised it was a member of staff using the machine, very inconsiderate! I can understand the ice machine having to be used by at 5:30am that's a little too early for my liking! I also read reviews saying rooms were small but ours was a great size! Huge bed, big shower, great view! Overall the stay wasn't bad and I would probably stay again as I think my experience with my phone was obviously a one off even though I don't like the maid moving my stuff, the hotel were apologetic and tried to make it up to me. I would just recommend the hotel telling their staff not to use the ice machine that early!If you want a great location at reasonable prices choose this hotel!

Room was clean and comfortable friendly staff free breakfast was ok could of been better if there were different choices French toast was hard and gross. Need to offer bottled water as well. Other than that nice experience

We came Valentines week 2017 and stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Just me and my wife chose the premier king suite. The view was amazing from the 16th floor. You could hear the sounds of the city just enough for it to be enjoyable. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable! They helped us out with everything from great local eating places to how to get around in the city. The continental breakfast was filling, complete with hot and cold items. However my wife and I chose Chick-fil-A two blocks away most mornings. The Empire State Building is two blocks down and one block over. Entrance to the Subway (34th and Herald Square) was just two blocks away. Macy's, H&M, Forever 21, etc are right at the subway stop. Times Square is just one more stop down on the subway (2 min ride). The location was perfect!!! The rooms made great use of the space allotted to them. Although they were quaint they didn't seem cramped. They were very clean all the way down to the remote control. The cleaning staff was kind and helpful!The only downside was a clanging noise that came from the elevator shaft. The noise could be heard every time the elevators moved. It was not overwhelmingly loud and did not keep us up at night but you could hear it in the room. Again, the front desk provided us with earplugs when we called down to ask about the noise. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York!

This hotel is in Times Square, a few blocks from all the lights. There are many restaurants, bakeries, bars etc right on the block. It is close to a subway station. The staff is very nice, offered to get us a taxi, whatever we needed. It is just a few blocks from the subway, and from Macy's as well as many other sights in NY. A really good choice for a vacation. The rooms are small, but the price (for NYC) was very good. Despite activity outside at all hours, the room was quiet.

This hotel was very nice to holiday at. Breakfast as much as you like for no extra cost. Rooms are good size with en suite shower. Not noisy at all. TV good. Coffee machine too. Reception lovely too. Ryan the porter was very courteous too. Only problem we had was key had a knack of opening door. Couple times it took few goes. I'd defo recommend this hotel to everyone..

Have just returned home from a 4 night stay at this hotel with family. Between us we had 4 rooms on different floors and none of us were disappointed. All rooms were cleaned to a high standard with beds made up & bathrooms cleaned every day. The most important things to me when staying at a hotel is a clean fresh bed & clean bathroom. This hotel has got it spot on. Large clean shower area was fab.Breakfast room is also kept clean & different breakfast choices were available each morning. Sufficient choice & something available to suit everyone. This hotel is also very conveniently situated for making your way around the city & close to subway for those days when you want to travel way downtown or uptown but want to save some walking time. The staff were all very accommodating, friendly & welcoming, a credit to the hotel & they have a lovely comfortable little lounge for those nights when you want to round off the evening with a little night cap before bed. I chose this hotel based on the reviews which were consistently good & I'm glad I did. We were not disappointed. If there are any bad reviews on this hotel I can only say some people you will never please ! Thanks to ALL the staff at this hotel who do their bit to make this a good clean friendly place to stay.
