I would be happy to stay here again & will recommend this hotel to others. Thank you for making it great. Best wishes to all from Bonnie Scotland

We have stayed in twin double bed family room for 6 nights. Overall impression is very good, delicious breakfast every morning served in the basement dining room. Hotel room a bit small for a family with two children, but we couldn't find anything better for this price. Location is very good, close to Metro, Macy's and Empire State Building. There is free coffee / tea / water available in the ground floor reception. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place.

This hotel is in a perfect Midtown location on west 36th street. By the time I arrived in the city it was 9pm & my registration was handled by a lovely welcoming lady in reception. We engaged in some good spirited intelligent political chit chat (it was the day after the travel restriction demos @ JFK the airport I had flown into & she was concerned that my journey had been ok)Fab loft style room with sloping windows on 16th floor with huge double walk in shower. Good selection for breakfast including excellent oatmeal. I had read other reviews before I left stating this fairly small room got over-crowded so I ensured I ate early - not difficult when suffering from jet lag anyway as I was awake @ 4.30am!As mentioned by other reviewers, this is a small footprint so all rooms are clustered around the two central lifts. The noise of these and the constant traffic buzz from outside meant it was not the best of sleepsHowever, the location is brilliantly central. I feel I had the best of both worlds by having 4 nights here then a further 4 at another hotel further uptown/east which was much quieter.

Great hotel and location, clean quiet modern room. Staff very friendly and accommodating. Empire State Building view from room (originally on 7th floor, asked to be moved to see the ESB, and they happily obliged after the first night - we stayed 5 nights- and moved us to the 14th floor)

Just back from a five night stay at this lovely hotel . Easy to find ,ten minute walk from Penn station.There are a few points that could be improved upon ,but overall a really good hotel ,friendly staff and a very convenient location,minutes away from all the best shopping in NYC.Good points....Great locationFriendly teamHelpful staff,from the front desk to the portersClean rooms ,efficient cleaning staffGreat wee cosy bar to the rear of the hotel with happy hour (check times )Nice seating area to the front of hotel.Free breakfast included,always something new daily,cereals,toast ,fresh fruit,yogurt ,bacon,eggs etc .Cons,and there isn't many reallyRooms really are very small,there were four of us in one room,four large cases,and shopping bags ,but it wouldn't put us of returning.It could perhaps be improved upon by getting rid of the desk chair(the legs stick out quite far),and replacing this with a smaller chair would help .Breakfast as is usual in most hotels gets very busy,although we always managed to grab a table without to much waiting,I imagine in the warmer months they open up the outdoor terrace to the rear which would relieve the pressure,they also do grab and go bags for breakfast .So if you can get this for a decent price go for it,the area is the best we have stayed in for sheer convenience to everything,two minutes from Macy's ,five mins in cab to Times Square.We always felt safe in this hotel,plenty folk walking to and from work at all hours,and always someone on the reception or the hotel lobby. Highly recommend .

We had an international flight landing in NYC at JFK at 8:30am with a PM connecting flight. We booked a room here on a website I've used before for day room hotels. (9 to 5). We took the subway to Herald Sq which took about 45 min then walked about 3 blocks. The room was nice and clean but as stated in all other reviews, it is tiny!Free wi fi. We visited the Empire St Building, which was our plan, and was less than 10 minute walk. It worked fine for us and I would return and spend the night some time.

Without any exaggeration, this hotel merits to be rated higher. It offers everything that can not only meet existential needs, but also give pleasure: 1. Location(it takes about 5 min to get to Times Square, and 5 seconds - to Fifth Avenue)2. Services that other hotels (rated 3 stars) do not offer: free wifi, a wide choice of very tasty food for breakfast, small, but with all necessary equipment gym, free tea and coffee during the whole day3. Daily cleaning of the room4. The staff that can manage all problems , very friendly!In particular, I would like to express my gratitude to Shameza who did her best to make my staying so comfortable and wonderful! The staff listen to their guests.One of main features of the hotel is the view from the window if you book king-size bed room. So, the reality completely corresponds to the description provided by the hotel. I will definitely come back and stay in it this summer!

very nice hotel in midtown close to times square and empire state building ..very nice choices for food on the same street as hotel ...was in city for business and the location was within walking distance to 7th ave

Stayed for 3 day weekend location was central we walked everywhere. Staff was very helpful and courteous. Rooms were quiet and well kept although a bit small. I would definitely stay here on another trip

I have stayed at this location several times while doing business in the city. It is clean, the staff are generally courteous. Its a great location. There are many restaurants in the area as well as good shopping. Convenient to Times Square as well. I am always pleased with the accommodations

We have stayed twice in this hotel and both times have been very happy with our experience. Friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms, free internet. Very good hot breakfast included in room rate. Location is near Fifth Ave., Penn Station, Empire State building, and subway statiin.

Room 202 I loved this hotel but if you are a light sleeper don't get a street facing room. I personally didn't have a problem with it. There are 2 lifts. Hot coffee or tea in foyer that you can take up to your room 24 hours. Small Gymnasium in lower ground. Breakfast not as good as other Best Westerns in Europe but still enough to keep you going if you aren't fussy. Staff were all very friendly. Room very clean. I could have done with a small fridge/mini bar for my medication. Bar wasn't open the week I was there apart from the Fri for a private function. Disappointed as it was my daughters birthday.

Never gonna win any awards and don't expect to see Empire State whilst sitting in your bath , but they do a good job with what they have to work with, rooms as expected small but nice laid out n very clean , great location for walking and even better for subway lines and main penn station , staff friendly and helpful , nice little bar , would say breakfast was so close to being good , but try cutting French toast that must have sat for an hour , the hot food was poor quality before being kept warm for ages , but breads n cakes Etc great choice so never left hungry, loved the very nice Coffey by the lift , other big complain packed snow boots hat gloves , wanted to see New York in the snow , the best western made it thewarmest sunniest weekend January on record

We really enjoyed our experience at the hotel. Around the corner is a Starbucks and subway station which we loved. We could walk to Times Square! Clean, friendly, and rooms are bigger than I thought they would be. They do hold your luggage before check-in and after check-out. I got sick the day of check-out and the staff were very nice and pushed our check-out time by 2 hours. Lobby has water, coffee, and tea for free which is convenient!

A very good option to be in Manhattan. The hotel is clean, the bedroom is small but confortable for 4 people (parents and 2 teenager) the breakfast is reasonable and you can find juices, coffee, milk, bread, eggs, bacon, bagels, cupcakes,etc Near 34th st where you can find Uniqlo, Macy´s, Vitoria's Secret and much more. The hotel is 10 minutes walk or less to Times Square and near to Empire States Building. It was a good experience in our vacation.

Very nice and cosy hotel in the heart of New York. Comfort room and good breakfast. But breakfast room is very small. After 9 a.p. there is a line. Location is great. 5 min from Times Square. Great value for money.

This hotel is perfectly located at the heart of midtown New York!The staff is helpful and they clean the room quickly. The rooms are small but the beds have nice king size. Breakfast is quite well, but could improve. Overall a very good stay with one of the best locations for exploring the city!

This small hotel is perfectly located at the heart of midtown New York!The staff is helpful & professional. The rooms are clean with all basic amenities, but small with not enough space to move around the bed (common for Manhattan). Nice king size bed.Breakfast is adequate, but could improve with addition of cheese & ham varieties.Overall a very good stay with one of the best locations for exploring the city!

I will return to this little gem. Right in the heart of "good stuff". Macy's, deli's, subways, shopping, pizza, even McDonald's is right around the corner if that's your fancy. The bar is as cute as they come and the bartender made great drinks. You really can hang out in there and feel real cozy.The patio in front of the hotel is most inviting. Feels like you are sitting in your backyard. Check it out for yourself. The staff is awesome especially Shameeza. The bed was extremely comfortable and for breakfast the had real oatmeal. A very helpful staff at breakfast as well.

Can't really say enough positive things about this place. Huge, comfortable bed. Immaculately clean room with good shower and good sized bathroom. Amazing location. Great buffet breakfast- eat enough and you won't need lunch! Stunning view of Empire State Building from the room. And for the price, I don't believe you'll find better in Manhattan. There are, as anywhere, a couple of niggles. The elevators do bang a bit which you can hear in the rooms. And the breakfast room is too small. I tended to go down earlyish, about 8.30, and always found a table with no problem, but by the time I was leaving I noticed people were waiting for a while. Overall though this is great value for money and will be my new go-to hotel in Manhattan. Highly recommended.

Extremely friendly staff! The "welcome bag" was a really nice touch!Comfortable bed! Breakfast was the best I've ever had at a BW( probably due to the lovely presentation of food). Subway was just around the corner getting you up or downtown in minutes!! We come in to explore the Big Apple or see a show. We are looking forward to Returning to this hotel! Great location & a great value!

Everything was super clean and well organized. The staff was welcoming and friendly. The location is very, very convenient to the Penn Station Herald Square area. Although everything is compact, there's plenty of room if you just want to relax, sleep, shower, etc. The bed is comfortable and fresh, bathroom spotless, and storage adequate. We had a king bed, and there was still room to move. Complimentary breakfast was adequate, and there is coffee and hot water in the lobby. The only negative, and it would have been a big negative if I hadn't brought earplugs, is that there are VERY loud thumps (at all hours) whenever the elevator is moving. I noticed that the elevators had been inspected August 2016 by United Elevator. I suggest that next inspection they should check out that noise. Overall, it's a decent, comfortable, convenient hotel and I'd stay there again - with earplugs.

Very pleased with all aspects of 4-Night stay. Room was good size by New York standards, comfortable for heat, and quiet despite being across from elevator (as only 6 rooms per floor). Room was cleaned well and all 4 of us found beds to be very comfortable. Breakfast was excellent with wide variety of choices, always fully stocked even when busy and tables cleaned. Location was excellent to restaurant options in close proximity, few blocks to subway, hop-on, hop-off bus route, and New York Penn. Walked back from Times Square a couple times. Would stay there again.

I feel very lucky to have found this hotel. I go to NY for work each week and had been staying at Best Western hotels in Brooklyn the past couple weeks (also nice); but this week the price was excellent for this one in Manhattan. Great stay. Nice room, staff, value and location

The hotel was nice and clean. Our room was larger than we expected. The breakfast was good but kind of crowded in a small room. We'd def visit again! PRIME location for everything!!!! Within walking distance of the Subway, Times Square, Empire State Building, Macy's, Baker Park, Grand Central Station, Rockefeller, 5th Avenue....everything! Parking garage nearby with discounted validated parking, great bars and restaurants nearby. Give it a shot! You won't be sorry!

5th Dec 2016 - My wife and I spent 3 nights at this hotel near to Macy's and The Empire State Building. The hotel building looked small from the outside and Small on the inside. Our room was small but luxurious, a window view of the Empire State Building just outside, Coffee and tea facilites and all the modern equipment was very good and to be expected and bathroom with shower only. The restaurant again was very small and crowded, breakfast was ok and nothing special to talk about. It has a Gym, conference room and bar. Local amenities were just around the corner from the hotel, Macy,s Shopping Center, Empire State Build and near to Bryant Park, Trains and buses are within minutes walk. Its an ideal spot to walk in any direction to shop, dine and take in the sights.

The hotel is in the heart of the City, a block from the Empire State Building, a 15 minute walk to Times Square and Rockefeller. Subway stops to everywhere else. Location is its biggest asset. The room is small, even by NYC standards, but it is clean and convenient. The staff is friendly and polite.

We stayed here for six nights. We came in by train from Newark Airport and Penn Stn is only blocks away. The hotel is small but in a very convenient location between 5th and 6th. Our room was small but updated and very clean. We were on the back of the building and it was very quiet. Breakfast was adequate but nothing special.

Stayed at this hotel following a recommendation. It proved to be the most perfect location for a sight seeing trip !! Penn station and herald Square subway very close - Empire State Building literally round the corner !! The hotel itself was comfortable and clean - great breakfast - staff polite and helpful - the rooms were small but perfectly adequate !!

Stayed Dec 16 to 21. Located right in the heart of the city. Very convenient. Macy's Herald Square and Empire State Bldg are just 5 minute walk from the hotel as well as the subway if you wanna venture out to either downtown or uptown. Free breakfast everyday and the drinks at the bar is buy 1 get one free! Staff are warm and accommodating. Allowed early check in. If no room available yet, they have a storage room for your luggage so can immediately start exploring the city!

Perfect location, warm welcome, ultrafast check-in. All organizational stuff was handled with high efficiency, including simple trivia as printing a boarding pass and pointing to a quick way on getting to JFK. Also short term parking for offloading was easy.. and the snow on the morning - wonderful. Thanks:-)

This hotel is situated between the 5th and 4th. It is centrally located with plenty of amenities nearby (casual restaurants, coffe shops). We stayed on the twelve floor.. There are five or six rooms per floor and we were situated in the back, so it was very quiet. Breakfast was good and varied every day. The room was smallish but there was enough space for our luggage. The bathroom was very small with no shelves for our toiletries. There was a bar in the back and a little terrace at the front. We had torrential rain for two days out of six, so it was really nice to be able to shop at Macy's (great sales) and be nearby the metro. We recommend this hotel for its prime location and great staff and we will be surely staying at the Best Western Herald Square next time we visit this great city.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel in early December. We were welcomed warmly by the front desk and we were quickly checked in. For the five days we stayed there, the staff was very helpful and responsive. The room was clean and very comfortable. We highly recommend this hotel!

For mid town New York stay and proximity to attractions can't be any better. Walking distance to PennSation/LIRR. Stafff was excellent. If arriving JFK, train to Penn Station is best way to go for price/convenience. Going to a show or restaurant this hotel is within walking distance. Subway is walking distance.

The hotel is conveniently located very close to 5th avenue and the empire state building. Rooms were find, no noise (at least on upper floors). They don't allow to book a two queen beds for a family (you need to book 2 rooms)

I travel to NY for business often and this is my secret hotel. The location is great, staff is always helpful and responsive, hotel is clean, and the manager ensures guests are well taken care of. I have stayed in many 5 star hotels around the world, and find the beds and sleep at this hotel very comparable. Highly recommend!

The shower pressure was so low my wife filled cups with water in the sink so I could rinse my hair. Thin walls heard noise all night long. The parking was not on site and I felt unsafe using the garage.

We go up every year to visit family and see Santa at the Herald Square Macy's. The people are so accommodating and friendly it's sometimes hard to believe (particularly given the reputation of NYC generally).I wish now that I could remember everyone's names but in particular the gentleman who helped with our bags and brought up the portable crib for our son has always been warm and friendly and gone out of his way to make our stay pleasant. The people at the front desk remembered us from last year and are always happy to chat and offer advice for going out into the city when they're not assisting other people.I'd probably stay here every trip if I didn't want to try hitting other parts of the city. I might anyway and just brave the subway next year...

The Hotel has a great location. Macey's is close by and the are many good restaurants within 2 blocks. From here it is easy to get to any place in the city. You can walk, take the subway or a taxi. Times Square, Madison Square Garden, Penn Station, Broadway and many other places are that close.The rooms are kept very clean and plenty of towels. The beds are very comfortable, unlike some hotels. We stayed in a King Executive room and were very pleased. It was our second time here.The staff is simply amazing! Especially Issa and Bebe! Thank you so much for all your help. Everyone was wonderful and helpful. The best overall staff at any hotel we have been to. We were married while there, and the staff was very supportive with suggestions and directions.We will be back to NYC and we wil be staying here!

The room was small and it had the smallest bathroom I've had in a hotel room, but surprisingly very quiet in the middle of Herald Square in New York City! There is not much of a front to the hotel, but definitely in a good area for getting to Macy's and the Empire State Building. Near the several subway sites. A short walk from Time's Square too.

Easy access to 6th and 5th, subway system and all uptown has to offer. If you can upgrade with BW points do so. The only thing we didn't like was the TP but hey it's NYC septic system...so swing by one of the local stores and grab some soft stuff! You can walk to Macy's, Saks, Rockefeller Plaza, etc. Staff was great and accommodating allowed us to have late check out, others were having bags held for their late departure. Hotel breakfast was great, cereal, hash browns, etc. nice to have onsite. This is a great location and we felt safe and comfy! Had a great stay and will stay again!

My daughter brought me to NYC for the 2016 Macy's Parade. This hotel was within walking distance of Macy's, Times Square and other retail stores, .The staff at the Main Desk was always cheerful, greeting us as we entered or exited the building..They were helpful answering questions about the area. The refreshment cart in the lobby was wonderful, particularly when we could make a hot beverage after we came in from the chiily weather. Our room was immaculate and well equiped with what we needed. The housekeeping keeping staff did an excellent job of recreating the "newness" of the room each day when we were out. I especially love the gentleman who escorted us to our room. He recalled us coming in September 2015. My daughter had broken a fingernail on her suitcase & was bleeding. He had provided a bandaid then. This visit, he asked if her finger had healed. THAT is personal service!We observed several families with younger children in the elevator and in the lobby, Although I dont have youngsters, this appears to be a family friendly hotel. If I return to NYC again, this will be my choices of accomodations.

The Staff at this hotel is the friendliest in New York City. It is very nice to be greeted everyday in New York City with sincerity and helpfulness. There is always fresh coffee, tea, or water available in the lobby. And this hotel has a hidden gem patio lounge!

Booked for a break on the 27th Nov to 30th Nov. Never been to New York or America before so was really looking forward to going with my partner.Location: The hotel was roughly 1.5 hours away from JFK airport (depending on traffic). We got a shared shuttle from the airport which dropped us off right near the hotel. The hotel was easy to find, big sign to indicate. We entered in and were greeted kindly by the staff (they also commented on how they loved our accents which made us smile). The hotel is about 10 minute walk from Times Square, 5 minutes from Empire State Building and 2 minutes from the department store Macys. I felt that the location was perfect and everything was within walking distance. Plenty of places to eat near the hotel as well and gift shops too!Room: Our room was on the 7th floor and unfortunately we had the view into an alley which was a shame as we would've liked to have a front room. However, the room was just right for our trip. It was quiet and cosy, wasn't expecting a massive room due to the size of New York city. King size bed with really soft and comfortable pillows. Big TV with plenty of channels but we didn't spend much time in the room anyway. The shower was amazing, had different settings and the right temperature. There is also a safe in the wardrobe for free. WIFI is also free so another perk that got us to book this hotel. Food: Breakfast was included in the package deal which was good as most New York hotels don't include this. The food left much to be desired but I wouldn't complain about it as it was included and saved us a few extra quid. The hot food changed every day, pancakes, oatmeal (porridge to me) and egg/bacon/sausage. There were pastries, cereal, fruit etc. Complimentary water, tea and coffee are offered in the reception area. Extra: The staff were very helpful with organising us things to do in New York. We organised the package deal with the Big Bus Tour company which included uptown, downtown, Brooklyn and night bus tours, Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island tour with audio, 9/11 memorial tour and bike ride rental. Due to our tight schedule and weather, we only took advantage of the uptown and downtown tour and Statue of Liberty. Definitely recommend asking about booking this. We even paid some at the hotel and the rest to the company (who you will see walking around Times Square). The staff also helped me with ringing the shared shuttle the night before our departure to confirm timing, All were really polite and lovely so please give my thanks to them. (can't remember names sadly!).I would definitely recommend this hotel to others, especially to those travelling to New York for the first time. It made one of my bucket list items the most amazing experience of my life and I would love to return one day! WORD OF ADVICE: Be prepared to tip! America is very into tipping and even though i expected it, it was a shock to experience as tipping isn't a norm in the UK and it did make our trip more expensive.

I know that the hotel standard in NYC is quite poor in general (or rather, good quality is very very expensive) but out of three different NYC hotels I stayed in this was the most disappointing. The location is superb - that is the one big plus. It is close to everything, but still not in a noisy area. There are several subway lines just 1-2 blocks away and many attractions are in a walking distance.So why do I believe it was poor? Well, first of all the breakfast was terrible. Disposable plates, poor selection and tasteless food did not impress us at all. Staff was in general minding their own business - sure they were helpful when they had to but I didn't feel that they put an extra effort in. Facilities weren't great either, even though it was very clean in both the common areas and the room.I wouldn't stay in this hotel again, but it wasn't a complete disaster either.

We recently stayed at the beginning of November. The hotel is in a fab position 7 mins walk to Penn Station 10 mins to Times Square, great location for shopping and getting about. Hotel rooms were immaculate clean great shower and great wifi. Nice bar to the back of hotel with outside area great to relax with a few drinks after walking all day. Breakfast was good plenty to choose from. Would recommend and definitely stay again if back in New York.

The staff was excellent and helpful. The location was great. The coffee/tea bar in the lobby as well as the complimentary (although somewhat sparse/basic) breakfast buffet was nice. The big problem is that there is apparently no service elevator so give yourself extra time in the morning or take the stairs. 4 out of 5.

Just returned from our 6 nights at this hotel.Everything was perfect from start to finish.Had a lovely room overlooking the Empire State Building.Room was modern and the bed was spacious and comfortable.All the hotel staff could not do enough,nothing was too much trouble and specially thank you to Bebe and Sade on reception for all their help and professionalism.Also breakfast was very good plenty to choose from.We would definitely recommend this hotel and we will be back one day.

My wife and I spent 4 days in NYC. We stayed at the Best Western Premier at Herald Square. Centrally located to all the NYC sites. The hotel room was EXTREMELY clean on our arrival. The staff could not have been more helpful and friendly, especially Bebe, the front desk supervisor. Always answered my questions with a quick answer and a smile. I HIGHLY recommend Best Western Premier in Herald Square for your NYC stay.

Fantastic location. Staff was courteous , noise factor was s problem. Water pressure was weak and washroom was a little tight. Need to address noise factor and water pressure. Also need to provide better options for breakfast. Lounge was great.

Recently stayed here for a week, 2 adults and 2 teenagers. Had a very clean, quiet and comfortable room on the 14th floor. Beds were very comfortable and room had great TV channels. The breakfast was fabulous - variety of hot dishes, cereals and pastries which varied every day. The coffee and water in the reception were very useful and available all day. The receptionists were so kind and always willing to help giving directions and advice. Happy hour in the evening was lovely in the outdoor patio. The bartender was great and always gave us bowls of nibbles when we were in the bar. Finally, the hotel was so centrally located within walking distance of most NYC attractions.

I found the Best Western Premier Herald Square very conveniently located and quiet. I particularly liked the fact that it is not one of these huge hotel complexes with hundreds of rooms. That is also reflected in the good service the attentive staff provides around the clock. Rooms are tiny but cater for all the needs of the average city traveller (including free Wifi). Compared with the other hotels on the same block I found the BW a bit lower scale than average. Still: It offers good value for the buck at this location.

I have stayed at this location several times and it always feels like a "home away from home" oasis in the city. Stephen in the lounge is a true gentleman and equally friendly to locals/regulars and guests from out of town alike!

This is a great hotel. It is conveniently located, well maintained, offers a complimentary breakfast, and overall a fantastic value. Jay and Bebe at the front desk are always welcoming and helpful. Erica in the breakfast area is also welcoming and very nice. I stay here whenever I travel to NYC for these reasons. Keep up the good work!

The hotel is in a great location in midtown. We had a room at the back of the hotel and it was very quiet for NYC. The lounge is nice and quiet and has great prices from 3-8. The free breakfast was better than most free breakfasts at other BW hotels. We had to check out at 4 am for our flight and they actually had a sack ready for us with water and snacks. Very thoughtful! The room was cleaned early as soon as we were out and about for the day.

Hotel is very well located, near Herald square station, penn station. It is walking distance from time square, Empire state ande Grand Central. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. Staff is helpful. The only negative point is the breakfast room, which is too small.

This hotel is great place to stay in New York city. It is a small but very warm and comfortable hotel with really helpful front of desk staff as well as all the other staff. The breakfast was good as was the free tea and coffee served all day in the reception. The room was very clean and tidy. It is a 5 minute walk from the Empire State building and a 10 minute walk to Time Square and 42nd street.

We have recently returned from a 6 night holiday at the Best Western Premier Herald Square and the hotel was everything we hoped for and so much more.Arriving at 9.15pm after a long day of travelling from the UK we were quickly and easily checked in and made our way straight to our room on the 14th floor. After reading many reviews I had emailed the hotel ahead of arrival requesting a room on a high floor (the hotel has 17 floors) with a view of the Empire State building. We were not disappointed! The view was fantastic and didn't get old all week - seeing it first thing against a bright blue sky, at sunset, in pitch black and even in low cloud. A big thank you to the hotel for accommodating this request.The room matched up to the view and we were delighted. Expecting a small room from reading previous reviews our room was a great surprise. With two of us travelling (Mum and daughter) we booked a double room with two double beds. The beds were extremely comfortable, we found space for our cases, between the wardrobe and the large chest of drawers there was more than ample space for our clothes, the beds were extremely comfortable and the room definitely boasts the most sockets of any hotel I've ever stayed in. The bathroom was also a great size with a double width, powerful shower, many toiletries and vanity mirror. Our room had always been cleaned when we returned mid-late afternoon. The hotel has two lifts which we found to be quiet and speedy. Like with anything, at busier times could be a bit of a wait with the lift stopping at many floors but we're talking a couple of minutes if that!Breakfast was the biggest surprise. Having breakfast included in the room rate was one of the reasons that we chose this hotel. We had planned on grabbing something quick each morning before heading out for a more substantial breakfast/brunch but the high quality and huge variety of the breakfast on offer in the hotel meant we instead filled up every day on fresh bagels, breads, pastries, cooked options (which changed daily) including porridge, hash browns, bacon, sausage patties, pancakes and waffles. Cereals and fruit were also available. The juice was gorgeous - freshly squeezed and the coffee was amazing. Others have mentioned the small size of the breakfast room. We never had any problem getting a table straight away and visited breakfast at varying peak times from 7.30 - 8.30am. Sometimes there were queues but there's plenty of space in reception and in the lounge or you could even take your food to your room! Worth the wait if you have one anyway.Sticking with refreshments, we loved the iced water and coffee facilities in the reception area. We made great use of this during our stay, always filling up our bottles before heading out on a morning or grabbing a coffee for a mid-afternoon re-charge. The coffee was the same great quality as in the breakfast room and this was a lovely touch!The location of the hotel is absolutely perfect. Sandwiched between 6th Avenue (Avenue of the Americas) and 5th Avenue you're never more than a few minutes’ walk from bars, cafes or restaurants (there's a Starbucks and a McDonalds just around the corner). On West 36th Street itself, across the road, there's a great Irish Bar if you get torrential rain like we did and just want to make a run for it - tasty food and drinks, huge portions, reasonable prices and a great atmosphere. Just a 5 minute walk from 34th Street Herald Square Subway station serving most of the major lines and Penn Station not much further along the street, this hotel is amazingly located for exploring the whole of Manhattan and beyond! We did a lot of walking to explore the city on foot: Times Square is approximately 20 minutes away and just a little further is the Rockefeller Centre. You're just 5 minutes away from the entrance to the Empire State Building, Macy's and Monarch Rooftop Bar on top of the Marriott (recommended for cocktails and amazing views of the Empire State!) . And if you head up 5th Avenue towards Central Park in no time you'll take in the library as well as Grand Central Station. It was our first time in New York and the location of this hotel just made everything so easy. Being on a slightly quieter street was great too - not being immediately thrust into the bustle but still with everything on your doorstep!This hotel is fantastic and made our holiday in New York a dream. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone - especially first time visitors like us. It's so much more than just the comfortable base in a great location we were looking for and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Starting from the warm and friendly reception of the front desk, the wait staff at breakfast & housekeeping one gets the feeling of being at a family gathering. Its so thoughtful to have not only coffee and tea in the lobby but also icecold water and free use of a laptop! I've stayed at bigger and more expensive hotels and there are less expensive hotels within the area but none that matches the cozy feeling at this one! Thank you

One of the best value for the money which you spend ... it is totally overwhelming and the crew which this particular place hires are a truly professionals from a concrete hotel management background ... front office executives are true assets to the hotel as they have provided great experience with their customer management skills.

The room was very clean and stocked, and very comfortable with a real shower! Many great choices for breakfast ( pastries, omelets)etc. Staff was very welcoming and helpful for information. Bebe went out of her way to help to make our stay the Best!!

A perfect location for exploring Manhattan by foot, our preferred mode of transport, and close to subway when necessary. Walking distance to all that mattered. Great sitting area out front for watching the world go by, excellent breakfast, nice really well laid out and comfortable room, great staff. The perfect hotel for our 5 day exploration of the city. Will stay again when next we return.

The hotel is modern and in a good location of Manhattan with easy access to subway and shopping. The room was clean and okay in space with free breakfast of great standard for USA but the staff is not friendly at all, working mostly with out name tags we feel not welcome for any question.

Hotel near delis, bars, Empire State Building, subway, Broadway, walking distance to Time Square and Central Park. Hotel was clean, rooms were comfortable, staff very helpful with directions and maps.

Stayed here for a couple of nights as we had tickets to Billy Joel at MSG. Great location for anything in the Garden. Room was small, as usual in NYC. Updated bathroom with great pressure in the shower. Breakfast is the usual BW fare and in the cellar. They do keep the hot dishes well stocked. Did try the bar out back. Staff were all very friendly and efficient.

The hotel was great! Perfectly clean. Rooms are super nice, bathroom clean updated and toiletry's were of good quality. Quite nights sleep, comfortable bed. Breakfast is far superior than any other hotel that I have stayed at, great selection of food that changed each day. Nice bar to get a great priced drink and relax at. Any questions we had about where to eat and how to get to places were answered right away. Bebe was an excellent front desk host who helped us greatly. Ryan got our bags to our rooms and gave us an overview of the room which was helpful. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

The location of this hotel is perfect for your stay in Manhattan. It is very near the Empire State Building and the busstop for the Big Bus Tour. And it is on walking distance from the metro station for the metro to the airport. The staff is helpfull and the rooms are small, but clean. We liked coming back to a clean room every evening. We always had a good night sleep in the wonderful bed. We were always happy with the variations of the breakfast. Personally I really loved the omelette with cheese and waffles. The next time when we are in New York again we surely going to consider this hotel again. ☺

You couldn't pick a better location - less than 10 min walk to Penn station for the E train to Jamaica to catch the Air train to JFK, round the corner from Herald square subway and Macy's. Short walk to the Empire State Building and Times Square. Hotel itself small and comfortable, staff unobtrusive and and yet attentive. Rooms clean, beds comfortable and a great shower with a decent hairdryer and toiletries. In addition, the breakfast was varied every day with plenty of choice, there were pastries, muffins, porridge, three cereals and two hot choices. Also bread and brioche and a toaster if you like your bread toasted. There was always good, hot coffee or tea available in the lobby and a fitness room and PC with printer available, oh, and not forgetting a coffee and tea maker in the room, and air conditioning. Recommend this hotel wholeheartedly.

Great location. 20 min. Subway ride to museum of nat. Hist. And 20 min. Ride to little Italy. Staff is wonderful, breakfast, bar tenders, and front desk. Room could get tight feeling if staying for more than 2 nights. Clean and hospitable hotel.

Great location for major sights and attractions. We walked everywhere. The hotel is very small, about 6 rooms on each floor so when we requested a quiet room, we ended up getting one right across from the elevator (even after going back down to reception to change). Guests need to realize that people may be sleeping and shouldn't be talking at the top of their lungs while waiting for the elevator or letting their toddler run back and forth through the hallways.Our 2 double bed room was just the right size for the 2 of us. Note there is not much room around the beds but we managed. The beds were comfortable and we slept soundly when the hallways were quiet. There is not enough hooks in the bathroom to place stuff and the counter is very small.The lobby always provided free coffee, tea and iced water which was a much appreciated necessity during our crazy hot visit in August. The little patio out front and in the bar area in the back was cute.Breakfast in the basement was complimentary and we enjoyed the offerings. You need to go early if you want a seat. We had no problems finding a seat every day...There was a good selection of hot food that changed every day and the usual cereal, pastries, and yogurt were available. We were surprised that they offered fresh fruit as well! The staff were wonderful in making sure the food was replenished. The free wifi was spotty so I relied on my own data plan. The front desk staff for the most part seemed to want to help you.

My family and I stayed here for the day and found the hotel to be in an excellent location with easy access to the shopping on Times Square and some excellent restaurants.The hotel is unpretentious with a small reception area and outside seating area. The rooms are small (we had a double, double room on the 7th floor) spotlessly clean and adequately furnished, there was only one chair at the desk but this was not a problem, there was a small wardrobe. The bathroom was small but perfectly function able with a double shower and small sink and all the amenities you would find in larger hotel bathrooms. The reception staff were extremely courteous and helpful. Whilst at the hotel we went to the Keg Room situated across the road, this is a great Irish sports bar, which has a super atmosphere and serves great food at reasonable prices ( for New York).

Great location, great reception by the employees, wonderful amenities, clean rooms, robust buffet breakfast...i could go on and on. The only New York City hotel I've felt safe and comfortable in. Feels like home including the free laptop in the lobby - they've thought of everything

We stayed for two nights in early October. Location was excellent for all the sights of Midtown and the subway. The hotel itself was clean, the staff friendly and for the price paid I guess you could call this a budget Manhattan hotel. We generally book 4 star and above hotels but we went with the good reviews on trip advisor and decided to give this hotel a go. Note at this stage, our room was booked and paid for well in advance in February and our stay wasn't taken until October. The room we were given was of adequate size for Manhattan. We were only on the 3rd floor so the traffic/general noise from the road outside could still be heard but not too badly. We were a bit disappointed that as we'd booked so far in advance that the 3rd floor room at the front of the hotel was all we were offered but aside from this the room was OK. We had a problem with a group who were staying in the adjacent room who didn't think anything of having a full blown argument and swearing in the lobby outside our room at 2am. We called reception and the member of staff on duty came up and sorted them out without drawing attention that it was us that had complained. We were impressed with this service given - too bad that the idiots in the room next door had woken us up in the middle of the night! This was not the fault of the hotel but I wouldn't expect this kind of behaviour in a 4 or 5 star hotel so maybe it is to be expected in a 3 star, who knows. The inclusive breakfast was just OK. The first day there were no seats at all so we had to take the food back to our room, the second day the place was empty so I guess you just have to be lucky. There is a small gym at the hotel but no one seemed to use it so we thought that the hotel could make better use of the space by extending the dining room into that space maybe? Our main concern with the breakfast was the disposable plates and cutlery. We are surprised in this day and age that a chain like Best Western can be so un-environmentally friendly. They had staff bringing out the food and beverages so why not invest in a dishwasher and get proper crockery/cutlery!!All in all this was an OK hotel but probably not one that we'd rush back to.

All hotels in the midtown area are expensive, but this one is the least expensive but still has quality service. The location is a block from the subway. The included breakfast buffet is one of the best I have experienced in all my BW stays. The room although small was very clean with new furnishings. The front desk staff was very helpful with directions. A special shout out to Bebe she is the best! This hotel is centrally located and the place to stay if you can't afford upscale, but want a decent place to stay!

From the moment we arrived we were greeted by friendly staff,clean and inviting room and restaurant area.Staff were very helpful with directions to get around, the hotel was centrally located to get to all the sights and subway, the hot breakfast every morning was well prepared and the staff were very attentive we will definitely stay here again and recommend to our family and friends.

Just came back from a 3 day 2 night stay in NYC. I have to say from Check in to Check out the staff and service was fantastic, especially the front desk they were excellent. The rooms were clean and modern, sure they are small but its New York you should expect that plus your only in the room to sleep. I loved how they had water, coffee, and hot tea in the lobby everyday that was a nice touch. The breakfast was different everyday and was actually really good (im a picky eatter too) I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely will be back next yr. Thank you too the front desk am and pm staff you are all wonferful keep up the great work!

Maid service cleaned bathroom but didn't make bed or clean bedroom area. Reported to front desk and response was maids left at 4 o'clock so no one available to make bed or clean bedroom area. Sent bellman to room with pillows and sheets so we could make the bed. Unbelievable.

Wonderful location and supremely comfortable bed with excellent bathroom facilities. There is so much more room than you initially think.A special mention to Stephen the barman whose friendly banter was the perfect tonic after a long day's activities. He is an asset.

Best Western Premier Herald Square was a great place for our wonderful New York City experience! You may have to look for this hidden gem -- it's got a very small space in front -- but once you've found it you will agree that the location is absolutely the best -- close to everything you could possibly want. Walking distance to most sights (Times Square, Macys, Empire State Building, New York Public Library), and for those you don't want to walk to, the subway station is super close. They offer a great breakfast -- you may have to wait, but staff are friendly and keep everything clean and organized and moving along. There are plenty of options for food close by as well. Included wifi makes keeping connected and updated very easy.

Located within easy walk of Penn Station, Macy’s and Times Square, the hotel has an outdoor seating area to the street front, offering a smoking area should any of your party need it. The space was kept immaculately clean at all times.Free coffee, tea and water were available in the lobby at all times of the day and the desk staff were all friendly and helpful.The rooms are small (certainly our double on the 7th floor was), but that’s expected in New York. Just be aware that a double room has two double beds, and is more suited to two people than four, especially when you factor in luggage for each person. But we had booked the room free through Best Western loyalty points, so essentially free accommodation in New York (at a very expensive time of the year!), so we were’t complaining.The biggest plus for us was the bar at the back of the lobby, which had a daily happy hour, and outdoor seating in a little patio area, which gave us a bit of respite from the small room when we came back to shower before heading out again at night. The barman was friendly and very helpful.A free breakfast is served in the basement area, with a good selection of hot items, cereals and breads/pastries, perfect for filling up before a long day walking the length of Manhattan. Yes the room is quite small, and you may have to wait for a table, but it really was the perfect way to set yourself up for the day.Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel. The location, the staff and all the amenities are ideal for a stay in such an amazing city!

My daughter and I were staying in New York for a few days at the end of our cruise. This hotel is small compared to some hotels in New York with only 15 floors! Our room was on the 7th floor at the front and was a bit noisy but did t disturb us too much. We arrived early and although we could not access our room the hotel stored our luggage and there was free coffee and water. The room was very modern with a wonderful bathroom and a big flat screen TV. It is located only minutes from Macy's and only a ten minute walk from Times Square. At the end of our stay our flight was not til evening but the hotel stored our luggage. We are staying in New York next year and will definitely be using this hotel again.

Very convenient for shows and touring, but quiet and extraordinarily pleasant and professional staff. Very nice lounge/bar for relaxation at the end of the day. Good vicinity for good, but not great, restaurants. Rooms are small, but bigger than some I have been in in the city.

It's a great hotel with the most convenient location. You can walk to Times Square in about 10 minutes and 3 minutes to a few subway stations. There are restaurants and eateries just outside the hotel and we feel very safe while staying there. The buffet spread is excellent though the breakfast area is a little bit small. Staff are friendly. Room is small but it's expected for NYC standard. I will definitely stay here again.

What a great experience mate! with Best Western Premier Herald Square at New York awesome quality time ,great hospitality staff, amazing food, lovely lounge, excellent room service,easy access to transportation, travel booking centrally located , especially the 16th floor king size room amazing view i still cherish that place, cheers to the front desk staff for their patience and assistance from my side it's definitely yes I recommend

Rooms are small but very nice, they give you more than the basics here. Staff ar very helpful. Breakfast is a full hot buffet. Close to time square, about 5min walk away so it is quiet at night. Try also have a small bar/lounge in the back which is nice after a long day of walking.

Had a 3 night stay at this hotel. Arrived before check-in time in New York but hotel staff were very accommodating and let us check-in. Even let us get breakfast as we had travelled a long distance, although the buffet had closed they reopened it for us. At check out, they were again very helpful and let us check out a little later as we had a late flight and also helped organise transport to the airport. Breakfasts were good, plenty of choices and replenished regularly. Complementary tea and coffee in the lobby were great. Room was quiet, clean and bigger than I'd expected. All in all a great place to stay, central location, helpful staff and would definitely recommend it.

Small quiet place to rest after long days. Spent 4 nights with 4 women in one small room. Double beds, queens would be much better but space is a premium. We removed a chair from the room and stored our suitcases to maximize space. Very little bathroom counter as well. Shower is awesome(no tub). We were on 11th floor. I originally wanted a higher floor with empire view, even tho this had no view (adjacent buildings) it was super quiet. The only noise would be from other guest doors opening and closing and since there are only 6 rooms per floor it was minimal. We were barely in our room so not a big deal. We filled up our water bottles daily in the lobby with fresh ice water and enjoyed tea and coffee every evening. Breakfast was great, many options, always a different egg/meat choice as well as traditional breads, cerals,oatmeal yogurt. Location is premium. Within 5 min walk to empire state, macys, Penn Station, msg! About 12 minutes from times square! Even tho there are thousands of hotels in this city, I woukd return here just out of comfort. ..and I hope to return some day. Thnaks NEW YORK!!

This hotel was close to the subway, Empire State Building, Time Square, 5th Ave. Staff was very helpful and friendly. The breakfast was good and there is a small outdoor patio where they had happy hour.

The room is a little small but cozy and also very clean. Excelent hotel service. Breakfast is well served, but the location is what suited us the most. Just a corner away from the subway station, we could go anywhere in NYC. it's near the empire state and madison sq garden and one can also walk to times square, broadway etc.

Was not expecting the great breakfast since I spend so many nights at best westerns. New things every morning. Never had the same thing all week. Great location close to time square. Great room too. Friendly staff

We had a great stay at this hotel. Excellent place to get around the city. The elevator was really slow and our key cards stopped working after a couple of uses. Breakfast was really good and there was a great selection and I needed to print something off and the there was a computer and printer there.

We were a little taken aback at the beginning when we saw the size of our room as it is compact, and we are not used to such small rooms. However, the room was very clean, quiet, and the bed very comfortable. The breakfast that was included was very good with a great selection that should suit anyones appetite. However, this breakfast room can be extremely busy at times, so be prepared to either wait for a table, or take your food to another part of the hotel.We found the staff to be very friendly and accommodating!! The hotel itself is in a great location for getting to Times Square, Macy's, Empire State Bldg. and the Hop On/ Hop Off bus. Also had good access to many restaurants in the area. As the bathroom is also very compact, if mgmt. could remove the picture above the toilet & put up a couple of shelves, it would give a little more room for personal bathroom articles.

The location and property are good but the elevators make a horrible noise. Upon complaining I was told that this is normal!!! I am on the 15 floor. I overhead other people complaining as well. The hotel needs to do something, this not the first time I am staying on a high floor, never had a problem.

A very easy going hotel, good service and friendly staff. Check in and out was smooth and easy. The room was clean at arrival and kept tidy by the staff through out our entire stay (Monday to Friday). The room was modern and up to date with a well working, low noise aircondition, nice TV and complementary coffee in the room. Wifi worked excellent and served our needs fine. The hotel's location is very good as we prefer subway for quick transport around the city. Short walking distances to sites as Times Square and Empire State building. We could easily walk to and from Penn station with our luggage as we used train from/to Newark international airport. Breakfast was quite good, not very thrilling, but absolutely fit for purpose (ie filling up energy reserves before a long day in the coolest citiy in the world!). On my wish list for next visit: a small cooler in room for water and soft drinks, or perhaps even a beer or two.

Ideally situated, clean and comfortable. This hotel suited us fine as it was so well located for so many of the main attractions that we wanted to visit. The fact that the room was small was not a problem as we were only in there to sleep and bed was comfortable. Breakfast, although nothing to get excited about was a bonus as most hotels in New York do not include breakfast.

My mom and I went to NYC for the Rutgers game and to visit my children. I picked the Best Western Premier Herald Square because of price and location. I was pleasantly surprised at the free breakfast. It is close to the subway, and a fantastic deal. It will now be my go to NYC hotel.

This hotel offered just what I expected of it. I arrived in the morning after taking a red eye flight and while there were no rooms ready yet the staff invited us to go down and enjoy breakfast and held our bags until later in the day. When I did get to the room it was small but comfortable. It is definitely in the same size range as other rooms I have stayed in in New York. The room I was in didn't face out to the street and it was very quiet. The bed was comfortable. The location was great. I would stay here again.

The hotel is clean, calm and freindly staff also Its place close to all attraction like empire state, macys, and time square but small rooms amd no drinking water no slippers and the reakfast chef epica is an amazing person too

We needed rooms in midtown at a very high demand time we feel fortunate that we found this property. The staff is friendly and accommodating. They delivered the competence and professionalism one would expect from a large metropolitan hotel but with the approachability and friendliness one would expect from a family motel in the midwest. We appreciate the patience of the front desk at a time that was not easy for them. The rooms are tidy and clean with tasteful modern bathrooms and good linens. The included breakfast is good quality and tasty with variation day to day. A great value in a great town.

Very friendly staff, clean room, very good location. Nice to have parking in the same block. Rooms are small, but we did not spend much time there. The beds were comfy and the breakfast was good. Would stay there again.

The twin room was very small, we expected so but were still surprised how small is was. It was very uncomfortable for 4 people... The bed was quite comfy and room was clean and tidy. Bathroom ok. AC was quite noisy and so was the AC:s installed outside of neighbour buildings...Our window was towards Empire State Building, which was great. Floor was 16th so no noise at all from the streets.. There is only 6 rooms/floor so no noise from the corridoor at all too!Lobby was tiny. The breakfast was ok, warm dishes varies every Morning. I hated disposables cups/plates though, not so environmental! TV was set quite loud, not so nice if you want to eat your breakfast in a silence....The bar at the backyard was ok, but noisy thanks to AC:s besides the terrace....Macy´s and Times square was near, but we didn´t find any good dining restaurants nearby, only fast food restaurants... Average Best western not so fancy, but good.

This is a wonderful hotel in a great mid town location. The staff are very helpful and the breakfasts are just right to set you up for the day. The room we had gave us a brilliant view of The Empire State Building. I would 100% recommend this hotel.

the hotel was great , and beautiful the service was excellent ,the breakfast was very enjoyable, the room was perfect the view was fantastic. everyone in the family was very happy with the trip especially being in New York City . the employees very helpful and professional

I liked the hotel, it had a lot of people but never felt crowded. Always coffee at premises. Smiling receptionist . Don't care for breakfasts that are not fresh made - place is underground and a bit clammy.

Small but to be expected in city. Was clean that's what I cared about. The hot Breakfast is so/so but they provided other healthy options. Was surprised at what we got for the price. Would def stay again.

This is an excellent hotel for a trip to NY. The hotel is a short walk to the subway. The subway stop puts you right in in the heart of the city. Location is close to all the major sites either via walk or public transportation. The hotel itself was wonderful. The lobby was very inviting and beautifully decorated. There is a neat lounge right off the lobby that has an outdoor space perfect for enjoying a couple of drinks before heading out. Morning breakfast was a legit meal. The rooms were small as others have mentioned but surprisingly had everything one would need, neatly organized and the also nicely decorated. I stayed for several days and brought a bunch of stuff for my trip but was never cramped or short of space. Ive stayed in Best Western's before and none came close to the level and quality of this place. This one's Premier status is well deserved.

Stayed here for 3 nights, very comfortable hotel and room. Matched the published hotel photos so that was a good sign. Bed very comfortable and although on the street side had no problems sleeping. Staff extremely helpful and it also has a little bar with daily happy hour. Breakfast was included and was good although a very small room which was very busy. Would definitely stay here again.

This is a wee gem of a hotel near Penn St station. Breakfast is provided and there is plenty of choice. I'd highly recommend it. OK the rooms are small but we weren't there to spend time in the room apart from sleeping!!!!

We stayed here 3 nights and enjoyed it very much. All staff were pleasant. Room was very nice, especially the beautiful shower! We had asked for early check-in, a room on an upper level, and a quiet location....all delivered! Ice water and coffee in the lobby is a nice touch. At check-in we were given a gift bag with 2 waters and 2 snacks; another nice touch. Location is superb! 2 blocks from the subway which we used every day. Nice seating area out front to watch the world walk by. Breakfast was excellent! Several hot foods to choose from; lots of variety. We would definitely return to this Best Western.

This is a great place, close to the metro and Time Square. Our room was quiet and the beds comfy. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. My family will stay here again. The two issues we had were the bad internet connection and the poor breakfast selection.

Ok, this has the usual small size rooms for NY, but the 3 adults in our group managed to navigate our 3 suitcases on the floor and not fall over. Staff are very good here, the free breakfast is quite good too with a bit of variation each day, although the breakfast area is tight for so many people. The ONLY downside was our room on the 3rd floor was just above some air-conditioning plant so we had the drone of the fans all night, it was bearable but annoying and I wonder why such rooms aren't offered at a cheaper rate. That's the only downside. Location is terrific with some reasonable eateries within a block. We'll stay again BUT be requesting a room higher up.

The staff, accommodations, price and location are perfect. I stay here whenever I'm in the city for business. Very attentive staff, great breakfast included and I love the patio bar that serves lighter fare food.

I just stayed at the BW Herald Square in New York. From the moment I arrived, all was pleasant. There were quite a few people at the front desk, naturally, since NY has tourists from all the country and the world. The front desk staff were helping every single one of them patiently and civilly. My room was spotless. The bed was great - with excellent pillows, which I appreciate. No noise! There's a safe in the room. If you don't know NY, you may not realize how excellent the price is for the quality and location. They have a nice little bar downstairs, in the back, taking you away from all that noise and chaos on 36th. Breakfast nice. Fresh fruit available. I highly recommend this hotel.

We have nearly completed our 4 night stay on this hotel.Its location is excellent the rooms are clean and smart and good size by New York standards and there is the bonus of a complimentary breakfast, it's not a extravagant choice for breakfast but is great start to the day.The staff are all friendly and attentive, well worth a stay you are very close to all the shopping.Thank you Best Western we shall return

We arrived at the hotel, mum, dad & 2 teenagers. We were initially allocated a room on floor 2 but the receptionist advised us to return the next day to change to a higher floor which is advisable for longer stays. We did just as she suggested , finding floor 2 very noisy & enjoyed 7 nights at this hotel on floor 17 with views of the Empire State Building The rooms are lovely, modern with everything you need. The bathroom has a great big shower. The housekeeping staff are excellent and once we hung out the do not disturb sign, we're not disturbed for an 8.30 am clean !Staff make this hotel, reception staff helpful printing out tickets we had bought on online, breakfast room staff efficient and the young man who stored our bags too. Breakfast can be a bit of a bun fight, the room is too small really, but you can take it back to your room or to the lounge . It might be a good idea to hang a notice asking guests to retire to the lounge with their coffee once they have finished their actual breakfast as many seemed to hang around chatting :( Food choices were variable and replenished oftenAll in all I would have no hesitation in returning to this centrally placed hotel

Reception staff were great and very helpful, rooms were small but clean, afraid that's where it ends! Constant notice from lift outside our room kept us awake and breakfast was self service on throw away plates and disposable cutlery. I expect that in a canteen not a hotel

We are arrived 3 hours before check-in but we were given a room without a hassle and extra charge.That was a nice touch.Our room was always cleaned even when we slept in and left the hotel late.We just notified the front desk and the room was attended to.The staff was always helpful and pleasant.The complimentery breakfast was simple and good enough.We particularly enjoyed the flapjacks.Overall,we had a good stay and will definately come back.

Great location to many of NYC highlights, excellent attention by breakfast staff, front desk staff able to assist with all requests. Housekeeping staff co-operative and attentive. Great bed and shower, fairly quiet considering the location in busy NYC. Also convenient to the hotel is a 24 hr carpark - excellent for when we picked up our hire car and needed a spot to park it. In room safe a good feature. Room is small so no fridge, only a minor inconvenience.

I have been to New York several times and have stayed in different parts of the city. I stayed at the Best Western Premier Herald Square this past weekend for 4nights/5 days. I was impressed by the location, incredible staff, trendy décor, comfortable accommodations, filling breakfasts, and continual replenishment of fresh water, coffee, and teas at the entrance of the hotel. This was especially helpful after a long day of nonstop activity. If this were my first visit to Manhattan, I would have commented on the small rooms. However, now I know better, as most hotels and venues tend to be smaller in scale. New Yorkers make good use of their space. The hotel is conveniently located between 5th and 6th avenues (you can do shopping for days), near subway stops, in walking distance of landmarks, and restaurants on all sides. To my dismay, on the last night of my stay, I noticed two Poke stops that I could have accessed from my room. I highly recommend this hotel! I'm already thinking about my next trip to New York!

We enjoyed this location and the staff was great. Special thanks to Erica, breakfast Manager for helping with food allergies and Ryan, bellman, for help with being locked out our room.Only negatives, small rooms and smelly garbage on the street front.

This was our second stay at this hotel. We've found it to be a nice hotel experience in a great central location in the city. The early room availability and room upgrade was a pleasant surprise this stay. Very nice breakfast is included in the room rate. We would both stay here again and recommend it to friends.

We stayed at this hotel Friday to Sunday for a family vacation! This hotel exceeded our expectations. It was close to Times Square as well.The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and had ample space. Plenty of towels and when an extra blanket was requested it was sent right up.It also had a nice sitting area out front, a inside bar/lounge in the back and outsideSeating as well. They offered happy hour, free coffee and ice water as well.I would definetly recommend and use this hotel again in the future!

This Best Western was clean, quiet and located perfectly in the center of manhattan. Everything is at the tip of your finger. Food of all kinds and stores of all kinds close. The air conditoning worked great. The bed was extremely comfortable. The toiletries and room was always cleaned and well stocked. The staff was always helpful and polite. The city is crowded and overwhelming but this hotel is on a quieter street and is relaxing inside which was perfect. The shower is big and good water pressure. I can mostly only say good things. The room is small but worked well for two people. I will let you know the wifi did not work well at all for my son and I on the 9th floor. There are 12 floors.

Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights on the 17th floor. Very clean hotel with friendly staff. Our room was small for a family of three but perfectly comfortable which is expected when staying in the city. Room was spotless with a view of the Empire State Building. Air Condition was working great without any sound. When I inquired about a fridge (needed to store milk for my toddler) they were able to accommodate me and installed a small fridge in the room. Hotel is in the perfect location. Times Square is a 10 min walk, Macy's is 5min, Empire State Building is 5min, Station is nearby as well as variety of restaurants and lots of shopping on 5th Avenue, Herald Square, and Broadway, all within walking distance. Neighborhood felt safe walking around in the evening. Continental Breakfast was included. Erika and rest of the staff during breakfast did an immaculate job servicing guests. Thank you for washing my sons sippy cup on two occasions it was much appreciated. Take advantage of happy hour at the bar and make the most of your stay at this hotel. My family and I enjoyed our stay and will be back.

Excellent hotel situated in Midtown. So close to Broadway, Times Square, and the subway. Sade (I hope I'm spelling it right) made check in easy, quick and simple. We had a room on the eighth floor, with floor to ceiling windows, facing W 36th, and it was great! Modern room and washroom, free WiFi, comfortable bed, and high functioning AC. The gym downstairs has new equipment too. Loved the little outside patio behind the bar, as well as the water, coffee and tea that were complimentary in the lobby 24/7. The only downside was the included breakfast. Overall, would recommend!

Best Western Premier Herald Square was a great place to stay. We had six days of sightseeing in New York City. The hotel is in a great location with access to all the areas we wanted to go. Subway lines are close. The property is very well kept and clean. The mirrored elevators are so shiny it's hard to tell that they are solid. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. Shower was great. The elevators were very fast and always there when you needed it. The breakfast was amazing. Since it starts early we could always get a wonderful breakfast before heading out for the day. Each day was different, there was always some kind of meat, eggs, oatmeal-anything that one might want to eat. It was excellent quality and delicious, very clean. Staff was very helpful and friendly, very responsive. Shameza was especially delightful. We would definitely stay here again!

Booked for 2 persons and specifically asked for tro beds sine my brother and I, whom both are over 6'6', were tarvelig together. The front desk refused and could not even help with a madress or a couch. Stay away unless you wanna throw 250 dollars in the sink!!!

THe very good is the front desk staff, the breakfast room staff and the service folks, and the gorgeous, very European room. Clean, well appointed, and really nice shower (yeah for glass doors and not yucky curtains). And, the ac/heat unit control was in the room and very responsive.The average is for the breakfast. While there was much offered and many folks would find it plenty. The orange juice did taste fresh, as did the milk. The bagels were good. The hot food was so incredible SALTY! After one bite, we threw it all out. We were there three mornings, and just ate a bagel with cream cheese. But given the pricing of food, it was a good spread and it was clear that the families didn't mind it.We booked on the phone after looking at prices as discount hotel prices, and they did almost meet what we found on those sites. The room was in great shape, but faced directly over the air conditioning units in the alleyway. It was the fourth floor so I'm guessing that higher floors - the hotel seems to have 4 rooms on a narrow 17 floor building - would be better. But given the location, it was a very good place at a good price for NYC.

This is a gem of a hotel close to Time Square - the breakfast was excellent, the service overall was excellent and the hotel is really nice and good value. Great for families. We enjoyed walking back to the hotel in the evening ... neighborhood was good ..

I stay at BWs frequently when traveling for work, and I can say without a doubt that this is the best one I have stayed at. It's a great hotel. Breakfast is good, the rooms are clean and comfortable, and the staff is very accommodating. Sade was particularly sweet for giving us the room we requested, which was an upgrade. I would definitely stay here again.

The hotel is ideally situated. It has easy access to Macy's and is in waking distance to Times Square, Broadway and the highline . It is a longer walk to central Park but if you fancy a stroll it will take you about 30-40 minutes. The hotel itself is tucked away just off 5th Ace. The staff are attentive and helpful. The breakfasts are great they have a good choice and it changes everyday. The lady (sorry I have forgotten her name) does a fantastic job. The food is hot and regularly changed there is a variety of hot food, pastries, cereals, fruit and yoghurts plus the coffee and juices. This does set you up for a good day out. The bar is a bit disappointing I was hoping for draft beer but there is a good choices of bottled beers and spirits. I wish they would have let children in the bar past six pm. Overall a good hotel well situated.

Very hot in May when we visited NYC. We chose this hotel for its location. The location worked out well for my daughter and I, however, the ac in our room (our entire floor actually), was broken and never repaired for our entire stay. We were given a fan which provided some relief, but after traversing the city all day, no one wants to come back to a hot hotel room. The manager stated he would pro rate the room due to the inconvenience, however, we never received the pro ration. Based on this, very disappointed with our stay and would not return. This is not normal customer service handling for a Best Western, in my experience. There are many lodging competitors to choose from so service needs to be top notch.

Good atmosphere with friendly staff.Breakfast included reasonable / good.Bedroom and bathroom very clean and comfortable. Good shower.Available coffee and tea in the room. Fresh water and ice in the lobby.Good location. Access by subway on the corner of 34st to 6th Avenue (Avenue of The Americas) 5 minutes walk.Times Square a 15-minute walk.It has a gym.Air conditioning effective and good soundproofing.very good WiFiA little cramped room for 4 people but comfortable

Located perfectly. Rooms were a little smaller than expected but had a great view of the Empire State Building. As soon as we got the bags up in the room we headed straight to the bar that not only had the best happy hour in Manhattan, but THE BEST bartender hands down. Stephen really set the tone for this whole trip for us. We looked forward to seeing him everyday we were here, he even made sure that he saved a few of the beers that I took a huge liking to during my stay. He happens to be off on our last 2 days here and it won't be the same, but he truly makes this hotel a 5 star spot and worth leaving a review before we even leave!!

Locations is supurb. Staff was very attentive, checking us upon arrival (before checking time). Breakfast was good and free. Room was of a good size and AC was very quiet (sic!!!). Room was very clean and bathroom was good too. I recommend this hotel and will stay there if I go to NYC again. Staff was very much polite and helpful.

My husband and I stayed at this Best Western for a weekend. We were very well taken care of. It's in a great central location but not too loud. The building was very clean, the staff were friendly and organized. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Do as a family of 4, kids aged 18 & 12, we were a little cramped but as we were only sleeping here and not spending any amount of time in the room, we made it work. Its super clean, comfortable and in a fantastic location. The higher up the hotel you go, the less noise. Staff were good and the provision of water, tea and coffee in the lobby was great.Breakfast was just ok, a little disappointed as it had been mentioned on here how great it was. Dining room was cramped with the amount of guests so if you can get there early, I recommend it. No complaints overall, we would stay again.

Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Location was excellent - close to Herald Square and subway. Lounge was great - be sure to check out the happy hour for drink specials (1/2 the price of drinks out at dinner). The only downside is the room size. Probably fine if it's just 2 people, but very crowded with 3-4. I've stayed at similar hotels in NYC where it was more spacious for similar price.

Right in the heart of NYC. Clean rooms nice layout and friendly staff. They went out of their way to make the stay easy. We had two separate bookings and had to change rooms, however they moved our luggage for us so we could enjoy the sites and sounds. Close to Macy's and a a short walk to Times Square.

The hotel is so well located in the midst of the city, you can walk either on 5th or 6th avenue and you will find everything around the corner, so centrally located that shopping, eateries, excitement is just walking distance away.

We stayed for 2 nights, time was limited so we chose this hotel being at the heart of Manhattan. The welcome was warm, the rooms were clean and location was perfect. Staff and management were very helpful and managed out local tours.The breakfast was good too, I was happy with this choice .

Our experience here as a family of four was mostly positive. Our room on the 17th floor was quiet, attractive, and the beds were comfortable. The air conditioning worked well. We had a view of the Empire State Building, which was particularly striking at night. Bebe at the front desk is very congenial and helpful. We booked at this hotel based on the positive ratings, location, free Wifi, and breakfast (which represents a daily savings of $30 to $60 for us).
