As a family with older children, there were definitely two downsides to this hotel. First, our double room was so cramped that only one person at a time could walk around the beds. Sitting in the desk chair with someone (relatively tall) in the bed behind you meant being kicked in the back. The space issue was compounded by a relatively small wardrobe closet and the luggage rack in the opposite corner of the room. Second, as many have noted, the breakfast area is congested and poorly arranged. There were daily problems with finding a table for four of us. In my humble opinion, the area for toasting bread/bagels should be moved to a separate table to prevent bottlenecks and the chairs in the room should be changed out for smaller ones. It's awesome to have breakfast on site and included in the cost of your room, but there was a moderate amount of unpleasantness with the breakfast experience. On a positive note, the orange juice was very good and I appreciated that there was hot oatmeal most mornings.We visited the lounge one evening, which was a good experience. The bartender was friendly and we enjoyed a hummus plate that was reasonably priced. Our hotel departure was smooth, with the front desk staff arranging car service to take us to the airport, though it was about double the cost of a yellow taxi.In summary, I would consider staying here again based on the location and cleanliness of the hotel, as well as proximity to dozens of reasonably priced ethnic dining options, but I would look at other hotel options that may allow more space within the room for our family.

I write this review taking into consideration my experiences at other Best Western Hotels in Europe. This was my first visit to the US so not sure if there is a different rating system for Best Westerns in the US. The hotel is located in a great location on 36W, which is a five minute walk to the Empire State Building and about 10 minutes walk to Times Square. The location makes it a great choice base to explore the city from. The hotel bar is also great with a happy hour that finishes at 8pm when all beers are $4. Some good bottled craft beers to be had. These are the positives about the hotel. The check-in process was good enough but there was no recognition of customer loyalty from the staff. I am a diamond select member but was not offered any welcome gift or a room upgrade, not so much as a thanks for being a loyal BW customer. I expected a little more from a 'Premier' BW. Our King size bedroom on the 16th floor was clean and comfortable. A bit on the small side but I guess this is to be expected in NYC. Again for a 'Premier' BW, I expected a mini-fridge and a small welcome gesture but this was not available. Sound-proofing could be better. Noise from the corridor and the room next door could be heard. The breakfast starts at 6.30 and finishes by 9.30. The variety is okay but could do with more options. The biggest disappoint was that the plates and cutlery were disposable plastic and paper cups for drinks and you are expected to clear up after you finish eating??!! Not a 'Premier' experience by any means. All in all, a disappointing experience for me as I was expecting something a bit more from a 'Premier' BW but maybe as I said the grading for Europe and US might be different!

Good hotel, great location. Stayed for 2 nights. Our room was spacious on NY scale, very clean and bed was comfortable. Breakfast though is a down side, served in a basement with no windows and air, crowded, very few tables.

Central to everything and a brisk walk to either Times Square or Penn Station. Subway a block away. Great front desk staff, great complimentary breakfast courtesy of Erica who works very hard. Rooms are contemporary, clean and comfortable. The hotel size itself is smaller, but in no ways uncomfortable. My second trip here and it won't be my last.

We stayed here because it was convenient with a cab to the docks for a cruise we were taking, but it was just a great location in general for mid-Manhattan. The service was excellent. When we had a problem with a squeaking bathroom door, they sent someone up to fix it. The staff at the front desk was very helpful. The rooms (we stayed twice, two nights before and one night after the cruise) were very small, common in NY. But they were clean and attractive. The beds are only full-size and my husband, who is not very tall, had to sleep diagonally. There is very little shelf space in the bathroom, but a good amount in the room itself. The shower was very nice. The included breakfast was good, even offering French pastries.

Traveled from upstate NY to JFK to pick up my daughter. Easy access from JFK to this location in mid-town. Hotel was nicely located. Times Square, Radio City, Empire State Building all very close. Walked to the World Trade Center from the hotel. It was a good distance but doable. Took the subway back to within 3 blocks of hotel. Hotel was clean. Staff was polite and helpful. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Free breakfast had everything you'd want to fuel up and hit the streets. Plenty of dining options nearby. Parking garage in the same block as hotel. Easy access to the Lincoln Tunnel when leaving town. I'd go back!

We are a family of 3 and stayed at the hotel for 8 nights, it was so comfortable, the rooms were cleaned daily and kept very neat, one of the best location to stay in as everything is around the corner, I will rate the location as 10/10, the hot buffet breakfast was very good the menu changed every day, the chefs, housekeeping besides the front desk were very friendly and warm, every staff pampered us and we felt like home, the only thing missing was a mini bar in order to store some food items, although I have traveled to entire Europe and this being my first trip to the US, I'm already looking to my next holiday in NY and already planned to book the same hotel

This is a newish, small hotel well located for business and leisure travel to Manhattan. The property is tucked into a row of other small hotels on W. 36th, within easy walking to Herald Square, the Empire State Building, the Morgan Library, and, a little farther, Times Square. The rooms are quite compact, as many NYC hotel rooms are. These are budget accommodations, but everything was clean, functional and pleasant. I was traveling solo, and I could see the room being quite tight for two or more, but I saw plenty of couples and families there. The room rate includes a light breakfast in the basement. There is a small exercise room. The staff is informed and helpful. Wi-Fi was good, street noise was minimal.

The hotel is really very well located in Manhattan within walking distance of NYC attractions. Plenty to see and do nearby with a lot of great eating options. Subway station around the corner from de hotel, though it is easy to walk anywhere. Very clean and cozy property with a nice contemporary décor. Amazing customer service offered by the all staff of the hotel, especially the staff on the front desk, they are very welcoming, friendly and helpful, always ready to answer any question or give directions. A nice breakfast is included in the room price. A variety of cold and hot food is served every morning, always restocked. Nice to have cold water, hot coffee and tea 24 hours on the way in/out of the hotel. A bar and a lounge with a cozy and quiet green courtyard are on site. It is true that the rooms are small compared with the standards (It is Manhattan after all), but they are very clean, with nice décor and comfortable beds. Free WiFi included, another plus. Definitely, I will choose Best Western Premier Herald Square in my next trip to NYC.

I had a short stay in here -- checked in late in the night and checked out early in the morning. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The room is clean and decent. It gave me a great experience... love it!

We stayed here for 4 nights. The staff were always friendly and professional. Our room was spotless and very chic. We requested a room with a view and were placed on the 13th floor. The breakfast served each day was very tasty and lots of choices. The earlier you get down there the better chance you have of getting a table. The location of this hotel is amazing. Right off of 5th Avenue and about 15 mins walk to Times Square. There is no doubt we would stay here again and have already recommended this hotel to others.

The property was listed as a Best Western Premier property which gave me the impression that the property would have larger rooms, a pool, and other special features. The property at best was a Plus property. The rooms are very small the breakfast was ok nothing special and the internet did not work the entire stay.

This is a great hotel. Room was clean, Beds comfy, good breakfast although the breakfast room is small. This hotel is tall and skinny and I believe there are only about 6 rooms per floor. Fresh coffee and ice water in the lobby all day. Room is not huge but it was plenty of space for 2 of us AND I had gift cards from the summer promotion. This hotel is close to The Keg Room and McGettigans...both Irish Pubs. Good food and drink. Also close to Keen's Steakhouse. Easy walking distance to subway, Radio City Music Hall, Empire State Building, Macy's and Bryant Park. They can also store your luggage until it is time to go to the airport. I would stay here again.

Perfect location, great rooms,comfortable beds and very clean. Friendly polite staff and very helpful. Really enjoyed the breakfast, lots to choose from. Would definitely stay there again a have already recommend it to out of town friends.

I stayed here in June, it was my third visit to NYC and this is the best hotel I have stayed in so far. Perfectly located. Near a subway, close enough to walk to Times Square, Grand Central, Central Park, Empire State to pick just a few. Felt very safe here. Complimentary tea, coffee and chilled water available in the lobby 24 hours with a small but pleasant hotel bar with outside patio at the rear. Breakfast was included with our booking and it was very basic but it was just right to start off your day and it was varied each day. The dining area is very small so occasionally there wasn't a free table but we didn't have to wait long for one to open up. However, it was fine to take your breakfast up to your room if you wanted to. The dining room staff were lovely and very attentive and helpful, everything was quickly replenished as it ran out. Rooms were great. I had a standard King room which was a decent size and clean. The bed was comfortable and there was a coffee maker in the room and a nice flat screen TV. There was enough desk / surface space to store items and a chest of drawers and small wardrobe with a safe. Nice bathroom with a big shower cubicle with a great shower. Our housekeeping lady was lovely, really friendly and helpful. All staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

We stayed on the top floor. I was nice, very clean with very helpful staff. Room was very small not really enough room to put your suitcases. I don't know maybe that is a typical size for a room in downtown NY by time square. The main compliant was that the A/C vent was right over the bed and blew down directly on you. I got very cold at night unless you sleep with the covers over you head.

Our stay was fantastic, bathroom and bedroom were very clean. Breakfast was delicious. Everything is in neighbourhood. Staff is very polite and helpfull. Free cofee, tee and cold drinking water in groundfloor.

Very clean, looks new, great helpful staff, convenient walking distance to times square, Bryant park, Broadway and subways. Eighth floor very quiet. Clean, small room but had every convenience. Air condition worked great! Free breakfast nice and lots to choose from. Beautiful little back patio bar w/happy hours. Really enjoyed our stay! Would definitely go back and recommend to others.

Hat's off the the staff of BWP, , especially Bebe, who was so helpful, funny, knowledgeable and friendly that she deserves a raise!!! We stayed there from 7/07/16 thru 7/11/16 in room 1205, but I kept telling Bebe our room was 1206 (guess my gal and I stayed out too late each night!). Our room was perfectly quiet, clean, neat and nicely decorated, especially for a budget price of $159 per night!!They have a free, worthy breakfast that had a ample selection of eggs, sausage, various breads, cereal, juices, coffee, milk and tea. Important extras in the lobby were cold water, and very good hot coffee. The New York Times and one other major paper were available for free at the front desk, and if you like the Times like I do, get there early as copies run out quickly. The bathroom had an excellent newer shower with tall, heavy-quality glass enclosures, the toiletries were of excellent quality, and the cleaning crew were top notch, as was the bellman.The location was a 10 minute walk to Times Square and Broadway shows, ~5 minutes to Union Station, and a few minutes from the nearest subway. When we return to Manhattan, we will stay here again, and request room 1206....I mean 1205;)

our stay was wonderful! Our room was very nice, clean and comfortable. We could see Empire State Building out our window. The staff were so helpful, friendly and welcoming. Would definitely stay here again.

We stayed for four nights at the best Western-room 1606. We had the best view of the Empire State Building! The only problem staying on the sixth floor was the water pressure during showers. FYI-the blow dryer is located behind the bathroom door… I had to ask the front desk where it was. There are no refrigerators or microwaves, but they will store items for you if needed. They did provide the little extras that many hotels do not - mouthwash, q-tips, shoe cleaner. They do have the customer in mind! Very friendly staff and provide a hardy breakfast to guests. Erka, kitchen coordinator, is very friendly. Hotel is located not far from the subway station. For travelers who do not walk a lot, bring good walking shoes and remember your feet will swell - so your normal shoes will not fit...be ready to walk at least 5 miles per day- but with the sights, it really doesn't seem that far. We averaged 9 miles per day and I had to buy shoes because my comfortable sketchers wouldn't fit my swollen feet! Buy the comfortable sandals that you can expand. Pack an apple from the cafeteria to eat later :)

It's been a while since I last stayed at a hotel in New York City. I chose the BW Premier Herald Square because of the excellent location, right near Macy's, Penn station, Madison Square Garden and many subway lines. As I extended my stay, I had an insight into two King-size room: executive (very spicy for NY standards, on the upper floors) and standard (rather on the small side, which is normal for NYC). When sharing the standard room and you've done quite a bit of shopping it might be a little tight. There is a complimentary breakfast buffet, however I went once as it was so crazy crowded. The staff is very friendly and accommodating, which is not always the case in NYC hotels. There is free WiFi in the room.

We were in the city to go to the fireworks and do a little sight seeing. The location is excellent. Close to Empire State Building, Macy's, Bryant Park, Penn Station. We arrived early and they kept our luggage for us while we went exploring. The two young ladies (Shameza and Bebe) who checked us in were very friendly and helpful. We also got our parking validated which took off $14 of the parking fee. They told us about some of the best places to watch the fireworks. We had a room on the 14th floor facing the back. Not much of a view but very quiet, which was needed after returning from the fireworks. We arrived back too late to eat but the front desk person, a young man, gave us the number to a 24hr pizza place and we were able to get it delivered to our room. Our room was small but it had two double beds, which slept comfortably. The room was clean and furnished with practical furniture--nothing exceptional. The bathroom likewise was small but towels were plentiful. Breakfast the next morning was sufficient as well. We arrived toward the end and the room was crowded so we took our food back to the room.The elevator wait times going down were longer than usual. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would stay again.

very good great excellent. good in all ways honest stuff great location good vies great housekeeping stuff great front desk great night auditor everything was on point will be back soon. nice rooms the area was great easy location to everything in the city comfort .

Excellent location, extremely good service; perhaps breakfast could be improved. Staff here was more courteous than I have encountered at almost any other hotel and was very knowledgeable as well. Worth it.

Stayed at the Best Western for 3 nights. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The outstanding customer service we received from the staff at the front desk was amazing ! From check in, to asking about places to visit and booking us a ride. Bebe, Shameza and Ryan should get credit for the fantastic customer service they have shown us on our trip !

Great location and wonderful breakfast.The rooms were small, but clean and updated. The water, tea, and coffee in the lobby is a nice touch. I would definitely stay here again. There were lots of families staying at this hotel.

We stayed at the Best Western for 3 nights. The hotel was small but very clean and comfortable. The best selling point though was the outstanding customer service we received from the staff at the front desk. From check in, to asking about places to run, booking us a ride to the airport, and finally helping us get sunglasses back that were left behind. Specifically Bebe, Shameza and Jay should get credit for the top notch customer service. Thanks for a great stay!

We booked this hotel as an addition to our lodging due to an extended stay in Manhattan. Our other hotel had no rooms available for the add on night that we needed. It was quite surprising and good. Thank you Bibi and Andre. You are indeed exemplary, staff.The location is prime, a few minutes to the Empire State Building, Fifth Avenue, and Herald Square.The breakfast was ok only, typical of muffins, bagels, juices coffee and tea. Nontheless, it was free. Staff in the breakfast area were attentive and pleasant. Our room was in the 13th floor, clean, neat, good size no issues. I'd consider staying again.

Good Location makes it easier to reach. All we have do is just reach Penn Station and take a walk to W 36th St. as simple as that.Room was not big according to our expectations. But clean and comfy as hell. View was awesome. Breakfast too good.Times Square, Empire State Building, Madison Square, Shake Shack, and many more just a 5 min walk away.Would definitely visit again if there is a discount.

This hotel is a perfect location for lots of activity. I walked everywhere! It is new and still has the clean feel. Staff was very helpful and accommodating! Room is small but so what! I had a 13th floor rear room which was very quiet! Would stay again in a heartbeat!

The room is very small. However, the staff is fantastic; especially Erica who cooks breakfast and makes sure your stay is special. She took a personal interest in our family and our experience in New York. The location is perfectly centered in the middle of everything Manhattan has to offer. We walked everywhere. We travel a lot and this is one of the best vacations we have ever had.

Don't under estimate this place, Small and Cozy is just perfect !! Front counter staff always pleasant and accommodating. My most recent visit , Shameza and Ryan were gracious as always, nice to see the same staff each time. Great little bar in the back, it's nice to RELAX and not be in the hustle bustle all the time, nice little patio in the back also. This place is 3 blocks to Empire State Building, about 8 blocks to Penn Station, 7 Blocks to the heart of Times SQ, 7 Blocks to Grand Central Terminal and so on.. THIS hotel is beyond convenient, stay here and enjoy what its location has to offer !

Spent a week in NYC at this hotel. Staff - Shameza, Bebe and Sade were friendly, helpful and accommodating with our sight seeing and travel within the city. They all went out of their way to be courteous and helpful. The hotel is clean, great complimentary breakfast that changed every day. Hotel is centrally located and within walking distance to Subway and bus stops and many historic buildings. Would stay there again without hesitation.

Staff and the Hotel were Superb, great customer service and always met our needs. The breakfast was also above and beyond. We would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends and family. Thank you BW Premier Herald for making our stay pleasurable and comfortable.

Recently spent two nights at this hotel. It was conveniently located to major tourist attractions in New York City and just a cab or subway ride away from others. The staff was very friendly and welcoming. The hotel itself was modern, clean, and quiet. The full breakfast buffet was superb. Great job to Erica and the rest of the staff.

The Best Western Premier was very clean and the staff was more than friendly and helpful. Also the location was convenient and minutes away from main attractions. I will definitely recommend this hotel to my family and friends.

A good hotel for all areas of NYC. Staff helpful and knowledgeable. View of ESB from our room, the higher the better. Very good bar opposite and good deli at the end of block. Our room was not large, but perfectly proportioned and very comfy beds.

We stayed at the this hotel last week and found it to be a very good hotel. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The breakfast was also very good with plenty of choice. It is better to be high up if possible as street can be noisy with dustcarts early in the morning. The hotel was well situated for all amenities.

We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights with 2 teenage sons.The rooms are tight with 4 suitcases, but they are very clean and very comfortable.We stayed on the 4th floor facing the back of the hotel, could not hear any street noise at all, we slept well !!!Beds were comfortable, and rooms serviced daily. The included hot and cold breakfast was great, fresh, tasty, enough variety to get you going each day.Dry cleaner/washing across road was also very handy.The staff were all very friendly and helpful.The location is perfect, walking distance to most tourist landmarks surrounding. Plenty of clothing shops including Macy's all within several blocks.Best restaurant was "Eataly" which is Italian and was about 10 blocks away where the food was amazing.

Visited for 5 nights in June; it was just 'fine'. Clean and well placed for first time visitors; in hindsight and for future trips I'll probably stay in Greenwich rather than Midtown.We were on the 11th floor, at the front of the hotel - fairly quiet for NYC and we certainly didn't hear noise from other rooms. Breakfast was ok, several options. We tended to have breakfast at 7.30 and the breakfast room was probably half full at this time. On one day we were a bit late and by 8.30am people were queuing for tables. Free tea, coffee and ice water in lobby was a nice touch. I'm a bit confused by the several reviews (by people who have submitted no other reviews to trip advisor) about the friendliness and helpfulness of staff. I'm afraid I found the complete opposite of this, the only exception being the housekeepers and cleaner at breakfast. The bar tender was extremely surly and the front of house staff were generally disinterested. In summary, it was 'just ok'.

Great staff, attentive, friendly, knowledgeable Good, satisfying breakfast offerings. Comfortable, clean room. Wish there was a small refrigerator in room. Lobby availability of coffee, tea, water, etc. was good summer-time amenity. Wish smoking was prohibited from front patio area. Smokers spoil the space for all others.

Best Western is not usually my preferred brand and frankly, I was surprised to see they had a location smack dab in Manhattan. Turns out that this is one of their "Premier" locations and I was impressed. Not sure how old the building is, but it look brand new. The rooms were clean and everything felt new. Only drawback is the size but I guess in NYC that's par for the course. Oh yeah! the location! fantastic location within walking distance to everything and accessible to public transportation. Empire State was visible from my room window.

A lovely hotel, very central location. Our room was on the 13th floor which offered amazing views of the streets below which the kids loved. The room was clean and comfortable, with much needed air con! We loved the ice machine in the hallway and the constant supply of tea and coffee. The room was tidied every day and the breakfasts provided a variety of food. We found the staff to be very helpful. Could not fault our stay!

Arriving after travelling a long way we weren't greeted with the most warm of welcomes. However this may have only been how we felt because of our own tiredness as we got checked in without any problems. We were given a room on the 16th floor (of 17) and when we looked out of the window we discovered we were in the shadow of the inimitable empire state building. What a view that is! The room was clean and comfortable with easy to use air conditioning. The TV had so many channels all in HD near enough which provided plenty of entertainment after a long day of travelling around the city. The bathroom was nice and I personally enjoyed the different settings on the shower including rain, massage and jet. The room was cleaned thoroughly every day. The breakfast had a mixture of hot foods, cereals and pastries, I enjoyed the range of pastries as a novelty for breakfast! The food was always nice although we occasionally had to wait for a table to sit at. However, the staff working the breakfast were good at clearing the tables and guiding people to an available table quickly. We also enjoyed the bar/lounge at the back of the hotel, very relaxing to sit and have a few drinks.The location of this hotel is perfect for travelling around. It is in midtown and right next to the empire state building, and a 5 minute walk to times square. Also there are subway stations to all areas of manhattan nearby. We walked most of the days around but also used the subway comfortably enough. The hotel allowed us to store our luggage on the final day and reserved a taxi for us which was for more luxurious than the yellow taxi we came over in. (There is a flat fee for JFK to manhattan midtown which we paid 70 dollars including tolls and tip).The hotel served its purpose perfectly and we would definitely go back if we want to explore new york again.

This Hotel and Staff couldn't be nicer, perfectly located to all the amazing sites to see, Hotel was Clean , Modern , The hotel staff did everything they could to make sure our stay was enjoyable, Definitely a place to recommend.

I stay at this hotel when traveling to NYC as it is an excellent value (newer, well maintained, reasonably priced, and fantastic service) and in a convenient location in mid town NYC. In addition, the holel offers a full breakfast offering every morning, which is fantastic, especially in NYC. I highly recommend this hotel.

The Best Western Premier Herald Square, 50W 36 Street New York, is conveniently located in the Garment district of Manhattan.This hotel is the ideal base for exploring New York. The hotel is close to the major shop such as Macy’s and easy access to all key attractions via the MTA Metro. Whilst the hotel does not have the best views from rooms, you have to remember this is a city hotel. The staff are extremely friendly and very helpful. The rooms are a little on the small size however they are very clean with modern décor and comfortable beds and a large LCD TV. The bedroom is equipped with enough storage for your needs, full length mirror and plenty of charging points, nice pull out desk, as well as in room coffee and tea making machine and also an in room safe. The bathrooms continue the theme with modern clean décor. There is a large walk in shower, vanity unit with hand basin, mirror, hair dryer and WC. The hotel offers free breakfast and the standard an offering is amazing as it is free, there was always a good selection of fresh fruits, variety of breads and pastries, yoghurt, cereals and a section of hot food which changed daily. We were a party of six with two rooms, I would strongly recommend this hotel, the only down side we found during our three night stay was that the free WiFi internet access was down several times and the bar was closed on two evenings, Sunday and Monday over Memorial weekend and that may have been the reason. We will definitely be recommending this hotel to our friends.

This is a very nice hotel. Pricey, but not overly expensive by New York standards. The all-you-want complementary breakfast saves at least $30 per person per day. Convenient to all Midtown attractions.

We stayed 4 nights, our room had 2 Queen beds, the room was very small which made it difficult to move about with 3 of us in. The room was very dark, facing a building next door with no natural light coming in, and very noisy!! The breakfast room in the basement was very small and inconvenient, not enough tables for all guests, often had to queue and wait for a free table, completely chaotic! On the plus side, staff were really friendly, the location is ideal. A short walk from Macy's, Times Square, Broadway, 5th Avenue, the Empire State Building, several subway also not too far, superb location for sightseeing, if you want to take the cruise ship to Statue of Liberty, go to 42nd street and walk about 15mns to the pier. Penn Street station a few minutes walk from hotel, take the E blue line to World Trade Centre to see the memorial.

Hotel is in a good spot to cover New York. Hotel was very clean when you walked in, Staff very smart and welcoming, dealt with you very quickly, we arrived at 11am in the morning and was going to ask to leave our suitcase with them to go off site seeing, we were informed our room was ready a bonus. The room was very clean the only thing was I had not taken shower gel as most hotels i have stayed in have shower gel but BW don't supply shower gel only soap so if you don't do soap take shower gel, just a little niggle...

We visited New York from May 15th thru May 21st, we stayed on the 16th floor, we loved the room except for the bathroom. The sink was so small nowhere to set up your stuff, for a night it wouldn't have been bad but for 5 nights it's kind of a pain to have to pack and unpack because you don't have space on the sink for anything. The breakfast was ok but we didn't aways eat there, I'm very sensitive to flour and didn't want to get sick for a day of sightseeing and there wasn't very many options for carb free diet. Loved the location no matter which way we headed when we left the hotel we always found something to do. The subway was almost around the corner, we got a week pass and saved tons on transportation. I would definitely stay here again because of the location but we might go with a less expensive room, we weren't in the room much except to sleep, the view was nice thou but there's tons of place to see nice views in New York.

Stayed at the Best Western Premier in Herald Square between the 16th and 20th May, 2016 for my daughters 21st Birthday. Staff at reception were very welcoming and looked after us promtly and efficiently. Our room on the 9th floor was lovely, modern and had everything we needed. Iron/board, hairdryer coffee making facilities and a large flat screen TV. Also a free, easy to use safety deposit box. Breakfast is served between 6.30am and 9.30am which we used every day, and they also have two large TV's on one showing breakfast TV and the other on a childrens channel. The was a good selection of food, pastries/cereal/toast/yoghurt and three hot dishes which varied each day. Also juice/tea/and coffee.The reception helped my daughter connect her phone to the wifi which is also available in the rooms. They can also arrange a taxi for you and have a room to store your luggage if you are leaving later than the check out time.Out side of the hotel are rattan chairs and tables so you can have a coffee outside.The position of the hotel is in an excellent position, turn left out of the hotel and at the end of the road if you turn left is Macy's and a few other shops. If you turn right your only a ten minute walk away from Times Square. If you come out of the hotel and turn right you get to 5th Avenue and turning right and your 5 mins from the Empire State Building.Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights and would not hesitate to recommend this. It was clean, room size was fine although space for hanging clothes could have been bigger. Breakfast was good. Location is great, really central. Street is not too noisy at night. Would definitely stay here again if returning to new York. Subway station is at the end of the street.

Great room, Great location near Empire State Bldg.Stayed 1 night. The hotel has small rooms but is very modern and efficient in design. The staff were all very helpful and all greeted usIt is very well located. You have places to eat, to shop and a subway really close.

Have to recommend this hotel located in midtown Manhattan. Easy walking distance to MANY sites and close to subway and bus stops. Great view of the Empire State Building from our room. The bartender, Stephen, was really friendly and had many useful suggestions for dining and sight-seeing. We enjoyed a walk on the High Line because of his recommendation.

It is very well located. You have places to eat, to shop and a subway really close. All the stuff is great specially Bebe and Shameeza (front desk) and Erica and Debbie (during the breakfast). The room was very comfortable and clean. The breakfast was very good and important. I enjoyed a lot my stay and i recomend a lot the hotel.

Stayed 6 nights. The hotel has small rooms but is very modern and efficient in design. The staff were all very helpful and all greeted us with a good morning or hello. The housekeeping staff was great, kept the room clean and neat. Necessary in a small room. The front desk gave good directions and suggestions. Great location, near Macy's - Empire State Building. All within 2 to 4 blocks walking. Around the corner and up a block to the subway.

My wife & I stayed here for 10 nights. Check-in was quick and we always found the front desk staff friendly & helpful if we had any questions. Our room (1005) was a decent size and the bathroom had a super shower. The room is situated at the back of the hotel, is lovely & quiet and has a great view of the top of the empire state building. Part of the reason we chose this hotel was that it is one of the few that offers breakfast. There are hot dishes available and these change every day. Everything was good quality, I absolutely loved the orange juice. The breakfast room staff work really hard to keep things topped up but always had time for a smile & a good morning. One area of the hotel we only tried late in our stay was the bar. Happy hour(s) meant that a glass of wine was cheaper than in nearby bars and restaurants. Other lovely touches were tea, coffee & water in the lobby, free wi-fi throughout the hotel and a computer/printer situated near the breakfast room for printing tickets, boarding passes etc. Location is excellent with one of the many entrances to 34th Street Herald Square subway station on the corner of 35th Street & 6th Avenue. Penn Station is only about a 10 minute walk away. If we ever return to New York we would definately stay at The Best Western Premier Herald Square again.

Enjoyed a great week in a very comfortable central hotel, convenient to all major attractions, all staff were very helpful and do try out the cocktail bar, Stephen was first class, Keens restaurant is down the street probably the best steak house in New York but do try the mutton chop.

Stayed here on the 14th May for 4 nights. Great hotel , lovely friendly staff. Rooms small but clean and nice decor could see the Empire state building from our room . Hotel based in midtown so great location within walking distance to main sights.Coffee and tea in rooms and also in reception all free. Breakfast was great with hot and cold food available. Would definitely return. Linda England

Really nice clean modern hotel with great breakfast and close to everything. We picked it because it was a few blocks from Penn Station and we were arriving by Amtrak. We had 3 people in the room, and barely had enough room for suitcases. We couldn't walk around without rubbing up against each other. Good thing we're a close knit family.

We were four per quite small room and managed well. Room was clean and we got extra blankets by asking. The best thing was the location, it's quite quiet side street. Macys, VS Empire State building, nice restaurants etc very near and Times square by walking distance.We didn't need to use subway at all. Breakfast was nice.

We were very impressed by all aspects of this hotel in Mid-Town Manhattan. The facility was clean and well appointed, and the staff was outstanding, helpful and kind. Having the front and rear patio was great. The Bar and the Breakfast were managed well and very accommodating. This was a very pleasant experience for folks from a small town in Texas!

Good Manhattan-hotel. Perfect location in mid-Manhattan and close to everything. And acceptable price in a very expensive stia like New York. The rooms are not large, but everything is in there. And everything is working...

I stayed here with my teenaged daughter while visiting NYC. It is just a couple of blocks from the 34th St Herald Square subway and bus stops. They include free breakfast and wifi, which is always nice. The room was nice with everything we needed. No refrigerator or microwave. There is a nice little fresh market/cafe a few steps away. Within walking distance of the Rockefeller Center, Empire State Building, Broadway Theaters and Times Square. They have a very small street front so it is easy to miss if you aren't looking for it, but not at all hard to find. Loved that we were central to everything in Manhatten.

As usual the hotels in New York are overpriced but I did get good service, good food for breakfast and the hotel staff were very nice. This hotel is about six blocks from Time Square and three blocks from the Largest Macys Department Store. The rooms are small but who stays in the room?

Good location to Empire State, Macy's and Times Square! ! ! Staff are so friendly and happy to help with any request :-) And is always kept clean with fresh towels daily ! And the beds are so comfy! Would definitely come and stay again 110% if coming to NYC again and would recommend !

The location was central to all the places we wanted to see and it didn't take long to find our way around. We walked to most of our destinations. The room had plenty of space for two people, was clean, and the housekeeping service was great. The front desk staff members were exceptional, providing helpful tips and recommendations. The hot breakfast was a little different each morning--a welcomed variety over the 6 days of our stay. We recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Nothing bad about this place. Friendly staff, held our bags before check in, big free breakfast. Clean rooms and maids did a good job each day. Small rooms but that's just New York. Room with a view has a big window facing the street. Nothing crazy amazing but it's cool.

I stayed here May 2016, great location. The staff has great customer service, but rooms are very small. It is very close to all amenities and shopping. You can walk anywhere, not far at all and I hate walking. Restaurants and deli next door to get anything you need. Train station is close, The breakfast is not that good....below average but I guess it will do until you get on the road. Did not try any other food there. Although rooms small very clean only good for 2 people and is still a tight squeeze with luggage.

Spent 3 nights at BW Premier Herald Square. Location was excellent. We were able to walk everywhere and also use the train. Hotel located near all methods of transportation. Room was fantastic and morning breakfast was great to get your day rolling. Staff and amenities were exceptional with no complaints. Will definitely stay here again on our next trip

This is a great location to get anywhere in the city. Lots of food options close by. Easy access to subways. The staff were very helpful with directions and information. The lounge was intimate and friendly. Great for a starter cocktail before an evening out. Lots of shopping close by if anything was forgotten or needed.

I recently stayed at this hotel in Manhattan. The rooms were a bit on the small side, which was expected, but very well appointed at a reasonable rate for New York. A great shower and a very comfortable bed were greatly appreciated. There is a small patio out front where you can just sit and people watch as New Yorkers go about their daily business that catches the early morning sun. A breakfast buffet is provided daily that had a good selection of breads, buns, oatmeal, yogurt as well as bacon or sausage and eggs or pancakes.I can't fail to mention the little bar that is hidden in the back of the hotel. It is open from 3:00 to about 11:30 p.m. every day with happy hour specials from 3:00 to 8:00 p.m. And what can I say about the bartender, Steve! What an excellent bartender! Personable, great knowledge of mixed drinks, and also a wonderful advisor about things to do and places to go in New York. The other bartender who worked there was a very nice person, who served my girlfriend and I quite well but I felt she was not quite as tuned in to customer service as Steve. My girlfriend and I returned from a long day of exploring New York about 3:10 one day. We looked forward to going to the bar and relaxing with a glass of wine and much to our surprise, the bar wasn't yet open. We returned about 3:45 and went in for a drink , the bar was open by then but you could tell she hadn't quite finished her set up---luggage rack still in the middle of the bar, no flowers on the table yet.Apart from this little hiccup, it's a really good hotel to stay in. It's well located between Fifth Avenue and Avenue of the Americas on West 36th making it easy to shop on Fifth Avenue or to go see a play on Broadway or walk down to Greenwich Village. I would definitely stay there again!

Finding a nice hotel under $300 in center city New York is a challenge. This hotel is nicely appointed with comfortable beds, clean and quiet. It's one block from the Herald Square subway complex and an easy walk to the theatre district. The rooms are small but so is the furniture. The shower is a walk-in, glass enclosed stall and top notch. If you travel light, you will have no problem storing and maneuvering your stuff. Good luck if you have two large suitcases. Our only complaint - the WiFi did not work well in our room with our iPhones. It was fine in the lobby and breakfast room. The breakfast is better than most among the large chain hotels, and the breakfast room is large and comfortable.

Located a short walk from Macy's this is an affordable midtown choice that's not in the middle of everything. There are tables outside the hotel that are often occupied by smokers which means you're often assaulted by the smell of cigarette smoke on the way in. The lobby is small but clean with dispensers of fruit infused water offering a nice touch. Now please note that hotel rooms everywhere in NYC are small. If you've not stayed in a big city before, this is something you're going to have to accept. Space is at a premium everywhere and that includes hotel rooms, so don't expect tons of space to sprawl out or much closet space. We had a room with one king bed and while the room wasn't tiny, it wasn't well designed. The space between the edge of the bed and the entertainment center was barely enough to roll your luggage past. Two people can't walk through it, you need to make room for each other. Another issue was in the bathroom where the door opens right at the sink, so if you want to stand at the sink, you need to have the bathroom door shut otherwise you're in for a tight squeeze. Finally, while it said we had a king size bed, it didn't seem like it. We have a king bed at home and my feet don't go to the edge whereas they did here. It was strange. The room itself was clean and the decor modern. The bed was comfortable. There was a good sized walk in shower with a good shower head. There's little closet space. Our room overlooked the street, not an exciting view although better than I've had in other hotels where you're basically looking right into another part of the building. Soundproofing left something to be desired, both with other rooms and with the street. Thankfully, I brought earplugs so waking up in the middle of the first night there to the sound of what was probably trash collectors, I popped them in and slept well the rest of the stay.Breakfast was included with a breakfast room in the basement. There were a good number of choices including eggs, rotating meat selection, pancakes, breads, sweets, yogurt, and fruit. The breakfast room could get crowded at times and we ended up bringing it up to the room one day as we couldn't find a spot. The basement also had a small excercise room that was ok.

Great location for this hotel right in the middle of it all. Close to Times Square (about 6 blocks) Very close to Herald Square (about 1/2 block) Close to Empire State Bldg. Also parking garages on same block as hotel. Small building tucked into the middle of the block with onsite lounge, clean upgraded rooms and good price for the area. Very happy with my stay here.

We stayed here for three nights and it was an ideal base for sightseeing around Manhattan. We felt as though we were close to everything we wanted to see and it was handy to be able to pop back to the hotel during the day if needed.The staff were efficient and helpful and there were no problems during our stay.The room was a bit on the small side but absolutely fine for what we needed: a comfortable and convenient base for exploring the city.Breakfast was included and was quite good (hot and cold buffet) but we'd recommend getting down there early as on our last morning we went down towards the end of the serving and had to queue at the buffet and for a table.Speaking of waiting, the hotel is underserved by elevators and almost every time we needed to use one, there was a wait, sometimes for a decent length. But that wouldn't stop us going back.

Good location and comfortable rooms which are small but adequate. Breakfast ok but can get busy. Free tea and coffee in reception is a great touch. There are sixteen floors with 6 Rooms on each floor. I would ask for a room furthest from the elevator as the noise can be intrusive. The king room has a great comfortable bed and plenty of storage space and also has a free safe for your valuables. No bath but a great large and powerful shower. Would definitely consider staying here again.

The hotel staff and location were good for price. There was easy access to the subway and walking distance to other points of interest. Shameza, Bebe and Salman at front desk made us feel welcomed and had good recommendations for restaurants, transportation and sightseeing. Only negative would be small rooms for two beds.

Only 2 blocks from Empire State Building, we walked everywhere! Front desk staff very friendly and helpful. Internet service was weak on upper floor but staff quickly accommodated request to move to lower floor. Would definitely stay there again!

My daughter and I stayed here this month and had a brilliant time. Clean well proportioned room. excellent friendly staff. Great bar and patio area and a brilliant choice in the breakfast room to get you started in the morning. Would recommend.

We stayed at this Hotel for 4 nights, it is right in the heart of the city. The beds were comfortable, the room was clean, the breakfast was very good and it was nice to have free wifi when you are travelling from out of country. The only problem I had was when I booked the hotel, I wanted to have a roll away bed and from what I saw online they had them and I was allowed to request one but when I got there they said that they didn't have roll away beds. This could have been a big problem but it end up working out. The rooms in New York, at least downtown, are very small and there were 4 of us so we had to be strategic where we put things.

I stayed here with my daughter for 2 nights on a mother- daughter trip to shop for her upcoming wedding. Before arriving, I encountered a situation with the central BW phone staff. A lower price was posted the night before than what I had booked the room for. When I arrived, the front office manager , Jay, was well informed of my request to honor the lower price and he did. I did not even have to ask, but Jay courteously informed me he would honor the new lower price. I was delighted. From the moment we arrived, the entire hotel staff was extremely friendly and always greeted us with a smile. The bellhop was polite, well mannered and the staff members behind the desk were very nice. The lobby was clean, neat and offered complimentary coffee and water 24/7. Our room was very clean, bedding was comfortable and the hall was quiet. A great complimentary breakfast with hot and cold items was available. Items changed each day . There was always plenty of seating , kitchen staff refilled items continually and the area was always clean. I would highly recommend this hotel. The location is fantastic, close to shopping and the train. I definitely will return.

Great job Bebe, Erika and Debbie !If you are visiting with family this is great value for your $$. Free breakfast, Wifi and Coffee. Front desk staff are friendly.We stayed there for 3 nights and it worked out great as the location is central to many attractions such as Broadway, Central park, Shopping etc. Great Veggierestaurants in the neighborhood as well

We selected this central hotel, partly because of the free wifi and its central location. The staff were helpful and friendly, particularly Erica who was very gracious in providing gluten free options for my breakfast. Rooms ere fine and clean.

The Best Western Premier is for the most part a comfortable place to stay. The area outside is noisy; lots of construction nearby at the time I'm writing this, and lots of trucks on the street at night (and I was on the 7th floor). The room, however, was a decent size for Manhattan, and kept clean and comfortable. Every staff person I interacted with was really nice, and helpful when I needed anything. The folks at the front desk helped with a few requests, and the breakfast and housekeeping staff were really nice too. The breakfast leaves something to be desired (e.g. dried-out, lukewarm eggs) but that's unfortunately just par for the course for American chain hotels.

The name says it all! Truly a Premier hotel with Premier staff! I am from NYC and worked in the Empire State Building (46th Fl) for many years. I know the area well.(Now a visitor for medical reasons.) If you are traveling for business or touring the greatest city in the world, you will be very happy that you chose this property! Don't let the size fool you!The staff are of the highest quality in hospitality. Salman, Shameeza, and Ryan mademy stay exceptional. They are the best of the best! By all means, treat yourself to a cocktail or soda and meet Steve, a highly experiencedbartender who runs a fantastic Happy Hour! Sit out on the lovely Patio, complete witha great retractable awning! No need to go anywhere else in town! The locals frequentthe Patio Bar, and they know where it's happening! Steve makes it happen!!!The rooms are modern and exceptionally clean with all the amenities you would expect with large windows for a great city view! Breakfast was included on the Concourse level where you will also find a nicely equipped Fitness center. (It was empty and other guests and I commented that it might be a good idea to use it, rather than admire it! Lol) Choose this hotel for excellent value and a wonderful hotel experience!

This hotel is modern, clean, and well appointed. It is in a great location, the rooms and especially the beds are very comfortable, the staff is friendly...it is an amazing find in the price range. The first time I stayed here was not long after it first opened, it was great then, and the standards have not dropped. I am particularly impressed with the housekeeping and cleanliness of the place. If you go at the wrong time the breakfast room can get a bit crowded and you may have to take your plate to the bar upstairs. Not a big deal. This hotel is wonderful find and I definitely recommend it.

For a hotel recently renovated the walls are paper thin. You could not only hear the next room over you could follow their conversation. Another issue was the lamp in the room had a damaged electrical cord that was repaired with scotch tape...a huge fire and life safety hazard. The facilities are clean enough and the staff cordial. I often stay at best western this was my first time at this location and now my last.

My office is directly across the street where I first walked in about 10 months ago. There is a very nice bar/lounge with a very cozy patio. The drinks are delicious and very well priced. They also have the “BEST” bartender Stephen who makes the place our “CHEERS” of New York.....;.Lawrence

Hotels in New York are not spacious and roomy as you'd find somewhere else outside of the city or in a Caribbean resort. Nevertheless, I did not mind the size of my room because I lived and worked in NYC for over 8 years. The room had everything I needed; and, most importantly, I didn't pay attention to the size of my room! The service was what made the difference. From a warm welcome from Bebe at the Reception Desk, to a very clean room (sorry didn't catch the housekeeper's name); and, a fantastic job by Ryan in Bell Services, I absolutely loved the experience I had in this cozy and classy hotel. Congratulations to the management of the property. This really is a PREMIER hotel.

Great Location in Manhattan !! Hotel staff very friendly and polite. The heat my room was not operating correctly, and they had it fixed that day. You must stop by the bar and have Steve mix you a drink.

Awesome stay- great location to Empire State Building, Macy,s and Broadway. Although the rooms were small ( which is expected in New York ) they had all the amenities one would want. Beds were great and spare pillows available. Breakfast was a basic selection on hot and cold items, which was well stocked and topped up constantly. All staff were so friendly and helpful from the breakfast staff to the front desk- they couldn't have assisted us anymore.A coffee,tea and hot chocolate station is available 24 hours in the lobby which was a bonus ! Spotless rooms! Loved my stay!

This hotel and the staff exceeded my expectation. We were surprised how quiet it was at night. The place was very clean with a nice sized bathroom and the bed was very comfortable. I will not need to even check around on a return trip, this is where I'll stay. I'll also be recommending it to all my friends.

In hear of town ? yes it is , close by to everything ?? of course it is , the best in value for money ?? no doubt about it , easy access to everything 100% yes , go a head and book you will not regret i have enjoyed staying here with the family big times , Thanks Best Western for recommending this property

This hotel is in a great location within easy walking of The Empire State Building, Rockafella Centre,Times Square& Broadway shows to name just a few. Probably best to get the bus to visit 9/11 memorial, Wall Street & to get the boat to Statue of Liberty. The room was clean and large enough for us with a great view of The Empire State building. Ryan was so helpful with advise of how to get around as were Bebe & Shameza on the front desk. The breakfast was lovely with lots of variety including Fruit Juices, Porridge, Toast, Cooked, pastries to name a few of which Erica ran with a friendly and efficient manner. We would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely go back to on another visit to New York.

We stayed to attend a Tartan Festival and this hotel was located near Bryant Park where many of the festivities began. Hotel rooms are small as they are in most NYC hotels but clean. Great service from the front desk to the cleaning people. Nice patio bar in back and seating out front to relax.

In town foe one night only and i had the best sleep at your Hotel. from check in everyone was so pleasant and professional. would highly recommend to all my friends. next time in New York will stay at your hotel.

Very expensive for a small room. Breakfast is average at best. Room was clean. Location in city was very advantageous. Front desk staff could have been a bit more helpful with local directions and subway.

What more could you need? Breakfast can be busy, but it changes daily and is a good start to the day. Complimentary iced water and hot beverages in the lobby are welcome. Bar area is comfortable and rooms are smart and perfect for a central NY stay.

i really enjoyed staying at this hote and i would like to recoomend other people for their stay. the staff was very good and the manager Jay Singh was very courtious. The breakfast was excellent. The location was beautiful.

Awesome location, close to everything ! The location can't be beat. Hotel was clean, service staff very courteous and helpful. We got to stay on the 17th floor with a great view of the Empire state building. The hotel manager was extremely helpful, he even offered his parking spot for free, saving us a bunch of money.The breakfast bar was great too, the staff often checked on us and made us feel welcome. I would highly recommend this hotel. It will deliver beyond your expectations. We definitely plan to be back next time we are visit NY.

A very nice and classy city hotel, with a really cute lounge/bar for relaxing with friends without having to travel to find a bar. Also, central location for site seeing, very close to the Empire State Building.

This is NY so the rooms are very clean and are small, but when you are touring NY, you do not sit in your room, do you? The hotel is very close to Macy's and the Train Station. It is really not a long walk to Times Square and there are great restaurants along the way. Downstairs the hotel has a nice lounge with outdoor seating in the back "courtyard" of the hotel. It is a nice little hideaway from the city for a nice time with friends or for a drink. The service is great, they have a nice included breakfast with a nice area to sit and eat. Parking garages, there are two very close. The one on the same side of the street does validate and it does save a couple of bucks if you came in by car.

We had a wonderful 5 night stay at the Best Western Herald Square. It was located close to many attractions, but not on a main street, so there was no noise pollution at night. Rooms are small, but I was expecting much smaller for New York hotels! We were only needing a place to rest at night, so we did not mind the small rooms at all! It was nice to come back after a long day to a comfortable room & bed. The breakfast was a nice treat as well. We did not have high expectations for the breakfast, perhaps just some bread & coffee, but were surprised by the diverse spread served each day. However, seating is limited in the dining area, so either go early or later in the morning!

When other reviewers spoke of how great this place was I was impressed, but now that I have stayed here - IT IS ALL TRUE. From checking in to checking out every service and person was more then promised. The rooms are small but so are all rooms in NYC but this property is so so so clean and everyone so helpful. Breakfast is great and clean room, the bar / lounge is great though small its cozy and great. So look to coming back.

Room size typical NYC but top floors larger, great views. Salman handled our bags and spoke to us daily / Erica at breakfast was great and so was the food Great location, able to walk everywhere and felt safe We will be back Never used a passMust see near the hotel Rockefeller Plaza- can see from your roomTime Square 10 min walkMacy's 3-4 min walkMadison Square Garden 10 minsTake subway south to see 911 and One World -life changingA whole day for Central Park-a 100% day for park/New York styleTavern on the Green in Central Park On west 67th- You will be treated like royalty $$$ and worth every penny

Great location and a wonderful staff. The rooms were clean and very comfortable and again the staff was more than accommodating. The best and favorite part of my stay was Stephen the bartender. He had great advice for getting around the city and treated the hotels guest very well. Thank you Stephen for everything!

Beautiful, clean, close to time square, nyc library, and many other attractions. Best part of the hotel besides the continental breakfast is the bar! Excellent drink prices, and the bar tender is the best in the city. Thanks Steven for helping us integrate to the big city! A++++ service. The hotel is situated right outside the most busy areas, so it's nice to walk out and slowly be on your way, with options of avoiding the big crowds. The maid service was good, organizing things for me in a cleanly manner (never had that done before and really appreciated it). Would love to stay at this location again.

Rooms are small but are very neat and clean. Service is impeccable. Front desk was always helpful. All staff were very courteous. Breakfast was great. Breakfast service was superior. A very good choice! Concierge was always happy to help. Coffee and water stand in lobby was a very nice addition.

Great Location. Tasty Breakfast - without vegtebales. The room is clean with new decor, but a small one...as in NY. Cheaper than the hotels around with a real good value for the money. Service is very good - all the nedded help ! Free Coffee and Tea at the Lobby.

This property and it's employees are awesome. Perfect location for visiting the sights of NYC. The manager and front desk were very attentive, accommodating and friendly. The rooms are adequately sized for a NY City Hotel. A two year old hotel that looks like it opened just yesterday. Nice design features, no long waits for the elevators. Parking garage several doors down

We recently stayed here and thought it was only okay, not great.The mid-block location (away from heavy traffic competing with pedestrians crossing at the corner) was relatively quiet for New York.From the street, the hotel wasn't very welcoming, with a cramped patio, tables, and chairs out front, a narrow entry into the hotel, a small lobby given the number of guests coming and going, and (on the up side) efficient but (on the down side) somewhat brusque front desk help.The room we had (1601) was very good and quiet, with a comfortable bed, stylish furnishings, a small but okay bathroom, and a view of sorts (see photos). Also, the room was clean and in very good shape.In contrast, breakfast in a drab basement room had limited options (no yogurt, for example) and definitely wasn't as gourmet as at other Best Western properties where we've stayed in the past.All in all, this was a mixed bag -- okay for maybe a night in a central location, but not worth the fairly high price charged, given the uneven quality.

Small room, we had a double bed room and it worked but there was not that much extra space. The room had a good size bathroom, it did take a while for the water to heat up.The hot breakfasts were great! There was eggs, meat, oatmeal and more.

When you check in to a hotel for one night only and want to make the most of sight seeing the city, this hotel is the apt choice. Located 10 mins walk from Times Square and Penn Station, you have access to the heart of the city as well as to the fastest commute option to get to and from the airport(s).

I stayed at this hotel last weekend and I was lucky enough to get room at 17th floor, to my surprised the room has a view of Empire State building...Check in was smooth,rooms were very clean and spotless...Next day morning i had a complimentary break fast provided by hotel...Can't wait to back again Best Western Priemier

Our family of 4 spent 4 nights at the hotel. The hotel is very clean and comfortable and an easy walk of about 10 short, not long, blocks to TImes Square. The staff was very nice and accommodating. The hotel provides a free breakfast with a few hot times each day, which is a deal for NYC. We felt totally safe at night, but we were always in by 11 p.m. or so. There are a few stores a few doors down from the hotel to get water, food, etc. There is a large Macy's and other businesses close by. The rooms in NYC hotels are small and this one was no exception. There were four of us and we were "on top of each other," but made it work. We were only there to sleep and shower and were out the rest of the time, so if your plan is to do the same thing, I think the room would work fine. The only negative is that the wifi did not work in the room, which didn't bother me, but was a bummer for my kids.

Steve, the bartender was amazing! Thanks for a great time!!! Friday night happy hour was packed and he was so attentive and fast with drinks, Saturday night wasn't as busy but we still had an awesome time!!

I lived in NYC for several years and have also stayed at a few fancier hotels in the city. I know how difficult it is to find a hotel that is conveniently located, has all the basic amenities, is clean and modern, is affordable. I needed a room to share with 2 of my sisters. We booked a standard room with 2 double beds for 3 nights, and our stay exceeded our expectations. We have stayed at some more expensive hotels in the city that were truly disappointing, and at similarly priced ones that were not as good a value. The rooms are small, as most NY hotel rooms are, but they are clean, the beds and pillows are comfortable, linens are clean. The bathroom is small but clean and the shower is great. Breakfast was hot, and the variety exceeded expectations as well (I thought this was going to be a bread/bagels and some spreads + coffee kind of deal, but they served hot eggs and breakfast meats, an assortment of breads, oatmeal, fruit along with coffee/tea/milk/juice). The hotel is just around the block from Herald Square so convenient for walking around and taking the subway or bus. It is in close proximity to some wonderful restaurants (Keen's Steakhouse is a must) and great shopping, and just a few blocks from Bryant Park (where there is a Breads Bakery kiosk that serves the best babka in the city). If you have a lot of luggage, it may be a tight fit. We had 3 carry-on sized bags and 1 standard check-in sized bag among the 3 of us and it took some maneuvering to find a place for everything, but we managed. The room is probably more suited to 2 people than 3 or 4 (unless they are small children) but they did maximize the use of space. The location is noisy, but all of New York City is, and it didn't really bother me. In fact, I slept extremely well. The staff was wonderful - friendly and helpful. My one complaint is the "free internet" to which I never could connect. I didn't report the problem, opting to use my phone instead, but none of my sisters could connect either, and I felt somewhat cheated by the promise of free internet that didn't work. Overall, I was satisfied with my stay and would book a room here again. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a clean and affordable place to stay in the city. However, if an internet connection is a must, speak to the front desk beforehand just to make sure it really is working.

We had a great stay! Rooms are small but very clean and you can't get a better location to do all of Manhattan! Free breakfast was good and a great way to start your day of sight seeing! Big thanks to Erica in the breakfast room for good food and her great efficiency getting people in and out!

Usual size room for New York. Clean etc. Very happy. Might have preferred a room on a higher floor for views, but not available. Room facing main street - enjoyed watching what was going on. Tea and coffee available at reception plus coffee in room, and ice on a couple of floors. No shower gel - surprising!

Was a guest from March 9th to 12th. Enjoyed my visit. Stayed on the 17 th floor. The rooms were very clean although rather small. The best part of it was the food- very tasty. Special thanks to Erika for keeping the dining room orderly and neat.Hope to be back.

Small new hotel close to Herald Square and subway station in 34th street, between Penn Station and Grand Central, close to Broadway and Times Square but far enough to avoid the crowd and noise. Good restaurants in the neighborhood (like Le petit poulet) and many shops and services. Nice staff, clean and quiet rooms, the breakfast room is not large and the choice of meals is just fine. I will come back in my forthcoming visits to New York.

This hotel is in a perfect location for shows on Broadway or Events at Madison Square Garden. We did both on our visit. The hotel in Herald Square is easy walking to Times Square, Macy's etc. We had a beautiful room on the 17th floor facing the street. I noticed on the fire safety map that there were 5 rooms on the floor. Two face the street and the other 3 long narrow smaller rooms are in the back of the hotel. It is in the garment district. The buildings are not wide. As I mentioned 2 rooms across. There windows went from floor to ceiling on an angle. Reminded me of the Luxor in Vegas. We had a king size bed which took up half of the room. It face the window, which was really awesome. The bathroom was comfortable in size given the size of the room. Everything in the room and bath area was new and updated. If you are looking for a spacious room, you may want to look elsewhere, but you may not find spacious in the city in this price range. It was the perfect size for our 3 day stay as we had lots to do and see and only slept in the room after our long, exciting, fun days. The bed was exceedingly comfortable. The breakfast area is in the level below the lobby. It was spacious with about 20 tables that could sit about 4 each. The selection was better than most places and the staff was very attentive, replenishing items all the way till the end of breakfast hours. There is a bar on the lobby level. We really enjoyed our stay and would most definitely return. I would request a front/street facing room because we enjoyed our view of the city.

Traveled with family and stayed in four different hotels and by all means the room here was the smallest. FD agent was good and the ladies at the breakfast area are the best. They were attentive and courteous hi-5 to them. Will consider other properties in the future due to parking ( which was expensive) and the size of room.

Stay for more than a month, out class hotel, best breakfast service, friendly staff. Jay, Salman, Bebe and all other staff are very cooperative. Rate 9/10. Best location near to subway and Pen station.

A boutique-type hotel near everything in midtown Manhattan. Clean room, comfortable bed, good breakfast included, fitness center if you need it, polite and informative staff, at a great price. A real deal!

Myself & my husband stayed at the BW Premier Herald Square for 4 nights & couldn't be happier with our experience. The front desk staff were always friendly & cheerful & would always happily answer questions/queries or directions. The location is brilliant, 2 mins to Empire State & Macey's and 10 mins (if that) to Times Square. With regards to rooms unless you have a palatial bedroom at home the rooms were reasonably sized & free Wifi was a bonus. We found breakfast nice & plentiful. My husband enjoyed the pastries!For the price we paid we were over the moon. I am a travel agent at home & know how expensive NYC hotels can be. This was brilliant value! If we return to NYC we will definitely be back!!

Stayed here this past weekend and the place was great. Got there at 11am and was able to get into my room even though check in time was 3pm. Room was nice and clean. Met a friend there who frequents NYC and he said the room was pretty big compared to places he has stayed. The free breakfast was a great added bonus.
Very practical with excellent staff. Clean and tidy and in an ideal location for sight seeing.Breakfast is simple but enough choice. No need to push in British plenty for everyone Highly recommended.

Small room,but hey it's NYC. Good location close to 34th street and 42nd street. Staff was friendly. The breakfast was above average. Halls are a little dark but it's all about location. Ice machine was not on every floor. No built in closet, more of a wardrobe in the corner. Double bed room very little extra spacing.

Clean and nice hotel. Room was quite small but beds were very nice. View from the window was nice (to the street and NY city). Free coffee and tea available.Breakfast wasn't so versatile but quite ok.The location was very good, metro stop near to the hotel, also some sightseeing places. Service in the lobby was good.

The hotel is in a great location near Times Square, Macys and other shopping streets but yet it's quiet at night. Hotelstaff were superfriendly and helpful. The room itself were up to date, modern with all facilities. Bathroom with a good sized shower. All clean and no remarks. Breakfast was suprisingly ok for being in a smaller hotell in the US. Bagels, toast, croissants, yoghurt, cereals, pancakes etc. Coffee tasted good aswell! Only remark here is that there wasn't a single vegetable, could be great with just some tomatoes and cucumber. What you get is what you see with this hotel and I would recommend it to couples and friends traveling.

Happened to stay at Valentine weekend,One of the cleanest hotel that i have ever stayed from lobby,rooms,bathrooms spotless and great customer service.Smooth check in and rooms were immaculate clean the only down size the rooms are small but who cares its NYC.And they have free hot breakfast,free wifi and free luggage storage.If i ever travel back to NYC this hotel will be my choice.My sincere thanks to Ryan and Bebe they genuinely cares about the guest.

Great hotel, in a great location! Very clean, fab breakfast and lovely staff, especially Salman from reception and Dave from housekeeping awesome guys. Rooms are small but very fresh and clean. Overall a very comfortable stay. Highly recommended.

Everything you could want for a short stay in New York. Great location, really friendly staff and modern rooms with funky NY pictures, comfy bed with good linens and a decent shower. Breakfast included and was really good, nice gym and a bar. Yes the room is small (King) and would be a bit squashed for 2, but I was here alone. My safe didn't work but it was replaced within 10 mins.Downsides: the lift is noisy making clunking noises and beeping at each floor. As this is a tiny hotel the rooms are all around it. Vending machines not working. When I returned to my room at 4.30 the maid still had not been.

The Best Western Premier is the only hotel that I stay at while traveling to NYC on business or for pleasure. The hotel is newer, well maintained, offers a decent breakfast in the morning, and has an excellent staff that provides great service. Jay, the Front Desk Manager, is fantastic and pays attention to detail! Erica provides excellent service during morning breakfasts.

A very kind staff, which will make an effort to provide an excellent service. Great location, near a central subway station. Not a fancy breakfast but surprising. Free coffee & Tea in Lobby. The room (we took the double bed) is too small, but this is the only minus that I've found. It was my second time in this hotel and probably I'll be back for third time.

The hotel has convenient location. Staff is very professional and helpful. Quality of good breakfast was good. Lobby and rooms and clean and convenient. Overall, very good value for the money. Highly recommended.

Great location. Walk within minutes to everything, Time Square, MSG, Penn Station, Bus Depot. Nice Burger joint at the corner 6th and W 36th. Rooms are small, cozy and clean. Great for just a couple of days. small entryway but its a hidden jewel!!! Great staff, very helpful. Only negative comment is I'm not a morning person but the guest door next to mine kept slamming shut all morning.

I completely agree with the many previous complimentary reviews about this hotel. Fantastic location - walkable to many key NY sights, plenty of places to eat within a couple of blocks. The Keg just across the road offers great food a lively atmosphere especially for sports lovers - plenty of screens with up to date basketball, football, soccer etc. Whilst a small hotel, the staff made our stay very comfortable - public areas and rooms kept very clean, good selection at breakfast with the lovely Erica and her team as well as very helpful and pleasant staff on front desk. I would definitely stay here again.The only downside is the plastic plates and cutlery at breakfast - not very environmentally friendly.

What else to expect if you get a room in boutique hotel in the heart of Manhattan? Except of very small room and poor selection of products during breakfast (if you live there for 10 nights) the location is perfect! That's the best added value. Big plus for an ice machine located on the 13th floor, friendly staff, bar with a small terrace and Empire State view.

Hotel was a great value. The price was affordable and good compared to similar grade hotels in the area. It offered additional value by including breakfast and wifi internet in the room price. The room was small but clean and modern. The floor-to-ceiling window was a nice feature for me since I liked to look out and absorb the city ambiance. The staff were all helpful. The front check-in staff found us a room that fulfilled our preferences and also provided suggestions for local businesses. The staff in the breakfast cafeteria went out of their way to satisfy us including juggling some items in the breakfast line-up to be available during our stay. Would definitely recommend for travelers looking for a clean, modest room that are there to see the sights.

We enjoyed our stay very clean and great staff the rate was very good for the location close to good restaurants and lots of sights to see within walking distance. The breakfast was a okay and every morning the staff were helpful and fun to converse with. When we asked for help with directions or whatever we always received as much help as possible

We have stayed at many hotels in New York and this one, while still small, was larger than most. One room and one bed is all you are going to get in New York and you dont spend much time in the room to begin with so its not as big of a deal as you may think - the bathroom was really nice and they cleaned everyday.
