If you get a handicap bathroom make sure you request extra towls as the curved shower curtain bar allows for a lot of the water that splashes on the curtain to fall outside the shower draining area. And the second dowfall would be that if you are not comfortable to go #2 infront of whoever you are staying with, there are no exhaust fans in the bathrooms.

I was very pleased to find a Best Western hotel near where my son and daughter-in-law ahve an apartment on Manhattan in New York Xity. I stayed in a well located smallish, but very nicely furnished room like many in European cities, in one of the most expensive of US cities for lodging. It was a "highjudge for the money" experience.

Great location, awesome team of very helpful people. Especially Erica at breakfast - loves her job and even shares her recipes. Would only change one thing, softer toilet paper. Will stay there again.

if you are looking for a place to stay close to time square, MSG and numerous other sites this is the place to stay. 6 blocks from time square 4 blocks to MSG and the empire state building and all the the shows on broadway. great people great service very clean and well priced.

This hotel was really very good. The staff were are very helpful and informative. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. We were here for a hockey game and touring New York. If you are coming as a group and you go to the Keg Room across the street, they will not do separate cheques. Too bad because the food and service was really good otherwise. We all had a lot of fun and everyone enjoyed to hotel. The breakfast was better than usual. It was included with our stay. The location of the hotel was great. 10 mins from Time Square etc, etc, etc. Lots to do and see. Cabs were plentiful and speedy.

My friend and myself spent 3-nights at the Best Western Premier Herald Square this month. From start to finish, the hotel was great. We requested a room in a quiet floor which was honored. Room was tastefully done and bathroom updated. Provided breakfast was delicious and hotel staff eager to please. Hotel staff members BeBe and Ryan helped us with taxis, area highlights, directions, etc. We will certainly return to the Big Apple and stay there.

Really enjoyed our week at this hotel. Check in was efficient and the lady on reception was extremely helpful when we need to change one of the rooms booked to a room with two beds as opposed to one bed.!Rooms are quite small, but I've stayed in smaller in Amsterdam and really it is just a place to sleep so no complaints there. Everything was very clean and we had a great view of the Empire State Building. The bathroom was also small but adequate for our needs and the toiletries were replaced every day. The shower was nice and large and falrly powerful - I have no complaints there. The tea/coffee items in rooms were also stocked up every day.The general appearance of hotel was clean and the restaurant for breakfast was kept very clean - I'm not sure of the environmental damage this hotel does with its plastic plates/utensils but that's their issue. The orange juice was probably one of the nicest I've had in hotels where OJ is included as it is usually just hideously sweet concentrated rubbish, but this was great.My only issues with this hotel were :Maintenance man - we had a problem with the safe and were told when we reported it at 7.50pm that someone would be up in "5 minutes" luckily we did not hold our breath as he turned up at 11.10pm when we were in bed - when we didn't answer he phoned the room and we told him to come back the following day. We rang at 7.30am the next morning and someone was there within 5 minutes so why this was not done the night before I cannot understand and I did not appreciate being called at 11.10pm - not exceptionally late but when you are on a time difference of 5 hours behind Ireland - it made a difference!!My other issue was the lifts! On the second morning one was not working and it was a long wait to get a lift that was not full. On my last day - we had to wait 20 minutes because again only one was working and the other was full of the maid's trolleys so we could not get in - if it wasn't for the fact I was on 16th floor with suitcases I would have walked down. I can appreciate the maid need their trolleys on each floor, but they should really put one trolley in at a time so guests can still get in - two trolleys when 1 lift is already out of service is ridiculous.I would however have no problems recommending this hotel and would definitely stay again. It's well located and has no bed bugs - which can be a worry in NY at even the best hotels!

Great location , great services! Close to everything !! Staff very courteous and very helpful! Will definitely use them again for future Christmas trips,, we travel to ny a lot especially for Christmas and this was very convenient to time square !

It was nice, helping staff, rooms were clean,breakfast was very nice and most importantly the location was too good. My experience at Best western was fantastic and I will definitely recommend to my friends and family and when I go back to New York every time I will definitely book Best western. Thank you Best western and keep the good work.Thank you,Rahman

Stayed here for a weekend and found it to be a very well located and affordable base for a weekend in NYC. The rooms are newly decorated, clean and well equipped with tea & coffee facilities, iPod charger alarm clock, bathroom toiletries and prettily displayed towels, was very impressed. Excellent and kind reception team. Downside would be the thin walls which made sleeping through jet lag a challenge - easily sorted with some earplugs!

As someone who does not sleep well, I was concerned the noise of the city would keep me up all night. The room they provided was one of the quietest I have ever experienced staying in a big city like NYC. I needed a quiet room, a comfortable bed, a clean/working bathroom, no crazies in the next room, a working TV, and a convenient location to attend several meetings. This hotel provided it all at a very affordable price.

/I stayed at Best Western for a month almost and I had an amazing experience friendly staff and good service, start from reception ( Mr. Jay, Salman & Bebe ) to the cafeteria staff Erica and others all were too good very friendly even the breakfast was also delicious and good and ill give 8.5/10 the hotel on their services.

Stayed 1/29/2016. My niece and I were in town for a short theater (Hamilton!) stay. I had booked this hotel on the Southwest site when I booked the flights. My requirements are: Safety, Cleanliness, Location, Economy, and 2 bed option. Free breakfast and wifi are nice, but not essential. Best Western Herald Square scored 5 stars on all my criteria, even the "nice but not essential". GM Mustafa and Houseman Ryan were extremely helpful and made us feel at home as soon as we arrived. Room was updated, very clean and comfortable with modern roomy bathroom and wonderful shower. A great find......we will be back!

Check in was a breeze, Bebe assisted me with my check in and offered me discounted parking on the same block. My room was very clean, bed was extremely comfortable, and the bathroom was a good size for our stay. Temperature in the room was perfect. Not much of a view but we only used it to sleep. Breakfast was fresh, hot and the dining room was clean and the staff was very friendly. I strongly recoommend this Hotel. Great find.

I visited this hotel with friends and family. Great place to stay for a few days in the city. In the heart of NY, near the subway, stores, etc... Staff is super friendly, housekeeping team does a great job in the rooms! Definitively will be back.

We were delayed due to the snowstorm but it was no problem for the hotel to change our dates. Location near to subways, Empire State, Times Square, and a short walk to Central Park. Area between 5th and 6th felt safe and nice restaurants and bars are nearby. Breakfast was fine with 3 hot items, cereal, toast, bagels, pastries, yogurts, tea, coffee and juices. Staff were very helpful. Bed was a bit small but I booked a room with 2 doubles so no.problem for us. Good wifi. Good shower in a clean bathroom. Would return.

Our stay here was wonderful. Close to so much in New York to see, close to subway. Walking distance to time square theaters, Rock center 2 blocks Empire State Building. Will stay here next time in New York.

This hotel is my 1st choice when the price is not too high. Located in midtown, close to the famous 5th Av, you can easily walk to central park, Times Square or to downtown to Chelsea Market.The rooms are big enough, big bathroom. The hotel is not too noisy and the staff very friendly.

This hotel is an astounding value in mid-town Manhattan. The room was very clean, and the bathroom recently redone, very nicely. The location was extremely convenient, many restaurants close by, walkable distance to theaters and several subway lines. Also, the free breakfast was good.

Well, aside from the snow storm that hit New York City, we had made reservations way in advance (as you should when you want to enjoy a weekend in Manhattan) and we were not disappointed with the service received at Best Western! You get a nice breakfast and the staff is very friendly and helpful. This is our second time staying at this hotel and we're looking forward to staying there again!

Had the pleasure of staying here. Get hot breakfast buffet, free WiFi and location couldn't be better. Room was a little small, but not by Motown Manhattan standards. Price could not be beat for everything included. The staff was top rate. Jay, Front office manager, must have a room in the back. Always there and took care of everything, even when I was sick. I highly recommend. Housekeeping staff very good and friendly. Even brought me water when sick. Close to subway and attractions. Nice happy hour .

This hotel is close to everything, including the subway. It is very quiet. I found it to be very clean and the decor very nice in my room. The employees were extremely friendly and offered assistance with the subway routes,restaurants and weather reports!! Particularly Jay and Bebe. I would have been lost without them! The next time I am in NYC this will be the place that I stay.

Excellent location for business or leisure, close to everything. The staff is super friendly and helpful, especially Jay, Bebe at the front desk and Ryan. Very clean hotel, smaller rooms but very comfortable.

This hotel allowed us to be in the heart of the city so we did not pay for taxis/ubers very often. The price was very comparable to the other hotels we cheched out and the room was plenty big for the 2 of us.

Chose this hotel for the price and location. Was not disappointed! Our room was small but we still had plenty of space for us & our luggage. Extremely clean and a very comfortable bed! Fantastic view of the Empire State Building from our 14th floor room! Walking distance to a lot of things we wanted to see. Staff so friendly & helpful. Breakfast was good with cold & hot options that changed daily. Would definitely stay here again.

Friendly staff, no fridge in room for my meds but with in 10 minutes we had fridge, room clean comfortable what you need Recommend, very close to macys empire state building and times square, Breakfast basic, but nice, get your own taxi as they use firm which is bit more expensive,

Had visited NY city over thanksgiving with family. Stayed at this place as its location is pwrfect for downtown visiting and shoping. We had all of that but was amazed by the customer service by the staff. It was a friendly atmosphere what ever time we spent in that hotel and very quick response on any request. Would definately recommend for NY downtown travelers.

I happened to stay at this place again after my previous good experience. This place did not disappointment at all. In fact, some of the staff even remember me and showed great care and took care of my extra requests. The front desk is always available and very swift in response. I like the ambiance of this place and the location and very in the moment experience of NEW YORK CITY. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who needs top class service with affordable price. Also, who wants to experience the luxury of to being in midst of NY downtown and other attractions.

Lovely Hotel, Perfect location between 5th 6th Ave on 36th Street. Our room was very Tiny, however still very lovely. My room had a view of the ESB. Breakfast very good, loads to choose from. The hotel does have free Tea & Coffee in the Reception area for you. Even though you do have Tea & Coffee in your room, its nice to walk into Reception and its there for you. Do recommend this Hotel. I found check inn was very quick and efficient. Also check out was the same. Lovely little Paradise.

This place is well situated and rooms are comfy and include a free breakfast, service at front desk is great.... Parking nearby is convenient and in a great neighborhood and is at the top of the Best Western chain star category, nice perks if you are a rewards member....

The hotel is within walking distance of Times Square and the Theater district. Also, right around the corner from great shopping, with Macy's and JC Penney. Last, there is a great pub across the street called the Keg Room, that was a great place to watch the various football games, including the patriots. We had a selection of appetizers and shared a dessert, which was good and we were not rushed.

The Price is great, it is completely worth the money because it is in a very good location. It is a short walk away from Times Square, Macy's, and many wonderful restaurants. The people at the front desk were very nice and helpful as well!

To be honest we were disappointed with this hotel - mainly due to room size and the bed sizes! Not many people have mentioned the bed size but it was a big no from us. However lets get the positives out of the way first! Location - couldn't fault it - From JFK we got the Air train and then LIRR from Jamaica to Penn St then it was an easy 10 min walk to the hotel. Easy enough to do with luggage on way back too and LIRR takes 20 mins - $25 each return which included the air train ticket. Trains leave every 10 mins from Penn. Checkin - easy enough though they won't recognise your status if you book through an agent ( I got Diamond as I'm a platinum with IHG- they do a like for like). So no room upgrade etc. Check out is 11am but got it extended to 1.30pm. Rooms- we were facing out the back - quiet but no view. The first thing you notice is they are very small - understand this is a Manhattan thing but there was 3 of us and we felt cramped. The room was nice though and clean but hardly any storage space for us all. The main problem for us though was the beds (and this is the most important feature of a hotel room!) we had 2 very small doubles and I mean small- I am 5 ft 5 and my feet dangled over the end - you can imagine poor hubby at 6ft 2 had cold feet during our stay! We are all average or small build - if you are a bigger person this is not the hotel for you! The bedding was annoying - a sheet and very thin duvet - kept having to get up in night and sort it all. Pillows felt cheap and I woke every morning with a pain in my neck.Breakfast- it's ok - cheap and cheerful but set us up for the day. Cereals, pastries, 3 hot items, yogurts and fruit. Also coffee station in lobby and a small coffee maker in the room. Small bar out back with small outdoor space at back and front. 3 min walk to Macy's, the subway at Herald Sq. Very central. A couple of small cafes to the left and right of hotel for food. Can also recommend Diana's Nail and massage bar - just turn left out of hotel and she is up on west 39th st. $25 for a mani and a pedi and $10 for 20min back massage. No need to book. This was our second trip to NYC - was last there in Nov 2014 - that time we stayed at Springhill Suites by Marriot - was just on next street -37th. It was similar but far more spacious rooms and 2 kingsize beds perhaps slightly more expensive but if we were to return or recommend to friends we would recommend the Springhill Suites over this one. Don't normally stay at Best Westerns - not sure I would hurry back. It was ok but just not brilliant I'm afraid. I just can't believe no one really warned us of the very small beds on here!

Thanks to Erica and Debbie at breakfast! Such nice people! Went overboard at breakfast to make sure we were happy. Great location. Rooms were very small but nice, but we didn't care because we were not in the room much. Stayed on the 2nd floor because we wanted to walk the stairs during this busy time in NYC. Great visit!

My husband hates cities, but for our 25th wedding anniversary, he let me drag him to see a show and the sights. The location was near the bus, show and Times square (but not TOO close for comfort :) . breakfast was AWESOME!! Room was clean but TINY. I guess that's NYC at BW, though. King sized bed seemed short to me. My biggest gripe was the BANG BANG noise constantly. It had to be elevator related. It was quiet between 1 am and 3 am. but I like more than 2 hours of sleep!! So, if you plan to get any sleep during stay, ask if the elevator has been fixed yet. Front desk seemed to aware of the noise when I asked. "oh that. We called the repairman"... isn't sleep what you're selling here? I used my rewards points so I won't complain too much about the high rates - it was a holiday weekend after all...

Everything was great about this stay, with the exception of the room size, which is small but really standard for NYC. The staff was friendly, helpful, and accommodating. The hotel is centrally located, a short walk to all the places we wanted to be/see. The breakfast was fresh and plentiful and left out long after the posted times, much to our delight! A terrific stay at a terrific price! Will be staying here again!
Stayed here for 7 nights .Great location ,rooms very clean ,nice breakfast and staff very friendly.Glad we chose to stay away from times square ,this hotel was perfect for us .Thank you best western.

Cosy hotel close to Empire State Building and Times Square, everything else is in walking distance (if you're not lazy). Extremely friendly staff, good breakfast and nice room. I wouldn't hesitate a second to go back here for my next trip to NY.

Great Midtown Manhattan location, excellent Front Desk Staff, Comfortable Rooms with a Great View of the Empire State Building from my window.....The bar was awesome too! If you love shopping you are within two blocks if the BEST shopping in Midtown. "Macys on 34th" is just around he corner.

First time we stayed inside New York city, this was the perfect location, center of all the things that interest us. Staff always maintained professional and polite demeanor. Already started planning our next visit, looking forward to staying at the Best Western in Herald Square again…

Our family of four spent our one night in the city at this hotel. We were a little cramped, but well worth it for the price! Located close to Penn station with a friendly staff. Would definitely stay here again,free breakfast too. The room and bathroom were updated, but small, would be difficult if we all had more than an overnight bag each. Perfect location, we walked to Times Square and Rockefeller Center. We were able to check in an hour early and they offered to stow our bags at check out. Hot free breakfast we did take advantage of, work out room that we did not take advantage of.

Rooms nicely updated. Breakfast was great. Walked everywhere. 10 min walk to Penn Station. Few blocks from Time Square, Rockefeller Center, Empire State Building. Lots of restaurants close by. Nice staff

The staff and location of this hotel are excellent. Great breakfast that will keep you going well beyond lunch. The wifi was probably the best I have experience at a hotel. Nice small amenities such as continuous coffee, tea and water in the lobby and computer set up to help you print your boarding passes. Only one negative -- rooms are small, but hey, this is NYC and you don't stay in your room very much in the city that doesn't sleep.

My wife and I and two teenagers spent four nights here from Boxing Day to the 30th Dec. The location is brilliant within walking distance of everything. The staff are superb, helpful and friendly.The rooms are not massive, but are adequate and cleaned everyday. Free coffee in lobby 24/7. Lovely breakfast, with different hot options every morning, does get busy after 8am.Would definitely stay here again, the perfect hotel for a short stay in Manhattan.

We stayed here for the Thanksgiving Parade. The Hotel is only a few buildings down from 6th Ave where the Parade passes. The Hotel is walking distance to the Empire State Building and Macy's and has easy access to public transport. There are a number of dining options around the Hotel. The rooms were modern and clean - but as expected in New York - a little small. But that was only a problem as we were travelling in a group of 4, otherwise the rooms are fine. Breakfast was standard. The hotel has a cute bar on the ground floor. Staff were welcoming and helpful.

This hotel is in a great location, we walked everywhere...easy and close access to subway. The hotel is nice and comfortable. The room was small but nicely renovated. We had a comfortable stay and the hotel staff was top notch! Reasonably priced.

Girlfriend and I stayed on a Saturday night. The hotel staff was excellent. Very informative friendly and a pleasure to deal with. Bebe was the woman who made our trip very special for us! Great location clean and an overall great experience

I recently stayed here for a Sunday night. I seek out Best Westerns for their independent owned stamp and quality and consistency. The Front Desk staff was excellent we were greeted way early,10am. Our bags were checked for storage. Everyone was very helpful and made the check in process smooth. Our room 1 queen beds, and we wanted a higher floor and they did accommodate us and everything was cleaned well. Even the remote!! was cleaned and bagged. The very small greeting/lobby area of the hotel served it's purpose and had the BW Fresh coffee. The location is also excellent with easy access to a variety of places and transportation. Two elevators but they lve fast and there were minimal wait times. The baggage fellow was GREAT as was the young lad at the front desk. There is little privacy if you want to speak to the concierge. The ease of getting around and walking distance to most areas 30ROCK, theatres, restaurants, MSG, Penn Station, Bryant Park, A short R Train ride to 9/11. Luggage storage before check and in after check out is all NO problem for the staff extending your hours of NYC visitation without worries,Free breakfast was crowded (no seating) and the choices were limited during the busy time we were there. We should have gotten up earlier perhaps! But we managed a meal.

Wonderful place to stay to get all over Manhattan. Close to Macy's and easy walk to all other sites to see. We enjoyed the hotel tremendously. The staff was pleasant, approachable, and able to help us get around to the places we wanted to go. This hotel is close to the subway to make it easy to travel to anywhere you want to go in the city. The location makes it a great place to base you stay to go through out the city of New York. Use this as a place to come back to to relax after a day of shopping or sight seeing. You are greeted by smiling faces and asked if you need anything. The breakfast to start each day is excellent. You get plenty to eat to then go off and start your day in the city. In your room, the internet access was superb. I could check in with my email from home and keep up with what is going on. Also, the TV in the room having DirecTV was awesome. Made me feel like I was at home, since I have that at my house. All in all this was a great weekend for my mother and I to celebrate the holiday season in NYC and spend time together just the two of us.

I recently stayed here for a Sunday night. I work at another Best Western Premier and had high expectations for the hotel. The Front Desk staff was excellent, and Sahmon greeted us immediately. He was very helpful and made the check in process smooth. Our room had 2 double beds, and everything was cleaned perfectly. Even the large window was spotless. The ambiance of the hotel, along with the design make the most of the space. The location is also excellent with easy access to a variety of places and transportation. One suggestion would be to make sure housekeeping resets the clocks after check outs. We didn't realize our iHome had an early alarm set by the last guest, which wasn't the nicest surprise to wake up to. Especially notable was our experience with Bebe at the Front Desk on our last day. She was kind enough to give us a late check out, store all of our luggage while we had lunch, and really helped to make our stay excellent. Her customer service was top notch.

Overall good hotel! Great location for shopping in 5th avenue and Times Square. 2 min walk from the Empire State Building! Also good breakfast the two ladies were very kind. The down part is that the rooms are too small for a big party (4 people). If you are in a smaller party I will definitely recommend this hotel for you as your best option. Thanks to the staff!!

Perfect location. 17 story Hotel with hardly any wait for the elevators. Very Clean. We stayed in room 1704 which faced the back toward the Empire State Building. The windows in the back are small, the windows toward the front are much larger and would make the room feel larger. We would stay here again. The staff was super friendly and helpful. They will watch your luggage on your last day so you can check out and see the city. Hot Coffee and Tea was available 24/7 for free. Free WiFi with strong reception.

This is a great hotel in a wonderful location--between Times Square and Herald Square, close to all major shopping. The only problem is that the rooms are very small. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. The breakfast is okay (powdered eggs), but enough variety for everyone to get something they like. We walked or took the subway almost everywhere from here. Very easy to get around.

I spent 4 nights here while visiting the city with my wife. We had a fantastic time exploring New York. This hotel is located right off of Hearld Square, right by a subway stop, and near the Empire State Building. We were in one of the rooms on the top floors. Loved the view. The windows slant up in our room and offered a great skyline view for us. The street is a little interesting and not the best, and breakfast is ok. Overall a great hotel. Loved it and will be back for another trip sometime!!!

This hotel is really well located, close to 6th avenue, a lot of subway stations nearby, breakfast is good, rooms are small but clean and comfortable, staff is friendly and helpful. Will definitely stay there again.

While we were in NY, the staff was more than accommodating while we were there. Our first day in the city it rained all day - That did not keep us from going out, but we were soaked when we returned to the hotel. The staff at the front desk offered to take our clothes for us and dry them, which was completely unexpected. Every question we asked, they pleasantly answered. We will definitely be staying here again when we return.

Second stay, had an excellent experience in July. Without another thought just made reservations. Some bumps on first day but after speaking to Jay everything was resolved and enjoyed our stay as the first. Breakfast is a bit crowded in the lounge, offerings are better than the usual. I am a light sleeper and find ear plugs help the city noise. Staff is friendly and professional, housekeeping to management. Clean and updated decor. Best location for everything.

great location for shops,shows and times sq and availability to grand central station for transport to jfk. airportmany thanks to all staff including those at breakfastbut a big thanks andre on reception he was a great help

Assigned room had not been cleaned up from previous guests. TV did not work, Powdered eggs were terrible. Water pressure on the 17th floor was a strong drip. There was no Gideon Bible present in the room

If you are looking for a nice hotel in a great location in NYC this is the place to go. The rooms are a little small but it is very clean,comfy beds, excellent breakfast, great location- easy walk to many interesting sites in NYC and close to many subway lines. The rooms in the back have a nice view of the Empire State Bldg. The employees are also very friendly and helpful. We have stayed here several times in the past several years and find it hard to beat in all aspects including price in NYC.

This hotel is in a great location. Right around the corner from Macy's and Time Square is about a 10 minute walk. The staff is wonderful and very helpful. Thanks to Andre who advised us to call before noon the day we were checking in to request a room (need to be 14th floor and above) high and in the back of the hotel to have a view of the Empire State Building. Subway is very close to get you to where you need to go if you can't walk there. Yummy breakfast. The rooms are quite small for 4 people. Very clean, comfortable beds and an extremely friendly and helpful staff.

We spent the night in the Herald Square BW so that we could catch an early cross-country train at Penn. We were delighted with our room, the location, the people who worked there - everything. VERY good price for the location. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

this is a hotel that is conveniently located on 36th st between Broadway and 5th in Manhattan . the stay began with the friendliest and most helpful front desk people you could ask for. the lounge (with a great bartender) also has an outdoor patio and is a slice of heaven tucked away in the back .. you have no idea you are in the heart of the busiest city in america. the rooms are very nicely done and very clean. a great breakfast comes with your room .. could not ask for anything more for the $$

The reception staff was friendly and helpful. The room was tidy. Everything was in working order. Breakfast was included. But best of all the location was perfect for a short trip to NYC with my friends.

The location is definitely the best part of this hotel. Only a block from the big Macy's, and fairly close to Times Square, Broadway theaters, Penn Station - and all the shopping in mid-town Manhattan.The hotel itself is fairly new - and it shows. Everything is clean and well-appointed. Beware that it's SMALL - very small. One room for a family is really stretching things.The free breakfast was busy. The room is in the basement below the lobby and it is SMALL. But, that's like everything in Manhattan.The staff were wonderful. I was able to check in really early (7am) because I had a red-eye flight. I'd say that was luck more than anything, but they were going to try hard to get me a room as early as possible, regardless.I got a room on the quiet side facing a brick wall. I wasn't so fussed about the view. I was more fussed with the fact that my door was right beside an ice machine. (3rd floor in case your curious). I was going to change rooms, but figured I might get a room by the elevator or on the street side. Each floor only has a few rooms with 2 double beds, so the choice isn't plentiful. And herein lies the problem with this place. Even with advance knowledge of a room preference, I'd say your chances are still probably 65% that you'll get noise - and lots of it. The noise is usually a deterrent for me since I am a light sleeper, but in this place it didn't matter. I was so exhausted every night I slept through the freight train known as the ice machine for 3 nights in a row...WiFi was good, but I am guessing that's because I was on a low floor next to the lobby.I'd stay here again in a heartbeat for the location alone. I'm not sure what I'd do if I came with my kids because of the tiny, tiny size. Probably have to get 2 rooms!

Hotel clean and reception staff very nice. Room tiny for price. Had e mailed ahead to say was our 25th anniversary and thought they might have maybe noted this somewhere. Hotel very clean and breakfast ok. Room very small where breakfast was served but staff very efficient. I probably wouldn't stay here again due to the size of bedrooms. I'm glad I didn't spend much time in it. 6th visit to New York 7th already booked for next year.

This hotel was perfect for a short shopping trip to New York. Great location, clean rooms and ample breakfast to set you up in the morning. Helpful staff and the free coffee and water in the foyer went down a treat. Nice little bar out the back as well for a night cap after a hard day's sightseeing and shopping. Would definitely recommend and would visit again.

If you need not expensive hotel in a perfect location, you have to choose this one. On the top rooms have a perfect view. The only disadvantage is a small restaurant. If you want to eat breakfast thre, sometimes you have to wait 10-15 minutes

This hotel worked for your short stay in NYC. The hotel is clean and the staff is very friendly. The room are nice, beds could have been a little more comfortable for our tastes....they seemed a bit on the firm side. Our 2 adult children joined us for the last 3 nights and we were cramped to say the least, but that is not the Hotels' fault. Most rooms in NYC are very small.

Quite small hotel in a great location. Subway is just around the corner. Shopping, theathers and restaurants all nearby. When in New York, I prefer to stay a little out of all the hassle of times square. Our room faced the backyard so no traffic noise at all. However, some noise from the hallway and elevators can be heard, so I recommend to bring your earpluggs.The hotel is recently renovated and the rooms and other facilities were extremely clean and well-kept. All the employees were really nice and helpful. We really enjoyed the breakfast every morning, lot of variety and not just donuts (like in many other hotels). Also complimentary coffee in the lobby all day long. I used the gym few times during our stay. It is quite small but have all the necessary equipments for a good workout. One improvement I would like to suggest; there were only one little closet (and a drawer) in our room. Some other rack for hanging e.g. coats would be nice. Now we just kept our coats on the chair.

There are so many hotels to choose from in NY and we were so glad we found this one! Arrived early but front desk found us a room on 14th floor and allowed us to Check straight in. We even received a phone call 5 mins after getting to our room, just to check everything was OK! The hotel is really slim and tall. there only looked to be about 6 bedrooms on each floor so this is not the usual type of place to stay. We had a King room and it was snug but excletionally clean and very comfortable. The only thing I thought it lacked was coat hooks on the back of the door. It was raining all the time we were in NY so we didn't know where to put our wet coats when we got back to our room!  Had a problem connecting to the free wifi but when we called the front desk they advised us what to do and the problem was fixed.Breakfast room is small but we never had a problem getting a seat. Plenty of food although you have to queue sometimes to use the toaster - not really any different to other hotels we've stayed in, but a small price to pay for a free breakfast.Had a drink at the hotel bar. Happy hour 3-8 so really competitive pricing. The bar was really cosy and on a better day we would have sat outside and stayed longer.Left our luggage after checking out. All very efficient. Picked up bags later and no problems at all,This hotel is in such a perfect location. Empire State Building, macys, Herald square all minutes away. Bryant park and Rockafeller 10 mins away. We also walked from Grand Central station when we arrived and it only took 20 mins. When we left to go back to JFK we walked to Penn station and caught the A express (took 10 mins at a brisk pace with cases).the subway took about an hour and we got off at Howard Beach/JFK To then take the LLR. Had thought bout taking a taxi but at rush hour thought traffic might be a problem. If you don't mind the subway this worked really well. Only $2.75 on the subway and then $8 for the LLR. Would definitely choose this route in future. And we would recommend this hotel to all our friends.

Let me just start off with BOOK NOW! No need to keep looking for another hotel. This has the best location for the price.Close to Macy's (for the Christmas window display) and Macy's Santaland!Walking distance to Time Square area, Rockefeller center.Right next to the Empire State building (which is decorated at Christmas time)We could really walk to just about anything we wanted to see.Also if you have younger children look up the self guided "Elf" walking tour online. We did it and shows you the places Will Ferrell went to when shooting the movie "Elf"The hotel is in the Manhattan area which is a little pricier area. Our room was well worth the cost.Our daughters were very impressed. They thought they were hot stuff when they saw our luxury room. Our one daughter said it was one of the highlights of the trip! I even made a weird special request and the manager Mustafah came through for us! I asked if our room could have a 8x10 picture of the actor River Phoenix on the bed stand for my one daughter. And when we walked in the room there it was!!!! My daughter was laughing so hard when she saw it!!!!They went above and beyond!Now this is NYC so rooms are not HUGE. I know some people complain about small rooms but unless you wanna pay close to a grand a night the rooms are going to be a little small. Pros: Clean, very comfortable beds, plush towels, complementary coffee, tea and beverages, FREE morning breakfast (very good BTW), close to everything and EXCELLENT management!!!Cons: NONE

Booked this hotel for a Christmas weekend in the Big Apple with our twin daughters. Great location, which is why we booked it, for a good price. It's right around the corner from the Empire State Bldg and almost across the street from Macy's. The perfect location for a Christmas trip. Times Square and the Rockafeller center tree are a short walk away. Rooms are small, but any rooms in Manhattan are. Nice bathrooms with upgraded accessories, and comfortable beds. Made a special request for a framed photo of River Phoenix in our room for our Daughter, and it was sitting on the dresser when we got there. Staff was friendly and check in was super easy.

I usually try to stay at Best Western. I was so pleased with this hotel. The staff, the rooms, the location...few steps from macy's and Empire State bldg. All exceeded my expectations. I would definitely stay here again. But would try to get a room on a higher floor so as to see the Empire State Bldg...

Went to New York for Thanksgiving. This is a perfect location. The standard of service is outstanding. The rooms are medium sized, a bit tight for the four of us but we were still quite comfortable. Breakfasts were good quality and there is not too much of a wait most mornings. Just round the corner from Macy's and the Empire State, you can easily walk to most places although we took a cab down to WTC for about $20. Perched between fifth and sixth Avenues this is an ideal location for shoppers. Walked down 36th Street at 9 o'clock and still found a good spot to watch the Macy's parade. Cab from and to JFK was about $65 (without tip). Rooms at the back of the hotel did not have much of a view but out walking around the area you get plenty to see. Really happy with choice that we made and will happily give the hotel a Highly Recommended status

The room was tiny but the service was wonderful. The front desk was very accommodating. The safe in our room malfunctioned and the service man came promptly, fixed it quickly and was very friendly. The free breakfast is the best deal. There's a full spread of hot and cold items, so if you are on a tight budget this will help keep your food costs down. Being that I am a coffee addict, I loved that they have fresh coffee in the lobby 24/7. The location was excellent. We walked to the theatre each night which took about 10 to 15 minutes depending on the theatre. Time Square is a 10 minute walk away as is Grand Central though there is a closer metro station. So to sum it all up, this is not the Ritz but it is clean, the bed was comfortable, the service was above average, the breakfast a good deal and the location was central.

I stayed in this hotel for couple of nights. I must stay it was really awesome . Great location very close to empire state building ,Friendly Staff, Hot breakfast with Good variety . I will surely stay in this place on my next visit.

Stayed here for 4 nights, 4 adults, room was small but who cares all we did was sleep, shower and eat breakfast here. Beds were super comfy, shower was amazing and breakfast was full and plenty with choices for all eaters!! Hotel was spotless clean, every member of staff we came across was friendly, but special mention to Andre on the front desk who was always so helpful to us. Great fast Wifi also. Guy who helped us with our luggage was so nice and friendly, great location central to everything. Couldn't fault this hotel, we will def stay again :)

Stayed for the Thanksgiving Day parade. Perfect location and great price. I slept so good in the bed. Staff was great and very helpful. Great location. Right around the corner from Macy's and within walking distance to Rockefeller Plaza. Around the corner from 5th Avenue and plenty of places nearby to eat. Very quiet.

Excellent location just off 6th avenue around the block from the Empire State Bldg and Macy's. Convenient to all transportation, subway just a block away. Times Sq/Broadway within walking distance. Very modern hotel with ample space. Stayed in the rear of the building; quiet and dark at night. There was no sense of being in the busiest city in the world! Very good hot breakfast with variety of pastries, breads, cereals, and fresh fruit as well. Staff are friendly and most helpful with any tourist issue or question. Highly recommend this hotel for family or business. Breakfast and wi-fi included in the price of the room. Only $50 (including tip) taxi from Laguardia Airport.

This hotel is clean and has the perfect location. Close to the subway, a parking garage right down the street... Times Square and 5th Avenue are just a short walk away. The staff is very accommodating and helpful. The rooms are a bit small, but that is what you will run into with any stay in NYC.

This is a great hotel and I highly recommend staying here. It is right around the corner from Macy's and two blocks up from the Empire State Building. We ended up walking everywhere from this location, up to Central Park and The Met and down to the 9/11 Memorial and Battery Park. The hotel is small, yet very charming. The decor makes it feel like you are staying at a boutique hotel. The breakfast is typical for a Best Western (cereal, bagels, pastries, yogurt, eggs, etc.), however it's nice to have to not go out and find a breakfast spot that everyone will enjoy. The rooms are small, however they have everything you need and are very clean. I will definitely be staying here again on my next visit to the city.

We stayed Thanksgiving week to see our son perform in the parade. Hotel is just off the beaten path. Well situated within walking distance to Times Square area. Hotel and rooms are small, but that seems to be the norm. Friendly and attentive staff. Decent breakfast provided each morning, both hot and cold items. Nice little bar area in the rear to grab a drink and wind down. The property filled our needs well, price point was fair.

Stayed there for 3 nights with my wife and kids. We had a room with two double beds , the room is comfortable but a bit tidy. It was clean , the bathroom had a real shower ! We were on the street side on the 5th floor a bit noisy in the morning as there was some road work being done just a 100 meters away. The breakfast was great , the only surprise was that we had plastic plates and cutlery. If you want a good view of the Empire State building ask the reception and some one will take you to the top floor and onto the roof, excellent view of the ESB. The Hotel is well located not far from Times Square, Empire State Building, NY Public Library Grand Central ! Also the 34th Herald Square subway station is just a few 100 meters from the Hotel.To top it off the Wireless is free.

I'd never really felt a strong desire to go to NYC, but I had to do a business trip to New Jersey and figured I'd bring my teen out to see some plays. Best Western has become my go-to brand - while/ some have been better than others, I've never stayed in a bad one yet. This was one of the best! I knew nothing about NYC or Manhattan geography, but it looked like the hotel was close to the theater district, and it was. An easy 15 minute walk to TImes Square. It was also around the corner from the Empire State Building and Macy's (which was all dressed up for Christmas.) Even better, it was an easy walk from Penn Station, so when I picked my kid up at JFK, we took the Long Island Railroad (LIRR) from Jamaica to Penn Station and were at the hotel in minutes. It was close to the Herald Square subway station, so we were able to take the subway all over. The room was small, but I expected that in NYC. I felt it was a good value for the price, especially when you factor in the hot breakfast. We were in room 204. We had two double beds and we had to dance around each other sometimes in the narrow space between the beds and the desk/TV. It would be pretty tight with three and unwieldy with four unless maybe two are kids. There was a window overlooking the lounge on the ground floor, but we didn't care about a view. We never had problems with noise. There was a staircase we could use instead of the elevator if we wanted. The most amazing thing for me was all the electrical outlets! I have never had such easy access to so many plugs! There was one in the wall by one bed, so a CPAP user like my husband would have had no problem. There were two outlets by each bed on the center console, along with a light switch. There were also outlets on the lamp on the desk. Plenty of space to charge everything without running cables everywhere. There was no bath, but the shower was nice. They included makeup removing towelettes, which was nice and probably saves their linens. The breakfast was on the lower level, along with the fitness room. It was a full, hot breakfast with lots of choices - eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, oatmeal - and different items each day. The staff was all very nice and helpful. We arrived early Saturday, so they let us check our luggage until 3pm check in time, and again on Monday after checkout until we had to leave for the airport. My daughter became interested in NYU, so who knows, we may be back for a college visit. I don't think I'd stay anywhere else!

Clean, well situated hotel, but rooms are way too small (but workable, just too small for our taste). Bathroom had no space for toiletries even though there was room for a shelf (but had none). No towel rack outside the shower. Had plenty of towels and shower worked good and beds were very comfortable. Breakfast hours too short (close at 9:30 am). Internet included and worked great. Just by looking at the outside of the hotel you wouldn't know that they had a cute, cozy LITTLE bar inside - we went there twice during our stay. Overall impression is that the room was just too small for our liking. For one or two people would be o.k. (if you like 'small') but three or more people - would be a very tight squeeze and very uncomfortable.

I stayed here for 3 nights while in NYC on business. Check-in was very quick and friendly, making sure I knew what I needed for my stay. I had a king size room on the 8th floor, a decent sized room and bathroom for New York! Very clean and the room was serviced daily as to be expected. Free wifi with no issues and a good speed. Breakfast was plentiful - served in their basement room - plenty of choice, fresh fruit, pastries, hot dishes (sausages/bacon, egg, pancakes etc) ... All round a great hotel, decent location and friendly staff. (When you are handed a trip adviser card on check-out, asking if you'd kindly do a review, you know they must be confident that they're doing stuff right!!) - well done to all at the Best Western Premier Herald Square :)

On one of the highest floors facing street. Noise on street too much for me! Could hear loud elevator noise every time it ran too plus like most hotels, room doors slamming shut is so loud (why can't hotels figure out a better door system!). Asked front desk if they had ear plugs but nope. Ran out late night to get some but still, no sleep. Too bad because I liked the hotel's convenient location and found it clean.

Hotel very clean and well appointed. New furniture and fixtures. Room has everything you need, nice shower, very comfortable bed, good internet, TV, and free full hot breakfast. I highly recommend, you will be pleased.

We were three friends on a budget. We took a two double bed room and had just barely enough space. The beds were very comfortable, though. The was very clean and properly maintained.The hotel is on 35th st, a short walking distance from Times square and all of middown main attractions.The staff was very friendly and out going.The price included a complimentary breakfast that was very good: bagels, cheese, cereals, pastries, orange and blueberry juices and coffee.Highly recommended!

We returned to our favorite hotel in NYC because of the great service at the front desk, as well as the value. This place is a 10 minute walk from Penn Station, close to 5th Ave shopping and Times Square as well .

The entire staff went above and beyond from the moment I checked in to the moment I checked out. They answered any questions I had right away. Their bright smiles and friendly attitudes made my stay that much more enjoyable!

I don't normally write review on hotels unless they're extremely good or bad. This one was ended up with a bad taste that I've to share.Pro: convenient location just a couple blocks away from Macy's and Metro. Almost next to Keen chophouse. Surrounding my a few good food places. Free water and coffee all day, but sometimes you have to wait for them to replenish the hot water. Decent free cold/hot continental breakfast.Con: Lucky that I got a room facing Empire State Building, otherwise it's quite noisy if your room is street facing.The housekeeper was thinking to get into our room around 9am on the 2nd day while I still have the do not disturb sign out. Since we didn't really leave our room till 11ish, so we asked for clean up on the way out. When we were back around 2pm, room wasn't cleaned, so we asked the 2nd time as we planned to stop the room again after shopping for a bit. Room was still not cleaned around 5pm. We almost have to ask twice before room was cleaned for the next couple nights until the last night. Also, the cleaners start making up the room as early as 8am which you would definitely be awaken if you're light sleeper as the sound proof wasn't great, you can hear them banging on the doors and vaccuming.Worst experience was the ride that was arranged by the hotel to Newark airport. I specifically asked how much the ride to the airport is for 3 times and I was told it is $83 cash all inclusive, tips and everything. No need to pay extra. It's already a bit higher than my last year visit for at least $10, but I still thought it's ok as it should be cheaper than cab during rush hour. In the end, the driver asked for $104 and tips before giving us luggages back! He said $83 is just for the ride excluding toll and tips. I refused to give him tips while I told my friend to start grabbing our luggages. The driver gave in taking my $104 and left. I never had any problem with any hotel ride arrangement prior. This left me a really sour taste at the end of the visit. I'll definitely not going back as the price wasn't much cheaper than other hotels. This trial visit totally disappointed me. Fairfield inn and garden inn were a lot better.

This hotel is great. The rooms are small but VERY clean and modern. The Breakfast has been the best from any other Best western hotel in USA and the staff at the front desk is REMARKABLE... big thanks to Andre and Bebe for being such a caring, helpful and professional with my husband and I giving us all the info we needed so we could enjoy NY in only 24 hours. WOW! we did everything thanks to Andre's knowledge about the city! This Texas folks felt at home and cared for! We will comeback again!

I really enjoyed my time here, thanks to a great staff, sharp looking spaces and design to the building, and convenience to not only all of midtown, but it was right around the corner where I was doing business.

My room was well stocked but somewhat small however the staff was friendly and professional and very couteous. I particularly found the front desk person named Bebe to be very helpful and she was new to the company.
user_location: New York, New York, United States

review_body: I chose the hotel primarily for its location price and tripadvisor reviews. We were greeted with a warm welcome from André on reception. Our room was very clean if a bit small and the bathroom was very clean but had a hole in the ceiling! Breakfast is included in the price which was also a deciding factor in choosing this hotel. The breakfast was self service. A good selection, tasty and plentiful to set you up for the day. The hotel has a small friendly bar but no real lounge to sit in. For New York I think the price was very good the location is excellent and the staff very friendly. We felt relaxed and at home here. A special mention again for André who stayed after his shift had finished to talk to my son about a project he is researching for school. A really great guy Thanks!. We would be happy to stay here again

The location in Herald Sq. Is very convenient by foot or subway. The room was very nice, renovated with fancy amenities at bathroom. Free coffee and tea at the loby all day. Nice compementary breakfast. Best price we could find. Gave me the feeling of great value for the money. Therefore I highly recommend.

Best Western Herald Square a super Hotel to stay to enjoy the sights. Location, staff, facilities all v good. Easily walked to Times Square, Bryant Park, Empire State and Top of the Rock. Would use this hotel again brilliant stay Jean & Chrissy

Having arrived at Penn Station via Amtrak, the location of the hotel is a very walkable distance from the station. It's between 5th & 6th Avenues, so if your up for a short walk, it's not that far from Radio City Music Hall. It's just a block or two from Macys and the Empire State Building. For dinning, Keens Steakhouse is just a few doors away, and it was a 3-4 blocks to some some great restaurants in Korea Town. The only negative to the hotel is the rooms are small, but it wasn't terrible in that I didn't spend a lot of time in the room anyway. The staff was very accomodating with sight seeing information and restaurant suggestions.

Great , clean hotel in central location of NY City. Nice breakfast and great staff in all locations of hotel Room was very quiet and clean Location is great no matter what part of the city you are trying to visit. Lots of great restaurants in the vicinity and at all different price points

reasonable hotel at great location. very close to Macys' about 5 minutes walk from Times Sq. rooms are decent, have been at bigger rooms in this area, but also at much smaller. Internet (wifi) was very slow , but it was free.

This is a narrow yet tall building wedged on the North side of the iconic Empire State building. The Best Western side is misleading as it says in room descriptions that there is an Empire State building view. This is not the case as some of the rooms face outward North and you have a city view vs an Empire State one. So make sure you get a high-floor (above 10) looking South if you want an Empire State view. BUT the rooms are super clean. Very nicely appointed. As others have said - they are small rooms - but it's NYC so expect that. The bar is nice. The breakfast room is large and very clean. It's a great spot in terms of location - FOR SURE. I'd go here again. The staff is very accommodating. They should make this a model spot for other Best Western managers/owners to go to - to see how a Best Western location should look and operate.

Great value and service! Good location and very clean. Back patio is a nice advantage for a relaxing time after work :) Staff is always friendly and I feel safe in this hotel. Would recommend to others for business stay but the rooms are small so if sharing a room, would be tight

First time for me and wife in New York and based our choice of hotel on location. Read some comments from various sources and checked the pictures of course, but location is everything here. There are number of hotels in the area of course, but this seemed to be best choice on price-quality ratio.Room was ok, rather small as they are in NY, but clean and tidy - everyday have to add. Breakfast was nothing to brag about, but gave enough juice to start the day. Recommend this hotel, if you are in town for about a week and traveling as a couple or with friend.

Location, service, cleanliness, all excellent! After a delayed flight, a walk from the train on the rain, I was greeted by Sade. She was very kind and friendly. For personal reasons I asked to get my room changed and the next morning Andre seemed to understand. Within several hours I was moved to a room meeting my needs. In fact, I could not have picked a more perfect room myself. Both Andre and Sade were very helpful, friendly, and genuinely seemed to love their job. The breakfast had good variety, was never empty, and friendly workers. Let say, everything was extremely clean! I will stay here on my next visit.

Great location near Herald Square, easy walk to Times Square, Empire State, Macey's, etc. Rooms are on the small side and breakfast in the tiny dining room is a bit of a scrum, but if you find a good deal online, this sliver of a building is a great base for an NYC break.

Very nice Hotel in the center of Manhattan and you only need three minutes by feet to the famous Empire State Building. The rooms are very clean and nice. You feel like home. Next time I'm going to New York l, I'm definitely going to stay at the best western premium hotel herald square

Three weeks ago I stayed in the Best western herald square hotel and I enjoyed being there specially becuase of the stuff. They were all very friendly and MS. Bebe helped me a lot!!! Thanks again,Liona PeretzIsrael

I have stayed in manhattan for many times and this is possibly the smallest hotel room I've stayed in BUT don't let that stop you from staying here! The huge bed was very comfortable (probably the most comfortable I've experienced in the city), the room extremely clean and the staff couldn't do enough for you. The free breakfast was always fresh and plentiful. The location itself is great for getting pretty much anywhere as it's close to all the main subway lines and only a short walk to times square and grand central. I would happily stay here again.

I'm about as fussy a traveler as they come. So, finding this hotel was a real find for me. My husband and I with our two adult children stayed for a week and found the location, amenities, WiFi, breakfast, and staff top notch. One of our rooms was located facing the street, the other away. If I could make a recommendation regarding a room choice, I would for certain say to choose a room NOT facing the street. I am a light sleeper and would not be able to cope with the street side noise. We found the location to be about a central as it comes - close to everything - subways, Bryant Park, Empire State Building ... all the stuff you want to see and do while visiting NYC. I really appreciated the beverage bar on the main level to grab a coffee, tea, or cold cup of water. My only "complaint" -- and it is no reflection on the staff or hotel itself -- would be certain guests. We were awoken on one evening of our stay at 3:10 a.m. by a group of female guests on our floor that were no less than shrieking. They proceeded to carry on with their noise only a couple of doors away for over an hour. I'm sure our whole floor was aware of this. As with all hotels, I find these types of guests not uncommon -- no matter what class of hotel you are staying in. Additionally, not to address this hotel in particular but why do all hotel doors have the slam shut feature? This is highly annoying for those that like to sleep past the early early hours - or when you're trying to drop off to sleep.I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone seeking a centrally located, exceptionally clean, and well priced hotel in NYC. Thank you to all BWPHS staff, everyone was friendly and fantastic. Hope to see you all again soon!

This hotel doesn't look much from the outside. Its thin and narrow and tightly squeezed in a side street (36th) between 5th and 6th Ave.My family of three had a twin double room. The room was small and the luggage of three suitcases and a couple of bags only just really fitted in.So whats good, why would I recommend?1) Location, its right next to several metro stations, within walking distance to everywhere, between two of the biggest avenues in NY2) The room - even though its a squeeze in the room it was cosy, very clean and the beds were some of the most comfortable hotel beds I slept in. They are made up daily, I guess the sheets were changed too, but I didn't make any stains!The room also has a cool quiet air con, even in October. I find many hotels stuffy, this wasn't. The bathroom has a double shower, plenty of hot water and full of bathroom amenities. The only issue is the extraction was poor and the main room windows would steam up. I had to stop my teenage son drawing a .... well you know what they are like at that age! There was also large flat screen telly on the wall which had about 200 channels many in HD3) The included breakfast - each day there is a hot breakfast, which varied daily from a sausage, scrambled eggs, pancakes, potatoes, omelette, bacon etc...The juice was freshly squeezed and the pastries were shipped in boxed fresh each day.4) The service - the staff at the hotel couldn't do enough for you and they were so friendly professional and helpfulIf you are looking a for a centrally located hotel to tour the city and use as a base for sleeping at night and somewhere to provide a good start to the day then I would definitely recommend this hotel. The wifi was fast and free and there was free coffee in the entrance which you can help yourselves to throughout the day and night.I would definitely recommend

Fantastic location just a block from Macys and close to a subway station. Easy walk to all other attractions. Small rooms but very well equiped and very quiet. Breakfast was really good, and varied every day. Would stay here again!

In transit between 2 planes, this property is very well located to do shopping (Macy's at one block) and to enjoy Manhattan The room is small but very well organised to enjoy all the space. Except the breakfast, everything was fine

The staff was great. Very close to everything. Room was small but all you needed. Full breakfast helped in the mornings. The manager gave us hints of where to eat when to go to the subway station and more.

Great place to see l. As a tourist couldnt have asked for a better location. So close to most attractions and a block away from train station. Breakfast had a great menu and staff super friendly. We could sit at timesquare till midnight and walk down to our room in minutes. There were plenty if retaurants to choose from. I am going there again during my next trip.

This place's location is just awesome, most of the attractions are at a walkable distance and the train station is a block away. Great breakfast and friendly staff make this a very good place to stay. Cant wait to visit there again.

No hotel room is worth what NYC hotels cost, but this was good value by those expensive standards. I always look for value, clean, safe, healthy and strong wifi. This hotel meets all of those requirements easily, and an easy 15 minute walk from Penn Station. The room was small, but room enough for two, modern and comfortable. View out of our window in mid-block was of apartments and offices, but looking directly upwards was a very close and dramatic view of the top of the Empire State Building. Lobby and bar area are small, but the bar is a nice place to relax with an enclosed though open roofed patio. I enjoyed and used the outdoor seating with tables between the sidewalk on 36th St. and the front door, although this is where the smokers hang out, and at one point I needed to go inside to get some fresh air. All of it together makes it a good hotel for necessary R&R when visiting the great, exhausting city. Free breakfast was used by sig. other, but nothing special about it. Recommended without reservation.

Great staff, clean and comfortable, like a small boutique hotel. Good breakfast included, good bar with a happy hour and patio out front and in the barIn the Garment district right around the corner from Empire State Building, in between 5th ave and Avenue of the AmericasI will book again

My daughter and I recently visited NYC for pleasure. Our hotel stay at the Best Western Premier was wonderful! The hotel is in an excellent location! The staff was caring & courteous. The rooms were clean, modern, and well appointed.

The Herald Square staff was amazing. They went above and beyond to make our stay a wonderful experience. They staff was professional, friendly, and quick to address our needs. The room was a clean and the bed was comfortable. I would recommend staying at this location.

Location was one of the driving choices for booking this hotel. I had to be at an event at The Times Center on 41st Street in New York, but did not want to be too close to the Times Square, though I wanted to be close enough. I arrived around 10:30 in the morning, and within 20 minutes they were able to get me into a room.For New York, the room was more spacious than I expected, it also had a view of the Empire State Building. The bathroom was spacious too. Both the room and the bathroom were immaculately clean. The Wi-Fi worked exceptionally well.I cannot praise enough the responsiveness of the people working at this hotel, particularly Ryan, Bebe, Andre, and Jay. I had to deal with a variety of situations, some somewhat unusual, and all of them were tremendously helpful, and were total stars at that.The lobby is not big, but it has a nice sense of design. Most importantly, it has a station where water, coffee (freshly made all day long), and tea are available throughout the day. There is a lovely bar area in the back with a charming back patio, which is a mini hideaway oasis from New York's hustle and bustle. As a bonus, there is also a lovely patio out front with comfortable seating, it was handy on so many occasions, and it made me reflect on how few hotels actually have this great feature.The breakfast area was spacious, but I would recommend going a bit early, as it can get very crowded during peak times. Their breakfast was of great quality with a tremendous variety of offerings, which were constantly replenished.The location of this hotel speaks for itself - it is close to so many famous sights in New York from Herald Square to Times Square, to Madison Square Garden, to Empire State Building, to Penn Station, and the list goes on. There are also many great restaurants in the vicinity. The Keg Room across from the hotel is nice for casual dining and they had great service, while Brendan's on 35th Street was a lovely more upscale dining discovery.I was glad I stayed at Best Western Premier Herald Square, and would not hesitate staying there again, so it's highly recommended.

Fantastic hotel in a fantastic location. I cannot fault this hotel in any way. The rooms were lovely and the staff were so polite and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was everything that you would need, add on the free hot drinks in the lobby at any time off the day, what more do you need.

I enjoyed this property a lot. It isn't very big but offers very clean up to date rooms. All the staff was friendly. One of the front desk agents event allowed me to use his personal umbrella when I neglected to bring my own!!

The hotel was exactly what I wanted, great location, great room & friendly staff. The bar tender "Stephen" made all the difference, definitely made us feel welcome, friendly and great company, cheers Steve! Deffo recommend - back soon hopefully.Room was lovely & clean and the location was ideal for all the key areas, bars, shops & restaurant

Great located hotel time square with friendly efficient staff' very clean establishment but rooms were fairly compact, nice freebies tea, coffee, a secure safe in your room, air con, gym, bar & complimentary breakfast each morning. BUT BEWARE! you will be asked to hand over $100 when you first arrive' to cover breakages & bar bill? Don't be in such a hurry when you check out to forget to ask for your $100 deposit back, as staff may not remind you!

We stayed here for 5 nights for my daughters 21st and emailed ahead to see if we could have a room with a view of the Empire State Building. However, when we arrived all the rooms were taken but the manager was lovely and the next day changed our room for one with a view. Absolutely great customer service! This hotel couldn't be in a more central location. It's clean, fast wifi, has lovely staff, a gym, a mixture of hot & cold breakfast options, everything you could want. If you arrive early they hold your luggage for you in a locked room. They also even have a printer station where we printed our baseball tickets for free. Overall a great stay and would definitely come here again!

This hotel is in a very convenient location, within easy walking distance to Times Square, Open-top bus stop, parks, restaurants and shopping. Streets around the hotel are busy, but the noise didn't carry to our room. We felt secure in our room at all times and reception staff were most helpful, providing us with local information and booking a car to take us to the airport. The continental breakfast was a sufficient, and the ladies who looked after the breakfast room were just lovely!!

This place is very conveniently located in midst of Manhattan Downtown. The rooms are very clean and well maintained. Liked the pleasant and friendly nature of front desk and service staff. The continental breakfast was fresh and awesome.Would surely recommend to my friends and family to stay here when they want to visit NY downtown.

I stayed at this hotel over the labor day long weekend because I happen to get reference through one of my friends about this place. First of all, the location is the best spot for any downtown lovers. Its right in the middle of the NY downtown and most happening places. Secondly, the staff, front desk and management was so courteous and friendly (which is rare...). They took care of all our needs as requested and on time. Even though the rooms are small, they are very well kept and maintained. Would definitely recommend anyone who wants to stay close to the NY Downtown and affordable.

We toured Eastern Canada and USA over a 20 day period. We booked different hotels(15) over this period. This was the best hotel we stayed at on this trip and probably one of the best during any of our travels.

Great location. Friendly front desk associates. Very clean room. Adequate continental breakfast. Nice patio out front. Although the room is small it had plenty of space for storage. We moved one chair and we were all set. Would definitely stay there again and would recommend to family and friends.

To be honest I only booked this hotel because I had points and it was available. I didn't realize it was downtown and didn't have a shuttle so $65 one way to and from JFK was a bit of a shock, but that was my fault.It was late when we arrived and we were given a king room on the 17th floor. What a view with the floor to ceiling windows! The room was somewhat small, but I loved it; It had current decor and art that celebrates the city, i.e. a large canvas of Lady Liberty's face just outside our room.Breakfast was wonderful with eggs, hash browns, bacon and various breads, juices. Nicely displayed and freshly stocked.I'd stay here again in a heartbeat! It's near so many of the city sites.

I stayed here in the month of July, and had such a pleasant experience. From the time i checked in to the time I checked out. The staff here was very helpful in providing me with everything i needed for my business trip. I stayed here for 3 nights and each morning woke up to a new delicious breakfast. The best part was the bar, with a great outdoor garden patio. It was very relaxing. I will be returning here when ever i plan to come to NYC again.

Our room wasn't huge, but it had everything you'd need and a comfy bed. The onsite bar has a little courtyard out back so you can site outside in the relative quiet and if you want to watch the world go by there is a seating area out front too. This hotel is perfectly located for tourists, there are plenty of restaurants and bars, with the Empire State Building and Times Sq a short walk away. There is also a subway station one block away so getting around is very easy

I came here with my elderly parents for their first visit to NYC (I had already been a few times). This is such a great location 1 min walk to herald sq subway which has 2 different and useful subway lines to all th major sights. There is the Empire State, Macy's etc all within 1 minute. There are also some great Irish bars and restaurants close by. Breakfast is a typical best western breakfast which is more than enough to get you started for a busy day of sightseeing. There's different kinds of cereal, various types of bagels and breads, patisseries, cream cheese, jams, and 4 different types of hot food which alternates everyday including juices, teas, coffees and yoghurts. There's always complimentary coffee, various teas and ice water to hand in the lobby area. Staff are all really nice and knowledgable. Cleaners were also very pleasant and friendly they kept the whole hotel very clean. I cannot recommend this hotel enough. There's also the usual iron, ironing board, hairdryer, tea/coffee making facilities in the room.If I came back I would defiantly stay here again!

Stayed at the Best Western Herald Square for two nights. It was a great location. The staff were wonderful and the rooms spacious and very comfortable. I would highly recommend this location to friends and family.

Check-in was fantastic. Loved our hostess. Kind, welcoming, and witty. The rooms are not the largest, but all we needed was a place to sleep, ballroom dance floor not required for rest. Beds were comfortable, rooms clean. Bathrooms updated to this century.

I stayed there for 3 nights at the end of my trip to USA. When I arrived with my heavy luggage there was friendly porter who took care of my bag immediately. Check in was immediate and the room was very clean and funky. It was a little small but I was by myself so it was alright.I must say, the location was fantastic! It's 10 min walk to Times square, and around 20 min walk to central park. Empire state building around the corner, Macy's mall and 5th Ave shopping was all very close by. Rockefeller building, MOMA was all walking distance. I just loved the location!!Also if you love Korean food, Korea town is 2 blocks away and you can get it delivered to the hotel. Honestly this hotel was reasonably priced and I had such a great stay here.

Yes the rooms may be small but with free hot breakfast and wifi it is a good hotel , I think if you compare per square metre $ this hotel is probably overpriced but it is close to Broadway it also has a reasonable sized bathroom, the noise from the air conditioners units out the side of the building can be noisy at night but the unit is clean, the only other downside would be the great sitting area out the front of the building but because it is mainly for smokers to enjoy no one else can and you have to run the gauntlet of smokers to get to the front door, not quite enjoyable for anyone else.

Stayed here for business in a 1 king bed room. Room was small but it is NYC so I expected that. That being said it was very comfortable and I had a great sleep! Nice to have breakfast available as well and the choices were plenty. Great location from which to walk everywhere in the city. Bring your comfortable shoes

The staff was very friendly and efficient! The room was clean very comfortable. I was recommended this hotel by a friend and would definitely stay there again! They even held are luggage while we shopped even though we had checked out.

This is one of the newest and cleanest hotels I have stayed at for a reasonable price in NYC in a long time. I had a room on the top floor and it was fairly big (with one king bed) and was very clean.The breakfast was pretty good too, with hot items as well as cereal and pastries. Great location to be in the middle of all the tourist activity too.

I love this hotel. I stay here every time I come to NYC. Rooms are always clean and comfortable, the staff is friendly and always remembers me. Very accommodating. Decent breakfast selection, ice water always available in the lobby. Great views of the city and very centrally located.

As first time visitors we were bewildered by the number of possible hotels to use. After reading reviews and really then making a lucky dip we chose here. We were not disappointed. Despite being in the middle of the action, and with great subway and Newark Airport train links, the hotel was actually quiet. Each floor seemed to consist of six rooms, resulting in no noise from neighbours. Perhaps we were lucky but we stayed for a week so I suspect this is the norm. Our room was at the back; not the greatest view but we could see the Empire State Building. Outside noise was minimal. The room was very pleasant and quite spacious. We liked it. Air Conditioning was brilliant. An essential as it was extremely hot and humid outside. Our room was ready for us when we arrived two hours before check in time and we were able to leave our cases in a case deposit room on the day we checked out so that we could collect them later. Breakfast was included in our room rate. Excellent coffee and orange juice. These were the highlights as some items were not really up to standard e.g. horrible boiled eggs. Everything was obviously brought in and was served on plastic plates with plastic cutlery. It could easily be improved by adding slices of bread, cheese, ham etc. It would also help if things were labelled e.g. I nearly missed the vegetarian sausage one day and I am vegetarian.Despite my breakfast comments I would recommend this hotel and would certainly book it again on a future trip.
