I lived and worked in Manhattan for more than 4 years, so I know the city pretty well. I stayed here over Labor Day weekend, and it turned out to be an even better location for me than I first thought. Only a couple blocks to Macy's and a very easy walk to Times Square (transportation hub) -- so it's really central to everything without being right in the middle of it. The hotel is small and VERY narrow... I passed it up the first time. But what a gem! 17 floors, with only 5 rooms per floor. My king room was small but the bathroom was sizable and the room had everything I needed. Also, it must have been recently renovated... very nice! The best part: I had a 16th floor room with an amazing view of the Empire State Building outside my window. The staff was friendly, check in/out was easy, and they'll hold luggage for you. The free breakfast is in the basement, and the room is small and crowded, but perfectly fine for most people... bagel and toast options, cereal, hot food (eggs, etc.), pastries, yogurt and fruit available.

We stayed at this hotel at end of July 2015 We had a family room for 4 adults. I cannot criticise anything about the hotel. It was very clean and tidy. The staff were fantastic and the room was wonderful. Breakfast was a bonus and was of good quality. The location of the hotel was ideal. Close to the Empire State Building so could never get lost. Will be going to New York next year and will definitely stay there again. Loved everything about it....the real bonus was the price. 4 nights for 4 people with breakfast I July was only £600. A bargain I thought

Stayed as a family during the Labor day long weekend. A room on 6th floor facing the 36th street. The street noise level was acceptable for a big city like New York. There is no bar or restaurant that is right across from the hotel building making the noise level even lower. The room seems to be recently renovated. Small table with a chair. New TV. Nice and spacious (compared to the room size) washroom.Helpful and professional staff. We asked for subway directions a couple of times and the description given to us matched the reality.Good quality breakfast. The breakfast area is on its own floor in the basement. We had breakfast between 8 and 9 am. Never had to wait for a table.Hotel location. From the hotel we walked to: Empire State building (around the corner), Times Square, M&M Store, Rockefeller Center, Grand Central Terminal, Chrysler Building, The High Line. Even Central Park - though may be a stretch for some people unless you like walking like us.Conveniently took subway to Statue of Liberty (and Financial district) and the US open tennis site at Flushing Meadows.I had a couple of issues with the room. Not worth mentioning as other travelers may not even notice them. What is worth mentioning is the response I got from the hotel staff. One of the issues is already addressed and another one they promised to look into. Way to go!

Had a very good time and the staff was great so was front desk. Rooms are nice and all of the existing establishments in the area were very accessible and friendly. Will definitely recommend. If you are in this facility this is a nice place to stay.

very good choice for downtown. walking distance to empire state times square Macys the rooms are a little small but very accomodating for the area. Price was moderate but expected for New York city. very clean inside rooms were very nice beds comfortable. The staff is very kind and helpful. have to give a special Thanks to Ryan the bell man. He is very kind always smiling and ready to help out with your bags. He made us feel welcome. Would recommend this Hotel for sure especially for first time visitors.....

The location is great because all of my business is within a few blocks plus walking distance to Penn Station. The rooms are pretty tiny but clean with nice amenities. The breakfast wasn't great, but "free" makes it better and it has free wi-fi. The bed was very comfortable. It was a good price when other hotels in the area were quite high. I would definitely stay again.

Stayed here for 4 nights, two double beds in room, two ladies sharing. Room was small but bed was extremely comfortable. Room service was flawless, I would recommend this hotel for location, service, cleanliness and while the quality of food at the breakfast is not great, it provides much needed calories for the NYC experience.

What a lovely hotel in such a busy city!! It's very well located, about 3/4 mins walk to the subway and with Macy's just a walk down from the hotel. It's in a safe location, we never found it to be dangerous, even when returning late. The hotel itself was just lovely with lovely staff! The lobby is small but clean and inviting. They have cold water and tea and coffee facilities in the lobby that can be accessed whatever time of day (this proved to be extremely useful!). The rooms are quite a squeeze. We had two double beds in ours but this expected in a New York hotel. The rooms and toilet was clean and they were cleaned everyday to a high standard. The breakfast was plentiful and delicious, albeit busy with lots of people! They say the breakfast finishes at half past 9 and so the times between half 8 and half 9, it gets very busy in that small breakfast room! You might even need to stand around waiting for a table. However, we'd always go down at around half 9ish, when things were dying down and so we'd always find a seat. For breakfast, you'll find a small selection of cereals, doughnuts, breads, bagels and cakes. In the hot breakfast, you'll did eggs (different each day), pancakes, bacon, sausage, hash browns and oatmeal. These are normally on a rotation so breakfast differs each day!There is also a lovely gym. The AC was never cool enough and we always found our room too hot. some of the other guests were also complaining about this but when we went to ask someone about this at the lobby, they sent someone to check if out straight away! Great service!! We had an excellent stay and would definitely recommend this to anyone visiting New York!

Great Hotel for Manhattan. Couldn't ask for a better location. Hotel is clean, and staff is helpful. The rooms are on the small side but your in NY so you should not be staying in your room. Had 2 parents and 2 kids in 1 room with 2 x double beds. Its cramped. Street is safe. Street Level hotel patio has cheap happy hour cocktails and great for people watching. Street has good restaurants and pubs on it. The hotel has some deal with parking garage 6 doors up and parking is very affordable parking in Manhattan.The free breakfast is a bit of a Gong Show.. especially if the hotel is full. Its a typical best western "free breakfast" but super busy.

Very well located in Mid-Town block away from Macy's 34st Street. Great inclusive breakfast! Building had an AC problem, hotel was booked solid, but staff found fans to use for that nite to make stay tolerable. Was able to get a different room the next night.

The staff at the hotel were very professional and helpful throughout my stay. I was there for a conference and had a package shipped to and from the hotel with no issues. The rooms are quite tight but well equipped and comfortable. The hotel is about a block or so away from the Empire State building and Macy's on Broadway. The area felt safe and there are places to eat within a couple of blocks of the hotel. There is a small patio out front to relax and have a drink and take in the NY experience but it is rather noisy at times. The subways are within walking distance. I would recommend this hotel for pleasure or business.

Able to get last minute reservations here for an unexpected trip to Manhattan. This is not a fancy hotel but it is clean, the beds are comfy, the breakfast buffet (included in room price) is fine and the staff is friendly and helpful. The room was tiny and crowded for two people but it served its purpose as a good place to rest at day's end. The housekeeping staff is terrific. If you want an elegant, full-service Manhattan hotel experience, this hotel would not be the best choice. However, for a sensible and practical choice in midtown Manhattan, this hotel can't be beat.

We stayed for 4 nights. Rooms were small but very clean and modern and beds very comfortable! Coffee and ice water available in lobby around the clock. Staff very attentive and helpful. When we requested an extra blanket and shampoo they were quickly delivered to our room. Breakfast area is small and seating very limited but there are to go boxes available if you ask so you can load your breakfast and take it to the outdoor patio or back to your room. Breakfast was decent. Starbucks very close (take a left when you leave hotel, cross 6th ave and its on your left). Quick walk to subway, Macy's, Empire State Building (we had a view from room but didn't spend much time looking out window!). Had an amazing salad at the "Pure & Fresh" restaurant a couple doors down from hotel (I would go back often if I lived there!!!!). Also a nice meal at the sports bar across the street - the Keg Room - spacious, open, many tvs and good food). Was easy for us to take subway to two MLB games and to the hop on hop off tours on Big Bus. Also an easy walk to Times Square. Free WiFi was great. Will stay here on a future trip to NYC.

I've been to NYC many times, purely as a tourist, and this was the first time I have stayed here. We went as a couple and were more than happy with our choice. Not a huge hotel like some of the 'grand-or not so grand' hotels on Manhattan but modern, clean and comfortable. We went in Feb earlier this year and it was freezing but got checked straight in and was pointed towards the complimentary drinks. Breakfast was included in our stay and there was plenty to be getting stuck into which always helps. I would without question stay here again, great location and easy access to the tubes. Highly recommended and will check this place out again when I'm next heading across the pond.

We stayed here for several nights. Hotel is located mid-block on a relatively quiet street and is very convenient for walking to mid-town attractions, to the subway and to Penn Station (ca. 12 minute walk with luggage). Rooms are well furnished and quiet, but small. We liked the New York-themed decor. Beds were comfortable and the air conditioning effective and quiet. The sink was not separate from the bathroom and there was no tub, but the shower was spacious.The room price wasn't cheap, but was reasonable. The breakfast was very good and comprehensive, gave us a good start each morning and offset the cost of staying in Manhattan. The breakfast room did get crowded around 9AM, but was there was plenty of room earlier in the morning. Staff were friendly and our room was generally cleaned early in the day. Appreciated the complementary NY Times in the morning and the fruit-infused icewater and endless coffee in the lobby late in the day when we needed refreshing. Wi-fi worked without problems. Our one problem was minor...the room door was difficult to open (often required a timely shoulder push immediately after inserting the room key) and we never could get the deadbolt to work. Reported it early on at the front desk, but the hotel did not fix it during our stay. We would definitely consider staying here again.

I was speaking at a conference in NYC and wanted to stay at a centrally located but better value hotel. I chose Best Western Premiere on 36th Street. The location is ideal with easy access to virtually anywhere. The hotel is fairly new with well appointed clean rooms and a friendly staff at hotel reception. The rooms are large enough and beds very comfortable. The area somehow is quieter than many that I have stayed at in NYC and this makes a huge difference. A perfect breakfast is supplied each morning and if you like exercise there is even a decent exercise room covering essentials. I plan to stay at this location again in November of this year when I return to NYC. For location, value and comfort this hotel is a great choice.

Nice Hotel. Very friendly and accommodating staff. Clean rooms and nice outdoor lounge area. The rooms are small but contain everything that you might need for a short stay. Breakfast was just OK but it was also free so complaining is not an option. The bar/lounge is nice and Stephen the bartender is a good guy who takes care of you. Parking is a block away which is bit inconvenient but it is NYC and parking is always an issue. The next time I'll just take the train in and grab a cab. Excellent coffee!!

Reception were efficient and helpful. The room was compact but clean and well equipped. We asked for a quiet room and in the main it was quiet. However the walls are quite thin and apparently many people cannot close a hotel door without slamming it...at any hour of t he day or night. These people were all Americans, I know because again at any hour of the day they were talking loudly, and not controlling their kids.Not the fault of the hotel of course.Staff are helpful. Breakfast OK but not special. Given it was thrown in, it was fine. Plastic knives, forks and plates????Talk to Steve the barman, great source of knowledge.

We stayed here for 5 nights and found the staff to be courteous.- Breakfast was included between 06:30-09:30- Rooms and hotel were clean- Great location and quieter than other busy areas/Short walk to Times Square 5-10 mins walkI would recommend this hotel and stay here again.Thanks for the hospitality

Great location and reasonable prices. Able to walk to all main attractions. Complimentary breakfast was good. Only comment would make is that dining room was too small and often found had to wait for a table. There was no supervisor in restaurant. Perhaps consider offering staggered breakfast times or opening bar so people can eat in there.

Room was narrow maybe as most hotels in NYC. However, it was cosy and clean. Breakfast was good. In any case, we got out early everyday and came back late evening. There were also nice places to eat nearby. Many attractions were walking distance.

We, a family of 6, had an excellent stay at the hotel. It has a great location but most important was the "can do" approach of the hotel stuff.The hotel was clean, inviting, well-maintained and providing high value for money.We'd love to stay there again!Uri & Gali, Israel

I've been to NYC over twenty times and this was one of the best hotels I ever stayed at. The price was very reasonable and the location was terrific. The hotel is in excellent condition and the staff are amazing. They were always friendly and did everything they could to make our stay enjoyable. They have a wonderful breakfast (included) with lots of choice and it varies from day to day. We did not use the lounge or fitness centre but they both looked very nice. The coffee and cold water always available in the lobby were extra special touches and greatly appreciated on hot NY summer days. I very much look forward to staying here again.

This hotel is in a GREAT location! The staff is amazing and so helpful & friendly! Rooms are rather small, but from what I understand, all rooms in NYC are pretty small. The hotel is very clean and the staff is great! Free breakfast was wonderful! The AC worked very well which was great after being in the humidity & heat all day. Beds & pillows were comfy. The only negative thing (and it wasn't a big deal to us) is that it is a little loud when people are in the hallways. The ice machine and doors opening & closing seemed to make alot of noise. However, there are only 6 rooms on each floor and we were right beside the ice machine. But again, that was very minor.I LOVE the bathroom lighting and I am tempted to call the hotel in the hopes of finding out where I can buy one just like it!

Great clean nice staff ! very cool hotel , rooms clean , everything was great.NEVER stayed there would tell my friends what a great time ! would stay there again, great location for me THATS ALL FOLKS

This is a clean and small hotel that is conveniently located in the heart of Midtown with access to anywhere in Manhattan. The staff is very helpful, professional and will work hard to make your trip pleasant. If this is your first trip to NY then you have come to a great place.The rooms are small - as are all in one of the most densest populated areas on the planet. You have to be a wee bit creative in your moving around the room but I have been in worse. Besides, how much time are you going to be in your room given the variety of events that are around you daily?You are 20 min to the 911 memorial, 20 minutes to Central Park and about a 15 minute walk to Times Square and the Theatre area.Full breakfast is part of the deal - use it.Great staff that works hard - have fun.

The check in process was smooth and the best part is they called us in 10 minutes to ensure the room is comfortable. We got a room at the top floor with a fantastic view of Empire state Building. Rooms were clean and comfortable and were cleaned each day; Toiletries and towels that we required to be changed were replaced promptly.Located right between Fifth and Sixth Avenue and just one block away from ESB makes this a good choice. The 34th street subway station is at a walkable distance. It was very safe to head to Times square and return comfortably by walk in the night. A perfect location to explore the city by walk / subway.The hotel staff were awesome; they were friendly and helpful whenever we reached out to them. The friendly greetings by front desk associates each time we enter and exit the hotel is highly appreciated. They helped us quickly when we had to reach out to them for an issue with our keys.The breakfast area was neatly maintained. The staff made all efforts to keep the place neat and clean. The food items were constantly refilled. We could see them cleaning the tables promptly when the guests move out of the table ensuring the table availability. Their efforts are really appreciated. One of our main expectation was good elevator access and I should say we were greatly satisfied as we could get to the room/ground with less waiting time. Cold water and coffee right at the waiting area is a good choice of placement; very helpful to grab the cold water on return in summer.Though the room space is small for this price, it’s perfectly acceptable for this Manhattan location. It lacks microwave and refrigerator but manageable due to multiple options close by. The wifi lacked at times but that was okay for our limited time.

The hotel is well maintained, clean and comfortable. I appreciated the welcoming and accommodating staff. The bartender especially greeted us daily and engaged us in good conversation. Breakfast was good but we never found a place to sit as the dining room was always crowded. The location of the hotel was great. Walking distance to mid town attractions with a renovated irish pub next door. I was disappointed the poor wifi reception. Unfortunately, this has been the case for us at most of our stays with Best Western.

My daughter and I spent multiple nights at this hotel during our first visit to NYC. It was conveniently located less than 2 blocks from the subway on a quiet side street. It was in a nice midway point between the sites downtown (like 9/11 Museum & State of LIberty) and the sites uptown (like Central Park and the museums). The room was very cramped by our suburban standards, but we knew rooms in Manhattan wouldn't be spacious. We had a great view of the Empire State Building out our window which was a neat plus. Being on the back of the building, we heard no traffic noise at night. While we were there during an extremely hot and humid spell, we did notice that our room's climate control had a difficult time maintaining a consistent temperature. The room was clean. The shower was huge! The breakfast choices changed somewhat each day and were kept well stocked right up to the end of the breakfast time. The breakfast room itself though was a nightmare! Cramped would be an understatement for the space. The furniture was much too big for the tiny space which made it nearly impossible to walk through the room when it was full. There was an option to get a to go box and take your breakfast to your room, but, as there was no space to sit up there except on our beds, we opted to wait for a table most mornings. As first time visitors to the city, I was hoping for a little more "concierge type" help from the employees at the front desk, but, while they were polite, they weren't as helpful as I had hoped. It was nice to always have cold water available in the lobby but we had difficulty finding ice at first as there isn't an icemachine on most of the floors and there was no hotel directory in our room. While there was wifi and I could get it to work on my laptop, neither my daughter nor I could get consistent wifi on our phones.

love this hotel, the décor was very modern, the bed was extra comfortable, the bathroom was my favorite part with the glass doors. the room is a bit tight but the overall hotel makes up for it. front desk is friendly and helpful and the price you cant beat that. definitely consider going back myself again with my family

Very convenient location - I walked from the bus stop and was able to walk to many attractions and restaurants. Public transportation is very close by as well. The hotel staff was very courteous and helpful; before our stay and while we ere there. The room was very clean and quiet, with a comfortable bed and a great shower. The breakfast was varied and well-stocked , but be prepared to take your breakfast to your room or outside, as there may not be enough seats. Overall - a great place to stay!

The staff are verry friendly and they are always helping you for your questions in an verry positife answer!!! No rgerets but the breakfast is a bit too little by european norms!! The thing that was most ingnoring was the fact that everything from plate to knife is in plastic to eat and to drink!!

This hotel was perfect! Let's start with the staff that greeted us at check in - Andre and Ryan. Both were very professional and welcoming. Andre was knowledgeable about the sights of the city.He offered great advice about navigating ourselves around. Ryan was quick to assist us with our bags. Most importantly, they were wonderful ambassadors for the entire Best Western organization and the City of New York. Crystal was also very warm and accommodating. The room itself was clean and comfortable. I am a stickler about a hotel bathroom and this one was exceptional. As a bonus the shower was huge! The bed slept like a cloud. The breakfast offerings were varied and suitable. The entire experience was great! I cannot wait to get back to New York City and stay at this property.

This hotel was perfect! Let's start with the staff that greeted us at check in - Andre and Ryan. Both were very professional and welcoming. Andre was knowledgeable about the sights of the city.He offered great advice about navigating ourselves around. Ryan was quick to assist us with our bags. Most importantly, they were wonderful ambassadors for the entire Best Western organization and the City of New York. Crystal was also very warm and accommodating. The room itself was clean and comfortable. I am a stickler about a hotel bathroom and this one was exceptional. As a bonus the shower was huge! The bed slept like a cloud. The breakfast offerings were varied and suitable. The entire experience was great! I cannot wait to get back to New York City and stay at this property.

Where do I begin this hotel is a great option when visiting New York. Its about five minutes away from Times Square, Macy's and subway stations . The room is clean, comfortable and affordable. The staff is so very helpful especially when I needed to catch the subway to the Bronx Zoo I got step by step directions which made it so easy for me.The hotel is well located next to three nice affordable restaurants, pharmacies, shopping and so much more. Best Western is the best choice for first time visitors to New York. I will definitely be back.

The bathroom was very clean, hotel located in the heart of NYC, within walking distance of all the sights. Neighborhood was safe, continental b-fast was very good, complementary coffee was excellent (FREE) and tea selection very good. Staff was very friendly with fast check-in and check-out. We had no waiting to check-in. Beds were comfy.

Great location, staff, rooms and breakfast. Best value for money I have found in a long time. Staff went out of their way to help and were genuinely friendly and helpful. When we needed directions to locations they were very knowledgeable. Trying to fit in all we wanted to do they were instrumental in locating and showing us the best way to find what we were looking for. A real great place to stay and I will be returning on a regular basis now that I have found this hotel

Our family of 3 just spent 4 nights here. Arrived at 7am after flying all night and were immediately impressed by incredible customer service. Friendly desk staff(lots of smiles!). The man who stowed our luggage as it was too early to check in was awesome. He took us to the breakfast room even knowing we didn't have a room yet. He always had a friendly greeting for us too. Room was small,but it was clean and nicely decorated.Breakfast was fine. Especially since it was included. The location was really good. I would certainly stay here again.

We came to meet a realative who came in from overseas for business. He had about 36 hours free in the city and that was the purpose of the trip. The staff was helpful in advising us on public transportation and suggested several places for dinner. If coming to NYC again I would stay here as it is near several areas I am interested in - garment district and library.

I was very impressed with this hotel on all fronts. The staff is phenomenal, rooms are impeccably clean and quiet, comfy beds, ample toiletries, free wifi throughout. You can't beat the location, central to everything and the subway is a short block away. There are two nice patios located in front and back of the hotel and a small bar/ lounge with happy hour very day from 3-8pm. I would definitely stay there again!

This hotel is conveniently located in the Garment District only a block away from the Empire State building. We had a short stay and found it central to most sightseeing spots and only a short walk to Broadway, Times Square etc. The room though small in size was clean and the beds were comfortable. The beds were made up daily and the housekeeping staff friendly. Having breakfast provided was a bonus and the menu varied each day. Staff at the reception desk were very helpful with directions, advice about restaurants in the area etc. During our stay we were regular visitors to the lounge where we were able to meet up with other guests and discuss what and where we had been for the day. Hats off to the bar staff!! Brian made us feel very welcome and provided great service - only drawback, the lounge was not open on Sunday evening.This hotel ticked the boxes - reasonable in price, location, clean and comfortable.

Great location, clean facilities, polite professional staff. It is new and freshly built. I see it rapidly gaining popularity for the NYC visitor that comes routinely. The price is worth the stay and if you need to eat there are numerous walking distance eateries and good clubs, Irish and Rock & Roll. The jewel is the lounge and Steve who runs it.

We were on the 5th floor, and when the air conditioning didn't work, were quickly moved to the 11th floor. Both rooms were very quiet! Breakfast was included, which we appreciated. The employees in the breakfast room are to be commended for there work ethic! They kept the serving area filled at all times, cleaned the tables after people were finished, and were very accommodating! We expected to be offered the same breakfast the two days we were there, but the 2nd day was different than the first I would readily recommend this hotel for it's service and convenient location and will stay there again!

Excellent is the first word that comes to mind. All three factors work for a traveller. Location, Service and Cost. The hotel is right in the heart of New York, minutes away from sightseeing spots, public transport and shopping. Comfortable, convenient and clean! Highly recommended!

Booking the Best Western Premier Herald Square was the best decision we ever made. My husband and I had spent a great deal of time researching hotel after hotel in New York and we settled on this one because of its central location and that it wasn’t a huge hotel.The hotel itself is on West 36th Street and 100 yards to the end of the street you’re straight onto 6th Ave and Broadway. It’s mid-town so perfect for getting around all of New York. There is also the Herald Square underground station at the end of the street which we found to be great for getting around on. It’s quite a central station for the tube with access to most places.We decided to take the train from JFK to Penn Station and this was less than 10 minutes’ walk from the hotel (and that was in bustling streets with luggage). Would recommend that, must better than sitting in a cab from the airport.On arrival the reception staff were great, checked us in swiftly and we were placed on the 13th floor facing the back of the hotel. This was perfect, nice and high so there wasn’t too much street noise and had a great view of the Empire State Building, two streets away on 34th Street. The windows are very good at sound proofing.The room was great for a city break. We stayed for seven nights and it was more than adequate – there had been some reviews which we’d read to say that this hotel had quite small rooms. Now, it wasn’t massive and we had to be choosey about what we hung up and what we put in drawers but found enough nooks and crannies for things like shoes and suitcases. The bathroom had a large shower and a long mirror so getting ready was easy.The room was clean and tidy, it looked recently decorated. It’s also very modern and our floor (I think they are all the same) only had five/six rooms on it so there wasn’t much noise from the corridors. As we were there for a week we did have a Friday and Saturday night there – they were the noisiest nights in terms of guests coming back to their rooms but that isn’t the hotels fault at all.This hotel was one of the only ones which we looked at that included breakfast. If I’m honest, we weren’t expecting much – maybe some coffee and muffins and had planned that we eat out every morning for breakfast. We didn’t do that once. The breakfast was more than adequate. We ate bagels, cereal, croissants, bacon, eggs, waffles, pancakes and fruit. Each morning there are three hot options which varied day to day. There was a plentiful choice of bagels and brioche – we were full to bursting every morning! The only downside is that the breakfast room isn’t very big. When we started our holiday we were quite jetlagged and went down for breakfast at around 6.30-7am and there was plenty of tables. But, as the week crept on and we woke slightly later as we got in to the swing of the time difference the room was gradually busier each morning. On our last day we went down at around 8.45am and we ended up having to take our breakfast back to our room. Get down early to avoid the rush and get a table – there was plenty of food though, everything was replenished quick.There is a bar at the back of the hotel which was a nice touch after a long day sightseeing.The beds were really comfy and there were some toiletries and face cloths in the bathroom as well as plenty of fluffy towels.Would highly recommend this hotel – very good location, very good value for money and an excellent night’s sleep in the big apple!

Great location to stay while in NYC. We were on the 15th floor facing 36th Av. and it was very quiet. Bonus...breakfast included! Helpful staff and clean rooms. Small hotel. Would stay there again. 24 hour coffee/tea/water service in the lobby.

Personnel was very helpful and professional! Lovely stay for business or pleasure! I was phoned in my room to find out if I am happy with room, that was a pleasant surprise as no other hotels did go that extra mile. Internet was fast and easy to access. Very pleasant stay and highly recommended. Centrally located and easy access to all attractions in the area.

Tucked away in the theater (Midtown) area is this gem of a hotel. With Best Western, there are no surprises in quality and service; but this one has a great location too. Due to the one way streets and construction, Uber takes a bit of extra time to arrive; but is a great way to get around. The place is small with 34 rooms, and vertical. (Sporting a 13th floor, for heaven's sake!). The lobby is small, but sufficient and there is an outdoor patio just outside in the front with tables and chairs. 24 hr Coffee and Tea service in the lobby is a lifesaver in the mornings. The included breakfast is delightful and sports different items on different days. We enjoyed chatting with the kitchen staff as well as other guests at this friendly gathering to start off the day,The sleeping rooms are very small. Really. VERY small. Beds are comfortable but not a lot of room to walk around. I felt a wee bit cramped in the very "efficient" bathroom, but I am a big guy.I would say that we were encouraged to "get out and see the City"; but the hotel staff made up for any inconvenience in room size. Very friendly, helpful, and warm. Exceptional place to stay.

Overall, an acceptable hotel for the price but does not qualify as "premier." The Pros: Very effective soundproofing, very comfortable bed, big fluffy towels, clean, nice breakfast (especially for New York City), friendly staff, reasonably convenient location, 24-hour coffee and tea in the lobby, reliable wifi, enough storage drawers closet space but only for a weekend.The Cons: Small-ish room even by New York City standards, no bathtubs, tiny bathroom, hard to adjust air conditioning, not possible to adjust the shower water temperature without being in the shower stall, no fridge or microwave in the room, no space for luggage in the room.

The hotel has a Great location, found the staff to be helpful & friendly. The rooms were comfy, modern & extremely clean. Great price also. Cute little bar at the back of the hotel if you wanted to have a few pre drinks before heading out. I would Definitely recommend & stay here again on my next NYC visit :)****

I want to thank the best western staff, especially for the front desk for the exceptional customer service and hospitality. I have no negative comments to make and I will most likely return to this hotel in the very near future!

We stayed here for 3 nights in fairly typical room in NYC. This hotel is either new appears to have been renovated recently and we were pleasantly surprised that it was very clean and tidy. The rooms were as usual small even though it was meant for 4 adults with two double beds but not different from some of the other places in the neighbourhood esp. for sub-$300 per night room. The night we arrived from DC, 36th street was closed to traffic for some unknown reason but the hotel staff were very kind and met us on 5th avenue and I managed to reverse our car opposite the hotel to allow my dad who has limited mobility to get off closer to the hotel as well as unload all our bags (since my son was vacating his dorm in Philly after graduation) and we were flying back to London with 2 pieces of luggage each! The hotel management very kindly accommodated all our big bags in the luggage room as we didn't require them and they gave us a nice room close to the lift so that we could park my dad's wheelchair outside and not clutter up the room further. The rooms had floor to ceiling windows and plenty of light, although there wasn't anything exciting to see in the street below. The hotel manager and all staff looked after my dad's needs very well including dressing up a wound he sustained in the room because he tripped in the room. The two men who handled our luggage and the hotel manager and all other staff were very friendly and actually went out of the way to help my father one evening when we had to leave him to go visit friends for dinner. They assisted in getting some packed dinner from a neighbouring restaurant and ensuring that it was received in the room etc. The hotel is so close to Empire State Building, Times Square and the world's largest Macy's and of course walkable (or subway) distance to all other attractions in NYC. In fact, the subway station is literally around the block on 6th Avenue/Avenue of Americas. Penn and Grand Central Stations are pretty close too and it very easy to find a door-to-door limo service to/from JFK There are plenty of breakfast and other food places nearby too. All in all, I think this is a great hotel and better than some of the grotty places I have stayed in near 42nd street. Will most certainly stay here again.

While deciding on a hotel to stay during our honeymoon from June 28 thru July 5, we had looked at two hotels, one in times square and The BW Herald Square. After some research and asking people who know NY we decided to book this BW Herald Square. Upon our arrival we we felt comfortable and were treated well. Our room, 1701 had a great view of the area with large windows. The room was a normal NY size room but everything is new and working so cant complain, plus you ain't coming to NY to stay in your room. The hotel is located in the middle of all the main city attractions. The best part is you can walk to all of them, trust me we walked to all of them on our visit which is nice and lets you get a real feel of the city. If you plan to go down to battery park, the financial district or other neighborhoods the hotel is located 2 blocks from the subway station. The breakfast in the hotel is also awesome and it allows you to use your money in other things. I want to specially thank the housekeepers that cleaned our room, they did a marvelous job keeping our room nice and clean. Thank you to the staff at the BW Premier Herald Square for making our honeymoon one to remember. We are already looking forward to our next stay at your hotel

I am extremely particular on hotels and always expect it to be clean and in good condition. Therefore when I was looking for a hotel in NYC after being there two different times and being unhappy with the hotels I was extremely impressed with this best Western. When you first walk in there is a very nice lobby and everybody who worked at the front desk was very nice. There is chilled water with fruit thats complementary along with coffee right there. We stayed in room 1601 July 4-7 which was an executive room. Yes the rooms are small but if you have ever been to NYC it doesn't matter where you stay, the rooms and bathrooms are always smaller. The room was very clean and more than enough space for my husband and I. The floor to ceiling windows were absolutely wonderful and really loved our view. Yes the bathroom is small and I guess the only thing I did not like was the rainfall shower, but it was nice. We would leave every day and return to our room perfectly cleaned and the bed made.The breakfast was good assortment and considering it is complementary I would recommend and we ate there on two different mornings of our stay. Right across the street there's a restaurant and bar called the Keg which offered very good assortment of food and assortment of beers. Not to mention ever easily across the street. There was a 24 hour restaurant at the end of the block, Keen steakhouse and a market and deli just around the corner. Great location because the Empire State is just a block behind the hotel, Bryant Park is only a few blocks away.I have to recognize Sade, Bebe and Andre. They were extremely helpful and very friendly. On the morning of our leave we decided on last minute shopping we wanted to do and they took care of our bags for us while we went and did that before leaving the hotel. The absolute best recommendation I could give this hotel is that when we return to NYC we will definitely be only staying at this location.

Our stay at this hotel was great! The staff was very friendly and helpful. They responded quickly to a few of our additional requests. The rooms, bedsheets and towels are clean. The daily breakfast is quite good and has a good selection of food. The hotel is centrally located and a short walking distance to all of the downtown attractions. I would definitely stay at this Best Werstern Hotel again!

This hotel is in a great location in midtown Manhatten- close to many great sights,shopping and food. The hotel is very clean and breakfast was very good, but the room descriptions are deceiving. All rooms state that they have a view of the Empire State Building(I did not realize that at the time I booked), but that simply is untrue. I think a view of the EBS has to be requested at the time of booking. The outside front patio was clean and comfortable. Very good value for the money. Wifi worked very well also.

Ive visited this hotel long time ago and I remember it was A good hotel, nice centered area, well maintained, clean rooms, staff were helpful, little bit small rooms, I recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to NY, for a quick business trip.

This hotel is a great spot to stay. Rate was reasonable, room was very clean, the complimentary breakfast was well done and you can't beat the location. What made the stay the most enjoyable was the friendly and helpful front desk staff. Andre was a stand out for fabulous guest service. I intend to make this hotel my regular place to stay when visiting NYC.

Fourth return to this hotel has confirmed this as our New York base! I have said it all before but just to confirm..... Great location, friendly staff and clean rooms. For a little better room experience ask for a room on the 16th or 17th floors!!

Forth return has confirmed this as our New York hotel. Said it all before but just to confirm..... Great location, friendly staff and clean rooms. For a little better room experience ask for one of the rooms on the 16 or 17 floors. Good place to sleep !

This Best Western Premier has all of the qualities of excellence one would expect from a property of this caliber: courteous staff, immaculate rooms (our party had two), yummy breakfasts with different features each day, and a location in Manhattan that was convenient to everything. But, there is more. We arrived on Sunday afternoon, June 28, 2015 and West 36th Street was blocked off due to a parade. We tried going around the block but side streets were blocked in both directions. We called the hotel in desperation for help. The desk attendant, realizing that there were no alternative routes, asked for a description of our car and told us she would meet us at the end of the street. She did. In what must have been a somewhat heated exchange with the police officer, she got him to lift the barricade and let us through. She then took our luggage while we proceeded to the parking garage next door. Talk about going "above and beyond the call of duty". This young lady did just that and we want to publicly commend her with the highest praise possible. After this very difficult start, our stay at the Best Western Premier was outstanding in every way. The location in Manhattan is unbeatable and if you pay in advance, the rate represents a very nice value in an expensive city. We cannot say enough good things about our experience here. We look forward to a return visit (one in which we will probably fly rather than drive!)

The hotel room was clean and quiet, the service was good, and the hotel staff was very helpful and polite. The hotel is within easy walking distance of many New York City attractions, including the Empire State Building, theaters, Times Square, many restaurants, ferry rides, and the subway. The breakfast was good and provided a variety of options that changed daily.

We were fortunate to get the top floor's larger two rooms facing the front, and the night time view was lovely. Everything was fine except for two things, due to design and not fault of staff: the "rainfall shower head" looks nice but water flow was weak and temperature was hard to control, and the air vent was directly over the bed, so either have the air con blowing in your face or turn it off and sweat... Otherwise all was great, staff, breakfast, free WIFI, luggage storage etc. Best thing is the location, so close to everything and reasonably priced. I'd stay here again.

I stayed here with a few friends over a holiday vacation. The location is great - can walk lots of places, although the hotel seemed to be on more of a side street rather than a main thoroughfare - this actually was nice noise-wise. The amenities are what you would expect from a Best Western - an above average continental breakfast in the morning, small but nice fitness center and friendly front desk service. I think they also offered a complimentary drink during happy hour at the hotel bar, which we didn't end up using since we were out during the "happy hour" time. The room was probably one of the smallest two-bed hotel rooms I have ever stayed in...with 4 of us (all female!) in the room it was difficult to fit all of our luggage and personal belongings etc. We managed but it took some maneuvering.Front desk agent was nice and let us store our luggage all day when we checked out while we explored the city. Overall, I would say this hotel is in a great location if you are looking to walk a lot of places and are willing to deal with a small room!

Nice room, nice bathroom, nice breakfast, nice staff, nice broadcast tv, everything was excellent. I had the chance to have a wonderful view for the Empire State Building for the Room´s Window. I liked a lot. It is with no doubt an excellent recommendation!

Our 6 nights at this hotel was great. We were greeted with smiles and enthusiasm making us feel very welcome. We were a few hours early but they had no problem giving us our room right away. Ryan immediately took our luggage to our room. The room was small and cozy, two double beds but that is all we needed. It was very clean especially the washroom. I am very particular about my washroom being clean and this one was great. Nothing grossed me out. Our room was always tidy and cleaned by the time we would return from our day out in the big apple! Breakfast was very good every morning, everything ranging from bagels, yogurt, pastries, some sort of eggs meats , pancakes or French toast, hot and cold cereals,fresh fruit, juice, milk, coffee and teas. We were well fed every morning before we would venture out. The concierge were very helpful especially when it was time to go back to the airport, they summoned a taxi service who were there within ten minutes. Our stay was definitely a two thumbs up. The hotel was centrally located in close proximity to everything. I recommend this hotel to everyone!

Excellent service, excellent breakfast and service, traveled with my father, this was our first visit, the places we visited very close to the hotel. personnel was great and nice, the price was a little expensive but it worth it

Hotel definitely was a little creepy but was convenient, and clean. Pretty much what you would imagine, no complaints though. It was very basic but the staff were nice. All in all it was well priced for a basic night in Manhattan. Not my favorite.

This is the 2nd time I stayed here. The reason is the location, the hotel is very nice, the staff is very nice and the rates are very reasonable for NYC. The breakfast was very hardy, the rooms are very clean and the mattresses are extremely comfortable.

Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights last year June. Excellent Service from Jay before confirmation of the hotel stay, he answered all my queries and he gave me the room that i wanted. Stayed on the highest floor and the room was perfect. Beds were very comfortable, rooms were cleaned everyday and the room is also equiped with docking station for iphone. The hotel offers free breakfast in the morning, nothing fancy but can make do with it. The hotel also offers free coffee and tea in the hotel lobby, very cool! Loved it.The lift is very slow especially in the mornings..

Great hotel and excellent location. Staff was very helpful. Hotel is very clean and updated. As usual, for New York City hotel, rooms are small and storage is limited. Breakfast is very good, but space is limited.

Overall, an excellent hotel. Rooms are a bit on the small side, this because the hotel is an older building that has been renovated. But, the renovation has been done extraordinarily well, with excellent attention to detail. The result is a fully modern hotel with above-average amenities for the guest.Very courteous and friendly employees in all departments - front desk, housekeeping, even the janitor is gracious and friendly. It's obvious that the management here puts a lot of effort into staff training.I will happily return and would recommend this hotel to my friends.

Our party of four checked in June 17 for a five night stay. Check in was quick and painless. Small rooms. We made due but impossible to work in the bathroom with the door open. Complimentary breakfast was adequate with excellent service by Ericka. Our final night was spoiled as the smoke alarm went off in our room while we were sleeping around 2:00 am. I was very disappointed in how the staff reacted to our clear imposition. Had thought that a gift card or some sort of incentive should have been offered as we had to wait for the technician to come shut of the alarm. Of course we had already taken steps to evacuate before realizing only our room was affected. Not impressed

The location we thought was going to be the only reason we would stay there, boy were we wrong. Upon arrival at 11:00 am the desk staff informed us that we could check in at 2:00pm but they could hold our luggage so we could start our day in New York City.We attended the Yankee's game that night and afterwards returned back to the hotel and went to the hotel bar. We sat outside on the back patio and enjoyed a few cocktails along with some piped in music, what a nice end to our very full day. We ended our get away with a hot breakfast with a good mix of food. This hotel has the location of midtown and the amenities that a hotel guest hopes for.

Although there was construction noise on the street below the employees made it all worth while. Ryan was especially friendly. He will store your bags, deliver them to your room and then orient you to the room and amenities. He is very helpful (and funny) so get to know him. Stephen at the bar is awesome and fun to talk to. Unfortunately the bar is closed Sundays and Mondays but there are plenty others. The breakfast is very good and a different menu is served each day. (Be sure you tip all your servers, they will make your trip a good one) Everyone at the desk are excellent at directions and they are especially NICE! I have nothing but good things to say about this place and would stay there again. As with most hotels in NY the rooms are a little small but if you are staying in your room you are missing out on all the great sights that are within walking distance. Thanks to all the staff who made our trip extra special.

There were about 10 of us that stayed at this hotel, and they did such a great job accommodating all of us. Just an FYI, this hotel is really tiny. We only stayed there for one night, so it was fine, but I'd probably start to feel a little claustrophobic if I stayed there any longer. Besides that, the service was great, and everyone was very helpful and friendly. The beds were comfy and the shower was amazing. There's not a lot of walking room in the room itself so don't expect to have a lot of room. Another plus was the dining area downstairs and the breakfast. Also, the location is perfect! Overall, give this hotel a try on your next visit.

Hotel is located on 34th West Street just two blocks away from Empire State Building, opposite a very large Irish Bar and 10min walk to Times square. (Oh opposite Macy's too!)Hotel staff were very friendly (And i mean very..this is NY after all). Breakfast was free and generally it changed every day. Two hot courses (for example scrambled egg and bacon or omlette and sausage) together with fresh fruit, yoghurts, pastries, bagels etc. Plenty to choose from! The breakfast staff were very good and interacted with the customers excellently! (They did deserve a special mention!)Room was quite small and due to the neighbourhood the noise of the outside taxi drivers etc started quite early.Free wifiI paid for my stay using points.

In the heart of Manhattan. Property is small but well serviced with a friendly staff. The room was small but well appointed, we had two double beds, it was fine for two but I can't imagine sharing the room with any more people. I requested a room that was quiet and it was except for the couple in the next room getting it on mid morning. We were lucky it was mid morning and not middle of the night because we heard everything.

Although the hotel is small, it was very comfortable. The staff was wonderful and helpful. The room was very clean. The free breakfast was good though the dining room was a little small to accommodate all the guests. There are several restaurants close by including "The Keg Room" which was excellent! The Empire State Building is only one block away as well as Herald Square/Macys. There are several subway stops within a block or two from the hotel. During our stay there was construction going on across the street. Though it was a little noisy during the day, it was quiet at night. It was in the 90's and very muggy while we were there, but the A/C had no trouble keeping the room comfortable. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

We had a room on the 16th floor, affording us a view and a bit of a buffer from street noise. A movie was filming out front! The bartender, Stephen, was a true gem and a welcome sight at the end of a long day of sightseeing. We stayed for a week, and loved every bit!

The entrance of the hotel is on smallish side but room we stayed in was of decent size for NYC. The staff is super friendly and helpful. The breakfast had a good spread. The best part is location- we were able to just walk over there with two kids aged 6 & 9 from Grand Central.

The hotel is quite narrow, there are only 6 rooms on each floor. We (group of 3) almost felt like we had a floor to ourselves. It was wonderfully quiet at night. Our room wasn't big (but which affordable hotel room in NYC is?) but definitely spacious enough for the three of us. The two king size beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was modern and clean. Special mention for the lovely room maids - no matter if we left the room at 7am in the morning or at midday, it was always cleaned when we came back.Breakfast wasn't amazing but enough to keep you full until late lunch. I was pleasantly surprised by the irange juice which wasn't just some sugary liquid but actual tasty, fruity orange juice. Not completelyy sure about spring roles for breakfast (just on one day) but that's just my personal taste. In general the mix of 3 warm dishes (scrambled eggs, omlettes, sausages, pancakes etc - the choices varied from day to day) and the usual baguels, toast, yoghurt, cereals, pastries and such was fine. The breakfast room itself was rather small but we always had breakfast quite early so never had a problem getting a table. As always in US hotels I didn't approve of the plastic plates and cuttlery. Way too much waste. The hotel is on 36th street so in walking distance of Broadway. Our main reason for being in NYC was Punchdrunk's Sleep no more on 27th Street which was easy to reach by subway or cab when we didn't feel like walking (20 mins walk).Plus Macy's and 5th Avenue are just around the corner so the hotel is great for both theatre and shopping. The staff was friendly, there was always free coffee in the lobby and the two elevators were quick and we never had to wait for one for more than a minute. I'd definitelystay here again in the future.

Location, price and service were just what we were looking for on our NYC trip. Rooms were nicely decorated and clean; staff were very friendly; breakfast was ample; location was PERFECT!; and price was reasonable among the options available.

We got a great last minute deal for 1-night stay, so it was very good value for money, otherwise it can be a bit expensive. Staff was very friendly at the check in, room size was average for a double queen size beds. Clean, comfortable, worthy of it's name and position here in TripAdvisor. Breakfast place/room felt a bit empty and cheap.Recommended.

We had originally booked a hotel closer to the financial district. Then Best Western offered a deal that was the same reasonable price. We read the reviews and changed our reservation. We are so happy with that decision.This hotel is very central. We could walk to the theater district and back for dinner or shows. Times Square was an easy walk. The Empire State building was around the block. We were close to shopping and NYC public library. We were a block from the subway.Our room was compact and recently redone. The bed was comfortable, A/C worked well and it was quiet. The bathroom was also compact, but with a large shower. I could have used a little more counter space. But this is NYC and the price was right.The breakfast had all the basics and they refilled everything consistently.There was a nice seating area ii front of the hotel and just inside the door they had free ice water with lemon and coffee or tea.There was a nice bar at the back of the hotel with a great outdoor area.Ryan was helpful with luggage and was always there with a smile. The front desk staff was helpful and pleasant. If we got a similar deal we would definitely stay here again.

The hotel is practically everything you could ask for. It's location is hard to beat, in walking distance of times square, Madison Square Garden and much more. The rooms are small, but no smaller than you can expect for a downtown hotel. The beds are very comfortable, the rooms are more modern and it has a great feel. The breakfast room is somewhat small, but the selection is great and is FREE! It's exactly the hotel you'll want. I see absolutely no reason to not stay here for your trip.

booked in the hotel website in January for stay last few days in May. Requested a high floor with a big window as seen in the photos. We arrived at 14.45, and was given a room on the 7th floor. The room was great with everything you could need, though the view was only of the buildings across the road it was nice and bright, If returning I would request a room at the back as the noise at night was really bad, Not in the hotel, but outside, the traffic, people at the bars, refuse trucks etc. Location was perfect, a 10 min walk from Penn station, round the corner from 34th st subway and Macey's, Wifi was good, and breakfast was ideal. Complimentary tea/coffee at reception was great. Overall I would stay again.

This hotel is exceptional. We stayed on the sixteenth floor. The room was very large by New York standards. Subway was a short walk away. The midtown location was within walking distance to many attractions. The front desk staff were always helpful. This will be my go to destination in NYC.

I usually would want to stay in an upscale hotel in the city,but needed to stay several days to be close to NYU Langone Hospital. The lobby is small,but as clean as a whistle. There is a nice selection of teas that you can bring up hot to your room too. Also, ice water with lemon. The rooms are small ...a little bigger than a cruise ship, but more importantly very clean. The bathroom was new with several nice clean towels in it with all kinds of soaps etc. Great big 40 LG Tv too. Free wifi...many change 14.00 a day in New York. Buffet free breakfast was good ,fresh fruit,eggs,bacon,Danishes ...The menu was different every day. I was here for 7 days and would come back again ,but this time go to a broadway show. Keens steakhouse is right next door to eat. Fresh and Go is too. Great for sandwiches,soup,wonderful salads.

We had an enjoyable stay. Great location. Newer hotel. Very clean. Erica, Ryan, Bebe, and Andre were awesome. 2 blocks to subway that takes you everywhere. 2 blocks from Empire State Building. 6 blocks from Times square. Close to a variety of restaurants.

Hotel was clean and near to everything we wanted to see, e.g. Broadway, Times Square and within reasonable distance to Central Park. Erica, in the breakfast room, made our stay extra special with her passion and care so evident in everything she did.Our room although very small was immaculate every day of our 7 day stay and well stocked. We found the fitness room to be clean.

Hotel is at a very convenient location, only a few minutes walk to subway; room is super clean, and staffs are very friendly and helpful. I will definitely choose this hotel again during my next visit!!

This hotel is right in the heart of the shopping precinct 36th & 6th and not far from Broadway shows. Next street for the Empire State Building. Macys 150 meters. Subway entrances 150 meters. Very walkable. Plenty of food and beverage places nearby.

K-Town, 5th avenue or Macy's right outside your door for shopping until 22.00 and if it's not within walking distance then the bus stop is which will take you uptown or downtown. Although the rooms are small, they are clean and well appointed. Friendly staff with wifi and breakfast included.

Great location, room is comfortable and clean, new bathrooms, bedding, towels, coffee maker fine, nice breakfast, helpful friendly staff, view is fine (top floor is much better), bar service was not perfect, but it's ok, a lot of bars around

Very nice hotel. Staff is friendly. Our concierge, Ryan is the best. He helped us right away with our luggage. He was there when we needed him. The rooms are small, but organized. Close to everything. Was able to walk.I will definitely be staying here again!!!

The location of this hotel is very convenient. There was some construction noise outside, and the staff was very helpful and accomodating when we asked if a quieter room was available. Their willingness to help address our issue definitely made our stay more enjoyable. Thanks again to Ryan and the rest of the front desk staff. Everyone we encountered was very courteous and helpful and their service was outstanding.

My wife and I had a really nice stay in this hotel. We were in NYC for 3 days. The hotel is clean, our room was comfortable, the staff were helpful, and the hotel location is very convenient to everything in mid-town and close to the subway. Would definitely recommend.

When we first arrived Andre at the front desk greeted us...well..I have been a Diamond member and am now platinum as I do not travel as much anymore. Andre by far was the most pleasant, jovial and personable front desk person I have ever encountered. We only stayed one night, as we were staying with friend the next few days, but had a few encounters where we asked Andre question and opinions...he was honest and did not steer us wrong. The hotel is centrally located near everything.We will be back to NY in the next couple of years and will stay at this wonderful hotel. Our room was fantastic on the 17th floor and was awesome, floor to ceiling windows. Breakfast was a great way to start all of our treks in NY.

We have just returned from an amazing 7 night visit to New York. The hotel is in an ideal location - 5 minute walk to Macys, Empire State Building and about 10-15 minutes from Broadway(we went to a show 'Kinky Boots' that was excellent) and Times Square.Staff were very friendly and very helpful and were great at giving us directions to the other tourist attractions, subways etc. Central Park was huge, we booked tickets for Top of the Rock (Rokerfella Building)via a website in UK called attractiontix and saved £4 per person on the entrance fee - it has amazing views from the very top level, we didnt bother going up the Empire State Building.Breakfast was ok more choice would have been nicer. My only negative point is that the room had a shower and we requested a bath. There is a lovely pub across the road from the hotel that did a lovely shepherds pie when you need something different to a burger!!Drinks everywhere in NY are quite expensive but comparable with some major European cities such as Paris.Beware that on top of prices advertised for EVERYTHING apart from shoes!! 10% tax will be added to your final bill

This place is extremely convenient for getting around NYC. Walking distance to theater district, easy to get to any place or event. Nice boutique hotel . Very comfortable bed and pillows Andrea and Ryan very friendly and helpful; nice staff; easy to get a taxi.

I attended a business event at the hotel and stayed the night. It was a great event, a comfortable room, friendly staff and an easy location to get to from Penn Station.I would recommend this hotel in NYC.

I'm originally a Brooklyn "goyl," but have lived in southern California for 47 years. From time to time I return home to NYC and this year decided to go back and see old friends in the city and neighboring New Jersey and out on Long Island. For the first 4 nights I stayed here in order to enjoy Manhattan and attend my beloved Met Opera. It's difficult to find a good hotel in a safe neighborhood, steps away from a subway stop that serves several lines, that offers included WiFi and breakfast AT AN AFFORDABLE PRICEl. This hotel fulfilled all my requirements and added a clean, stylish room with a roomy bathroom and a superb staff. I enjoyed my stay VERY much. The breakfast was certainly adequate, especially for a gluten intolerant person like me. Plenty of fresh fruit and yogurt for me to enjoy. The WiFi worked very well with my Kindle Fire. All the people who took care of me, from the front desk to housekeeping to the people in the breakfast room were wonderful. When I needed a later check-out time, my request was cheerfully granted. I was always greeted when entering and leaving the hotel. Of course the location is fabulous and I was able to either walk to where I wanted to go or grab a train at the 34th Street station. Usually the city noise keeps me up at night but the architect seems to have made an effort to insulate the building well. Can you imagine staying in a hotel in midtown and barely hearing the traffic outside?? Well that was my experience! WOW! I honestly can't think of anything to complain about and I'm thrilled I decided to stay here. I will stay here again!

Great location. Easy walking to subway. Room was comfortable but small. Staff super friendly & helpful. Erica in breakfast room a delight. Great experience. As a travel agent I will be happy to recommend.

My husband and I stayed two nights for my son's wedding, which was at a venue only three doors away from the hotel. However, the location was perfect otherwise as well. We traveled into Port Authority by bus, and found it a pleasant and easy walk from there, as well as to the rehearsal dinner on 33rd St. Several others from the family were staying there as well, and the small patio area in front of the hotel was a great meeting and congregating place, although the music playing was a little annoying, and made conversation a little difficult at times. The bar was nice, and the patio by the bar was more pleasant. The staff was very friendly and helpful, handling a request to leave something for my daughter to pick up at the front desk efficiently and cheerfully, and holding our luggage for us after we checked out until we were ready to leave later in the afternoon. And when I carelessly left things in the safe after we had checked out, they quickly sent Ryan back up to the room with me to retrieve them. Ryan was everywhere, handling luggage, keeping the patio area clean and tidy, stocking the coffee area and cleaning it up, and always with a smile! Breakfast was certainly adequate, with coffee, juice, pastries, eggs and breakfast meat, pancakes or French toast each day. Several reviews have mentioned the plastic tableware, but I have seldom stayed anywhere that had a breakfast buffet with fine china! The area is in the basement, but the room itself was clean and neat, although a little crowded and hard to navigate when all the tables are full.The room was small, but comfortable, with a good bed and nice bathroom. I would agree with another reviewer that the placement of controls in the shower make it difficult to regulate the water temperature before you get in the shower. My only complaint would be that housekeeping never serviced our room. We were in and out during the day, for several hours away each time, but they never seemed to "catch" us out, nor did they knock when we were in to see when we might be gone. The front desk did supply new towels, shampoo, etc., after I asked.Overall, we had a very nice stay and would certainly consider staying here again.

Stayed for 4 nights. Customer service was excellent. The staff was very friendly and answered every question to help make our stay enjoyable. They helped the most explaining the transit system to get around the city. My room was comfortable and nicely sized considering how small some NYC rooms can be. The free breakfast was a great way to fuel the day. When I return again this will be where I stay.

My elderly mother and I stayed 4 nights and were very pleased with the comfort, convenience and courtesy at this Best Western. The (2 doubles) bedrooms are teensy, but once we unpacked and stowed our bags, they proved satisfactory. (Would be nice to have room for a 2nd chair, tho!) The beds were great, the room was surprisingly quiet, and the amenities top quality.The bath was disproportionately large with towels stowed under the sink (Mom couldn't figure our where they were initially), and really AWFUL lighting. Impossible for putting on makeup; why do hotels DO that?The location was fabulous and SO convenient to subways, cabs, walking to eateries, etc. The little breakfast room was frequently jammed, requiring the tiny bar upstairs to be pressed into service for additional seating (holds about 8 people). However, the quality and variety of breakfast selections was better than expected, and well-presented.The front desk staff were amazingly helpful and courteous, both during and after our stay. Mom left a couple of items in the armoire, and discovered this while we were on the train to New Orleans. I called the hotel and spoke with the housekeeping staff who instructed me on how to have them sent to Mom's home by UPS (at our cost, of course). This hotel was a cost-effective and completely satisfying accommodation in one of the most expensive cities to visit. I would gladly stay there again.

The staff at the property is professional, friendly and helpful with requests. Without a doubt the staff made this stay one of the very best. The location of the hotel made it possible to easily access a vast area of the city. Also any special requests were satisified without exception. When having breakfast in the morning a friendly and welcome exchange with Erica will begin your day on a high note. She is truly a professional!

My first time in New York so I was not sure what to expect. What can I say? Front desk personnel are above and beyond. Kudos to Andre and Bebe for making it such a welcoming stay. Nothing was too much trouble for either of them. The hotel is close to everything, Times Square, Rockefeller Centre, Central Park, Theatres and shopping on 5th Avenue .Room size is average from what I was told for New York. Its spotless and apart from missing a small fridge in the room ( personal preference) It had all I could need.My room was at the back of the hotel so sleep was blissful. Free wifi, king size bed, and large shower made the room a nice place to come back to after exploring the city each day. Its good value for money. I certainly will be returning to this hotel on my next visit

I stayed 5 nights at the hotel and was pleasantly surprise how nice it was. The room was very clean, the beds comfortable and the bathroom very nice. The breakfast is awesome, good selection and tasty. Friendly staff who is at service at all times. The hotel is very well located and next door is a good healthy restaurant. I will stay there again next time.

My room with a kind size bed, located on the 16th floor on the street side had en entire glass wall providing plenty of light. It was roomy, pleasant and comfortable A great stay. The room I had was bigger than most standard rooms of that hotel

We had a great stay at the Best Western @ Herald Square. As many have mentioned it is a minimalistic venue, as expected considering the location, so the small rooms are to be expected. However, we found it adequate to our needs.Also, the room was super clean, bathroom in particular, and very quiet (it was on one of the top floors, granted).Service was good. Andre and Bebe at the front desk, along with the other staff we met, were helpfull and pleasent. We didnt need much help, but when we did it was provided straight and to the point.Otherwise, the hotel's location is a winner, 36th street being just in the right place. Not too close to the Times Square crowd, but still a walking distance to eveything in Midtown Manhattan, and a quick subway ride to the rest.

I have been with my family in march. Clean, small but comfortable due to new furniture and decoration. Invaluable location, close to Broadway, Fifth, and all kind of transports is a good place to stay, moreover considering cold nights like Thor Storm.. Good Price-Cost relation. Small cafeteria to take breakfast, but nice, aceptable.

This is the third time I've stayed here, Z at the front desk always provides the best guest service, very helpful. The midtown location is ideal, good value for the rate.It's a short walk from Penn Station, close to the subway. I'll be back soon.

The Best Western Premier in Herald Square is comfortable, clean and the staff very pleasant. The rooms are quite small, but nicely appointed. The toiletries are high end, and the breakfast ordinary. This hotel might be tight for more than one person, planning to stay more than one night.

Hotel is a best buy in an expensive locale of midtown Manhattan. Facility is well situated to Midtown attractions, and to the subway for getting elsewhere in the city. Room was extremely clean and adequately functional. Hotel and rooms make the most of the typically tight space in midtown. Staff was uniformly eager to please.

The hotel is what you expect from a Best Western. I stayed for 3 nights on a quick last minute getaway with my sister and niece With the 3 of us and all my luggage because I always overpack we had plenty of room. There is closet space drawers and a desk. Floor to ceiling windows overlooking the street. The room was clean, the double beds are exactly that... doubles so couples beware. It was just fine for what we had planned and the cost was very reasonable, The free breakfast is a good breakfast with actual food. Located within walking distance to subway and my favorite store Desigual! If you are looking for a budget friendly hotel and want to ensure you are not getting a dive this place is great for budget travelers. Keep in mind unlike many other hotels in NYC this one is very firm on the 3 pm check in rule. If you arrive early in the morning after a red eye flight to the city waiting until 3 pm can take up valuable time for fun. I traveled late Feb 2015 not a peak time and still waited for a room. All in all it is a clean good hotel. Perfect for a couple nights. Long term may be too hard for me since I do like a few extras in my room, and if its your first time to NYC the room size is normal for NYC, higher floors are quieter. If you are wavering and on a budget this is a safe place to rely on for a enjoyable stay.

This hotel was an excellent choice for an inexpensive and fun- filled weekend trip in New York. We wanted to save money and still have opportunities to enjoy good food, do some shopping, and see a show on our trip. The hotel was centrally located from the bus station, Radio City Hall where we saw a wonderful show with excellent seats, museums (Metropolitan Museum, MOMA), walk around Central Park, visit several shops, and a choose from a range of restaurants and food carts.

Very small lobby. The rooms were clean but VERY small. Too small.  I do not see what is "Premiere" about this property. It is average for a Best Western which we generally find acceptable.Spent 3 nights over Easter and the location was convenient. However I will not return.

Stayed for 3 nights for a weekend away in NYC. The location was perfect. Close enough to everything but far enough from the Times Square madness. Steps from a nice stroll up 5th Ave to Central Park or down 6th Ave to Macy's or up Broadway to Times Square. Can walk to both Penn Station or Grand Central. Room was clean and modern. We had two rooms both on the 17th floor (top). The front facing one had full wall of windows looking down at 36th Street and the other faced the rear with a regular sized window and a perfect view of the Empire State Building and cool NYC rooftops.

My soon and I had a great stay here.. Its close to most of what You will do when You only have 1 week.. Walking to Time Square, Empire just around the Corner, Madison Square and so on.We had a lovely stay and would stay there again

We came to New York for a quick overnight while traveling from the Mid-West and found this hotel perfect for our needs. The hotel is clean, modern, and in a great location. Additionally, a parking garage is available less than a half block away that gives a discount. Free breakfast is always a nice perk when coming to New York. The coffee/tea/water in the lobby were a nice touch. We didn't use the workout facilities this trip, but it looked clean.

Found this location during search of hotels near Times Square. Had a very comfortable stay. Room was small but clean with good amenities. Lounge had buy second free at happy hour. Staff were very friendly and accommodating. Excellent deal on parking close by. Would definitely return.

3 nights in April with our teen daughter. Location: great, lower midtown, easy walk to theater district and Times Square and right near Empire State Building. VERY pleasant/helpful staff. Typically small rooms (for NY) are updated and had a nice shower. Breakfast is better than average buffet---good bagels, good donuts, hot food decent. all day free coffee/tea is a plusDespite being on side street VERY noisy at night, horns, machinery. Not sure why, usually on side street in NY this is not so bad. Hotel itself inside was quiet. Perhaps get a room on a higher floor (we were on 6th)

The hotel was in a good location with parking nearby. Everything is modern and new/good condition. The room was a bit small. We were traveling with two strollers and I ended up parking them in the shower so we could move about easier. Free WiFi and breakfast and their were a few good restaurants nearby on both ends of the price spectrum. I would probably return.

We stayed here during a 4-day trip to NYC. The hotel was very clean and modern.
