The breakfast had plenty of food choices, but was very crowded (hotel was full) so we had to take the food back to our room to eat each day which was difficult. Our room was very clean, but space is limited in NY so the the room was pretty tight with 4 people and suitcases. We had called ahead to get an upper floor room so my son would have a view of the Empire State building, when checking in they saw the request and told us if we stored our luggage for an hour or so that they could meet the request. We were on the 15th floor and had an awesome view, my son was thrilled! We did ask one of the staff for help figuring out the subway vs. using the buses, but she could only give us minimal help and offered us maps for each, which was surprising. There was a parking garage only a block away, which was perfect for leaving our car and traveling with luggage through the city. Overall, great location (mid-town) and very clean!

Excellent place to stay in NYC. Staff was extremely helpful unloading our cars and checking our luggage and locking it away while we explored for the day before check-in. Rooms were tiny but they were very nice. Small but luxurious bathroom. Breakfast was very good every day with a large variety of things. Great location for walking to many sites and close to subway.

Brand new with breakfast and wifi at easy metro for $150 and spacious for NY. 2 mins walk to around the corner for metro, 12 mins walk to Time Square, 6. Mins walk to Bryan Park. Ask for room on side to Hyatt Place because construction on the other side.Plentiful breakfast with hot and cold items and strong wifi in room.

The Best Western Herald Square Premier is modern & clean. It's near Herald Sq - a few blocks from Penn Station The price is reasonable & includes full buffet breakfast - but it has small rooms - not enough room for 2 people to move around each other.the breakfast room had inadequate capacity & nothing special. 1 of 2 Elevators was not working one morning - created a major delay. It was such an unpleasant scene that we ate breakfast out the next day.Not up to the Premier designation.

We found this place very good value, Front desk service was great and breakfast was good too with a good healthy selection. Also just a short walk away from Times Square and close to the subway. If we could change anything there it good be stronger coffee in the lobby and at breakfast.

Great value for a brief overnight stay in the shopping district in NYC. Booked last minute and needed to be near Herald Square. Comfortable room, nice staff (especially Andre at check-in), Wi-Fi and breakfast included in rate. Only problems were loud elevator on 17th floor and low water pressure and only luke warm water in the am. I would recommend and return!

VERY small room. Good size bathroom. When you're in NYC I don't know why you would want to spend time in your hotel room, so space was a non issue. CLEAN, great breakfast and excellent location. The only downside of our stay was the construction next door. All the little extras(breakfast, microwave and fridge, drink coupons, happy hour, friendly and helpful staff) are why I love staying at best westerns.

Nice location to times square 7 minute walk depending on the direction you are heading, near shopping and food. Well lit location for those concerned about walking and safety. 5 minute walk to conference center I needed to get to every morning. Free breakfast and complimentary WIFI nice bonuses. Rooms are a bit small but that's typical in NYC.

After a nightmare of an experience checking in and out of another Best Western hotel we decided to give the hotel chain another try and go to a different property. They were so accommodating and not only did they match the rate we were paying at the prior hotel but they gave us a wonderful room! They were so understanding after we told them how poorly we were treated by the staff at the Best Western Convention Center that they wanted to make sure we stayed as Best Western customers. Shout out to Jay at Front desk who checked us in and made us feel so very welcome. Granted this property is more upscale but service is service. One should not be treated poorly just because the property is less luxurious ESPECIALLY when we are paying the same price and it is the same brand. The location of this hotel is perfect! Great place down the street for breakfast and lunch. Close to Time Square and Macy's. This is the second time we stay here and it is just as good or better than last time.Definitely stay here DO NOT stay at Convention Center location!

Our stay at the Best Western Premiere Herald Square was excellent. Very clean and comfortable rooms, personable staff, central location in mid-town Manhattan, all made for a wonderful weeklong stay. Walking from here was easy and just a block away from all major subways. The hotel was very accommodating to our early arrival and later departure. Zuleika at the front desk helped from beginning to end. Ryan, the houseman, took care of us at every opportunity. And the breakfast staff of Edwin, Erica and Debbie made sure the food was fresh, hot, and with a fine variety for all attendees. There is no question that I would return here upon another visit unless my son buys a large condo with extra guest rooms. We are walkers and this offered the perfect location for uptown and lower Manhattan adventures. A very solid value.

Typical BW. Clean, comfortable bed, nice breakfast. The room was a bit larger than the usual NY hotel room and was immaculately clean. We were on the 17th floor and the Empire State building was just outside our window. The hotel was ideally located for our theatre going trips. Herald Square subway was just around the corner and there were major bus routes at each end of the block. We stayed 5 nights and the cost was very reasonable.

Traveled from Ireland in March 2015 for St Patrick's Day. We couldn't have picked a better hotel for this! First of all getting to the hotel: From JFK it's about 1.5 hours and $7 on the Subway. Take the E Subway the whole way into Manhatten and then switch onto at a D or F at 7th Ave to 34th Sq Herald Sq. The subway is just two blocks away (3 mins walk).The hotel itself is a very nice boutique hotel: the rooms are smallish but would be comfortable for two adults. The bathrooms are big and good tv selection, desk space and coffee making facilities. The breakfast is self service but it is good and good variety. There is a small gym downstairs which is good. The bar is small, it only serves paninis though. The only real downside to the hotel is that the elevators/lifts get congested at peak times. Recommendations for food, The Keg Room across the street is very good (Approx $80 for meal for three adults), there is a lovely restaurant called Brendan's on 35th St. The hotel is very close to Macys, Fifth Ave (St Patrick's Day Parade), and really central overally.For LGBT travellers I'd recommend XES lounge on 24th St which is 20mins walk from the hotel. And recommend Wednesday or Sunday for karaoke! Lovely staff in the hotel too. The noise level isn't too bad in the hotel.

My now fiancée (he proposed to me at the Statue of Liberty's crown) and I stayed at this hotel for a few nights for our first trip to NY and we loved it. The hotel location was perfect and the staff were absolutely amazing. Salman, Andre, and Zuleika were very helpful. As we were leaving the hotel to see the Statue the first day, I remembered I forgot both of my room keys in the hotel room (yes, I know lol). Salman was very helpful and provided me with an extra key. He was so nice along with the rest of the staff. I recommend this place. Great service and free breakfast!Montserrat C.

This hotel is in a great location. It's only a few streets away from the Empire State Building and a 10-15 minute walk from Times Square. The subway station is near by and so easy to use. Macy's is only one street away with other shops near by on 34th street. On the outside of the hotel there are a number of chairs and table which in the summer would be a perfect place to sit down and have a drink or two, however we were there in Feb when it's was freezing and snowing. Rooms as we know in New York are compact and this is no different. There was a lack of space for 3 suitcases but we managed. It was great that breakfast is provided as there was always something to eat. They had bagels, bread, a selection of 4 hot foods, pasties, fruit, yogurts, juice and tea and coffee. The 3 of us are fussy vegetarians and we had no issues. Also in the entrance of the lobby there was always tea, coffee and water for free for guests to help themselves to. Perfect just before leaving for the day or for coming in from the cold. The staff so lovely and nothing was too much for them. I will definitely stay here again on my next trip to New York.

Great hotel in MIdtown, 5 mins from Empire State Building, around corner from Macey, 10 min walk to Time Square. Rooms nice everything you need, television lots of channels, good shower and nice bathroom, would only say put a coat hook on the door, it was -12 we had big coats and nowhere to hang them Cleaned dailyBreakfast was very good no complaints at all, staff always helpful but not intrusive, its operated like a cafe you help your self. Only gripe plastic knives and forks, at times very difficult to cut up scrambled egg on toast etc with a plastic knife.Free coffee etc in reception 24 hrs a day and it tastes good to :)Bar ok, small but we found it a bit expensive for cocktails but they did have offers on.If we ever come to New York again would say here without a doubt also will recommend to any friends who may visit.Staff always nice on Reception to. Good Hotel :)

We had a wonderful stay at the hotel. Clean and friendly. Great variety of foods at breakfast. Very close to subway. Empire state building right around corner. Many attractions well within walking distance.

The Hotel is located right around Harold Square (Macy's) which is nice, since you are very flexible where you want to go in New York. I have to say the hotel was nice but the Breakfast Buffet if you can call it like that was terrible. It's not worth getting it unless it's a free update. The overall Service is great the people are very friendly and even when we had a complain about our room, we got a new one right away. So it would for sure be a hotel I would come back.

I reserved this hotel only because it was the one I could find a vacancy. I had never stayed here before and was a little apprehensive, but found it very clean, nice decor, comfortable--looked brand new inside. And it was a great value overall. Definitely will consider it again when in mid-town. It is a nice find in NYC, where I've stayed in much more expensive hotels that I wasn't as satisfied with.

My daughter & I along with another family traveled to NYC from Texas to meet with Entertainment manager for Musical Theatre training & options for lodging. Our time in the city was wonderful & found the location of Best Western Premier Herald Square very convienent to many places. The hotel rooms were smaller than we were used to with double beds vs queen but very comfortable, quiet, extremely clean & maintained. Nice walk-in showers! Friendly staff who offer suggestions & assist with questions about the area. We would stay here again / Price was right! Thank you Best Western !

I stayed here for a weekend with my husband first time in New York and could not fault the hotel at all ! really good location within 2 min walk to Macy's 5/ 10 min walk away to everything thing else the staff were very helpful couldn't fault wi fi was free and working and to top it off breakfast was included so made our stay even easier spotlessly clean and rooms were spacious defiantly recommend !! For anyone of all ages loved New York loved the hotel will be going back !!

We got a great deal on this hotel and the quality was much better than we were expecting for such a low cost. The distance from times square was great (about a ten minute walk) and we had no problem walking to and from the hotel. The complimentary breakfast was a great bonus and the coffee was high quality compared to standard hotel coffee.

We have stayed in Best Western Herald square for a week beginning of March. On arrival we were greeted by friendly receptionist who explained everything to us. Our room was rather small, but that`s New York. Only problem was that we could not open windows to get some fresh air, which is understandable being on 9th floor, however this became an issue on 3rd or 4th day when there was no fresh air...Rooms however were cleaned daily and were nicely decorated.Breakfast was very good, with plenty of choice, also coffee and tea in the lobby was a pleasant surprise.Overall we enjoyed our stay and would stay here again.

My 13 yr old son and I (55 yrs old) stayed for 3 nights at this hotel, Friday through Sunday. When we checked in the receptionist noticed we reserved 1 King bed room and offered to upgrade to a two bed room for free because I have "elite" membership status. That was awesome and showed caring staff! Throughout stay staff were VERY NICE & HELPFUL! Hotel has been recently renovated and our accommodations were quite nice. The exterior is deceptively unattractive and there is renovation in the neighborhood but inside appearance of the hotel is newer (not brand new). The hotel is 6-7 blocks easy walking distance to Penn Station. We pulled (walked) our suitcases from the station and back to the station (when we checked out) without any trouble instead of paying a cab. My son and I like to walk so we walked to Time Square Friday night & the area surrounding the theater district. On Saturday we got up early and walked all over the city exploring then took the subway back in the evening. Subway is a block from the hotel. Sunday AM we took the subway to the Museum of Natural History then chose to walk back through Central Park, then exploring & enjoying the city, the architecture, stopping at fun stores, NBC Studios, time square and then back to the hotel. The rooms are tight like almost all hotels in NYC. New big screen TV (HBO) & remodeled glass shower & clean bathroom. The breakfast offered a good variety including scrambled eggs, sausage, bagels, pastries, hot & cold cereal, juice, milk and coffee and other things. So it was actually a nice free complete breakfast (not just pastries & coffee). Overall very nice experience at this hotel and will return!!!

I found the hotel staff very friendly and helpful. The hotel is only a few minute's walk away from Times Square, the Empire State building and Macy's. It also has a subway station one street over.This hotel is tall and narrow with only 6 rooms per floor. Yes the rooms are a bit on the small side, but who cares - you're in NY. The rooms with the floor to ceiling windows are very nice.The continental breakfast is also very good.I was there during the Thanksgiving Day parade. I was a little disappointed to see that the section between 34th and 38th is a 'quite zone' for the parade. So being on 36th St corner, the marching bands were not playing. We should have gone a few streets over. Oh well - I'll know next time, but I will stay at this hotel again..

Loved the location ,only around the corner to Empire state, short walk to times square and top of the rock, around the corner to subway, which takes you to central park etc. or if you don't feel like walking take the subway to Top of the rock... Friendly, helpful staff, good hot breakfast included. Free tea, coffee and water station in lobby, comfortable rooms and bed, cute little hand towels made up in the bathroom was a nice touch, excellent meals at the take way next door too.

Nice and new hotel, clean and spacious room, stylish furnished. Good wifi. Not so good acoustic insulation between rooms.The best is the location, really central and confortable for visiting the city using public transportation or walking.Good breakfast, just some problem of crowd... the room is not enough spacious for the guest in rush hours.Some inconvenient with the elevators... almost all days with one out of two was not working, sometimes even the two.... and if you stay at the 15th floor is not so confortable...highly recommended!!!

We chose this hotel for the combination of location and price. The location was perfect for us, but I would not stay here again unless we find another deeply discounted rate.There was a minor problem with our reservation, which took entirely too long to resolve because the desk clerk's goal was to make sure she didn't get into trouble with her boss for the way she handled the problem. The room was barely bigger than the two double beds, but this is NYC, so that wasn't a surprise. The barkeep in the lobby lounge was pleasant and drinks were reasonably priced. There were three things that seriously impacted our stay and that would prevent me from returning here:1. the bed - instead of putting enough blankets on the bed, it was decorated with one of those idiotic "bed scarves" which may look stylish but serve no useful purpose. The temperature in the room dropped overnight and several times I woke up cold. At 3 a.m. do you really want to have to call the front desk for another blanket?2. at 8 a.m. on Saturday morning the housekeepers began banging on the doors on our floor asking if the guests were leaving and if they could clean the rooms. IT WAS SATURDAY MORNING AND WE WANTED TO SLEEP IN, NOT LISTEN TO HOUSEKEEPING'S NOISE. That cost me 2 hours of sleep, and I find it totally unacceptable that the housekeeping staff can not do their job without disturbing every guest on the floor. They stood out in the hall (which was as tiny as the rooms) and talked loudly when they weren't making banging and clashing around noises. Rude, unprofessional and inappropriate.3. the bathrooms: why have so many hotels gone to the high fashion but useless style of bathroom? Here's what I wrote to the hotel about their trendy new bathrooms:The bathroom (room 704) was horrible. It has one of those trendy new looks that makes for a horrible user experience. For example, why is the only towel rack INSIDE THE SHOWER? There is no place to set down one's toiletry kit - the narrow ledge around the sink is too narrow and/or wet. No place to set one's clothes while one is in the shower, except the toilet lid, which is slanted so that the clothes slide off onto the floor. The glass door of the shower opens outward, and when you open it, the water all runs off of it, onto the bathmat and the floor - which means that the floor is now all wet, and so are your feet, which makes putting on your clothes, especially your socks, a problem. If you really must put in glass doors, MAKE THEM SLIDING DOORS. Also, with the current design of the doors, you can not stand outside the shower and adjust the water temperature before you get into the shower, so you either freeze or get scalded until you can reach the knob and figure out how it's supposed to work. The shower control knob has no visible markings, so you have to guess where to set it to get the right temperature. The shower head is so high that the average women (5'4" is the U.S. average) can barely reach it to adjust the direction or spray. How about going to the European style of shower hear, the one that slides up and down on a rod, so that any size person can have a comfortable shower. Also the brand of soap in the shower does not rinse off well with the softened water - think about choosing toiletries that are compatible with the local water!Finally, the towels in our room (cleverly hidden under the sink, not anywhere convenient for the user) were so rough and worn that I'd give them to local animal shelter, not to a paying guest.Bathroom: looks 10, functionality 2.

We were anticipating traveling somewhere else but a winter storm changed our plans and we headed to NYC for a couple days. We booked this hotel because rates were good on a third party website. We didn't want to stay on busy Time Square but still close enough to things to walk. We picked this place and are happy we did. The room was cozy but clean and perfect for the two of us. We didn't spend much time there anyway. The breakfast was adequate, good enough to get us started for the day. The staff was friendly and accommodating. NYC hotels can be so variable. We live less than two hours away but like to stay at least one night when we go just to take in all the city has to offer. We will definitely stay here again.

Lovely, spanking clean hotel close to everywhere- well everywhere midtown. Breakfasts varied every morning, hot food was hot and fresh and replenished quickly.Room big enough and beautifully maintained and cleaned daily to very high standard.Staff lovely- friendly and really happy to help with any query. Visited during record breaking cold snap in NYC , could have done with an extra blanket but then I should have asked.A little noise occasionally from street but this was a city after all.Thoroughly recommend this hotel, our 5 nights there were great.

Very good hotel location and good value for the price you pay. But the room is somehow too cold (even with the central heating), and I had to wear down jacket inside my room...and asked for an extra blanket.

This is a great hotel. Small but quaint. Tiny rooms but quiet and clean. Excellent concierge service, a big thanks to Andre at the desk and Ryan the bell boy...your help to make our trip special did not go unnoticed....thank you so much for all your help and suggestions in making our trip to New York fun. Excellent hotel, no complaints. Free breakfast (great selection). Very close to Big Bus stop #3

We stayed at The Best Western Premier Herald Square from January 23rd to the 25th 2015. We have used the Best Western chain numerous times in the past but this was our first experience staying at their 'flagship' Premier hotels. To say we were less than impressed is an understatement.Never having stayed in New York before I was not surprised that our room was small, real estate is expensive. That said our room did not even have a proper closet just a small wardrobe tucked in the corner. None of the amenities we have come to expect were present including a microwave, refrigerator or even a bar fridge. The room was nice enough, if a little garishly decorated, but so tiny that our night stands were shelves bolted to the wall.Breakfast was included with our stay which was nice but it is served in the basement adjacent to housekeeping and the gym. Hardly an appealing place to eat and we were served on plastic plates with accompanying plastic cutlery.There are definitely some good things about this hotel. The location was good and the desk staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly. Those two things are what induced an average rating, without them this would have been a 1star. "Premier?" I think not.

We stayed two nights pre-cruise, hotel very clean, beautiful hotel, should be under 5 star listing, excellent location to major sites. Staffs are very friendly and helpful, they make it a memorable stay. Good breakfast. Would definitely stay here on my next trip to new york.

We choose this location as it was within walking distance from Penn Station also if you are flying into the city. It's a very convenient location, close by you can walk to Macys, the streets where all the restaurants are (and I don't mean chain restaurants around Times Square), and also close to the Big City Bus Tour. The staff was helpful, recommended the best bus tour, we had tea, water, coffee in the lobby and the room was clean and small but figured as much since it was NY. Would highly recommend.

We choose this location as it is close to Macy's and found that it is close to a the subway and reasonably close to Time Square. The decor was great, staff exceptional and breakfast was pretty good. If anything, it is a bit far from a good selection of restaurants as Hell's Kitchen is a good 20 - 30 minute walk but other than that central and close to the attractions. It took me awhile to figure out that there are not a lot of liquor stores in Manhattan so if you like to relax with a cocktail or wine in the evening, it might be a good idea to pick up a bottle before getting to the hotel. We did make Happy Hour at the Bar a couple of nights which worked out well. I frequently stay at Best Westerns and am never disappointed

All the staff we encountered were friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. While the room was small it was well laid out to make the best use of the space. Central location made for easy travel to tourist attractions. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

I'll give this place 4-stars and I'll tell you why. BWs don't always have a stellar rep east of the Mississippi. I've found they are a more reliable stay when in the Western US. Maybe times are a changing. Based on a great AAA price of $86 plus tax and the other great reviews, I decided to risk it. I was pleasantly surprised. I thought the service was very friendly. I got a 15th floor room facing north. The window wall slants in -- a cool design feature on the upper floors. The room was clean. the view was spectacular. The LEED Platinum Bank of America building spire is the focal point. I liked the funky wall art. Everything worked. I have two complaints -- there was a weird elevator machinery clicking noise AND like many other hotels with limited bathroom shelf space, they put the bath towels beneath the sink and while they put them as far from the toilet as possible, in my mind, still too close... Oh well, nothing is perfect. Tip, they have a free breakfast with hot food selections -- that's a good deal! And make sure you go to Culture on 38th and 6th for some amazing coffee -- after your free breakfast, of course. Cheers!

I stayed here for 3 nights in January during the slow season and overall enjoyed my stay. Since it was slow season the rate was excellent compared to normal prices in NYC. I think however If I would have paid the regular season rate I would have been disappointed. The location is excellent with easy access to transportation including Penn Station and you are within walking distance to many sights and Times Square. I took the LIRR in from JFK and it was very easy to get to the hotel. The hotel is not big but has a small lobby and bar area, as well as a an exercise room and a breakfast area downstairs. Breakfast was adequate every morning and the coffee was hot! The room itself was typical for NYC and is good for one or two people. My room was on the second floor facing the back so it did not have much of a view. The one thing I did not like was the pillows. The bed is comfortable but the pillows are not very soft and they do not offer any alternatives. Other than that, my stay was fine for the three nights.

There are two things that matter in a hotel: towels and sheets. This Best Western got both right. We visited for a week on our trip to NYC, and loved it. Concierge were very helpful in getting us directions to subway lines and making recommendations on where to eat (and right-on I may add). In addition, the lounge downstairs has a killer barista who mixed me one of the best drinks I've ever had. Are the rooms small? Yes. But you are in New York city! Every single space is small. I think we were the loud room on the floor, because we didn't hear a single noise the entire time we were there. Our room faced the courtyard and we had a blast window-watching the offices across (I understand the ugly naked guy thing in Friends now!). My husband and I are spoiled brats and like new or recently updated hotels, which was perfect because this one was new. It well off-set the smallness of the room. Although our toddler, when he walked in, ran to the other side of the room and started crying once he realized there wasn't a door through which to run further. I guess his thing is space. But he didn't chip in for the bill, so whatever. If you're traveling during Thanksgiving, this is your gem! It stands on the street that's closed off to the public. The only way anyone can stand at this prime parade spot is if they live or have a business on this street. We arrived to the parade at 9:30 (as in not 6:00a.m. as every review on the internet I've read recommended) and were able to get a table at a burger joint on the corner with a beautiful indoor view of the parade. Crap. Why did I tell you that? This was supposed to be my secret for life!Anyways. We really enjoyed our stay, and will absolutely come back!

Excellent place for an excellent price. If you need a hotel in Manhatten that's the place to go. Location close to Penn station. Fly to Philadelphia and take AMTRAK to Penn station; cheaper the to fly to New York and use a taxi to go to Manhatten. Car parking might be a problem.

This was my first Best Western hotel in the US (the other time was in Italy outside the Rome airport). I must say it was a great stay for one night. It's located just blocks from Penn Station and not too far off from the main Square. It is a super inexpensive hotel (for NYC standards), but is clean and modern with a fresh look. The room was small, but you're only sleeping there since you'll be out all day shopping and taking in sights! Lobby staff were helpful and friendly.

We were delightfully surprised by all aspects of the hotel, from the outstanding helpful staff to the chic decor, high quality amenities (e.g., scented soap), and nicely served breakfast. Although we are frequent NYC visitors who prefer the relative calm of the Upper West Side, we would definitely stay here again .

Very good choice of a hotel right off of 5th Avenue. Clean with all of the required services. If you're not looking for a fancy NYC Lobby which few need anyway, this place offers a simple clean modern room and the good price includes breakfast which is a big savings and convenience. Wifi is included in the rate and there's also a fitness center which is really just a room with a couple of things, but if you just want to get in some exercise to keep the routine it's good to have. I wanted to get leave my things somewhere in the morning and they were happy to take it into storage and give me receipts so I didn't have to worry about being in between hotels for the day. There is some noise from the street and not the place if a great urban view is what you're looking for.

I felt like it is my 2nd home. They treated us like friends. I like their warm hospitality and tea/coffee service at lobby all day. They serve tea/coffee 24/7. I like to sip tea before bedtime or at nights. Their hospitality exceed my expectations because they went the extra mile for me and my guests what we needed. The hotel's rooms are not spacious and they are designed like almost Manhattan's apartment size.

This small hotel is wonderful. Upgraded, upscale rooms, with what appeared to be only 6 rooms per floor. Phenomenal location, great staff. Free breakfast. Terrific price. A complete find for travelers of all tastes.

For the price in NYC, this is a great deal. Lovely room, beautifully decorated - we had a king on the 13th floor. Good location. Small but functional. Closet really small, no more than a couple of days of clothes can fit. Coffee maker was cheap, but that's not what I go to NYC for. Starbucks at the corner. Staff was professional and welcoming. Would definitely stay here again.

This hotel was such good value for what we paid. NYC can be so expensive to stay in, but this was a find! It was in the perfect location for us as we could easily walk to our Broadway show (even in 20 degree weather!), and go in either direction to get to our favorite restaurants and stores. We usually stay at Kimpton but the room size at this Best Western were even roomier than the Kimpton we stayed at last time. And the location was much better!

I stayed at this hotel as a suggestion. I was pleased to find out te hotel was clean and in a great location in NYC. Staff was courteous and the value was exceptional! Having breakfast included was key. The lounge and the fitness center were an added bonus.

This is a Somali boutique hotel right in the center of New York City and close to Macy's, Times Square and major attractions. Good people work here and prices are great too! There is also a free breakfast and rooms have designer couture touch with small spaces.

My stay here is always a pleasure, the staff is kind and accomodating as well as respectful ov ones privacy. They offer great ameninties and I love that the building is eco certified. Last time I was there there was no hot water but I'm sure that was an isolated incident and I did not call the problem down so it is my fault I did not have them look into it, I guess I didn't mind enough to push it.

Nice hotel, reasonable price, with friendly staff. The rooms are small, but clean and quiet. The location near Times Square is fantastic! The breakfast was ok, despite I don't like plastic cutlery in plastic. I'd stay here again.

This hotel is perfectly situated by Times Square. My bf and I are big-time walkers, but I would still consider this easily 'walking distance' to most of the major NY museums by normal human standards. The front desk staff were all friendly and helpful.The room was nice and modern and the bed was suuuper comfy. We stayed in room 1305 and were told we'd have a view of the Empire State Building but it was definitely just a view of the cute, old apartment building across the street. It would have been nice to see the skyline, but we were in the room furthest from the elevator and, considering that there's absolutely NO soundproofing between rooms and the hall, (seriously almost half an inch of light shining under the door that I had to stop up with a towel) I suspect that I would have slept much worse in the other rooms. We could hear every voice in the hall all night and of course guests will be coming and going at all hours by Times Square. We heard every door handle turn, every door slam, the ice machine, the elevator chirps, everything. I don't know that I've ever had a more frequently interrupted sleep and this was a mid-week after the holidays were finished.I'm also amazed by how much light was in the room. The tv glowed in two places and had to be covered up, the smoke detector had a bright green LED light, the light under the door, the thermostat if in use and even the window. I can't understand why BW would use blackout curtains cut to fit within the window, it just means that you have a rectangle of light shining all around the edge.The free breakfast cafe used entirely disposable dishes and utensils, not even reusable coffee mugs which seemed like incredibly, incredibly excessive waste. It was also pretty much all pastries and baked goods so if you can't eat grains, you won't really be getting a free breakfast. The 'hot' foods were microwaved bacon, sausage and pre-cooked microwave omelets (ugh, the texture was unforgettable). It seemed like all of their hots were just microwaved foods. This was also the only restaurant I saw in New York that had a 'B' rating from the health inspector. We tried to eat reasonably well, but both had mild stomach aches from the breakfasts.All in all, you'll get a GREAT location for an average New York price and I'd highly recommend ear plugs, a sleeping mask and breakfast elsewhere if you feel like this is still the hotel for you.

We stayed here 1/13/2015, arriving about a half hour earlier than the posted check-in time. We were given no hassle about being early, which was a pleasant surprise. The hotel validates your parking ticket which discounts it down to $35. The facilities were SUPER clean, recently renovated, and the staff was extremely accommodating and welcoming! The price was fair, we paid $189 for 4 of us, taxes included. The room was smaller than I had anticipated but had some of THE most comfortable beds EVER! The complimentary breakfast included MANY selections and was fresh and tasty. I'd stay there again in a second!

It was our first trip to New York. We wanted a hotel located near Madison Square Garden, Central Park, Times Square etc. This hotel is! Room was very comfortable and quiet. Hotel's staff - very friendly all the way. Thank you! Compared to european standards breakfast was also OK.New York.. We will be back. Amazing city and lot's to do. Seen Knicks, Rangers and Billy Joel. Great honeymoon. Greetings, Juho & Anni from Finland

Great hotel in a great location. Breakfast good, rooms a bit small but ample. Showers very good. Would definitely recommend this hotel. We ate in O'Reilly's on 35th. St. and it was very good. Also ate in the Italian restaurant in Macy's, very expensive and was not great. Go early to Ellis Island, queue was really long when we got back to Battery Park, approx 11:30.

Clean rooms. Decent breakfast. Incredibly helpful staff. Great central location. Came on a business trip with 7 others. Definitely staying here in the future. Rooms are a bit tight, but beds are comfortable

This hotel is a hidden gem in the heart of NYC. The staff is caring and we will definitely use this hotel for future trips. The breakfast was excellent and we were very happy with the nice bar that was open for happy hour. If you are looking for a great NYC experience close to Herald Square, stay here!

My husband and I have recently stayed at other Best Western Plus or Premier properties in NYC and California and were very pleased with them, rating them 4 or 5 stars. Based on those good experiences, we decided to try this Best Western Premier but our expectations were not met. But the hotel is in a good location for tourists, has comfortable beds, and offers an ample breakfast--this will be enough for many people.When staying at hotels we always request a high floor and a room away from the elevator and ice/soda machines. At this hotel we did get the 17th floor, but the layout of each floor meant that all rooms were pretty close to the elevator--and ours was diagonally across from it. Still, it might have been OK except for the frequent sounds that seemed to come from the elevator even when it wasn't stopping at our floor. At first it sounded like someone coughing outside our room, but later we realized the sound was mechanical, and the repetition of the sound drove me a bit crazy--but I may be more sensitive to noise than other people. Other noise issues were due to other guests loudly slamming doors (or more accurately, letting the door slam instead of holding it so it closes more quietly) and hearing the neighbors talking and laughing in the room (an indication of thin walls or poor soundproofing). Wearing earplugs at night did help some, but we did not sleep well. The other problem affecting sleep was a heating system that alternated between chilly and too hot when set at what for us is usually a comfortable temperature; we asked the hotel to check this on the second day and they did try to fix it, but it still was not consistently comfortable at night. Another maintenance issue had to do with the shades for the floor-to-ceiling windows. When we checked in we could not pull one of the shades all the way down, and we called the desk to request that they fix it or move us to another room. They sent someone up but he was not able to fix it completely, though he was able to pull it down enough that it kept most of the light out of the room. We agreed to stay in the room if they could fix it completely the next day while we were out. When we came back to the room in the afternoon, the shade was fixed but there was a much bigger problem--there were bits of dust or dirt all over the bed, apparently from where they put the shade while they were working on it. Also, although the bed was made up, the rest of the room had not been cleaned--dirty towels still on the floor, wastebaskets full, etc. Since I saw the housekeeper down the hall and thought she had just forgotten to finish the room due to the shade repair going on, I brought her the dirty towels and the wastebaskets and requested that she give me new towels. She did so, but she never came in to finish cleaning the room. I reported these issues to the front desk and was told that the rooms are serviced around 2:30-3 (we had come back a little earlier than that) and that they would ask housekeeping to do it when we went back out. We did go back out soon after, but when we came back the bathroom surfaces obviously still had not been cleaned. Add that to the fact that when we checked in there was toilet paper in the toilet (not dirty, but still disconcerting), and I was very disappointed in the housekeeping at this hotel. Perhaps it was partly due to misunderstanding and poor timing, but I expect better at a Best Western Premier.

The location was good, our room was recently updated and nicely decorated, and the beds were very comfortable. The staff was stellar. Every employee I ran across, from the front desk to the maids to a maintenance worker I saw in the lobby, went out of their way to provide exceptional customer service. They didn't wait to be asked, they proactively sought to make the hotel stay and the trip to New York as pleasant as possible. I have stayed at a lot of hotels at a lot of price points, and this staff was by far the best I've ever encountered.

One of the Top place that I have been too absolutely loved it. Very friendly and welcoming atmosphere.walking distance to all of entertainment facilities . Clean and spacious .Definitely recommend it.

Stayed here over New Year for 5 nights. Taxi from JFK was $62. Staff are fab, especially Erica (breakfast) Andre, Lou and Edwin. Rooms not the biggest (family of 4) but we managed. We were next to lift but not really an issue. Got a street side room so not the best view and lots of traffic noise and music, but we slept ok. rooms nicely decorated and clean. Beds quite comfy too. Wardrobe very small and only a few hangers. There is a room safe which will hold iPads etc. Breakfast is included and you shouldn't be disappointed. Hot food changes daily but even for a non meat eater still found something. For a Brit we missed baked beans not being an option lol. Daily choice of cereals,porridge,pastries,cakes, bagels, toast,yogurts,fruit and then varying hot options eg waffles, pancakes,omelettes,bacon,scrambled egg etc. Nice to find decent orange juice. Plastic plates & cutlery odd but not a problem. The breakfast staff (Erica) are great. Really friendly. We never had a problem getting a table either. Reception guy Andre is a jolly giant. Really helpful and fun. Lou and Edwin great guys too. Hotels location is fab, and FREE Wi-Fi. We had a great time and if we came back to NY would def try to stay at this hotel again. Maceys a couple of blocks one direction, Empire State the other way, and a McDonald's, papa johns and small grocery store round the corner. Times Square bout 5-10mins walk. NY public library nearby too. Would recommend getting a Big Bus pass. We had 2day deluxe which does uptown, downtown, Brooklyn, night tour and includes a cruise past Staue of Liberty & the Islands and bridges. Reception sell these tickets. If you don't have a planned itinerary ride the bus and see the sights and work out where you want to go/get off the next day. The Brooklyn tour goes from near where you catch the ferry for Lib Island and 9/11 is also down this end of town so plan your day! Starbucks are everywhere, but we struggled to find a diner/restaurant with vegetables on the menu Applebys near Times Square/Broadway does veg and reasonable prices too. Beware the American tax system. The price you see is + 9%Tax and tips extra. Oh, and if you want a great American cheesecake, find Juniors! If you visit Grand Central go downstairs to the food court area, so much choice, lots of seats and noise. You can people watch and really take in the non sleeping city comings and goings. A last tip, is to haggle. People on the streets selling everything, from food& drinks, to pictures, photos, landmark booklets, etc etc. Enjoy your stay!

When we arrived we were greeted with big & friendly smiles. Our room was on 6th floor and was beautifully clean. The breakfast was brilliant to! The only negatives I would give is that when we were there the weather was so so cold our room was cold & the heating wouldn't warm it up enough. The window sill was metal and it had thick frost on it to! The other negative was the road was so so noisy!!! Sirens & people shouting but we then bought ear plugs which resolved it. Even though I had the negatives I will stay there again.

My family was welcomed by the very competent staff. We went to our room and gazed out the window at the Empire State Building. The room was clean, and at every turn the staff genuinely wanted to help us. Maps, personal reviews or eating establishments, and walking directions were easily offered. If you have a choice for a good clean place.... STAY HERE

I had low expectations but was very pleased. The hotel is very clean! It is very quiet! The location in midtown is excellent for museum and theater going. Free breakfast is a plus and it was decent! Good coffee, yogurt, great pastries. Price cannot be beat! We paid 100 bucks per night inclusive of taxes. Small room but it is NYC and we only slept there. I would stay here again, no doubt.

Nice experience in the strategic location in NY. Not fancy, not luxury or any high top hotel. But... you do not bloody NY prices for it. Staff is very friendly indeed. I believe it is nice place to stay if you are going for business or on budget to NY. Breakfast is rather simple, but included in hotel stay. As a dowsed I would count very "thin" doors in the hotel room creating noise from outside. WiFi is not speedy, but free.

Very friendly staff, great location (near subway stations, 5th Avenue, Times Square, Macy's, Empire State Building, etc.), very clean, great beads, TV does have every channel's, very good breakfast (specialy if you eat early), very good Wi-Fi. The Rooms are a litle bit to small specially if traveling with children.

This hotel was very close to times square, the subway and lots of shopping. The staff were very pleasant and helpful; however, I found the room I stayed in very small and had no refrigeration or microwave. If you are going to New York, for a short time, for example 3-4 days it will be ok, but I would not recommend it for an entire week vacation.

Clean comfortable simple updated room but small, free breakfast, centrally located - less than $100 a night in NYC - excellent value. Have stayed here with my husband and also another time with family. A little crowded for family of four because of small room but the value is amazing.

Stayed at this hotel in midtown Manhattan, very good location. Close to subways, Times Square, great walking streets, Broadway shows....what better location can you hope for? But, the best things about this hotel was the friendly staff. Very helpful with everything. Rooms are clean, great beds, pillows, up-to-date TV's. Breakfast included and very good. Usually one would think that an included breakfast at a hotel chain would be below par but it certainly was not. Hot food and many choices. Can't recommend this hotel enough. Nothing fancy mind you, not great views (but to get high floor hotel rooms in The Big Apple is going to cost you a heck of a lot more than this fine hotel which is reasonably priced. Staff can't be beat. We go back to NYC often and will always stay at the Best Western on Herald Square. Thank you staff....Joe and Diane Stevens.

We chose this hotel because we got a good rate and it was a pleasant surprise. Excellent service. Clean Rooms. Free breakfast, if you're on a budget. Perfect location, if you're a tourist. Close to many subway lines so you can easily get around. Upgrade to the executive king rooms on the top two floors. These rooms are large for New York standards and have a quintessential NYC view. My only complaint is the low lighting in the bathroom, otherwise good option in the city.

Check-in and Check-out was simple and uncomplicated. The room was small and comfortable; but we did not go to New York to stay in a hotel room. Located in Midtown the hotel was convenient to everything.

Stayed 5 nights in this hotel 17-22 Dec, I spent a lot of time researching, I wanted to stay in a central location but didn't want to spend a lot of money, the hotel is in an excellent position, Madison sq gardens, Macy's, times sq and Empire State Building are all a stones throw away, staff are all friendly and helpful, rooms are spotless and have everything you could need (hair dryer, safe, iron, toiletries, drink facilities, etc) the free breakfast was excellent and there was a good selection, there are quite a few places to eat and drink close by to the hotel, the keg room opposite the hotel was great for food or just a drink. I would definitely stay here again and recommend to anyone.

Enjoyed this < 2 year old location's easy walking distance to Broadway theaters, Grand Central Terminal, Macys, Empire State Building, as well as Fifth Avenue shopping. Spotless rooms with everything you could need including large showers, IHome, free wifi, sizable flatscreens and an onsite bar. Helpful staff offered bag hold and cabs. Hot full breakfast - with ready-made waffles one morning - was excellent. Hotel offers a great value and a memorable visit!

Recently experienced 5 fantastic days in the heart of New York - my wife an myself stayed at the Best Western Herald Square, just off 5th Avenue - which was ideally located for our holiday - everything we wanted to see and visit was in easy walking distance - the Empire State Building, Ground Zero, Central Park, not to mention my birthday lunch at Keens Steakhouse in West 36th Street, a truly fantastic experience - Brilliant.

Room was exceptionally clean. Staff are extremely accommodating. Breakfast is very generous for all tastes. Location is perfect for a visit to NYC. I've worked in the hotel business for many years and must comment that this place far exceeded my previous employers establishments in NYC for about half the price!

Attended a function at Madison Square Garden with my daughter and needed a nice place with 2 beds for the stay. Was impressed with the room's cleanliness and the modern condition of the entire facility. A great value.

I am not sure why this hotel was deemed "Premier". I have stayed at many Best Western Plus and they had more amenities than this hotel. There was not a mini fridge or microwave in the room, very low light in the bathroom, the Elevators were loud and slow, and the only vending machine was located on the bottom floor and was broken. My expectations were high since I have never stayed at a Best Western Premier, but I ended up disappointed. Live and Learn.....

This hotel is in a great location! The breakfast was very good! The staff was very friendly and helpful!! The only downfall is the size of the room and the noise level on the street (but that was expected in NYC)! Room size is cozy for 2 people. Would definitely recommend and stay here again!!

We booked a room for 2 nights, and I must say, it was a wonderful experience. Starting from the front desk staff, to the room, to breakfast, it was all amazing. The location of this hotel is central to any, and almost everything in the city. Times square, Rockefeller Center, Empire State Building, ground zero.. all literally minutes away. Great modern look and feel to this newly renovated property. Breakfast was buffet style, and very tasty. I would definitely recommend this room to travelers and friends/family if visiting NYC. The front desk staff made it even more worth the while! Thanks Best Western Premier. Looking forward to our next stay in March!

Was a great location for visiting NYC. Many attractions were located in a 9 block radius and the parking accommodations were really great. The breakfast was very nice and was very good. Clean, comfortable and a very good staff who helped with all our needs.

My husband and I just got back from spending 3 nights at the Best Western Herald Square. This was a great hotel... especially for the price! The location is great... less than 2 blocks from Macys and close to EVERYTHING... just a 11 minute walk to Times Square. The hotel is on 36th street and right down from several others. The reception area was warm and inviting with great service. We were on the 15th floor in a King room. Let me saw, the room is small, but very well laid out. Nice 32' flat screen with Direct TV. Comfortable bed and more than adaquate bathroom. Large shower area too. For two people... the room was fine. There are only 6 rooms on each floor with 2 elevators. We never had to wait on the elevator! Breakfast area was below the lobby... nice selection with bacon and eggs, no complaints. This hotel has a bar in the back and had great happy hour specials.If you're coming to the City... and looking for a modern, clean, friendly and convinient hotel, not to mention reasonably priced.... this is the place for you!

Excellent location. 2-3 minute walk to Metro. We had the executive king room which is larger than most of the other rooms. Still it was small compared to most places we stay, but then again, that's NYC. Front desk was friendly, remembered our names and were very helpful. The complimentary breakfast was really good and of course saved us time and money. Would definitely stay there again. Recommended.

Booked a room for 4 with double beds on an overnight stay after a show at the nearby Hammerstein Ballroom. Clean and comfortable, room appeared newly refurbished. Great shower and modern bath. Parking next door. Highly recommended

Multiple issues with handicap room including flooding bathroom and lips on floor into the room and bathroom!!! Room and doorways too narrow to maneuver wheelchair. When I told the desk about the flooding I was told they knew. (So why not fix it?) An accident waiting to happen Also I had a free night voucher and they charged me $597.00 for second night! My husband checked the price a few days before we left and it was $295.00 a night so we paid the same for one night as they charged for 2 nights. Which means we did not really get a free night! So I called the hotel after we got back and they said too bad ( not quite in those words) and the hotel manger never called me back!!! We used BW for all 9 nights in a west coast trip to get my free night.

Immaculate, boutique, Best Western well-located in Herald Square (36th St between 5th and 6th), walk-able to Penn Station, J.P. Morgan Library and Museum, and a wonderful Italian restaurant Ai Fiori at 400 Fifth Avenue on the second floor of the Langham Palace Hotel. The TV remote is disinfected after every guest. This may be easy to accomplish as it's a smaller hotel with only six rooms per floor. Room 1205 was very quiet. It was also very small, two people would be very cozy.There is a complimentary breakfast which had a surprising amount of hot foods (cream of wheat, waffles, egg souffle-type dish) on level "C" which smelled good as you walked down the hall. The dining room is small so I'd imagine at peak times it could be crowded.My only suggestion for management is that it would be nice to have an extra blanket in the closet. Each room has its own thermostat but it does take a while to heat up.An excellent choice if you want a clean room in a good location.

I came to NYC with my daughter for our first extended visit, chose this hotel based on other traveler's reviews and found them to be very accurate. It is a wonderful location and made for convenient walking, shopping and sightseeing. The staff was very accommodating and helpful with any questions. It simplified planning to have breakfast at the hotel. I would certainly recommend this hotel to my friends.

This hotel was perfect for a trip with a few of my friends. We got two rooms right beside each other, which we were very happy with. It's a great location for walking to various restaurants, bars, tourist attractions, shopping, and the subway. The morning staff at the front desk were extremely helpful and very nice. Special thanks to Andre and Lou, who gave us great suggestions on restaurants and subway instructions! The rooms were on the smaller side, but very comfortable. We were only really there to sleep anyway lol and the bathroom was spacious enough to get ready in and not feel cramped. Also, the hot complimentary breakfast in the morning was a great start to the day! I would for sure stay here again!

Stayed here with husband for 4 nights over Thanksgiving weekend. Staff were all very professional and friendly. Rooms are small but perfectly adequate. Location is excellent. Free breakfast was very good. Can't recommend highly enough.

We had a great experience! we had 2 rooms ...they were able to put us right next door to each other. The rooms were VERY clean. The staff was very helpful and friendly! We would definitely stay here again!!

This hotel is so lovely. The staff ,especially Lou on the front door,he so funny and full of good information , the food , the location and most of all very clean. The room was on the 15th floor with a view of the Empire State Building the room was so nice and quiet. The breakfast was really good after the initial shock of plastic knives and forks and the plates,but a what a good idea. A nice little touch was hot drinks always available in reception.The hotel is a nice walking distance to Times Square and the Empire State Building was just around the corner. We walked both with ease. Lots of nice shops on the way,we also picked up the tickets for the tour bus in Times Square to. All in all I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

I stayed at this hotel with two friends while visiting New York. It was perfect! It was clean and the staff was friendly! They have a small but cozy bar and continental breakfast. The location was within walking distance from Times Square and Rockefeller Center. I would definitely stay at this hotel again!

This hotel is centrally located, (just off the main road, so quieter) walking distance from metro trains, shopping & tourist attractions eg Empire State Building, Bryant Park.The rooms may be small, however they are well maintained & very clean & the bed is super comfortable. The staff are very friendly & "Lou " in the front office is a great source of all information, trains, bus & general walking directions. I would recommend to all friends visiting New York for leisure

Lovely hotel- everywhere felt very clean, breakfast was great quality & good selection (not the same stuff every day!), comfortable beds, excellent location with Herald Square a 2 min walk away & plenty of bars/deli's/restaurants on the doorstep, great bath room with good shower& every member of staff we encountered were friendly & very helpful. The only 1 not so good thing is the usual 'small rooms' complaint with hotel rooms in NYC-3 girls in a 2 queen beds room with luggage & lots of shopping was a very tight squeeze, though I would guess if you were a couple in a king room it might be more spacious so I wouldn't let that put you off. We aren't that easily pleased, but all agreed we would come back again so thumbs up :-)

I like this hotel because it's within walking distance of Penn Station. Staff is friendly. Rooms are small, but it's New York City. Easy walk from this hotel to Macy's, Empire State Building, and the restaurants of Korea Town.

This gem is centrally located in Manhattan near Times Square. The room was super clean and our King size bed was a DREAM!! Current Taxi ride is $52+tip from JFK. Nice little patio out front as well a bar and patio in the back.

I would HIGHLY recommend you consider staying at this hotel. The hotel only has 6 rooms on every floor but all are comfortable, clean and decent size. I believe having a smaller hotel is a bonus, because the staff gets to know you and know your needs. The perks of this hotel are: the staff will go above and beyond to help you, the hotel offers breakfast, you can store your luggage both before you get into your room or after you exit the room, the NRQ is just a horse shoe around the corner, Broadway is just a few walking blocks away, Macy's is 2 short blocks away and you have various dinner options with a full price range. My room offered a awesome view of the Empire State Building which was very impressive at night. I would highly recommend this hotel for my DECA and VEI groups.

This is my second stay at a BW Premier property (second location), and I have to say I am still a fan. Their hotels are clean, well kept, and the staff were very helpful with logistics and needs near and away from the hotel. The rooms are a bit on the small side, but from a a business trip perspective and a 'getting out to see the sights' perspective this was not an issue at all. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and colleagues looking for a centrally located hotel that doesn't break the bank.

Everything is nice about this place except the size of the rooms. We were booked for three nights but left after the first because we couldn't stand it. It might be fine for a single traveler but no good for two.

The hotel was pretty good. Small rooms, but typical of New York City boutique type of hotel. Staff very nice and room clean except for one large dust ball in the bathroom. We had a family emergency and had to cancel our second night and the staff was very cooperative.

We were very happy to have chosen this Hotel before our cruise. It is conveniently located if you arrive at Penn Station with Amtrak or The Port Authority Bus Terminal with Greyhound. It is an easy Taxi ride to Manhattan Cruise Port (about $14.00 + Tip). We were within a walking distance of Time Square, Empire State Building, Macy's store, Bus Tour Stops etc. We arrived very early and Lou at reception took care of storing our luggages. He also helped us choosing the right Tour because our room would be ready only later in the afternoon. The King Executive room was spotless and large enough for two. Large full length windows. Nice shower in bathroom. Comfortable bed. Complimentary breakfast was included. We would definitely return. Thanks to all the staff and again Special Thanks to Lou who did the outmost to welcome us and take care of us. More than we could have imagined. By the way Lou, Puerto Rico is still beautiful. Best memories from Cleve & Diane (Oct. 24th).

Room to small for more than 2 people. No room to move around. Closet way to small to store luggage or even hang clothes. They should remove the ironing board and hand somewhere else as that takes up the whole closet with it facing frontward. Nice linens, amenities (should have had more for 4 people), very clean and well appointed. Staff by far is the best I ever experienced at a Best Western. Everyone from the front desk to the baggage handler, and the bartender were exceptional. and should be commended.

Hotel was comfortable, not too small (room fit 4 ladies!), very clean, seems new. Located couple of block from Empire State building and in the middle on Manhattan (walking distance to everything!). Highly recommend

The room was great and the staff was very nice.They had the best free breakfast I've had.They had good parking very close. We really liked the location as well with close subway access and a short walk to times square.

For ages we looked onto visiting New York with our two sons 12 and 14 years old. We have stayed at Best Western hotels before in Europe and we're not disappointed with this hotel. Located a few blocks from Time Square and just round the corner from Macys and the Empire State Building. The hotel was very modern although are family room was quite tight with the two double beds on it. Great shower room and well equipped. Breakfast was served in the smart basement refectory and there was a great deal of choice. The staff were friendly and Lou the concierge was full of info of best restaurants and tourist hints. We took the Big Bus tour which is a great way to see the city and allows you to hop on and off as you please. You will not see New York properly unless you do this trip honestly it was the best thing we did. We did the north loop first which took in Harlem and round Central Park. the next morning the south loop down to Wall Steet, Freedom Tower and Liberty Ferry. We did Empire State Building at night shock was Breathtaking (expect to queue in NY) the Rockefeller Centre (the Rock) we visited during the day and you need to book. The Rock was one of the many highlights of this trip as the views are stunning. Some hints - get yellow cab from ranks at JFK ($58) set fee. Def do Big Bus Tour. Go to a show - buy tickets at Time Square during the day. Visit 9/11 Memorial and museum. We didn't bother with the New York cards and voucher systems just turned up and paid, NY is expensive so just go for it. Visit the Village (Greenwich) as New Yorkers call it and most of all Go to Central Park. Take comfortable shoes. Have a great time.Sent from my iPhone

I really enjoyed my stay at the Best Western. The facilities were clean, in good shape, and comfortable. The location was easy walking distance between Penn and Grand Central, which makes it convenient to the whole city.

The location was excellent! Comfortable beds and pleasant staff. The staff always asked us if we needed any help with directions etc when we were leaving. The room was clean, the decor was nice and it was an average size for NYC. We can't wait to come back!!

Stayed with my wife for one night .Had a very nice time.Hotel is in a very convenient location, close to grand central, resteraunts and the subway.The hotel was very clean and the staff was very professional and helpful.Our room was roomy and the floor to floor windows gave a great view.We would come back anytime . It was also nice that breakfast was included as many hotels do not come with it.

Very pleasant and convenient for exploring the Big Apple. B/w 5th and 6th Avenue , so ready access to uptown and downtown buses (half price for seniors - need $1.25 exact change, transfer free). Breakfast included in price and it's a  complete hot buffet that changes daily. Coffee and tea to-go right by the elevators. Room is VERY clean.

Had a great experience at this hotel. close to everything we wanted to do. A little high priced but worth it. Friendly staff and clean all around. Nice rooms a little small but works for what we needed.

The entrance to the hotel may not be particularly grand but I found all the staff most helpful and cheerful. The rooms are small but perfectly adequate and are kept clean. Good location for this part of town.

Great Location for Metro, shopping and sigthseeing. Very clean and excellant and helpful staff. Breakfast is good and you get enough, The rooms are a bit small but it goes for 3 persons, because you're the whole day away. We would go there again for sure.

Excellent AARP rate at this modern smaller hotel in great location. Smallish rooms but with king size bed, well thought out furnishings and great walk in shower. On the list for a repeat visit for sure as the location was incredibly convenient not just for this last stay but for almost anything we would want to do in the city.

We enjoyed our stay at this centrally located hotel - 10 minute walk from Times Square and 1 block from the subway. Friendly staff and a complementary hot breakfast included. We would stay there again.

Very good hotel. Great location for Metro, taxi and shopping. Two minutes to the Empire State Building, Manhattan mall and Macy's. Very clean and modern facilities. Room was a bit small for a family of 2 adults, 2 kids and a baby, but did the expected: comfortable beds and great shower.Breakfast was fine, but not too varied.Staff was very nice but it's tips for surrounding activities was not overwhelming.We stayed two nights and the overall experience was very good.

Excellent staff. Comfortable rooms. Lou helped with our sightseeing questions. Full breakfast free. Beautiful view of empire state building at night. Shower is fantastic. I will be coming back here. Validated parking with in walming distance

The central location, the good breakfast and wifi as well as the shower in the hotel room made the stay worthwile. Times Square is not too far away and public transportation is within a 5 minute walk. We can recommend the hotel and would come back there.

Good hotel and location and really great for both uptown and downtown Manhattan, if you like walking to places. Easy access to Subway. Rooms are small but quiet. Breakfast is OK, but can be crowded. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Make sure you introduce yourself to Lou, the great Concierge, as he really prides himself in helping you with any tourist needs.

Conveniently located (Empire State, shopping, and train station is close by). Walking distance to Time Square and Broadway. Rooms were very clean, quiet and beds were comfortable. Staff was friendly and very helpful with directions.

This Best Western has a few things going for it - the rooms are clean, modern and comfortable and it is in a prime location near the subway, shopping and lots of food options. Overall I was very happy with my stay at this hotel, the sleep quality was great - very comfortable beds and pillows. The rooms are a little small but that is pretty standard in New York. There is also free breakfast and wifi which is hard to find in NYC. The breakfast is good and has lots of variety but I found the eating area a little cramped. The gym is quite small but has what you need. My two complaints are that there was one day that the elevator was not working and I had to walk 14 flights of stairs up to my room. I don't blame the hotel because these things happen but I wasn't even offered and apology let alone any sort of discount for the trouble. Also, the front desk staff could be nicer, they were adequate but could be more friendly and helpful. All in all though it was a good stay.

Perfectly situated. Could walk everywhere. Very friendly staff. Clean. Safe. Quiet. I highly recommend this hotel as a base for exploring New York. Breakfast is not of a higher quality, but if you go right and then right again on 5th avenue, on the other side of the street after a few blocks (not even 5 minutes walk), you can have an amazing breakfast at Bread and Butter. They have lots of fruits and organic produce you can buy to bring with you for the day.

It is a mixed bag: The hotel location is good, the staff in general is friendly and helpful. Rooms are small, but bathroom is ok. Breakfast is basic, but you will smell of a fry-up once you are done. Worst thing is the smell in the elevators. Every time, it stinks of marihuana which comes through the air-vents. Not something you want when you pay top dollars for a hotel, so it is not worth the money.

Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and had pleasant stay. Good location close to everything to get around sightseeing. Staff really friendly and helpful and breakfast had a good selection which changed daily. Like others have mentioned the rooms are a little small and as we were only there for a short period it was not a problem. Would recommend this hotel to stay at for all my friends and family

Stayed there 8 nights. It was a really pleasant stay! The hot beverages in the lobby saved us a lot of money. The breakfast changed everyday. There was a good selection of pancakes, eggs, porridge, yogurt, bagels, coffee, ecc.. The only problem was that there aren't trash cans for recycling.The staff is very kind and the rooms are normal size for NYC.The location is great. It's 10 minutes from the subway for jamaica, which is good if you come from JFK. Macy's, Bryant Park and Times Square are near. And the wifi is free!

Stayed here for 2 nights. Not sure what the fuss is about from previous reviews. Love the location of this hotel. It's less than 5 mins from subway and Macy's. The hotel is sort of 'boutique' ish. I do agree with previous comments that the rooms a bit small, but hey, for the price you're paying in NYC, it's a pretty good deal. Room and bathroom are well maintained with a very comfortable bed. The breakfast is basic but adequate with selection of eggs, sausages, toast, cereals, juices and yoghurt.Staff are very helpful and pleasant. Check out is at 11am but managed to get it extended to 12.For the price I've paid, I would definitely come back here again on my next visit.

From the time we arrived early they were so kind. They held our bags while we explored the city without worry, suggested a hop on hop off big bus site seeing tour that saved us a ton of money and time and was very attentive to our every needed.The room was spotless stocked with all amenities plus more and the breakfast was hot and fresh.The location was the cherry on top close to everything!Highly recommend

As others have pointed out,the hotel's title is a misnomer. Make no mistake, from the teeny tiny rooms to the plastic cups and indifferent service, this is very much a Best Western. A few modern decor touches and a decent buffet breakfast made it bearable, but only just. Paper thin walls had us waking up at 3am from noisy neighbours. And once again in the morning when we awoke to the same neighbours' hair dryer. And house keeping showed up on our checkout day at 9am. Plus, no express checkout, and no customer survey afterwards. For the price you pay, there's nothing "premier" about it.

Staff is great and customer service is much better than my prior visit. Fabulous breakfast and always respectful of my privacy. I love going to a clean hotel and this one is one of the cleanest. I would like to add that Best Western is a brand that is consistent in every location and is a HUGE reason I continue to stay loyal and return.

Clean, quiet hotel. Beds were extremely comfortable. Staff were friendly and curteous. Very helpful with directions. Within walking distance of Penn Station and TImes Square. We stayed for a week-end leisure trip and were very satisfied.

I usually enjoy staying in Best Western Premier hotels in Europe and I naively thought this hotel would offer the same quality of lodging.Unfortunately it is not the case. The size of the room, the quality of the breakfast and the noise made me think Best Western in the US don't reach the quality of their European counterparts.It is not a bad hotel, but once again, don't expect anything special from this place. It is a basic 3 stars you wouldn't pay more than $100 for. But sadly, I paid between 3 and 4 times this price...

After considerable thought, I decided to give this hotel an average rating with the understanding that for an average hotel, it was very good. Unfortunately, due to the small size of the room (king-sized bed) and the lack of counter space in the bathroom, I cannot, in good conscience, give this hotel a higher rating. However, I would certainly put this hotel at the top of any list of average hotels. It was very clean, the bed was comfortable, the décor was modern and up-to-date, and there was sufficient storage space. Additionally, the television was quite large and internet access was excellent. The breakfast that was included in cost of the room included both hot and cold choices. With a room on the 8th floor neither my wife nor I was bothered by street or construction noise. It should also be noted that this is New York City and that noise comes with the territory! I should also point out that its location is excellent, within walking distance to many of New York’s tourist attractions, as well as major subway stations. All in all, my wife and I enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would recommend it to others.

Just returned from a weekend trip to NYC. Since we were going to a concert at MSG, which eventually was cancelled, we wanted to stay close to the venue and chose this property. The hotel turned put to be a little jewel of a place. Very well located, on E. 36th St. between 5th and 6th Avenues, excellent rooms and service and a very good hot breakfast (included in room rate). I will definitely consider staying again here.

Hotel was well positioned on 36th street between 5th and 6th avenue. Hotel was clean and tidy and all staff were very friendly. It was quiet at night just far enough away from the bright lights of Broadway. I would recommend this hotel to anybody travelling to New York. There is a very friendly bar right opposite the hotel called The Keg Room which is well worth a visit.

Perfect for a more economical hotel stay in Manhattan. The Executive Kings are the way to go....above the street noise. All rooms are small, but that is reflected in the price. Breakfast was nothing special, but adequate (and affordable) to start the day, and free in room internet also was a nice perk. I would stay here again....knowing that it doesn't pretend to be upscale they deliver a good product at a fair price.

My husband and myself stayed in this hotel and enjoyed the cleanliness of the room and especially the bathroom. The bed is very comfortable and the mattress is firm ,good for my back. The location is wonderful close to everything, walking distance to Broadway, Times square, Rockefeller center, Central park, Bryant park and Empire State building. Plenty of restaurant nearby. The staff are polite and helpful. We will be back.

We stayed here for 3 nights in early September 2014. I chose the hotel for its proximity to the Empire State Building and claims of a great view from the hotel. Truth is, there are only apparently 6 rooms with such a view and chances of you landing one are slim. We got a view of back wall and not much else. The room was really small for twin beds and no fridge...But the rooms were pretty well maintained and it was a great location, with the Empire State, Macy's, Madison Square Garden and Penn Station right within walking distance. And the staff were very friendly and helpful. For NYC you really cant expect much more...We found the complimentary breakfast pretty adequate too for our needs.

We booked this on a grand opening special, so our rate was fantastic. The rate was probably what I liked most about the hotel. The hotel could not be in a better location. Just blocks away from the train station. Close enough to Times Square to walk (if you want -- or just take the train). Hotel staff was very friendly. I did not think the room was too small, but being on a budget, I wasn't expecting a very big room. It was clean and big enough for two of us to stay in comfort -- although, we spent almost the entire day exploring the city, so we were only in the room to sleep at night. Staff was friendly. We arrived early Saturday to give us an extra day, and the hotel took our bags until our room was ready. Overall, great location and great price. I would definitely recommend this place.

If you are looking for a reasonably priced and clean hotel in NYC, this is it. The amenities are average, as it isn't a true full service hotel. The king room is a tad small but was very modern and up to date as well as CLEAN. My only suggestion is that the front desk staff should be more knowledgable about the city as far as making suggestions as to where to go vs just keeping you with in a block of the hotel because that is the easiest to recommend. I would definitely stay here again!

Great Value in a great location. Close to shopping, Madision Square Garden, Penn Station and the Empire State Building. Clean pleasant room with a very friendly staff. Nice outside seating area and large breakfast area downstairs.
