Our stay at this hotel was absolutely perfect!! From the time we arrived, until we checked out, we were treated like royalty! No request we had was unmet and the staff here was quite possibly the best ever!!! They truly made my family's first trip to NYC the best trip ever! We travel a lot and I have never experienced better customer service. From front desk to housekeeping, it was sheer friendliness and professionalism! I realize I'm going on and on, but they deserve high praise and commendation! As for the rooms, they were spotless, beds were luxurious, and breakfast was awesome! We had a great hot meal each morning before heading out to sight see. I have already recommended this hotel to all of my family and friends! We cannot wait to return!!

We just have chosen this hotel, because of its perfect location in the heart of upper Manhatten. You can reach Times Square, Rockefeller center and even Empire state building by foot. Service was friendly and perfect organized, even breakdast!

Hotel exceeded my expectations for recent NYC trip. From the front desk staff to the cleaning staff everyone was extremely helpful and accommodating. Lou, the concierge was probably the best concierge ever experienced in NYC and I've always stayed at 4 and 5 star hotels on previous trips. The location is perfect, the rooms are normal sized for NYC but great space planning and there was room for everything. Baths were great, free breakfast which wasn't the best but considering it was free it was okay. Free coffee, water, tea station in lobby and one of the cleanest hotels I've ever stayed at. Kudo's to the staff and Best Western.

To be honest I picked this hotel for my points and for the great internet price. The location was also a plus. But what was just a one night stay has become my new favorite NYC hotel. The staff make the difference and the great breakfast included was another plus. Well done best western!

It was my first time in New York and we arrived there without any hotel booked. We walked around Times Square to find a hotel but didn't found one in our budget. We finally decided to go on Trivago to booked a room and found that hotel! What a great place! About 5min walk from Times Square and 2 from the Empire State Building that place is where you have to stay! Yes, the rooms are small, but you have free wifi and free breakfast (really great one! Was delicious!) which is rare in that area, the rooms are clean and beautiful, and the staff is really nice. Lou is there for u whatever you need and is a great person! We really had fun with them and enjoy our stay! We will for sure return there for our next trip! It was my first time in New York and we arrived there without any hotel booked. We walked around Times Square to find a hotel but didn't found one in our budget. We finally decided to go on Trivago to booked a room and found that hotel! What a great place! About 5min walk from Times Square and 2 from the Empire State Building that place is where you have to stay! Yes, the rooms are small, but you have free wifi and free breakfast (really great one! Was delicious!) which is rare in that area, the rooms are clean and beautiful, and the staff is really nice. Lou is there for u whatever you need and is a great person! We really had fun with them and enjoy our stay! We will for sure return there for our next trip! you need and is a great person! We really had fun with them and enjoy our stay! We will for sure return there for our next trip!

Very nice Hotel,small rooms but very attractive. The receptionists were great and very helpful with everything! Perfect location, just 6 blocks from Time Square and the 42nd street and right opposite of Macy's store. The breakfast was very taste but could had more..

Very good staff and breakfast. Room is small but attractive, clean and quiet. We arrived via Amtrak and walked to the hotel (and it was faster than taking a taxi). On site bar was small but had an outdoor patio. Friendly barmaid kept it open past 11 PM closing.

The accommodation and staff did a very well job on making our vacation as pleasant and convenient as possible. Very kind and elegant people in combination with state of the art rooms & additional features like gym and happy hour bar made our stay a very good one! without any hesitation a big A+

Great hotel right where you want to be, near all the sights and also the subway, Lou the concierge is especially helpful and is happy to assist with all queries.Had a double room which was quite small but what can you expect in a NYC hotel. The room was very clean at all times and we had a view of the Empire State if you looked hard enough!!Tea and coffee available for free in the lobby at all times and also free wifi.

staff : friendly and very helpfull rooms : small & bad sound insulation (external - street & internal - elevators , other rooms) beds : very good bathroom : adequate, nothing fancy breakfast : limited choice, plastic plates and cups, quality food ok location : noth special. maybe advantage if you only stay one/two nights for shopping. close to subway (as is every hotel midtown)

Recently spent one night at this very nice property while traveling through New York. I am a BW Platinum elite member which gives me a few extra perks but I reached that level by staying at many of the BW properties Worldwide. I can honestly say that I was very impressed by the experience here. I believe the room rates are very fair. I know some other past travelers may say that the rooms are small and may be the case but I had a sufficient size room for 2 people and a king size bed with nice view of the Empire State building from 16th floor. So the rooms are still going to be bigger than you would find in a European setting. There is a cozy little bar in the rear and I was given a free arrival drink coupon and if you have to pay, the happy hour prices are very reasonable. Rooms are nice, bed is comfortable and very nice bathroom amenities are provided. Breakfast is downstairs one level and can get crowded and put pressure on seating availability and all the food choices but I suggest go late or early to breakfast but not at prime time. There is cereal, fruit, bacon, eggs(small patties), breads/pastries, and coffee(very good), juices, etc. The location is right on, walking to many local attractions and the subway is a 5 minute walk. So everything is spot on here at this hotel and I wish to point out that the staff are very friendly and helpful. I was given a late checkout next day and they stored my bags till late night following day. I really appreciated the excellent service from Jitender, Salman, Laura, and Andre. I hope they get commended from the Management.

Great location; friendly/helpful/courteous staff; very clean. ALL of the staff we met were extremely helpful and friendly. Lou, the concierge, has great tips for sightseeing. The breakfast choices were great - hot eggs, bacon/sausage, hot oatmeal, cereal, pastries, fruit, coffee, tea, juices, milk, etc. We spent 4 days during the week - well stocked each and every day we were there - and we went at varying times each morning. Breakfast room in on the floor below the lobby. Rooms are small (but you're in NYC and this is normal for this price range) but very clean and well-kept/decorated (FYI: no tub, just shower but it's large and very nice/clean). We were on the 8th floor and there is some outside noise, but, again, you're in NYC - the city that never sleeps! If you must have complete silence to sleep, there is a CVS a couple of blocks up (5th & 38th) and they sell earplugs! We arrived early to check-in and they will hold your baggage for you until your room is ready. Also, check-out time is 11 am, and if your train/flight is leaving later (ours left at 3 pm), they will hold your baggage for you as well, free of charge (tips are appreciated). We returned at 230 to pick up our bags which were promptly retrieved. Location is great - VERY close to the Empire State Building, Macy's, and subway stops - the front desk will help with subway questions and give you a map. There is free cold water, tea and coffee available in the lobby all day. This was the first time I took my children into the city (10 and 14 years old), and we felt very comfortable and safe at this hotel. They enjoyed it as much as I did. We will be back soon and we will definitely stay here again!

My family and I recently spent a night at this hotel. Everything about it was excellent. The location is perfect. Many attractions are within walking distance and the herald square subway station is also close by. The staff was unbelievably helpful and friendly. The rooms are small, as are most in New York, but they make very good use of space. The bathrooms, especially the showers, are surprisingly large. The prices are also very reasonable for Manhattan. We will definitely stay at this hotel again the next time we visit New York.

People say excellent location : every midtown hotel between 4th & 8th has a great location, thx to NYC SubwayPoor breakfast, no variance, little choices, plastic plates and cupsWhen arriving later (but still in time 8 15). Almost everything was gone when i asked to replenish fruit and bagels, staff Said it was on first come first served baseVery small rooms for the paid pricestreetside rooms poor sound insulation : noise from street and elevator, other rooms all night long.Friendly staff ... but don t solve real problems

We picked this hotel for two reasons: Best Western rewards points and it's close to my son's college. For the location - you can walk to Times Square, Bryant Park, Empire State Building, Penn Station and Madison Square Garden - the price is very reasonable. The hotel is small, like many in the area, with just six rooms per floor and about 17 floors. thus, the rooms are quite small. But you'll be greeted with a nice clean smell, a modern look and all the amenities. The front desk staff is very friendly and helpful, especially Laura J. And the lobby always had fresh coffee and ice water available. Go ahead and take advantage of the free breakfast, since you'll drop quite a few coins eating dinner out on the town. The breakfast selection includes a nice buffet with the usual eggs, sausage and oatmeal, but they mix it up a bit each day. If you like to sleep late you'll be fighting the crowd for a seat in the dining room.

To end my UK brother&family's vacation to the US, we decided to close with a visit to NYC...and we could not be happier with my selection of the Best Western Premier. From my first phone inquiry regarding rooms and availability, to being politely greeted at our arrival and check-in, and culminating in a delightful yet all to brief stay, the staff was always personable, attentive, considerate, and mindful of their guests.  The rooms' green/purplish décor may be somewhat modernistic but I think it fits well given the hotels short 2yr existence...defiantly not boring and dated. There is no denying that the room size may suffer from some economy of scale, but they are all clean, comfortable, stocked with amenities, and very inviting. Those same words also apply to the bathroom, but I must also note that I truly adored the adjustable shower...could only wish to have one in my home.  This hotel offered all of the associated comforts and benefits of many of the large upper class chains, but seemed to provide them in a more homey manner. They offer a concierge service, weight room, complimentary refreshments, and quaint in-house bar, unfortunately it is only open until 11pm. In trying to find a more family friendly hotel another truly appreciative nicety provided with our stay was the free and quite delectable breakfast buffet, which only saved $$ and time in planning our days' NYC activities.  I could probably continue with a few more paragraphs given my delight of this hotel(having not even touched on its central location & convenience), however doing so would only make my previous words seem redundant. In truth I second guessed even leaving this glowing recommendation for fear that this little gem in the city might be consumed by the masses, leaving me with some concern should I find my way back to NYC.Great Stay,K. Gary P.

Two adults and two teenagers in a double room was tight, no doubt about it. Smallest hotel room I have ever seen but it is NY and they say they are all small. Great location. Easy walk to Times Square and Broadway. Subway station nearby and Amtrak station only a few blocks away. Good bar across the street (Irish bar of some kind). Tio Pio restaurant next door not worth it. Too many good places to eat in NY. VERY friendly front desk staff and kitchen staff in free breakfast area. Decent free breakfast with hot stuff that rotated daily. Felt safe walking between times square and this hotel at night.

Very nice room, very close to times square and all the action. my biggest complaint is the rooms are Extremely! small but your in new York! so if traveling with family pack light because there is barely any room for your luggage in the room. Also, the bathroom was very small but clean, fresh. I Would Stay here Again.

The hotel is in a very good location, awesome bathroom, tasty breakfast with a large choice of meals. Very friendly staff, especially Andre in the reception and the baggage guy Lou. The only con is that a room is quite small.

My sisters & I had a girls trip to NYC just last week Aug 5-9.stay at this hotel and it was "Great" Staff is very friendly,helpful and nice.The full breakfast every morning was ""Awesome" one of the reason we chose this hotel the cook &cheif is great.Ms Erica in the breakfast room is very very sweet you must go down and have breakfast to see her smiling face.The location is great if you want to visit Macys,Penn Station,Rockfeller Ctr &Empire State Bldg its literally two blocks away but it you want to be rite in the heart of Times Square its a five or 10 min walk but after you pass Bryant Park its real easy to find just follow all the lights &people.lol...overall our 1st trip to NYC was a great experience we had a Great Time!!!!!!!Praise God.

Very pleasant stay. Lovely choices for breakfast, and good. Would stay here again. Not far from the subways if needed, and close to points of interest if you would like to walk. Rooms a bit small but very comfortable and clean.

Very Good place, close from time square, subway and Macy's ! Rooms clean, quiet and free breakfast every morning. Parking are very close from the hotel. Staff was very professionnal, friendly and very polite Thank you André, Lou and a lady at the lobby that I don't remember her name. (for sure, she will remember me.) I'll be back at this hotel soon ;)

Very good location and staff was very friendly. There complimentary tea water coffee service in the lobby was nice. overall stay was very good.wifi was also very fast. Breakfast was also nice. They also didnot charge us the local calls from there room phone

My sisters and I took a girls trip to NYC and stayed at this hotel.... great stay!!! Rooms are a little tight but location was great! Full breakfast every morning and great service all around. Clean rooms which is always a plus. And staff was always willing to help. Will be back in March!

we stayed in this hotel in our trip to New york last year in September. We took single king bed room, though it was a bit small, but was clean and tidy.Staff was friendly and helpful. The best part is its location , it is very close to times square and at walkable distance from many other attractions. in short its a good deal for affordable price in New york City..:)

Excellent location - though construction next to hotel was noisy even at night. Rooms was small but adequately furnished. Breakfast in the morning was a big plus. Personnel at the front desk were courteous and friendly. Easy access to nearby attractions and MTA was another plus.

Nice hotel. Wished there were a refrigerator and microwave in the room. There was a microwave available in the cellar where the breakfast was served so I was happy for that convenience. Hotel staff were helpful and friendly. Gave me extra maps when I requested and also were helpful in directing me to places I needed to get to. I had no problem unloading and picking up my luggage at the hotel; that was my main concern since vehicles are not allow to stop in the streets of New York City. Apparently, the hotel has an unloading area in front of the hotel, so it worked out great. The location of the hotel is walking distance to shopping at Herald Square and Times Square. Trains stations are very close as well! Complimentary water with lemon was refreshing as the family waited for each other at the outside sitting area in front of the hotel on a hot summer's day. Overall the stay at this hotel was very enjoyable!

The front desk was very welcoming and greeted you with a smile. Our check-in was fast and had our room key within a minute. We were on the 16th floor of 17. We didn't have the view of the Empire State building but had a view none the less, had the executive room. The room was quaint and clean with a large screen TV, coffee maker, in-room safe, a king size bed which was very comfortable. Free wi-fi was nice but the signal was variable. Construction next door is ongoing and I don't understand they start so early in the morning! The noise level isn't loud though. The hotel has free coffee/tea/water at the lobby 24/7. There's also a quaint bar in the back of the hotel with good happy hour prices. Breakfast is included and has different variety everyday, it opens from 07:30 to 09:30 so I advise to get there a bit early because the room can get crowded. The hotel is conveniently located to places you want to go. It's a short walk to Times Square, Bryant Park, Herald Square, Empire State building and subway stations. There's also a lot of eateries in the area, souvenir shops and stores. New York is a hectic place but it's fun to explore and at the end of the day the BW Premier is there to welcome you back to rest.

Over all this is my hometown and alot has changed but I loved my visit back home and taking so many pictures to always remmeber this wonderful trip and posting it on facebook. Hanging out with family is great all the time.

The location of this hotel so I was pleasantly surprised to find that it was far more affordable than other local chains in the area. The staff is incredible, accommodations are perfect and overall, it is a GREAT value!

We found this to be comfortable with excellent staff, the first night was a room on the twelfth floor, with some street noise, the staff had a quieter room on the opposite side of the building with a partial view of the Empire State bldg available for the rest of our stay and moved us there on the fourteenth floor . Small rooms - like most Manhattan Hotels, close to the subway, breakfast was included and this helped to get the day started quickly.

We have never stayed at Premier Hotel and you can really tell a difference. This hotel was close to the subway and many places to see and eat. Everyone was so kind here and so helpful. They helped us with all of the modes of transportation and what would be best for the location we were going. The beds are so comfortable and is by far the best hotel bed we have ever slept in.We had 2 great nights sleep and our room was very quiet and free from outside noise. Kuddos to all of the staff who made our stay incredible.

I just stayed at this hotel for 1 nights in July 2014 while on business. I was very pleased with this hotel. The location was great, just a few blocks from a subway station and within walking distance of the Empire State Building and Times Square. The rooms were small but we expected that because most rooms of this price range are...The breakfast was good but could be better if they offer cook to order after all its a "Premier" BW. Very friendly staff and has bar area.

Needed to overnight in NYC for medical appointments. Pleasantly surprised by high quality of this hotel; would not have considered others in NYC in this chain. Rooms small but well appointed and functional; best of all they are very well insulated against city noise. Staff extremely friendly (didn't expect this in NYC)! Be aware that there is currently a construction site next door (east) to the hotel, so select your room carefully. Stayed using points, so not making a judgement on value for cost in this review.

We just stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in July 2014. We were very pleased with this hotel. The location was great, just a few blocks from a subway station and within walking distance of Macy's, the Empire State Building and Times Square. The rooms were small but we expected that because most rooms of this price range are small in New York. The price for this hotel was just a little cheaper than other hotels I had checked on in the same area. The rooms were clean, the staff was friendly and helpful and the free breakfast was great! Staying here helped make our first trip to New York City a great experience. I would highly recommend this hotel.

We had a fab 10 night break here. Great staff, comfortable rooms and space outside to sit and people watch. A very handy location for getting around the city. We had a problem with ac which was dealt with quickly and efficiently. Good variety of items for breakfast. It changed daily which is a bonus if you stay more than a few nights. Plenty of places to eat in local neighborhood. Would recommend

the front dest staff was to helpful and kind,,,always at your becon call...room was fantastic and the bed was awesome,,,,nice and cool in the room for the summer time we would for sure stay here over and over again when in the big apple,,,,a must stay hotel

Good location, close to Subway stops and walking distance to 30 Rock and Times Square. However, rooms were postage stamp size - so small there was no place to put our suitcases when we put our clothes in the only 3 drawers available. Recommend trying another one of the 5 hotels which are within a block of this one. Breakfast was mediocre - breakfast room much too crowded to ever enjoy breakfast. Our room had dust on the ledge of the headboard and some trash in the bathroom when we checked in.We asked about a cab to the airport, and the front desk called us a Limo - more expensive than a regular cab. Hotel had no public rooms, and our room was the smallest we have ever had in our 40 plus years of traveling. Could not even sit outside as there were always people smoking and the only view was of the trash piled on the streets.

My son and I recently to went to NYC and stayed at the Best Western Premier at Herald Square. The hotel is right around the corner from the 36th Street Subway--location to the subway is very important!!!The hotel is lean and tall with a small patio on 36th street though the trash piles up right in front of it so we never sat out there. The lobby is very small and was quite cramped at times but the desk staff always said hello even when surrounded. There is ice water with lemon and coffee service available all day. The ice water was delightful after walking around the city. We checked in late afternoon so all the rooms higher up were taken. We stayed in room 403, right over the street. I was thankful I had a white noise app on my phone to drown out the street noise that starts early in the morning. We slept fine with it on. The room is very small but had everything we needed. A built in closet w/hangers, a dresser with three doors, a big flat screen TV mounted to the wall and a big comfy bed. The bathroom has a large walk in shower and a small vanity with a shelf underneath of storage. We only went down for breakfast one time, the room was crowded. Few food choices were available. We skipped eating there and went around the corner to a bakery.The workout room was small but adequate. The Business center offered one computer. "Reduced" parking down the street for 35.00 a day. The staff make this hotel something really special--Andre was working the desk when we checked in and most of the days we were there and was friendly. My son left something in the room and I called the hotel a few hours after we had left the city, I spoke to Jay Singh. He went and checked and it was in lost and found and told me the process to have it mailed to us. He was very kind and patient, through several phone calls. The housekeeper turned in our items left in the room to lost and found--awesome. The late night desk staff was awesome.

We stayed at this hotel end of March. Hotel is new and front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Central located. Room is clean and comfortable. Breakfast is good. I recommend this hotel for the future guests.

The staff was very helpful - they helped arrange a bus tour and our taxi to the airport. The hotel is pretty new and very modern in design. The room was small, but that was expected in Manhattan. The location was very near the subway and close to restaurants and shopping. The bed was also very comfortable. We would definitely go there again.

Very good experience at this hotel. Worth the money and the view is great. Also extremely close to the empire state. Close to the subway as well. The decor was outstanding and I loved the new york themes picture frames in the room. Shower was very nice. Staff was very friendly. I have stayed at over 20 hotels in New York in the past 3 years. This one is in my top 3 for sure. The free breakfast is very good and kept very clean. I will be returning here for all my future stays. They need more Best Western Premiers throughout New York.

This hotel, while it has many floors, it is on very small real estate. That means relatively small rooms. Other than that, it was great. Very modern and clean, free Wifi, and great staff who are very friendly. Steps away from Keen's Steakhouse at the corner. If driving to NYC, you may want to park at Meyer's parking on 35th btwn 5th & 6th, instead of icon across the street from the hotel. A short walk can save you $20 a night. This can add up when staying a few nights.

I stayed for one night at this hotel and had a delightful experience. It started at check-in - the receptionists were patient with us when we took 25 mins to rearrange our luggage before checking our bags prior to the check-in time. We ended up getting into our room early, but we were nervous to find our room on a lower level right across from the elevator. Thankfully that was unwarrented - the room was sound-proof. The bathroom was beautiful. Not only was it clean and well stocked, it had a great layout. One of the best showers I have ever taken. In the morning there was free breakfast, which was yummy (yay free!) and then we headed to the subway. As we checkes out, we got more excellent service. An employee let us know that we could check our bags with the hotel for the remainder of the day for free. This made our trip far more enjoyable since we didn't have to lug our bags and we wouldn't of thought to ask for the service. Basically, the employees catered to our every need - even the ones we didn't know we had. The Penn station stop was only a few blocks away, which made it easy to use public transit to get around. They are also walking distance to Bryant Park, which is great, and Times Square. The one caveat is that the rooms are small. It was a bit crowded with three of us in the room. For the low price we paid though, it was more than adequate and clean as a whistle. New favorite NYC hotel!
user_location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States

review_body: We stayed at this Best Western for 1 night precruise. The front desk personnel were so helpful, they stored our luggage (a massive amount, thanks to our adult daughter coming) so that we could go sight seeing, had our room ready by 1:30 pm and accomadated our request for extra pillows and a blanket with a smile. The room is not huge but very well laid out and the bathroom shower was huge. Everything was very clean. We loved the water, coffee and tea available in the lobby, especially after trekking around NYC for hours. The location was excellent, very close to the Empire State building so we had nice views whenever we walked anywhere. Definitely make the trek to Best Bagels, super yummy bagels. The breakfast at the hotel was very filling, not awesome but enough choices for us. They were also willing to give us a little leeway on check out time or hold our luggage for us again. All in all a fantastic stay!

Loved this hotel! Very clean and beautifully decorated in very clean lines and modern in style. The staff was well trained and provided the most professional and caring help we would have not expected in a very busy city like NYC on a holiday weekend. The hotel is only 3 blocks away from the Empire State Building one way and 3 blocks the other way from the Chrysler Building. 5 blocks from Times Square and around the corner from Bryant Park. Accessibly close to everything we wanted while traveling with children ages 10 and 5.

We stayed at the Best Western Herald Square for 4 nights over the July 4th holiday. It's a great location - walking distance to the subway, Broadway & Times Square. Would highly recommend and would stay again.

My father, my sister and I stayed 2 nights at this Best Western in New York city and it was a great experience! Rooms are clean, well decorated, comfortable and cozy (even tho a bit too small...we didn't have much storage and we didn't have a freezer). Breakfasts - in which you get many good choices - are included so it makes the experience very convenient. The location is also very convenient since you are pretty much close to everything and at two steps away from 5th avenue. The most memorable thing to us was however how professional and cool the staff was: We actually had a misadventure which started by a police agent who unfairly gave us a parking ticket, cause we were apparently not supposed to be parked in front of the hotel during the few minutes of our check in. The front desk staff witnessed it and one of the lady wrote us a letter for us to contest our ticket, telling that it was an unjustified one. It was so nice from her and it happened to be so helpful since we went to the office of New York - where we can contest tickets - and we were proclaimed NOT GUILTY! Thank you guys you're the best!!!

I wanted to stay close to the city and all the attractions to be walking distance. That's exactly what I got convenience to empire state, time square, central park, train station. The staff at the hotel were professional and friendly. would definitely stay there on my next visit.

We stayed 4 nights at the new BW Herald Square from June 19 - 23. The hotel is clean, beds are very comfortable and location is excellent. Most of the rooms are doubles and quite small but you have everything you need and Internet connectivity was great. There was noise from construction but only during weekdays. We were up early and out the door by 10:00 so it was no problem for us. When you're in NYC, who wants to stay in bed sleeping! If that's what you want, you're in the wrong town. Other than the construction, our room very quiet after hours. We were on the 14 floor facing the street. If you're looking for extra quite, go high. You can't determine which room you'll get until after you check in. Ask to see the room before settling in. You can always change if they have availability.One thing I like about Best Western hotels is the complimentary breakfast. That helps a lot when you're on the go. They have plenty to offer for everyone: fruit, cereal, yogurt, fresh pastries and at least one egg and sausage dish + pancakes, waffles or french toast. The hot food is not of the highest quality but that's to be expected in a chain hotel. I skipped the meat dishes as there were plenty of other options.Service was excellent. They even stored our bags when we checked out so we could do more sightseeing. It was very well organized - the bags were ticketed so there were no mix-ups. We enjoyed the cute bar with patio. It was a nice escape for a drink and the bartender was very helpful. Herald Square is a convenient location for visiting all the main sights in NYC: Empire State Building, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, etc. Plus, you're in the garment district so there are plenty of discount shopping opportunities if you have time for that. On the downside, Hearld Square is the heart of Manhattan so it's noisy, super crowded and dirty. However, it is a good place to get an overview of NYC if you've never been there. Next time, we'll pick a neighborhood like, Chelsea or Greenwich. Here are some helpful tips based on our experience:Brooklyn Bridge and Brooklyn Heights:We took the subway to Brooklyn and walked down to the new Brooklyn waterfront park which is lovely. However, it would be much more convenient to take the water taxi from Manhattan. The water taxi takes you right there. With the subway, we got off too far and ended up walking through the projects which is not the best experience when you're unsure of where you are.From the waterfront park, you can walk up to Brooklyn Heights which is where I lived as a child. There are beautiful brownstones, and an amazing view from the renowned Brooklyn Promenade. The neighborhood has become very trendy and it was a surprise to see so many tourists wandering around. To get back to Manhattan, we rented CitiBikes and biked across the Brooklyn bridge which is the best way to go because of the city view. We went on a Sunday which was crazy because it was so crowded. Again, go midweek to avoid the crowds or go really early. Sunset might be better for beautiful photos.Beware when you use CitiBike. The pay stations are awkward and had technical issues. We walked to three different stations before we found one that worked and had enough bikes. Furthermore, you have to return your bike and get a new code every 1/2 hour or they charge you an additional $10 + tax. How inconvenient is that? We got overcharged and it's impossible to get a refund. If you must rent bikes for a couple of hours, skip CitiBike and rent a bike from a real bike shop. Their bikes are better maintained and they have helmets. They're more reasonably priced for longer rides, and you don't have to swipe your credit card every 1/2 hour.911 Memorial & Museum:Here's what most people don't know: You don't have to buy a ticket to see the memorial park. This is not mentioned on the memorial's website. To the see the memorial, just follow the crowds of people and you're there. There is no line to wait in. If you want to see the museum, however, buy your ticket in advance to save time and be prepared to go through a security screening. If you have a big bag, you'll have to check it so travel light.Empire State Building:Go midweek and buy your ticket in advance! Or, go later in the day for sunset pictures. If you go on the weekend, go really early as it's very crowded (as is everything in NYC on the weekend). Don't buy your ticket from the street vendors. You'll end up paying more and there's not that much benefit from it.NYC Pizza:Want to try some great NYC pizza? Go to Greenwich Village! I highly recommend Joe's for a slice. This place is renowned for it's pizza. It'll be hard to go back to regular pizza after a slice of Joe's.Hot Dogs:Unfortunately, authentic NYC hotdogs, I'm told, are no longer readily available in NYC. Instead, every corner has a "Halal" hot dog stand that sells falafals, gyros and hot dogs. And, they don't come close to what NYC hot dogs used to be. What a shame. If anyone knows of an authentic hot dog stand in NYC, please email me! My advice is to skip these overpriced stands (they all charge different price according to their mood). If you must buy a dog at one of these places, don't pay more than $2 as that is the going rate. Make sure they post their prices. If not, move on.

Overall very satisfied with our stay. The staff was amazing, the location was excellent because it was close to everything without being totally immersed in insanity. Only negative, rooms were small, but that's New York.

Herald Sq location is much more preferable from where I otherwise choose . It is in the neighborhood of everywhere , and QUIET . The hotel is clean , friendly and helpful on all services . The room is a tat to snugg , lacked refridgerator . But such is no problem when there is every a busy day you're on the go , and have a comfy clean bed to recuperate .

We stayed 4 nights at this location. It is clearly new and well run. Anytime we needed anything (extra towels or laundry bags) the request was handled quickly and graciously. My teenage son woke up at 3:30 coughing. I went downstairs and the desk clerk accessed the "store" for Nyquil. He also suggested extra blankets and immediately had another employee retrieve them. When checking out - they offered to hold our luggage until our flight, if we needed it (we didn't.) I get the feeling this is a family business and everyone is fully invested in taking care of the customer. Great location - around the corner from the Metro. We would stay here again if we got a chance!

This hotel has great customer service. We took megabus from toronto to new york and arrived at around 7am, but checkin isnt till 3pm. We arrived there at around 7:30, they offered the hotel breakfast for free since it was so early but technically we dont even get the breakfast that morning cause we didnt pay for the hotel for the night before, which was nice of them. They also offered us to store our luggage and offered early checkin around 1pm so we could shower and clean up. The room was well furnished, with a very clean and modern washroom with no shower curtains just glass doors( which i love cause shower curtains are really dirty if you think about it). The beds were comfy too. The location is perfect pretty much center of Manhattan and just blocks away from time square and herald square. For the price we paid, for $489 for 2 nights for a 3 person room before tax is a great deal for a hotel like this at this location in Manhattan.

The service was top notch. They watched our luggage all day. The location is 10 minute walk to Penn Station. The room was clean and nice and modern. So small, but we didn't really mind because we didn't hang out in our room. We would definitely stay here again.

The staff is very friendly and helpful. They consistently went above and beyond to make sure that we had a pleasant stay. Although the rooms are small, they met our needs and were very clean and nicely decorated.

I like the location cause its just close to every place. Clean, simple, small hotel room. breakfast is free and great. its 6 blocks away from times square. close to Macys Mall, Subway, and Port Authority. Staff are friendly and helpful.

I've placed the specific details below but to summarize: if you'd like a place to sleep well and rest from long days exploring NYC this is NOT the place to stay. Housekeeping was extremely noisy in the mornings, ignored our "Do Not Disturb" sign THREE times and woke us and put the wrong size sheets on our bed. Yes, the location is great but there are many other hotels next door and nearby. We would not recommend this one.Pros: The front end staff was very friendly and helpful, the room was beautifully decorated and sound proof from the busyness outside and the cleanliness was what we've come to appreciate from Best Westerns Cons: The noise and disturbance from housekeeping ruined our stay here (listed below). The breakfast (especially the eggs) is not good and the guest room doors need buffering as they are the loudest we've ever experienced. When we presented our experiences to the hotel staff they apologized but brushed us off very quickly. We then completely a Best Western survey and detailed our thoughts and received nothing more than a form letter not addressing any of our concerns. Disappointing!!!!Here is our account:"Quiet Please" sign on door - 8:00am housekeeping cleaning room next door and singing at top of her lungs for over a half hour."Quiet Please" sign on door - 9:00am Knock at door announcing "Housekeeping". They must have realized their mistake because they left before we got to the door but by then we were already woken up.One day we returned to hotel at 5:00pm to rest before going out again- the room was being serviced by housekeeping so we had to wait in lobby for 15 minutes. We mention this only because of the inconsistency in the times they serviced the rooms, leaving us no way to predict when they'd be there which made it more difficult to plan our day."Quiet Please" sign on door - A knock at the door, we answered and housekeeping had brought us fresh towels as they had forgotten to leave some earlier.We went to bed on our fourth night and couldn't sleep due to the sheets bunching/shifting. At approx. 12:30am when we turned on the lights and took a better look we discovered that the sheets didn't fit the bed at all. It became evident that they were Queen size and we were in a King size bed. We requested the proper sized sheets from the front desk. Instead we were brought new blankets. This was soon corrected but the whole thing prevented us from sleeping by a good hour.We were so disappointed in this hotel and even more disappointed by the way the staff and Best Western itself have dealt with our feedback.

This is a very nice Best Western only a block from Herald Square in the heart of mid town. The rooms were all very modern with great TVs and Internet. Being NYC of course the rooms are small but adequate and very clean. Service was excellent, staff friendly and helpful. Only negative would be the breakfast; very nice selection but not all the hot food was actually hot and staff was challenged to keep up with volume of diners on Sunday morning. All and all I would definite recommend this hotel.

Best Western is the best in the services they offer. I recommend staying here. The food is awesome, I love the health fix room. The location in New York I right for every area and extra accommodates for walking or riding the taxi, subway, or bus.

This Hotel be in the perfect place.So clean, excellent Hotel !!!The crew is so attention and always help us.The breakfest it's so good too. The more important is the place, be in 36th between 5 Av and 6 av. 6 blocks from times square.

We stayed 3 nights June 11 – 13 2014 on the seventh floor.The room was a good size for an NYC hotel and had a king sized bed for me & my wife.The bathroom was bigger than expected and it had a bathtub sized shower with glass doors.The room’s A/C climate control was excellent.We had no interruptions from outside noise or from neighboring rooms.The breakfast from 6:30 to 9:30 AM was excellent; eggs, a breakfast meat and either waffles or French toast every morning along with pastries, breads, bagels and yogurt in the small fridge under the cabinet where the utensils were stored along with regular and decaf coffee.Never used the workout/weight room but it looked adequate.The thing we really enjoyed though was the bar just off the lobby that had happy hour from 3 – 7 pm where you could get 4$ glasses of wine from a smart, classy, attentive bar tender. There was both an inside area and an outside area in this small bar that was just perfect for relaxing. This little bar was not lost on the local NYC professionals who were there our first night unwinding after work.

My wife and I stayed here on 6/11/14 thru 6/14/13. Staff was courteous and polite. Hotel was very clean. Rooms are very small considering the room rate, however very quite. Great location in Midtown and away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square. Complimentary breakfast was a nice added perk. Overall a great place to stay and will definitely stay here again. Staff is very kind in allowing you to leave your luggage if you arrive before check-in and after check-out if you have a late flight.

First time to New York and couldn't have asked for a nicer hotel. The staff was extremely helpful and polite. The rooms were very clean and had everything we needed. Location is excellent and breakfast was a nice perk. Will definitely stay here again.

I stayed at this hotel togheter with friends in may 2014. We booked a room witd two double beds, slightly on the small side for 4 adults but in New york all hotel rooms are small. The hotel has a great location in midtown, only two blocks away from Macys. Room is clean, nicely decorated and with a good sized bathroom. Coffe/tea maker and a safe. A complimentary breakfast is served in the basement every morning, its crowded and served with plastic cutlery,plates and cups. Breakfast buffet is bagels,fruit,eggs,sausage, cornflakes and yoghurt, good enought to get the day started! Staff in the reception is very friendly and even helped me to prepare a bottle of wine to the room on arrival for my cousins birthday.Of all hotel I have tried in the cirty, this is by far the one with best value/location/staff!I'll see you again!

A few weeks ago my daughter and I stayed here while in town for a friend's bat mitzvah. I got the reservation on Priceline without knowing in advance which hotel it would be. We got lucky with this Best Western. The room was spotless and very quiet (which was the tradeoff for having no view in a room that looked out to the adjacent building rather than the street.) Yes, the room is small and like most NY hotels, had not bathtub, but that's fine for me. I'll take clean, new and small over larger and costly or aging any day. The one negative is the overly-crowded breakfast area in the basement. It was good to have bagels and cream cheese, Chobani yogurts, and eggs as well as other standard breakfast fare. I want to give a special shout out to the great staff at the front desk who gave us good recommendations and kept our luggage for the day after we checked out until we caught our evening flight. Those great folks were Sade, Zuelika and Jitender (I hope I spelled their names right!) Each year when I'm in NYC I stay in a different hotel for variety, but I'd really consider staying here again. My daughter loved being near all the great bead shops - we spent an afternoon getting her beads (she loves making bracelets for her friends.) Being around the corner from Korea town means lots of yummy, affordable eats as well. I've stayed in lots of lousy Best Westerns on the west coast, so this made me realize they're not all bad!

I've stayed in other hotels in NYC before, but I won't stay anywhere else now. The BWP Herald Square is an excellent hotel, centrally located, with wonderful customer service, and updated, clean rooms. Look no further. You can walk to the subway, the Empire State Building, NYC shopping, great restaurants (Keen's Steakhouse is right next door), and park your car for a reduced price right down the block. Fantastic.

Extremely pleased with the entire experience. The hotel staff, breakfast buffet and room size were far better than we expected. The room was spacious and the beds very comfortable and the staff were extremely helpful in guiding us around the city as well as suggesting places to visit. We will recommend this property to all of our friends and family.

Hotel was very clean, staff very friendly and helpful. Very near Bryant Park, Empire State Building and Times Square, MSG/Penn Station. Having the breakfast included was a time saver. Though not a fabulous breakfast, it was quite satisfactory.. unless you're a breakfast snob. I love a great breakfast but definitely not a snob about it. Elevators make a 'clink-clank' noise as they pass floors. This noise goes on through the night when you're trying to sleep.. it was mildly annoying. Other than that.. I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. And, let's be honest, you don't go to NYC because of the hotel you will stay at.

Excellent location, very close to Times Square/Herald Square. Close to a subway and felt like we were in a safe neighborhood. Free internet and breakfast a big plus. Rooms were very clean and staff was super friendly, will definately go back. Good value for your money and while the rooms were small they optimized the space and was decorated very nicely. Location and staff was why this hotel stood out and is why we will be back to stay there.

Hotels in NY are generally pricy and this BW is no exception, nevertheless it was a nice and pleasant stay over all with a few ups and downs. The hotel is very well situated in midtown easily reachable be public transport and with that an ideal starting point to explore the city. Also the hotel appears to be quite new with some nice design elements in the interior not typically found in a BW. The rooms are relatively small but practical and nice. The room and the hotel have a few positive highlights for the modern traveler:- a smart phone charging alarm clock how cool is that :-)- plenty of electrical plugs in the room-high speed, reliable, Wifi everywhere-a very decent, modern, functioning(!) little gym. Breakfast is good, varies quite often in the items offered, so even a longer stay does not get too boring the staff here is very friendly. This however does not apply to all the male front desk personal. Strangely enough only the males there were quite snappy when confronted with minor request or problems. We had to ask 3 times for an additional blanket, which got forgotten the first evening and was finally delivered the next day...after asking one of the female front desk staff...;-). Despite being a registered, frequent customer to BW were not able to get a late checkout.Room service appears to be generally slow and sloppy, one day our room was "forgotten" entirely...again at least 2 times asking the guy at the front desk to fix it. Two things I like to mention as well although the hotel or the staff can not really do anything about it: While we were staying we had two construction sites around the hotel with cement-pumps starting as early as 5am and garbage trucks loading construction site trash as late as 10pmThe windows appear not to be able to shield you from any noise coming from the street so it can be a quite noisy night. We had one very rainy day were our window was leaking water, that at least got fixed instantly. Normally I would give 4 points here but that guy at the front desk and the room service make me give 3.

Stayed here for a short business meeting in New York and found the location very convenient and walkable from Penn Station (the Amtrak station). Empire State building was 2 blocks away, Macy's was a block away. Dinner at Keens Steakhouse a few doors away away was excellent. Also, Korea Town is a short walk from the hotel, and dinner at the New Wonjo restaurant on 32nd St (Korea Way) was great. Go upstairs where they'll grill your dinner right at the table. Only cons with this hotel: No refrigerator in room and rooms are small, but it's Manhatten.

Lou is your man, he is in charge of luggage, but knows where you should go and how to get there. The best rooms are at the back of the property and above the third floor, they are quieter and a bit roomier. Free tea and coffee is available in the foyer and the complimentary breakfast is great. The free wi fi is a great bonus, and you are able to message home for free using facebook. The pasta and soup shop just a couple of doors down on the same side as the motel was handy and very tasty also. Terrific location, we walked everywhere, even tho the temperature was minus. Would recommend, perfect for 2 people, a little crowded for 3 but still worth it for the friendly staff and great location.

Stayed here for 5 days in May/June. The location is perfect. It is in midtown and close to everything. Rarely caught a cab although we were busy sightseeing night and day. Close to Broadway, Times Square etc and a few blocks from Penn Station if you are arriving or leaving by train.We had had a long flight and our room was very quiet. The hotel itself was very clean, friendly and helpful. Some might say the rooms are small but only if they are unfamiliar with NY hotel rooms. Seemed standard to me. Breakfast was fine, but nothing special. Good restaurants, pubs and everything you need right there. I would happily stay there next time I visit.

Nice small clean and snazzy room - everything you need! The bed and linens were very comfortable - the tv was great and came with a sanitized remote - WOW - I would come back! Really reasonable prices! The Desk and cleaning staff were very nice and very helpful - I like this place!

After looking at three different hotels for our first trip to New York City we chose to stay at Best Western Premier Herald Square. It was a WONDERFUL experience! The hotel has a boutique hotel feel and is new, clean and fresh. A full breakfast is offered each day and the hotel staff is AMAZING!! Lou was particularly friendly and helpful each day of our stay giving us ideas of places to go and ways to save money. We stayed for five nights and were served a hot full breakfast each day. The staff would always wish us a good day as we left in the morning for our adventures, and welcomed us back each evening. The hotel is in the most ideal area of town. We walked everywhere the five days we were there - even to Central Park! We never hailed a cab the entire time. On the morning we left, I forgot a few items in the lobby that we had purchased. When I called, Zuleika told me how to send a shipping label and they would return the items UPS. Sade packed them up nicely for us and made sure they were delivered. The only negative (if you can even call it that since it is New York City) is that the room was small. I'd stay there without hesitation again if we ever decide to visit NYC again.

The staff was awesome. The room was very, very small and since there is construction next door, it was extremely noisy. We only got less than 4 hours of sleep each night if we were lucky. There is no refrigerator. The breakfast area was very small as well and people were walking all over each other to get to the food. People were taking tables from each other. We would have taken the food up to our room but there is no place to eat in the room except on the bed. We didn't get towels one day and the staff was extremely nice and got them for us right away. Make sure if you need a cab, you hail one yourself. If you have the hotel get one, the price doubles.

This is a wonderful small hotel in Herald Square. The staff are all friendly and extremely helpful. the rooms are clean and the service is personal. We had a problem with the a/c and they immediately changed us to another room. This is by far one of the best properties in New York!

As a confirmed Hilton Hotel addict, I was extremely hesitant to try a Best Western property. After taking a status match to Best Western Rewards at Diamond Level I thought that it was time to try it out. This hotel is a lovely little surprise. The staff were amazing throughout the entire stay, friendly, welcoming and efficient. The recognition of Diamond status was excellent and the early check in and late check out were greatly appreciated. The rooms are nice and well decorated. The hotel is recently constructed and still feels new. The bathroom is the by far the best of all of my visits to NYC. The rooms are NYC size, though still felt okay. In hindsight i would have preferred a higher floor, to achieve a small view and to escape construction noise from next door. The negative aspects of the the stay included the terribly mouldy/musty smell from the basement level that was often in the elevators and the terrible linens on the beds. The fitted sheets do not fit the king sized beds and the flat sheets also seem to be the wrong size. this should be addressed immediately. Overall however, a good stay.

this is a very small hotel. excellent location with the subway only a block away rooms are some of the smallest I have ever seen but adequate. The rooms in front are noisy from street sounds. Unfortunately there was construction going on next door. The staff was willing to move me to a higher floor. The bathroom is really small as well so only one person in at a time!

Literally just got home today from a brilliant 5 day stay at this quirky hotel. Cannot praise it or it's staff enough. Would definitely stay here again if in NYC and would encourage you to book here!! Small, personal, and customer service done right. Thank you

Great breakfast, awesome location, really good happy hour from 3-7 Monday to Friday and reasonable room size for NY! Debbie at the breakfast buffet is the BEST and made my husband and I feel like we were family!

I had a standard room on the eleventh floor of this hotel. I was alone, but the room could have fit one more (more than that would not have been fun). I was on the back side of the hotel, and it was quiet except for two guests next door. (Oh well.) The property is a short walk from Penn Station, which is why I chose it. Rooms were clean and staff friendly. Don't stay here if you're looking for the hotel to entertain you: this isn't a resort. Instead, use the hotel as your base of operations as you explore the Greatest City in the World.

Loved this place! brand new, so everything was in great working order. No nightmare surprises here!, great hospitality, courteous staff, amazing breakfasts, central to everything, Could view the Empire State building from our room. We stayed here a week and enjoyed everything NY could throw at us...for anyone travelling from OZ, you cant go past this hotel for comfort. Rooms are small...but hey, they are clean, modern and cosy as! The rates were unbeatable when I was doing my reviews prior to booking this hotel!This hotel has won these Aussie's hearts...will be back!!

Lovely hotel with great staff. The room was just about right. We knew it would be a bit small but hey this is New York right?The location couldn't be better being a block from Empire State Building, 5 mins from Times Square 3 from Macy's etc etc.We moved rooms due to building work next door and the staff were great in that respect. We moved to a room higher up which had the best view of ESB!! All staff extreme helpful.Only complaint? The breakfast is down in the basement and didn't change much and why oh why do they have plastic cutlery and paper plates? Not very easy to use and not environmentally friendly!Great stay and would definitely go back!

Stayed here the night of May 10th 2014. I'm a Best Western Diamond Club member and really enjoyed the stay here. The room was clean and well appointed. The staff per usual were great and extremely helpful. The area is filled with shops and great restaurants. I have always enjoyed this area of the city. The rates cannot be beat for NYC. Will definitely be back.

The staff were very friendly and helpful. Whatever problems we had with the room were solved quickly and pleasantly. The rooms were very clean and inviting. Breakfast was included, and had a varied buffet menu. The staff made sure that the next morning lactaid milk was available for me; all done with a smile. Coffee, tea, and lemon water are available in the lobby 24 hours a day. The hotel is well located: within walking distance of Penn Station, buses, subway, shopping and all. The room prices are high as are most New York hotels in this category.

Let me first say I would stay here again. The staff is excellent. The hotel is clean, new, and for the price - $110.00 a night booked six months in advance - how could you beat it? Two cons: the full breakfast. We went one morning, and it was less than satisfactory that we decided to skip it the next two mornings. We aren't all that picky, and it will do just fine to load up on carbs before touring the City, but it tends to get very over crowded in breakfast room, and we didn't want to wait for it. Last con would be how noisy it can get around 3:00 - 4:00 a.m. It isn't the hotel that gets noisy. It is the bar across the street letting out. I would stay here again for all other reasons I mentioned. Affordable, clean, great location, etc., etc.

The staff was fantastic, so was the location, we walked to times square many times. Great price is what got us there but my only issue is that the walls are quite thin. Unfortunatly we had a mother/daughter beside us that decided to have an off/on 2 hour argument so it kept us up that night.

brand new perfectly located hotels with very friendly and caring personnel!Spent 4 days there in Nov 13.pros - location, staff, freshness. The place is perfectly clean. Excellent and free of charge WIFIcons - limited space in the room. Expected though, taking into account price per sq in such a location

This hotel was everything it claimed to be. We were not in the least disappointed. Close to the subway and steps away from Macy's in Herald Square. We had a nice view of the Empire State Building from our window. It was quite busy for breakfast each morning but we never had to wait more than 5 min.

The hubby booked this hotel in Herald Square as it was walking distance to most of the sites we wanted to see. I have to admit, he did a great job of it. Though it is literally 6 rooms per floor, 3 in the front and 3 in the back with the elevator in the middle. We stayed from March 9 to 14, 2014 (March Break for our kids). The positives, it was within walking distance to Times Square, Empire State Building, The New York State Public Library, The Museum of Modern Art, Grand Central Station, etc. The breakfast food was typical danishes, bagels, coffee, tea, juices, fresh fruit. The staff were great at replenishing the items and very helpful. The negatives, the room was small (2 double beds) for myself, hubby and 2 teen girls. I guess as this hotel is so central, the breakfast hours of 6:30 am to 9:30 am doesn't allow tourists to sleep in a bit before getting a bite. (I solved this by grabbing a few items & bringing it upstairs for the sleepyheads lol.) We plan on visiting NYC again & this hotel is definitely at or near the top of the list for our next stay. Another plus, plus was the staff was always helpful and courteous. The concierge was also helpful in suggesting places he would eat at. Nothing beats eating at places the locals eat it. After checking out and just before we entered the Lincoln Bridge, our teen realized she had possibly left her cellphone in the room. We managed to make our way back to the hotel & the front desk was kind enough to let hubby and daughter up to check the room unescorted. We did find her phone. We are grateful to the staff in helping avoid a long ride home with an inconsolable teen.

We stayed at the Best Western Herold Square on Sat April 26 and had a great time. Very friendly and helpful front desk staff, great location. It's about 10 minutes' walk from Penn Station. We will be back again.

My family and I spent a night at Best Western Premier on 36th Street in New York and have nothing but compliments. We chose the hotel after reviewing the extensive feedbacks on here on trip advisor: (Who doesn’t?) We weren’t disappointed. They receive top grades from us in every category. Unfortunately we weren’t in New York for longer than 2 days but, even for longer stays we wouldn’t hesitate on choosing them Impressively, at a time when so many hotels boast of well thought out decorative themes, this hotel nails it perfectly. Best Western has definitely upped their game.The breakfast has a reasonably satisfying broad selection of items but get there in good time as space is limited; Waiting time for a table however, isn’t too lengthy. If there is something you need that isn't available, ask and you might be surprised.Of course the finest hotel without a courteous staff means nothing. I am taking the opportunity to thank everyone their help and a memorable stay. Lou thank you so much for your kindness; the staff in the breakfast kitchen for the hot cocoa and lactose free milk and Zuleika who goes beyond the call of duty and is as exceptional as her name. Keep it up and Thank you all. Smith Family, Sweden.

very good location.very close to herald square. We stayed in a two queen bed room. The room was not too small but ofcourse not too big. This is NY. I have been to NY many times this was the biggest room I stayed. The hotel was very clean, housekkeping was good. Breakfast was good. If I go again I will stay here again

Typical size room for NYC. Staff was able to accommodate our early arrival with room key. Stayed in Room 701, right off the elevator. No elevator noise to note. Street noise at all hours, but after all--this is New York and those people never sleep. Bring a white noise machine if you are a light sleeper. No trouble with heat/air. Bedding was nice, fresh towels each day, in house breakfast was great--different items each day. Hotel can hold bags after check out for last minute shopping. Front desk staff very kind in pointing out local restaurants, street navigation, etc. Didn't visit the lobby bar. Location of hotel was perfect--just a few blocks from Yellow/Red/Orange lines. Purchase the 7-day Subway card for ease in getting around. Shout Outs: Lou--totally enjoyed meeting him, learning about his family and shoe collection (Happy Birthday); Zuleeka--lovely gal, hospitality professional; Mustafah--professional and helpful; Kitchen/Breakfast ladies--always refilling food, cleaning tables, making sure all were happy, they totally ROCKED!! A+ Hotel.

This property is fairly new at a year and change. Really amazing how they were able to squeeze in a hotel in such a narrow space. Being new describes the condition so nuff said. Only 6 rooms per floor so hallway noise is easily heard in quest rooms. The opening and closing of stairway doors are excessively loud. Street view rooms are next to lifts and chimes are heard through guest room doors. Complimentary breakfast does get crowded after 8 and seating can be a wait. The staff is exceptionally friendly. The location is great especially for shopping with Macy's just around the corner. 34th and Herald is around the corner for the orange and yellow lines. However, 34th and Penn is a little farther if you are with luggage but absolutely doable. Do have a look at the bars and restaurants on 36th for most are fabulous. Construction is in progress next door so keep that in mind. Overall this was a pleasant experience and we will definitely look into this property on our next trip. Aloha!

My mum, my daughter and I stayed here recently on our '3 generations' trip to NYC and we really really pleased with our choice. I can only reiterate what others have said - small but clean and nicely decorated rooms (with efficient air con) and very friendly and helpful staff (I must mention Lou who was really helpful getting all our luggage out and arranging our taxi to JFK - much appreciated). We had rooms on the tenth floor and didn't experience any traffic, elevator or construction noise, though perhaps we were too exhausted from our busy days to notice:). Breakfast was a good added extra - there was a lot of choice (juice, teas, coffee, yoghurts, bagels, cereals, pancakes, sausage/bacon, egg patties, toast etc etc). Although the breakfast room was small, we always found a space to eat. Location-wise, we found it ideal to be between 5th and 6th avenues to go up or downtown by bus (or across on 34th street to the High Line) and just around the corner from the tube which we took to go to Battery park and also Brooklyn. All in all, I would recommend this hotel for a good value, clean and comfy option.

Hotel has a great location in Midtown. Lobby bar is well-stocked and bartenders are helpful and personable. Rooms are small, but NYC is perhaps known for that. Biggest disappointment was the very tiny bathroom with no room for shelving toiletries and no closet or anyplace to hang clothing. We had to keep all clothing in suitcases until needed. Nice patio in front ot hotel is available.

This is a new hotel in a great location just south of Times square and close to several Metro lines. The rooms are a nice size,clean, comfy bed, good breakfast- eggs,meat yogurt,pancakes, etc. Our room had a view of the Empire State building which was just around the corner.

My 17yr old grandson and I have just spent a fantastic week in New York made all the better by staying at the Best Western. It is in a brilliant location with Macys at the bottom of the street and The Empire State at the top. Situated between 5th and 6th Ave it couldn't make access to all the top tourist attractions better. The hotel is bright ,clean and service first class. Our room had two double beds in and although small was more than adequate for our needs. Rooms cleaned every day and the breakfast was an added bonus with a great choice of hot and cold foods. Try to get down before 8-8.30am as it gets busy after that and finding a table maybe difficult. If you need to book for any trips or visits i.e 911 Memorial(don't just turn up you need to book a slot)) then see Lou the porter in reception and he'll sort you out no problem-he's a star! I would recommend this hotel to anyone venturing to New York and will certainly be using it again should I return

Great hotel, stayed here for my wifes 50th birthday 4 nights over easter for the location dont think they can be beaten on price. The staff were so helpfull giving you individual maps for any place you wanted to find. Had a great room 1706 on the 17th floor overlooking the empire state building.The breakfast was fresh and lovely from 6.30 am to 9.30 am. Happy hour in the bar 4pm till 7pm from only $2 a beer. Some great pubs in the same road the ginger man is a must visit turn right out of hotel and a 5 minute walk over 70 real ales on draught from around the world !!!

Great hotel (Rooms are small but clean and nice), but they are building a new multistory building next door and start construction at 7am Monday to Friday even on Good Friday. It will be likely 2 years before they are done. If i had known this i would have gone somewhere else. Breakfast, staff were all great. They should have put up a warning on the web site like they do for other BW hotels in this situation.

The location and the price are reason enough to book this hotel. You are literally 5 minutes away from the Empire State building, there's a metro station 3-4 blocks away, there's restaurants and small stores all around and you are 10 minutes walk from Times Square. It is a very small building, almost hidden between 2 bigger buildings, and the entryway is small as well. Do your check-in, check-out and pay while the front desk staff are not busy because the main lobby is small and you don't want to wait there for awhile. Breakfast is included in the price and you have to go in the basement to get it. I believe it is served from 0630-09h, but better get there before 08-08h30 or else there is no seat available. There enough variety (eggs, bacon (except during week-ends), pancakes, pastries, yogurts, cereals, juices and coffee, etc.) The rooms are small but comfortable enough if you put aside the fact that it is INHUMANLY cold. There's a huge window to provide natural light to the room, but there is no insulation whatsoever. This creates a very cold floor, wall, and furniture close to the window. Evidently, the bed near the window was also very cold and lacked warm blankets. I had to ask the staff to bring at least 3 warm blankets to compensate for the cold. The heating system is at the other side of the room and doesn't reach the bed near the window. This was a major problem, affecting sleep and health. The blankets helped but they couldn't warm the ambient air. The hotel should definitely find a way to warm up these sides of the room. There was a lot of noises, even during the night (but hey, this is NYC, so do not expect the city to quiet down at night). There was also lots of noises from the hallway, because of the way they are made, doors are slamming all the time. Bring earplugs and you'll solve at least all the noise problems. Wifi was not working consistently. Working better, for example, in the early morning then during the evening. But I was not in NYC to remain on the internet in my room, so this was not so much of a problem. Staff are available 24hrs at the desk and were quick enough to bring the blankets (20-30 minutes). If you know you get cold easily, and you visit during winter time, ask for blankets while checking in, that will save you time. Without this major issue, this hotel would have scored 5 stars easily. I still would recommend it. You won't find many hotels that offers great breakfast, central location and convenient rooms for such prices. I would go back, but not during winter!

This was my 4th time in nyc and by far the best location ive ever stayed at,right round the corner from macys and empire state bld. A little gem, very modern n clean rooms n very friendly and helpful staff. Id definately stay there again.

I've been in NY before but this was my first at a Best Western, and I heartily recommend this hotel. It has an excellent location, nice and very clean rooms; still smells like new. The staff is very friendly. Moreover, the price is way too cheaper compared with other hotels around the same area.

Amazing hotel with very friendly staff who are always willing to help. In the entrance of the hotel there is lemon flavored refreshing water and coffee and tea for all guests. Location is extremely ideal for walking anywhere and subway is 5 min away! Rooms are small but comfortable with great amenities and very clean. Breakfast was fantastic, everything fresh. Definitely will visit again, our new favorite hotel. Last but best is happy hour at the hotel bar, great specials and fun to meet other guests. Highly recommended!

A great up market New York hotel, close to all attractions and subway just down the road. The hotel has great views of the empire state building from level 15. The room was small but nicely decorated. Great Wi Fi access, breakfast can be awkward at times to get a spot to eat, but no different to other USA hotels. Absolutely loved staying at the Best Western Premier Herald Square

Great location in NYC - close to all the attractions and to the subway, lots of restaurant bars nearby. Breakfast is a bonus. Up-to-date comfortable rooms. they are small but that's what you would expect right in the middle of the midtown Friendly, helpful staff.

The hotel service was exceptional. The room is perfect for a couple but is a tight fit for four people. Be sure to request a room on a higher floor, as the hotel is across the street from two bars and it can get a bit noisy.

Stayed at this hotel for three nights March 20-22 2014. The location is fantastic for Mid town Manhattan. The staff is very helpful with directions and information. The breakfast is wonderful. The rooms are small, but that is to be expected in Manhattan. It was clean and well supplied.

This hotel is very well placed in Manhattan, this is a very good asset. The rooms are clean but so small! Staff is friendly (in average). Time to time, items are missing such as towels or tissue that we had to call the desk, however, the fix was very prompt, in the minute, the missing item was there. The drawback is the noise. The window (s) covers all the wall (on the street side) and the phonic insolation is poor, moreover the street - although a small one - has a lot of traffic and the building next to the hotel is in construction, therefore, sleeping correctly is a challenge.

"Don't let the tiny charm of this hotel fool you (it's literally three rooms wide) - the staff and location more than make up for the diminutive size of this hotel. Yes, the rooms are small (they remind me of hotel rooms in Europe) but they are immaculate, quiet, and centrally located to the heart of NYC, adjacent to the garment district and steps away from the subway and the Empire State Building. I also want to recognize the staff at this location - they were wonderful, and any challenge I had was rectified immediately and cheerfully. I am unsure how the management team managed to hire every single cheerful person in NYC, but they did it. The breakfast nook was tiny, but you can bring it back to your room and enjoy it over the morning news. The wireless internet (free) was extremely fast, even with email attachments. If I stayed here again, I would request an upper level floor facing south - some rooms overlook the Empire State building. I think they would also be a bit quieter as well. Also, while the hotel amenities do not list Parking as one of their assets (and BW call center does not say they have parking), they do have a discount for parking at a nearby garage. It is *not* Icon Parking - be sure to ask for it right at the hotel."

It is so well located. Easy to get every where.Nice clean, small hotel. Friendly staff. Breakfast is quite basic but good start for the morning.I recomend this hotel to all my friends visiting New York.

I have to say I was pleasantly surprised with the great service, decent rooms and perfect location of this Herald Square Best Western. Based on some of the other reviews, I wasn't expecting the staff to be very friendly or knowledgeable of the area. The price point for the room was very favorable so I wasn't concerned, but I have to say everyone I dealt with there was friendly, helpful and went the extra mile. Three different individuals at the desk over the 5 nights I was there provided great restaurants, directions and helpful tips. I'd had 13 boxes of varying size sent beforehand for a convention and one of the gentlemen there brought them up from storage and helped load them. The location was great. Penn Station and subways to all parts of the city were just a few minutes away. They also have a Citibike location right around the corner where you can use the bikes and drop off at different locations around the city. It was way too cold for us to take advantage of, but liked the convenience. We were fortunate to have a room on the top floor with a view to the north. If available, I definitely recommend a higher room. The views are vey nice. We ate breakfast there each morning...nice assortment of both hot and cold breakfast items and it definitely saved us on eating breakfast out. I would definitely stay here again.

Small clean hotel ideally located for getting around for New York for a group of 7 first timers girlies celebrating birthdays, small room but apparently common in NY but comfy beds even with sharing not a problem, helpful staff, secure clean nice little bar and breakfast included would stay there again

My son and wife spent 5 days during the Big East Tourney at Madison Garden. The Best Western at Herald Square was very close to the Garden as well to central NYC. We traveled by foot as well by the Metro. The hotel was clean and all expectations were fulfilled. We would be likely to return to this hotel the next time come in New York.

I recently stayed at the Best Western Premier in New York City for five days. I found it very comfortable and, to use a pun, quite 'accommodating.' I'm glad I gave it a whirl.It is a new hotel...so it's clean, bright, pleasant, attractive. It's very centrally located in Herald Square. This is not the "hot spot" for dining. But, if you walk a few blocks up or down the street you can find wonderful restaurants for breakfast, lunch or dinner. And, the walk will do you good!The rooms are definitely small. So, you'll have to organize yourself. I kept losing things. But, I kept finding them again as well. Breakfasts are, well, not for someone like me who likes health food.
