But, they're adequate and a lot of people who are less fussier seemed perfectly happy.I got a great price for booking five nights. The staff was friendly, helpful, always courteous. The weather was FREEZING and the heat in the room worked well. There is no real lobby to speak of. But, I wasn't there to socialize. So, that was fine with me.All in all, while it's not the Ritz Carlton, it's a great mid-level hotel that is immaculately clean and very comfortable. I would definitely stay there again.

Modern clean hotel in the very center on NYC, close to everything. Convenient location- in few steps from Empire state, Macy's, 5 mins of walk to Times square, perfect for sightseeing and shopping. In few blocks from Penn station - start for both JFK and Newark airports. First we received the room facing the backyard with small window and bad smell of food from outside. It was really terrible for us because we got used to sleep with the open windows but they changed the room upon our first demand without any problems. Finally we were happy to receive the room on 13th floor with wall-sized window and nice street view, typical for NYC. Room is small but OK for NY stardards, nicely designed. Everything is modern and clean, but do not expect much - it's quite typical and simple. Complimentary breakfast and coffee/tee through the whole day. But for me standart budget USA breakfasts have almost nothing to eat - just cereals and fruits are OK, everything else, even bread and pastries, are absolutely uneatable. We had problems with wifi on all non-apple devices. For 2 persons they places only 1 set of small shampoo/conditioner bottles and it wasn't replaced for 3 days. Actually you can choose this hotel with no doubts if you have a good deal -it's really OK for NYC with its extremely high prices. But as for me - for my next stay I will look for something else - this hotel is good but enough to stay only once.

The hotel is new, so it is very clean. The breakfast room is a little small and not very welcoming, due to the fact that it is underground with no window. The staff was professional. The bedrooms are small. The localisation makes it a good hotel to visit New York for two or three days.

New, Clean, and well maintained. An easy subway ride to Times Square and the theater. Stayed two nights. Room small, but by new york standards, well designed and comfortable. Do not plan on hanging many clothes in the small closet. Suitcases also will have to be stacked in the corner. All and all a good experience. It was my second stay at this hotel.

The Location was PRIME AND The STAFF VERY INVITING AND HELPFUL.... The ROOMS were SMALL but very CLEAN. I stayed on the 6TH FLOOR and it was QUIET and the beds were COMFORTABLE. The lobby area and lounge were Beautiful and up beat with music playing all day.. BREAKFAST was HOT and SATISFYING. Will stay again.

First time ever in New York and wanted to stay close to ALL the action (had 3 Broadway shows to attend). Great location (2 blocks from Empire State Bldg; 4 blocks for Broadway; close to transit. Top floors have view of Empire State Bldg. Nice free continental breakfast. Staff are fantastic from front desk checking in or out, to ladies maintaining breakfast area, to all other staff---very friendly, always with a smile, very accommodating when asking for tips/recommendations on where to find routes and dinner restaurants. Felt appreciative. Definitely would stay here when I COME BACK...

Located perfectly in the center of Manhattan a few blocks from Penn Station and a few blocks from Times Square. Reasonably priced compared to other hotels. The rooms are very small. Breakfast is simple and included but you got the most necessary. Wifi included and available in the room. Luggage storage is available. The only thing I have to complain about is the cleanliness, which pulls down the overall grade. Housekeeping was poor the first few days and even though I complained two days in a row to the staff in reception that was not fixed the first few days. There were a lot of hairs in the shower and the floor in the bathroom plus other dirt in the rooms. Not until the third day this was corrected, probably when another cleaner came and the overall level of cleaning also became much better.Keens steakhouse located 40 meters (130 feet) next recommended for a dinner. Really good steakhouse.

My wife, toddler and I were able to come visit the city and hotel for the first time just recently (checking in on Sunday February 23rd 2014 and checking out Thursday February 28th 2014) Here are the highs and the lows of our stay.As for the highs:Your location is as well placed as I tell my clientsThe your building is beautifulThe breakfast was filling Breakfast servers were extremely friendlyAs for the lows:Housekeeping I am sorry to say was very poor:A few examples;Bed was so poorly made upon check in I had to remake it myself (coming up and almost off in a corner)Toilet paper was never replaced during a four day stay requiring a call to the front desk, a trip down to the front desk and was still never replaced (not to be grotesque but thankfully we had our child with us as after waiting more than an hour plus for said toilet paper ((that never came)) my wife had to use baby wipes in lieu of toilet paper)Tissue paper was never replacedRoom was never vacuumedHousekeeping left magic easer type cleaning sponge in room after a cleaningBedspreads seemed to have not been washed during duration of the stayOther areas of concern:Breakfast items only changed once in a four day stayRequested highest floor with best view and on first night received fourth floor facing another building with no viewWhen addressing concerns unfortunately fingers were pointed between the front desk and the housekeeping manager

Staff and service great, very happy to say "go there". Value for money big time. breakfast very decent, free tea coffee all day in lobby. Great mid town location. Train in from Kennedy and stroll from Penn stn.

Three people staying in a double queen room. Downsides:*Manhattan hotel rooms are small, and this one is particularly tight.* Scuff marks on the walls, stain on the duvet cover.* Bed not triple sheeted.*Tiny closet with ironing board inside taking up even more more space. Wood hangers that use slots instead of hooks.*The TV remote was in a bag that said the remote was "fresh", but I found gunk on the remote.*Loud music in lobby; I found it unpleasant.*Bedside table on only one side of the beds (ie between the two beds).*TV doesn't swivel, and it's not equidistant between the beds. (I guess this is where having a tiny room isn't all bad.)*Very little horizontal space for toiletries in bathroom.*One has to reach through the cold shower stream when turning on the water in the shower.*No bedside reading lamps.Benefits:*Good location, and based on the location, the value is good, despite the room being tiny.*Breakfast is very adequate.*Free coffee bar all day.*Helpful and pleasant staff, at the front desk and in breakfast room.*Free local calls and free wifi.I would stay here again, if I could get a competitive price for the room. For more than three nights, I think I'd get claustrophobic.

What a great location. This Best Western is right around the corner from the famous Macy’s Department Store. Overall the hotel was recently renovated and has all the modern amenities. The new updated bathroom and shower are 5 star! The wall of windows in the room, allows plenty of nature light into the room and makes the room feel twice the size, which is a good thing. Overall the room was very small for 4 people, but then again, its New York. You want space, go outside. Again, what a great place to stay from a location stand point!

Stayed at this hotel whilst having a holiday with my wife.Turned out to be an average hotel but suited our needs. We didn't eat in, all meals were taken out within the city.Front staff attitude was average and thought they could have been a little more helpful.On our arrival we checked the mini bar and found a bottle of wine to be missing, when we highlighted this the front desk tried to charge us........We were not given the upgraded room as we requested before arriving until my wife made a song and dance about it.The hotel was adequate for our needs, the room was clean and tidy, but who needs a bed in the city that never sleeps..

We stayed at the hotel at the end of October as a base for a friends wedding and a chance to explore New York. We weren't disappointed either with the hotel or NYC as a whole! The whole hotel feels new and clean with good use of limited space (as with most hotels in NY). Staff are uber friendly and helpful with staff greeting you every time you walk through reception. Rooms are a little on the small side but it's really not an issue when you are exploring the city. Breakfast has a good choice but it does get busy so getting down early is to your advantage.Would definitely stay there again

We stayed at the best western premier herald square. The hotel is centrally located and very clean. The staff is extremely nice and helpful. They will do everything to make the guest feel comfortable and welcome. The quality of service was definitely without reproach and extremely amicable. We were five people which in the rooms were a little tight but they found a way for everyone to get a good night sleep. I would definitely return to this hotel and recommend it to my friends and family.

Although a rough start to the holiday by being overcharged by 121dollars which was eventually rectified, our safe didn't work in our room but was quickly replaced. We absolutely loved this hotel, it was constantly clean and tidy. Breakfast was a bit samey but was always hot and plenty there. Our view out our room wasn't spectacular but we were never in it. The bed was soooooo comfy and shower was huge and lovely! It was a 5min walk from Macys and 10mins from Times Square. Location was perfect!

A newly remodeled hotel with a cozy room and spotless bathroom. The view of the empire state building was so beautiful. We walked to and from Penn station and had a great dinner at a local restaurant. We'll stay there next time we visit NY.

got a very good price to stay for a night here I was pleasantly surprised the room was small but very nice very comfortable bed nice bathroom would definitely stay here again very good location they offer a free breakfeast and new York times that is a great deal for new York city

It was really nice to be close to Times Square and to the Empire State Building, as well as to the Subway. I would definately come back to this Hotel, because it was a good price for being so close in the centre. The most important thing was that the room was clean. I don't need anything else! One thing, I have to criticize about this place is its staff. They weren't really friendly and that is for me something important. But for me no reason not to come back.

A friend and I stayed here two nights and chose this property based on location and proximity to Madison Square Garden and mid-town area. Positives: Location, PRICE, rooms are new and spotless and decorated in that mod style that is all the thing now Negatives: Service, lack of decent restaurants in immediate area (walking distance). I felt like the staff at the desk was continuously looking down and was not knowledgeable with the area or places to eat when asked; it felt like we were interrupting them from "something" when we asked a question. I don't remember them smiling, not once - well, it is New York, I guess. Room was cleaned well, but why on earth did they leave our dirty bar glasses behind? Were we supposed to walk these down ourselves? Weird. The small lounge is adorable and the bartender was very friendly - we enjoyed the happy hour there. I might stay again based on price, but do not expect any service. Break out your iPhone, you're on your own.

I stayed at room 1701, which had these problems: inadequate water pressure for showers, loud and frequent mechanical noises coming from the elevator shaft and ceiling throughout the night, thermostat did not respond to attempts to make the room warmer. The staff questioned that the problems existed and did nothing, because 'this was the first time they heard of it'. I had a very lousy night of sleep. On the good side, the decor was classy, the TV large and new, the cable programming excellent.

I had never stayed here before. My "fav" hotel was booked because of the Westminster Dog Show. I ended up here and it was in the same area and much cheaper. I liked that breakfast was included. The only complaint is that another hotel is being built right next door and they started construction at 6:30 AM. So ask for a room away from the construction if possible.

As a business traveler that tries to be a good steward of company funds, I choose this hotel based on price and prior good experiences with Best Western Premier locations. But this placed WOWED me! Great room (considering NYC room size reality), clean, newly appointed, good for computer work. More important than that was the people who made me feel welcome, going above and beyond to ensure my comfort. My new spot when in the city doing business.

50 West 36th was a great location for shopping, two blocks from Macys, and shows, six blocks from the theatre district. We walked to the shows and down to Little Italy from the hotel for lunch. The room on the sixteenth floor more than met our needs. Our room was across the hall from the elevator, but never a problem because there were only five rooms on the floor. Weather during our visit was frigid, the weekend before the Super Bowl, but the room was very comfortable. The property is relatively new. The bed was very comfortable. The staff was very helpful and courteous. The breakfast was typical Best Western but with the low priced room it was an inexpensive New York breakfast. Do not go to the breakfast room late as a surge of last second rookie tourists jam the room. Go earlier and you have the room to yourselves. We have been visiting NYC for over 15 years. We would definitely consider this hotel again. We saved enough on the room to pay for our meals and two shows while in town for three days. The only disappointment was when leaving we requested a taxi and a private vehicle was called instead. If not on the way to the airport, we would have denied the driver and found our own taxi. Next time we will be very specific. In every other way the visit was great.

This hotel is great for a short trip to NY. My husband and I stayed for 2 nights and loved everything about the hotel. Location was great (only 2 blocks away from Empire State Building), great friendly staff, and quick check-in/check-out. Would def recommend to anyone!

This is an easy walk from Penn Station. Price for seniors is excellent and room is more than adequate. The hotel is well managed, the rooms are clean and modern, and the front desk staff very friendly and helpful. I skipped the crowded breakfast and got a good meal at the Jerusalem cafe across the street. This is a good overnight stay--not the kind of room that I would want for relaxing, but excellent for business and other out and about stays.

We had a room at the highest floor, the 17th. The view from the room's floor to ceiling window was great; a prober city view with some skyscrapers and old buildings of NY. I've heard rooms in NYC are tiny but I couldn't say that from Best Western Premier Herald Sq. I really liked the modern rooms and photo canvas paintings on the walls. The heating worked well although it was freezing out-side. They even served yogurth at breakfast which I though isn't a standard in US hotels. Location couldn't be better, walking distance to Time Sq., Empire State Bldg., Macy's, Desigual store, Rockefeller Ctr and subway stations.

Stayed for 3 nights last week in the middle of the polar vortex! Location-wise, it is superb! Just less than two minutes walk to the 34th subway station. 3 minutes walk to Macy's and other shops. Great for walking to Times Sq and anywhere in midtown. The room is rather small but furnishing is well maintained and quite comfortable and clean. The bathroom was also tiny and for a relatively new hotel, there are already rust stains on the ceiling. There's hardly any counter space for anything but we had drawers in the room to store our toiletries. Our room (603) faced the street which I was pleased with at the start but soon found we could hear everything happening on the street. Rubbish trucks and drunk guests at 3am was the worst. There's free wifi and breakfast which is great. Overall a good deal in a well located best western.

Stayed here one night for a quick NYC getaway. Staff was welcoming, rooms clean and comfortable, breakfast standard fare. Good mid-town location. Nothing negative to say about this hotel. Would stay here again.

My mate and I stayed here purely based on location and was not disappointed! An easy walk to Macy's, Empire State Building, Time Square. Small cafés and pubs are located close by if you don't want to venture too far to eat at night. The complementary breakfast included in the cost of the room is great and caters for most diets. The bar located within the complex is small but the service is great and a nice way to wind down after a hard day of sightseeing. The rooms are small and wouldn't recommend a room on the lower floors street side as it is noisy. We were on the 4th floor, but other than that, no complaints. Clean, great wifi access and great bathroom for a small room. The staff were friendly and when there was an issue with our transfer service to JFK airport, the day we were checking out, they could not have done enough to help us. I am sorry I didn't get the guy on receptions name to thank him, but he went above and beyond especially as we had technically checked out of the hotel! Would definitely be back!

Hotel was easy to locate. Check in was fast. Lobby small but comfortable. Coffee available upon arrival. The room was small but very clean, decorated nicely, and comfortable bed. Breakfast is a bonus!!! Everyone was nice to us. Would stay there again!

My gf and I stayed at this hotel the last weekend in January of 2014. It was very clean, the staff was friendly and helpful and the location can't be beat! 5 minute walk to Times Square, 10 minutes to Grand Central or Penn Station. We will definitely stay here when we return in the spring!

Our room was in fresh condition and very clean. The partial view out our window of the Empire State building was a bonus! Penn trains and subway were very handy nearby. The airconditioning worked well and silently,and didn't overheat us; and the bed and pillows were so comfortable. The wi-fi worked well in our room.The location is so convenient, and Macy's Dept store so close for anything you need! The staff were all very pleasant and very helpful. We will definitely come back again. We used the hotel recommended taxi transport to La Guardia airport and were happy.

I want to start by saying I would definitely stay at this hotel again. The points I am going to make are observations rather than criticisms.We chose this hotel specifically because it is reasonably new and we were pleased to find it is not yet rough around the edges. When we first arrived we were a bit taken aback by the smallness of the room but I understand that this is usual in NYC. It did not affect our stay at all so unless a large room is important to you this would not be a problem. In contrast to the small room the shower was lovely and big. It was powerful and we always had plenty of hot water. The hairdryer was brilliant too - better than my own!The room only has a coffee maker. No kettle so no freshly boiled water for a ‘proper’ cup of tea. There were urns of coffee and hot water in the foyer by the lift. A welcome touch after a hard days sight seeing as we could grab a drink on the way to our room.The complimentary breakfast was fine. There was something for everyone. We didn’t use the bar.Finally I would say that I expected a view of the Empire State Building. We had a view of the street. This was entirely my fault for not researching this properly beforehand. The street was noisy but that was no problem to us.

BEST WESTERN PREMIER Herald Square, we stayed there 1/25/14 (Saturday night). We live in New Jersey about 90 minutes to NYC. I parked at Journal Square, Jersey City, no parking hassles. We took the ‘PATH’ train to Penn Station NYC. The hotel is 2 blocks from the station, great location. This hotel is less than a year old and very clean. The rooms are compact, but my wife & I had no problem with the small space. We did say, as a couple, we could not stay more than 2 nights in this size of a room. If either of us were here alone on business there would be no problem with this room for 3 or 4 nights. It is easy walking to fine restaurants, shopping and activities. We had tickets to a Broadway matinee show Sunday and were able to walk the short 10 blocks. This hotel has a nice bar lounge on the first floor the prices are very reasonable for NYC. They even have a ‘Happy Hour’ weekdays 3-7. There is no restaurant in this hotel. They do provide a free breakfast which is typical Best Western not bad/not great. We were satisfied with this self service meal (saved about $40 not having to buy breakfast). The hot items were pancakes, sausage patties and eggs (I think these are frozen and heated for breakfast, this was not a problem for us). There was a hot chafing dish with oatmeal that my wife enjoyed. The coffee was good and a good selection of tea. There were pastries, breads, cold cereal, fresh fruit & yogurt to choose. The lobby has free hot coffee & tea all day. The value of this hotel is very good for NYC. The staff is very professional and treated all with respect. This is a small boutique hotel, less than 100 rooms. I would recommend this hotel for anyone who does not need a large plushy room. Because of its location, cleanliness, value & great staff we will be back next time we want a room in midtown Manhattan. Enjoy, Chuck-06

Nice place, good, safe location. Very clean room. Staff was excellent and very willing to help in any way they could. Breakfast was OK, crowded but plenty of food and a nice variety. Room was pretty small, but fine. TV remote was clean and had its own special "notice of disinfection" bag. Would stay again

Cute little gem of a hotel. Great service from every employee. Hotel is 3 blocks from Macy's and about a 10 minute walk from Times Square. Lots of Irish bars on this street. The only thing I had a problem with was the internet speed. It is complementary though. Breakfast was very good. Fantastic shower! The bar lounge is cozy with a fantastic bartender! Rooms are Typical size for hotels in NY. Overall good stay!

The best hotel for the price. Very clean and comfortable room! Excellent & friendly staff! Room was very small, but considering it is New York it was ok. Breakfast was OK, it had the basics for a Best Western.

This is a reasonably new property in the heart of mid-town Manhattan. Close to Macy's and a short subway ride from Central Park. The rooms are terribly small which is understandable considering the premium on space in Manhattan. Breakfast was disappointing with not eggs although I believe the web site claimed that eggs were included. They gave us a breakfast voucher for two people despite us being four in our party. They gave us $8 off the parking fee of $43 at a nearby indoor parking lot. Nothing to write home about.

Great Location especially for walkers and those using public transportation. Couldn't reset the clock and never was able to figure out the thermostat. Neither were major issues for a single night, so I never reported it until checkout. Would definitely stay there again and would also recommend the hotel to others. Great hot breakfast.

Convenient location near Herald Square. Friendly and helpful staff. Clean, but small rooms. Great for a single business trip, may be a bit tight for a couple or family. Overall, good value for the location.

Very nice clean and modern hotel in a great location. The rooms are cozy and not a lot of storage space for 4 people but clean and comfortable. The lobby bar has a happy hour Monday to Friday 3 - 7 $3 Champagne and beers.

This is a place to consider if money is tight. The rooms aren't the biggest and the place isn't the fanciest, but it is clean, comfortable and the staff is friendly. Plus, you're close enough to walk to Broadway and Times Square. This is well worth the very reasonable rate.

We chose this hotel because of past recommendations on Trip Advisor. . .and we were not disappointed! Booked three months ahead at a decent price, checked one month ahead of time and found the total price reduced by over $200, so cancelled and rebooked. No problem with Best Western (online), a personal favorite of ours. Staff was extremely friendly throughout the hotel. This is a sign of a well-mamaged hotel. We were greeted warmly each morning by the ladies in the breakfast room who quickly replenished the very good selection of food--cold cereal, eggs, bacon/sausage, oatmeal, yogurt, etc. Quite a generous free breakfast for NYC. (As an extra tip, on the day we left, we gave the two ladies our Metro cards, each of which had a couple of rides left.) The location was perfect with lots of restaurants, bars, shopping, and subway stops nearby. We were never more than 2 stops away from our destinations. We did not have a great view, but our room was very quiet, large TV, with excellent wifi and good-sized safe. Happy Hour in the bar is well-priced and cozy. We flew into Newark and used the car service Easy7.com--their fee was comparable to what we pay in Houston to go to our international airport from our home (38 miles). Easy 7 is also recommended by Trip Advisor participants. I will definitely stay at this hotel on my next trip to NYC.

There are plenty of hotels in Manhattan that resemble a flea pit - this wasn't one of them. Everything was spotlessly clean and fresh, nothing worn out and broken - exactly as it should be. The hotel has a small footprint. The 3 rooms situated at the front have floor to ceiling windows, whilst the 3 at the back get the E.S.B treatment (if you're high up enough). Despite all the reviews about 'cramped rooms' I found mine adequate. Although having all the flat surfaces covered with fancy soaps, moisturiser, tissues, lamps, tea & coffee accoutrements, phone, note pad and alarm clock meant there wasn't even enough space for a Kate & Will's photo! Luckily the room had deep window boards and these got used as a makeshift shelf. The rooms are very comfortable, have nice beds, a decent sized TV, all of which comes as a welcome relief from the hustle and bustle outside the door. Extra tea making facilities are always available in the lobby which is very handy for a quick cuppa when going in or out. Breakfasts were more than adequate with: eggs, bacon, flat round things?, potatoes, toast, cereals, juices etc .. although HLN with Robin Meade would be appreciated on the 2 plasma's. The only real criticisms are for the guests who think it's okay to slam doors late at night......and also the complete loser who thinks they're really funny by dropping 3 cents into the tips jar down in the breakfast room. Oh dear!

We booked this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and because it is a new hotel opened last May.We are happy to say that we had a great time there during Xmas holidays and we are absolutely satisfied with BW Herald Square.Coffee /tea maker in each clean and small room. Coffee/tea always available for free also in the small lobby. Breakfast was basic but enough to start the day. From Monday to Friday the small lounge bar offers happy hour for a short selection of wines. Everything about the hotel is “small, short or essential” but everything is well managed and maintained.Anyway when you're visiting NYC, you're not spending so much time in your hotel.Hotel location is perfect: Time square, Penn station subway, Central Station are few blocks away and within walking distance. Wi-fi is free and fast. Staff was mostly courteous and professional. Ask for a room at high floor on the back of the hotel: no traffic noise and a great view of Empire State Building.We only have one complaint: holidays are over.

Ok, the rooms are small. VERY small but nice. I would not stay more than 1-3 nights. Although it says it sleeps four, it would be tight. There is no room for luggage. The closet is about 1 foot wide. I stayed there the coldest day in a minute (Jan. 7th) and it was comfortable. There is exercise equipment, 24-hr coffee/tea and a free hot breakfast. Everything about the hotel is small. But I have to say it is a study in minimalism, BW took advantage of every square inch. They even have a lounge with a happy hour and courtyard. I would stay there again, for a weekend and recommend it for 1-2 travelers. I got a good deal on the BW website, Great location although I almost missed it; adjoins a Holiday Inn Express. Got our own cabs and rode the Metro a block away. It is as pictured, fairly new. Might have been an alleyway before. Watch out for early morning construction noise on the back side of the hotel.

My wife and I spent one night for an overseas layover and that was more than enough. To say the rooms are small is an understatement, there was barely enough room to walk around the bed. At $300/nt, I expected something more substantial even in NYC. I also had some issues with the front desk arranging a cab transport. They refused to arrange a yellow cab and would only deal with the black "limo" cabs (which are conveniently waiting outside) who set the rate based on what you are willing to pay. After trying to charge us $35 for a 4 block ride early in the day, we bit the bullet for afternoon transport back to the airport as the weather was deteriorating and we wanted to check in for our flight. For comparison, a yellow cab ride from the airport was $57 and the return trip via black cab was $93 (which was originally quoted at $65). On a positive note, the rooms were clean and the breakfast "buffet" was adequate. This place is ok for an overnight if you are traveling alone without much luggage and don't need the hotel to arrange a cab.

the staff is very helpful and friendly. the hotel is only 3 rooms wide, with 6 rooms on each floor: a cute little skyscraper in a great location in manhattan. the beds are so very comfortable! the complimentary breakfast is plentiful and delicious. everything my only complaint is that the heat didnt work... and we were there on the coldest day in NYC history! we were so tired from a long cold day after we tried everything with the heater we just ended up sleeping in our winter jackets. we shouldve called the reception im sure they wouldve helped but we were just so tired!

Stayed here over the New year rooms quite small as per most in NYC small wardrobe but could easily place suitcases under beds o give more room for all your shopping bags!!, There's a coffee machine in room along with large plasma TV. The bathroom is well equipped with very large shower with complimentary toiletries plenty of towels a hairdryer and shaving mirror for gents.Breakfast area was very small and crowded best try and get there when it opens I went at 8am and there was nowhere to sit as all the tables were occupied, bacon and sausages were on offer along with scrambled egg, toast, bagels,pastries and yogurt were also on offer along with tea and coffee this is also on tap 24hrs in reception area Erica one of the workers in the breakfast area was really nice. All in all great hotel at a decent price located near Macy's, subways and times square a 10 minute walk away 5th Avenue 1 minute walk would definitely consider staying here again due to the price.

My daughter and I had a 2 night stay in New York City in October, at this hotel, very clean and quiet the staff were fantastic and the location was perfect walking distance to just about everything. Although the breakfast room was small the food was plentiful and quite good. Will definitely stay here again.

The hotel is in the heart of NY, near all the important and interesting tourist sites. There are restaurants, coffee shops, cafeterias, and shops surrounding it. The hotel is small but is comfortable. It was very clean. The staff was very friendly. The only downside to it that you could hear every sound. But I was fine with it because I spent the whole time outside touring the city and indulging all the good food they have in the city. Breakfast was good especially for people who like eggs, bacon, bagels, and other sweets. There was coffee and tea 24 hours in the lobby which was great. I definitely would stay there again.

Pretty good hotel in the center of Manhattan. Decent price. Good breakfast. Nice personnel. Lot of things to do around; shopping, sightseeing, museums. Everything is easy to reach. The hotel also has a convenient agreement with a parking garage that is literally in a very close distance. If I have a chance, I will stay at this hotel again

Great location near Times Square and Penn Station. Room was clean and comfortable although quite small. We were in the back room on the 8th floor and it was quiet (away from elevator). Good experience - would stay here again. Got the room with two double beds and was fine for two people (myself and adult son)

I stayed at this hotel for a trip to New York with 7 friends to see the Christmas lights. The hotel was very clean and it is less than 2 blocks to Macys and the subway. It is very convenient to get around New York. I only used a taxi one time and that was getting back to the airport. Although the rooms are small, we were able to fit 4 women in each room. The breakfast was good and free! They had a nice selection each morning with usually an egg and hot meat included along with cereals, bagels, and fresh fruit. They have a decent happy hour M-F until 7. I would definitely stay here again!

This hotel is outstanding, very upscale. Great amenities, very comfortable beds, beautiful bathrooms, great hot/free breakfast. We will definitely stay here again. Great location for sights in NYC, near Times Square and Rockefeller Center.Really good restaurants nearby as well.

I stayed at the BEST WESTERN PREMIER Herald Square for 4 nights with my mum and sister in October. This seems to be a really new hotel that has been squeezed in between two other tall buildings – our cab driver couldn’t find it initially and had to do some tricky manoeuvring on the street outside. The rooms were pretty small but big enough for the three of us for the limited time we spent in the room; when you are in a city like NYC you just need somewhere to rest your head! It was all really nicely fitted out and the shower was huge! The location is really good, just minutes from the Empire State Building, Macy’s and the shops on 42nd Street. There are also some food options nearby such as 5 Boro Burger and there is a subway stop for Herald Square on the next block. We ate breakfast every day in the breakfast room (this was included in our rate) and we didn’t struggle for seating/have to queue. There were different hot options each day along with bagels, muffins, cereal etc. We did eat early (jet lag) and noticed that by about 8.30am it was getting busier. We enjoyed happy hour drinks in the bar most afternoons where the staff were lovely and it was never too busy. The only real negative was on our departure – we asked about transport to the airport and they booked us a cab but this actually turned out to be a towncar which would have charged us over double what we’d pay in a yellow cab. A bit annoying but we flagged down a cab outside the hotel instead.

I stayed here for five nights with my family just a few days back and we had a wonderful time.It was our first time to New York and after reading the reviews here on tripadvisor.com I decided to try it out.At the time of check-in just one room was ready even though we were there at around 5:30pm;but it was a busy time because of holiday rush,so it was alright.There were many reviews which mentioned the room size,and yes they were small but not really a problem.We had booked two rooms,one with king bed (for two persons) and the other with double beds (for four persons),but the double bed really isnt that big for two persons ; our kids were ok with it,but if it was one adult and one child,i think it would be difficult to managebut the beds/pillow were really comfortable.The breakfast was basic continental type,but it was ok for us ; the area/location was the best...just a little off the main avenues (5th and 6th),so not too much crowd or traffic ; and we walked to most places...like times square...rockefeller center...madison square garden...etc.I felt it was a little bit more expensive than it should be,but we were there for five days between 24th and 29th december,so i guess the rates are always high around that time.Anyway,had a wonderful time,and would definitely come back.

I stayed in this hotel for last-minute business meetings - just two nights, but more than enough to realize what a nice place this is. Very simply, it checks all of the boxes any traveller would be looking for;- Very clean (no hair in shower, bathroom spotless, room and public spaces always clean)- Recently renovated (carpet still smells new, furniture looks great, everything works)- Great free hot breakfast (eggs, bacon, pastries, juices, coffee, etc.)- Fast and free wifi (skype videocalls worked just fine)- Friendly and welcoming staff (no issues during my stay, but everyone was nice for regular encounters)The only two negatives - the rooms are very tight and there is no valet. This is a small hotel, wedged between two buildings, so the space is limited (the closet is probably 1/4 of what you are used to in a normal hotel room and there is very limited open space). I had no issues at all, but for a family, it could get tiring for an extended stay. The lack of valet is mostly fine, as there is a garage a few buildings down on W36th, but it could be a minor inconvenience on check-out. Since the street is one way, you're pretty much stuck walking a few minutes down the road with your bags to get your car (much faster than getting your car and going around the block back to the hotel). Again, I had no issues whatsoever with this, but it might be annoying for some, depending on the circumstances.Overall - a fine hotel at a truly great price. Go into this knowing what you are getting and I can almost guarantee that you will be a happy traveller.

This hotel is very conveniently located, being just a short walk away from the shopping district, Grand Central Station, the Rockefeller Centre, etc. The rooms are very small, but this is not a hotel to do anything other than sleep in. It was comfortable and clean, with attentive staff and a decent breakfast thrown in. Nothing to complain about all! We even had a view of the Empire State Building from our room...

Stayed one night in city on Christmas Eve on way to NJ and were very happy! Rooms are small but clean, staff was helpful and accommodating (shout out to Lou who got us an early check-in and stored our bags after check-out), free hot breakfast was ample and good, and price was right! Close to Empire State Building and Macy's and walking distance to Times Square. Would stay here again!

This is the one of serveral hotels with a fantastic location near almost any place you would want to visit. We only stay one night but we look forward to staying a long weekend in near future. You can walk to Times Square and all the other attractions in NYC. The price was unbelievable and the room was excellent.

Newly updated with a boutique hotel feel. Small rooms but very clean and new. Stayed there with 2 adults and three children and room was small, but fine for 1 night. They do not have rollaway beds here though which I was disappointed about so one of the kids had to sleep on the floor but they were very nice about giving us extra blankets and pillows. Good for a family of 4, no bigger.

super stylish tiny rooms, very functional designs make it very cosy and comfortable. The kids and I loved our floor to ceiling window on one whole wall looking down in the street life of NYC; our friend had a room with a small window but it had a view of the empire state building. we were really impressed with the breakfast room and the food too. Unbeatable location, friendly staff and good value. Would go out of my way to recommend this hotel.

My sister and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights recently and could not have asked for a better accommodation! This hotel is new and the rooms are clean and beautifully decorated. We stayed on the 16th floor and OMG the view was amazing!!! We woke up each morning in awe that we were looking out onto the skyline of NYC out of the giant floor to ceiling windows! I would recommend trying to get a room on one of the top floors, trust me, the views are priceless! The room was bigger than expected, although the counter space available for toiletries and things in the bathroom was almost non-existent. The elevators can be pretty noisy and make a loud banging noise throughout the night. Luckily, I brought earplugs along just incase this sort of thing happened and they definitely were needed in order to get a good nights rest. The front desk staff was super helpful and even kept our luggage (free of charge) for 4 hours after check out so that we could soak up the last bit of NYC before we had to catch our flight. The area felt very safe and was in walking distance to so many attractions including Bryant Park, the Empire State Building, Macys, Rockefeller Center, Times Square and with subways so close it was easy to take a ride anywhere else in the city that we wanted to go. I absolutely loved this hotel and couldn’t say enough nice things about our stay here! We will definitely be back!

The hotel is small but well located. The room size was good by New York standards, although the closet was very small. The location was ideal for our purposes, close to Time Square, the shopping areas, and within walking distance of most of what we wanted to see. Plus, the subway is handy.

stayed 4 nights in December, nice & central, around the corner from Macy's, close to the Empire State building & just a few blocks from Times Square. Very good helpful staff & included a decent, but not great breakfast. the room was a little small, more like a Euro hotel, but you're not in the room during most of your stay. I'd stay there again, no problem.

What a super nice hotel!! Staff was friendly and helpful. We enjoyed a delicious breakfast each morning. Rooms were a little small, but very clean and well decorated. Excellent location. Close to subway stations and best yet, Macy's!! We will stay here again and recommend it to our friends and family.

As everyone knows by now, this is increasingly difficult to find a brand new, clean and central double room in the sub USD 200 category.... this one qualify the 3 criterias>#Small but well furnished, equipped double room. With all the needed>Large, comfy but a bit too soft bed / extra blanket etc... top overallClean, super Italian style shower with quality product and hairdryerWhile, unfortunately not yet a Nespresso© machine, a decent tea, coffee kettlerConvenient TV and Radio. The Free Wifi sounds a nice perk but its slowness make it unusable.#Breakfast. Do not expect any quality one but fresh coffee and pastries are just ok for a quick coffeine fix early on before jumping to your day program#Staff, for NY standards are quite efficient. Super friendly and efficient left luggage,locker intendants. Overall, this is a good place to stay 1 or 2 nights. Because mainly of its super clean and new condition, the location makes it very convenient next to the subway and all attractions reachable very conveniently and safely in this nice borough. btw lots of super Korean restaurants on the same 36th 50W street. Enjoy}}}}

This hotel is located near the Empire State Building, Macy's and near the metro. It's a great location and easy to get around all over Manhattan from here. Walk to Times Square. Plenty of good food available nearby. Clean, comfy beds, excellent breakfast. The room was a little smali but still enough room. The bathroom was really nice

Just had a full week in this hotel, was meant to be 5 nights but our Saturday night flight was cancelled until Monday so had to stay on for 2 more days, 9th floor room looking onto 36th St, could get a bit noisy at times but didn’t bother us at all, check in was a dawdle and room spotless and maids did a great job.Had a lie in on our first morning so thought we had missed breakfast so we took a stroll down to have a look at the breakfast room and was surprised to see it was still opened after 9.30am so we sat down and stuffed our faces with eggs, bacon, bagels and tea, superb.Great location just around the corner from Macys and the subway.Would go back in a minute.

Newer Hotel, clean spacious room for New York City standards. Friendly staff, great bartender named Feliks. Full breakfast that had many hot and cold items for everyone's taste. Upscale pasteries. It is a short walk to 5th Avenue and the decorated holiday windows, and a short walk to the theatre. Lots of restaurants and pubs nearby both upscale and moderately priced.

Small room but great location, helpful staff; 6 blocks to Times Square; 1.5 blocks to Penn Station. Comfortable and secure area for walking. A good bargain pricewise. We were there during the Christmas season and prices were as much as doubled at many hotels. We didn't use their breakfast but lots of good spots in the neighborhood. We are already planning a return trip.

Very affordable hotel in heart of Midtown. Within 2 blocks of Macy's flagship, lots of dining options and shopping. Very small as are most hotel rooms in this area, but modern updated decor, comfortable and clean. Great value for the price

Very centrally located especially on arrival from Newark (EWR) at Penn Station. The hotel is within walking distance and you pass by Madison Sq Gardens, Macy's and a view of the Empire State Bldg on the way! The rooms are small but well-appointed; although we had two beds, I'd hesitate to have 4 persons to a regular room. The hotel is recently renovated and you can tell. Having breakfast included is a real bonus for a large American city and, it is a FULL breakfast. I gave the hotel a 'very good' instead of excellent b/c of the smell in the elevator. It is a short ride up and down but the lingering smell of bacon (grease) is quite overwhelming (even for someone who likes bacon!)

This is a small hotel, 17 floors, 6 rooms per floor. Renovated in the spring of 2013. All the rooms are new and very nice, but small. Very clean. The breakfast is very good with eggs, bacon or sausage, potatoes, oatmeal, plus cereal, rolls, bagels, yogurt. The breakfast is included and a great value for NYC. Location is only 2 blocks from Macys and subways. Not that close to theatre district, but walkable. We had a room on the 17th floor and water pressure was low. We could see the Empire State Building out our window.

Ideally located in Manhattan. Fairly new, clean, nicely decorated hotel. The rooms are small but this it typical in Manhattan where real estate is at a premium. Friendly, professional staff. We will return!

This was our first stay at this premier hotel and the pluses are super clean, excellent included breakfast and caring staff. However the rooms are clearly small and although the location is perfect for Macy's and the Empire State- the Best Western Presidential is a better location for the theatre district-it is older but has bigger rooms and curb help. Premier is however very recommended.

To start, we had a cancelled flight and got this room for under a hundred bucks for the night. And I loved this hotel! Easy to get to, small, quiet and super friendly staff. Close to all of the irish pubs and awesome Asian food in midtown. For one night, free wifi and breakfast included it couldn't be beat. They also happily storedour luggage and sorted out our transport to the airport. Love them!

Within walking distance to Penn Station and Madison Square Garden. Really close to Empire State building, had a beautiful view from our room. We even walked the 13 blocks to Rockefeller Center-tree was beautiful. The hotel was good, the internet never worked and the bar was a bit pricey but that's NY for you.

We stayed here 2 nights on a little getaway. I was a little nervous about the room size after reading previous reviews, but there was no need to be. Rooms were of an average size for NYC.We had two adults, one small child and luggage and shopping bags and were not cramped at all. We stayed on the top floor in a corner room with a King bed. It was quiet, comfortable and REALLY CLEAN. We had a magnificent view of the Empire State Building right outside the window. What an awesome "night light" the Empire State Building turned out to be! Here are the Pros and Cons:Pros:-Incredibly CLEAN rooms-Attentive housekeeping service-Cool, modern decor-Great views-Huge television that gets all of the Direct TV channels-perfect for unwinding after a day of sightseeing.-Beds and pillows were really comfy. I mean REALLY comfy.-VERY fast elevators. Never had more than a 3 minute wait, and it was rarely even that long!-Free hot breakfast-scrambled eggs, sausage, pancakes, etc.-Free coffee and tea in the lobby-Excellent Midtown location-around the corner from Macy's and near many nice restaurants and bars. -Hotel will call a car service for you if you wish to avoid taking public transportation or trying to hail a taxi. NOTE: it is a CAR SERVICE-NOT A TAXI. Yes, you will pay more. But they are upfront about this and sometimes it is worth it if you have someplace important to be and time is of the essence.Cons:Very minor stuff. A fridge would be a great addition to the rooms. Also, the walls are a bit thin. Overall: I HIGHLY recommend this hotel. It's a great value.

We used a free night voucher here, otherwise the place would have cost between $400-$500 a night. The room was small, the huge window overlooking the street was dirty, coffee wasnt refilled in the morning, no valet (so you have to double park in front) and no one helped us with our bags. I felt like we were staying in a roadside best western for $75 a night. Location is great, but than again anyplace in midtown would be as well.

This hotel is in a prime location! Steps away from the subway and right next to the famous Macy's Herald Square. There are a lot of restaurants and shopping nearby and it is only minutes away from the Empire State building by foot. This hotel is brand new offering floor to ceiling windows with breath taking views. When entering the hotel you are greeted by some of the friendliest staff who are looking to help you find your way around the big apple. Felix at the hotel bar is sweet and quite knowledgeable about the history of NYC. Although the hotel is near other hotels this Best Western truly is a Premier hotel offering the best service at the best price!

We've always liked to stay with BW so naturally we booked this hotel when we went to new york for the first time. Hotel is right in the middle of everything! One block to subway station, 1.5 block to Macy's and has a famous steakhouse 3 doors down (Keens).Room is tiny, understandably, but very clean. Staff is friendly. Breakfast is yummy. Cant ask for more with a new york standard!

Rooms a little small, but great location! can walk to most places. Parking is a couple doors down, a little pricey, $35.00 a day w/hotel validation. Rooms did not have a fridge or microwave, but there are plenty of restaurants close by. Go out for breakfast, the complimentary breakfast is sparse and usually cold. The staff was really friendly and helpful, rooms were very clean, the cab rides to local attractions were not too pricey ($15.00 to Time Square, $10.00 to Central Park). I would probably stay again, it suited our purpose.

Small, clean, conveniently located new (Spring 2013?) hotel in Herald Square between 6th and 5th Ave(s). Subways, Herald Square, and various restaurants just outside entrance of hotel to just around the corner. Small, clean, comfortable rooms; morning paper (not on holidays), self serve coffee/tea in lobby, and self serve breakfast on lower level. Good value for budget conscious travelers.

My friends and I recently had two rooms for a short weekend stay in NYC. The hotel is brand new, very clean, quit and in a great location! i would highly recommend this as an option for a trip to New York!

We checked in to the Best Western after we had to move from our previous hotel. And what a quantum leap in standards it was! Why didn't we come here in the first place? It was even more affordable. Still in a great location near the Empire State Building. The welcome was very warm, with hot drinks on hand in the lobby. The rooms were spacious and modern, with a good HD TV and WiFi. There was a little bit of noise from the street, but in general was fairly quiet. Breakfast downstairs was more than adequate, and the gym was above average for most hotels.The only possible blemish was that the staff didn't know what a 'late check-out' was, which given we had a late flight, we would have gladly paid a little extra for.However, given all my comments above, I would be back.

well, i stayed here with my family while in NYC for a holiday. while I cant say that it was cheap, it was reasonable by NYC standards.location was great, just a few minutes away from the subway, and near the main street where you can get food and stuff. macy's is near by too. so is korea town if you wanna get some korean food. staff were nice, breakfast was fine with a decent american style breakfast. free hot drinks are available at the lobby all day. hotel seems really new, which i believe it is actually. hence i would really recommend this hotel for the price and location. its hard to get such a nice comfortable place at a better price in such a good location. Also, please do not ask the hotel to call a cab for you. just flag one on the road. there are plenty all day. the ones they call will be more expensive and seems like a chauffeur service since its not a typical yellow cab. it takes forever to come too. dont even bother

This was one of the best hotels I've stayed at and I have stayed at plenty (The W, Waldorf, Westin etc). The staff was extremely nice and helped me with ease. I loved the bar downstairs, prices were extremely fair and the bar tender Felix I believe his name is was a great person to talk to and definitely knew his drinks. I wold stay here again, no question about it.

Rooms are clean, very cool hip art on the walls and comfortable. Not sure how many people I would want in the rooms, I stayed by myself in a king room and was fine. Great location with a nice outside patio area.

This hotel is in a great location and the rooms are sleek, modern, and clean. Located between 5th Avenue and 6th Avenue, the hotel is close to the 34th St./Herald Square subway station.Unlike other reviewers, I did not find the room crampt. Small, yes, but not crampt. If you're in a Manhattan hotel room and you don't have to walk on top of the bed to get to the other side of the bed, you're in a pretty decent-sized hotel room. For three nights I stayed in a room with a king-sized bed and furniture perfectly proportioned to the room. No complaints there. My room, located in the back of the hotel on the 8th floor, was also very quiet.The staff was friendly and helpful. There was no problem keeping our luggage at the hotel in between the time we checked out and the time we left the city. The staff clearly knew several repeat customers, mostly businessmen. So, it must be good if they keep returning.At 3 o'clock there's a happy hour at the hotel bar. $4 for a glass of wine in Manhattan is a steal. The woman behind the bar was also very friendly and pleasant.My only complaint is that the lobby was like walking into a 100-degree sauna. No idea what that was about. But it won't stop me from returning or from recommending this hotel to others.

Was my fifth time in NY and I've never stayed in such a comfortable hotel like this, we were three in a two double bed room, was very spacious and nice decoration. The building is new, the breakfast area is big with a variety of food and fresh fruit.The location is the best, just in the middle of everything, around corner is the subway station, Macy's, Starbucks, HyM, the Empire State, and a few minutes walking is Times Square ...The staff at the check in and the bell boy were very friendly and also speak Spanish.The hotel is accessible thought public transport from Newark airport, I took the greyhound bus and leave at Bryant park, just 6 blocks walking ( around 7 minutes)

The Best Western Herald Square provided a quality experience. The staff were excellent, the hotel was clean and nicely appointed. The only somewhat negative comment would be the 10 X 12 room was a bit cramped. It was certainly fine for an overnight stay, and its location near Penn Station was perfect for us.

Great Location - Best bell/ luggage guys EVER This is a hidden gem in Manhattan. Just a block away from 34st Herald Square Metro Station, 5 mins or less from Macy's and Bryant Park... In the middle of the garment district with top places to do business. Get the top floor rooms, we never had an issue with noise or anything and they were very comfy considering the avg size of NYC rooms.

excellent+ clean place to stay. very friendly staff . hotel held my luggage for 5 hrs before my checkin time and didnt charge. didnt have a bottle opener and bar staff opened bottle and didnt charge. great service all around.

Stayed here last week for 6 nights with my sister...couldn't say enough about the staff-from dining room to reception to the guy who came to fix our safe...they were SO nice.Lou (concierge) deserves a special mention - always pleasant and helpful.Location was fabulous-couldnt believe it when we turned the corner and there was Macys!!we only got the subway once as we walked everywhere.It was just so central, it didnt seem worth going to the hassle of getting a taxi or subway.Lovely weather too.we were initially assigned a room opposite the lift and asked immediately to change to another-this was done without any fuss or sighing and with a smile.the only down side(s) for us were the price of a glass of wine $9 unless it was Happy Hour-we ended up going across the road where it was half that price.My biggest problem was because the room was so small(and it was VERY small)there was no easy chair..which meant that we had to sit on the bed all the time and with a bad back, it was not comfortable.The bathroom was a great size and lovely.All was really clean and spotless.Household were fabulous and kept the place really shining.Overall,I would highly recommend this hotel-the rooms are small but breakfast was sufficient and it was so great not to have to commute in and out of the city and have everything on the doorstep.

This hotel had everything we needed - good rate, clean rooms, comfortable beds, breakfast room, and to top it off, the staff at our hotel were so friendly and happy to help. The room as small, but hey, we're in NYC! I appreciated having the convenience of the breakfast room in the hotel. Nice selection of breakfast items and the fresh fruit was fresh! The weather was nice (for November) and we were able to enjoy the outside patio in front of the hotel. Location was perfect for this particular trip. Plenty of bars and restaurants close by. We are Red Sox fans and the staff graciously congratulated us on our World Series win! Thank you!

Booked the Best Western in Herald Square for 2 night in October and November. Location fantastic, close to Maceys, Time Square, Penn Station etc. Staff great. Room a bit small but overall very clean and comfortable. Booked accessible room (husband in Wheelchair) no problem getting into bathroom and shower open and spacious. Requested a plastic chair for shower and it was delivered ASAP... Would definitely recommend anyone to stay here and would stay again. Thanks Best Western

For easy access to Manhattan, it's hard to beat this location--even if the traffic was so grid locked that I had to walk the last two blocks while the Super Shuttle, literally, went nowhere.This new property has a curious shape: very narrow (each of its floors only has six rooms) and quite tall. My midway, tenth-floor room was directly opposite the elevator, yet I was seldom bothered by the comings and goings of my fellow guests or staff.The layout--especially for business travellers--is somewhat awkward as the work station more or less blocks easy passage to the two queen beds. The unseasonably cool weather was too much for the ceiling-installed heating system: even after setting the temperature in the high 70s, the floor area never really got warm. The hotel's Wi-Fi was woefully inadequate: sending emails was hit and hiss depending on the whim of the server; downloading even moderately sized files was consistently truncated before all of the bytes had dutifully arrived (thank goodness for my Bell turbo stick which finally began working as advertized).On the plus side, the daily happy hour had genuine bargains and attentive staff; the lower level breakfast buffet offered a commendable variety of hot and cold selections along with typically efficient staff.If the technical challenges can be overcome for the business traveller and the heat somehow tweaked to provide warmth from head to toe, then this hotel would be highly recommended to one and all.

Front desk staff were great. Room was very good. The only negative about this stay was the breakfast room staff. We were in a hurry to catch a train, with a cab booked for 6.45 a.m. Breakfast room was supposed to open at 6.30 a.m. but even though 2 employees saw us waiting outside at 6.25 a.m. they didn't open it until I knocked on the door at 6.35 a.m. and even then it was grudgingly. Consequently we barely had time to have juice and cereal.

I helped coordinate a school trip and after reading several reviews about this hotel, decided to book our rooms. If you are planning a trip with a group, this is the ideal place to stay for the following reasons:1. There are only 6 rooms on a floor, and you can all be located close together.2. The hotel in near almost all subways.3. You are located close enough to Times Square/Macy's, etc. to walk or ride the subway.4. They serve breakfast in the hotel--a nice way to have a group planning meeting in the morning.5. The hotel staff is awesome. They went out of their way to help all the members (most were 16-18 years old) of our group feel at home and seemed to enjoy speaking with them each day about how things were going. Even though some kids deactivated their keys on a regular basis, the staff always smiled, made another key and helped them figure out what they were doing wrong.6. There is a patio out front that allows you to meet up as a group before going out for the day and without blocking the lobby.7. The hotel staff anticipates your needs. We stored our luggage, as our flight left later in the day. When we returned with only minutes to spare, we found our luggage on a cart ready to be wheeled out to the bus. Perfect timing.8. After a few days the staff knew we were riding the subway. When several lines closed down for the weekend, they let me know what lines were closed and how to work around the closed lines.The location is great but the staff make it awesome.

I stayed here last week for one night.The Good: Laura at the front desk, and Antonio and Yvonne in the breakfast room. These 3 staff members were wonderful, smiling, polite, efficient. The hotel should be proud to have them on staff. I also thought the mattress was very comfortable, and the toiletries were good. There's free coffee in the lobby. The breakfast was a step up from normal complimentary - bacon, hot oatmeal, eggs (patties, though, not real). The breakfast room is pleasant and clean and they re-fill everything. The decor is modern, bright and cheery.The Bad: Not much, but I wish the windows would open. The corners of the bathroom floor needed a bit more attention, cleaning-wise. And of course being NYC the rate was insane but comparable to other hotels in this range.Overall, a good choice. I'd come back, for sure.

I booked a three night stay at this hotel when I was running the NYC Marathon. On Saturday night, which was the night before my race, the hotel had a party that was held down in the breakfast area of the lobby. The music was so loud that I called to complain 4 different times. It wasn't until 3 am that the music stopped and I was able to get to sleep. Then to make matters worse the wake up call that I requested for 6 am came at 5 am!! When I woke up to leave the entire 3rd floor smelled like marijuana and it was incredibly smokey. I complained to the front desk the next morning and they said they could not do anything about it. I have called the general manager 6 times to request a refund and he will not take my calls or return my calls. I called Best Western and they are unable to do anything to assist me as all of their hotels are now franchised. There is a lovely Hyatt Place next door so do yourself a favor and stay there instead!!

The location of this hotel is perfect, right next to the Empire State Building, Times Square and Macy's. As previous reviewers have mentioned the rooms are quite small but the beds were comfy and the room spotlessly clean. The complementary breakfast was a nice extra.Overall a good for value clean hotel in a great location.

I would probably like to start by saying that the hotel is good, but there is no rating of good, so have chosen average. The main reason why I give it average is is due to the tiny rooms.Spent 6 nights recently at Best Western Premier in mid Oct. Hotel is in a great location - close to Macy's, Penn Station, Empire State, lots of eating places.Hotel is reasonably new & very clean. Employees are helpful with directions etc & pleasant to deal with. Rooms are extremely small. There was no place to keep our 2 suitcases & had to walk like a crab to get around the bed. Not sure if all the room sizes are the same. The room had a very comfortable king size bed, which almost took the entire room size. I have stayed at other NY hotels & know that rooms are small but this room was the smallest I have ever stayed in. Other than the room size, our stay was good.Breakfast provided was sufficient with plenty of seating. I can imagine during peak times that people would need to wait for tables. There was one morning that we had to wait less than 5 min for a table, the people vacating the table left all their rubbish, so I politely asked them would they like me to put it in the garbage for them, they quickly turned around & put it in the rubbish themselves. I think they expected the staff to clear it for them! What is wrong with some people? The staff looking after the breakfast room did a good job & replenished supplies as required. We only had cereal, toast & yoghurt, but noticed some hot dishes as well.My hubby made use of the exercise equipment & said it was modern & in good condition.They also have a computer with a printer which is handy for boarding passes, directions etc, which I made use off. Free wifi was good, though at times was a little slow.I would recommend this hotel to friends, but would make them aware that rooms are very small.

Personnel were efficient, not overly friendly, but just fine. Our room was sort of small; but, adequate. Location is within a few blocks of Empire State Building, Times Square, et al. and, subway station is only a block away. Nice patio in front which is perfect for people watching. The real bonus is the comprehensive breakfast buffet w/ donuts, sausage or bacon, scrambled eggs, cereals, juices, coffee, etc. Beds were super fluffy and comfy. Coffeemaker in room; but, no fridge.

The ONLY bad thing I can say about this hotel is that there was some early morning noise due to construction next door. That's it! The beds are SUPER comfy, it is located in a convenient area, breakfast is great with hot foods, free wifi, what more can you ask for! Front desk staff are super helpful. Thoroughly enjoyed my stay.

Didn't realize how good the location was until we got there. Great for taking the subway because your right by Herald Square station. Breakfast was okay and we didn't find the eating area overly crowded although some reviews have commented on this. In New York there are lots of people everywhere, all the time, so if you think the breakfast area is crowded wait until you take the subway at 8am Monday morning. Extremely clean rooms. Smaller but we completely expected that. It was a great place to start and end busy days in New York.Staff were nice and helpful. They booked us a taxi/town car to the airport which arrived right on time. We had some issues with gift cards being processed at first but the staff fixed the problem within a few days of returning home. When I return to New York I will stay here again. The hotel value was great. $250 a night for a room in midtown Manhattan is a good price!

Stayed here to see a show at MSG - perfect location to go to and from Gran Central, Hell's Kitchen, etc. New hotel, clean and nicely decorated. Breakfast included, but can't comment on quality since we didn't go. Small but not boutique style hotel. Very small room, but that doesn't bother me since I'm there to do things out of my room. Only slight problem: elevators sometimes very busy and noisy in hallway! I expect the street noise........

The staff was excellent, and very responsive, when I arrived early. Its a new hotel, small, quaint, but well done. Breakfast is better than most BW. Very good value, also has a small but well equipped fitness center.

Good location. If you are going to take a cab to the airport do not ask the front desk to get you one. The hotel seems to have some contract with a private company and the price is much more expensive than a regular cab.

Don't blink . . . you might miss the hotel . . . in fact we did and so did our cab driver. This hotel is small in size but big in customer service! We arrived at the hotel from our cruise-port by cab and if my wife hadn't caught the sign we might have driven around longer even though our GPS picked it up. We arrived early (5 hours before our booking) because of our cruise-ship disembarkation but the staff was very willing to let us put our suitcases into storage, grabbed a fresh (always available coffee) and complementary maps for our morning walk. You couldn't ask for a better hotel location close to everything in Manhatten, even though we walked 10 km a day - it was well worth it. When we got to our room, we had booked a King-size bed but they gave us two double beds. Explaining our booking, they made things right and moved us to our requested room. Room is decent size, definitely not big but sufficient. Very new and clean! Breakfast area and food was very good - an expectation of all Best Westerns. Cost is more than you would like to spend but this is Manhatten! Even though we weren't leaving till later after checkout (5 hours) they once again stored our luggage and arranged a cab for us at the expected time. We would definitely stay here again - glad we found this gem!

I frequently travel to NYC for work and "value" is key but occasionally I stay at nicer hotels when traveling with my wife. I would easily rank this with some of the 4 star hotels I've been to, more so with the savings. I stayed on the second to top floor and the entire wall of my room was a slanted wall of glass looking out at the city. Really something to see and I didn't expect that in this class of a hotel. Not sure if the clean remote is a gimmick or not but either way nice to see they took the time to consider cleaning it if so. I'll be back again.

My sister and I first visit to New York were very happy to find a hotel with the quality and the geografic situation of this one. When we made the reservation we were a litle nervous at the beginning because of the price, very affordable, as you all know NYC hotels CAN be very expensive. But what a great surprise, althought the rooms are a litle bit small, who cares, you just sleep, everything in the room and the bathroom is very, very clean, something we appreciated a lot. Even the products in the bathroom of very good quality. Generous breakfast and very good. But the best thing the manager Christian and the receptionist we booked for 5 nights but decided to leave a night earlier, no problem at all, they accepted with no problem at all. Thank you very much! Will stay there any time.

Very expensive for last minute booking. Very small but clean rooms and bath. Breakfest area dirty and very dissapointing. Great location clse to subway, time square. Nice eating places and shopping area:), 10 minutes walk to MoMa.

A budget+ hotel walking distance from Times Square? We confidently expected a room barely big enough for the bed. So we were very pleasantly surprised to find a very spacious room, with ample space around a generous bed. Also a spacious and well stocked bathroom.The hotel was recently opened in 2013 so everything was slick and span.This is a narrow hotel, with only six rooms on each floor, which means no long walks from the elevator to any room.We only dealt with the concierge on the final day, when he was charming and helpful looking after our bags after we had checked out.Breakfast is somewhat basic - a good range of cereals, pastries, scrambled eggs, sausage, grits and pancakes, served buffet style on plastic plates with plastic cutlery. There was often difficulty getting a table. Some people took a plate back to their room. However, for the price we paid I view breakfast as a bonus.

We spent 2 nights at this hotel. A really good location to everything.Not far from Bryant Park, Times Square and about a 25 minute walkwith suitcases from the Port Authority. So much around to see and doright at your finger tips. A lot of resturants close by. The rooms were small but very nice. We were lucky enough to getthe 17 floor and when we looked out the window we could gaze atthe Empire State Bldg. It is a small narrow hotel. Nice table and chairsout front to sit by the sidewalk and watch the people go by. There iscoffee and tea when you come in at any time.The complimentary breakfast was good. All the regular breakfastitems hot and cold. The area was small so we had to wait a few minutesthe one morning. The staff was quite helpful with questions any questionswe had. Again we would stay here again. We were lucky to get it a price that wasreasonable for NYC Rates. We must have hit it at the right time. Onlybecause we just sleep there and eat breakfast. Check it out.

The hotel is well located. Very close to Empire States. It is a new hotel, very friendly and helpful staff. Free breakfast. The only thing I didn't like is that there is a construction next to the hotel and it is a bit noisy.

Stayed at this property 3 nights Oct '13, It's all about location, location which could not be better for downtown Manhatton, 1 block (2mins) from empire state, round the corner from Macy's, a short walk up broadway to times square, around the corner from main underground at Herald Sq.Back to the hotel, which is small in NYC terms, but being new it is clean, modern & very pleasant, small reception area with coffee & tea machines. We had 2 rooms, 3rd & 4th floors at the rear, nothing to look out on at window, but who cares when you are so close to the action, i beleive the higher rooms upto 12 would have a view of empire state, but you only have to step outside. The rooms are modern & comfortable, small but quite adequate & everything you need for a short stay, the bathroom is quite large with a large shower area.There is a small lounge & bar area which looks good but did not use, if you want a quick drink or 2 try the KEG room across the road, a typical american sports bar & very good for eating as well.the breakfast room is in the basement, well decored, & pleasantly surprised with the variety & just sets you up for your long day.Would have no problem staying again

This BW property is latest one in NYC offering a truly exceptional service (that's why they carry "Premier" and as I know they're the only one in NYC and maybe within 250 miles). We stayed on 16 floor and the room has view of Bank of America Tower (3rd tallest in NYC). Room isn't oversized but it is more than enough to stay comfortably. Very very clean room, nice decor, good breakfast, nice location...literally you can just walk to NYC spots. We will definitely love to stay back here. Thanks BW Premier Herald Square for providing great experience, we truly love it!!

Very busy trip as so much to see and do. Best Western staff helped with all our questions, advising best walks, buses, metro, etc We did not spend much time at the hotel but staff were friendly and helpful as we raced out in the morning and came back tired at nite,.

Nice hotel in an interesting, unique, and fun neighborhood. Ridiculously expensive, as is all of Manhattan. Small room but well appointed. Breakfast was good. This area of old seaport is still recovering from Hurricane Sandy, but this hotel has come back in style.

Very similar to other new mid range hotels in New York Midtown area. Small rooms but make good use of space, nice linens and décor. Very small and noisy breakfast area with standard fare and plastic tableware. Only stayed one night because of a problem with another hotel we had booked. The biggest disappointment was when we left -- they tried to trick us into a limo ride instead of a cheaper cab. We asked them to call us a "cab" to the airport and when we got outside, there was a limo waiting -- when I asked, the dispatcher said that it was $50.00 to LaGuardia and it was only $3.00 more than a cab ride. I travel to NY several times a year and knew this was not true, so we hailed our own cab and got to LGA for $33.00. Are the hotel staff in cahoots with the limo company???? This had actually also happened to us in May when we stayed at the neighboring Hyatt Place Hotel. So beware and take a yellow cab instead - their rates are controlled by the city of NY.

brand new hotel... great position (W 36 St between 5° and 6° Ave).. friendly staff.. small but fully furnished rooms... huge shower :) coffee and tea always available in your room... average prices..I can suggest this hotel to anyone planning his visit in NYC!!!!

The rooms are small but they have everything you could need, are nicely decorating, clean and new and in a perfect location! We booked a twin room and it hard two double beds which didn't leave much floor space but they managed to fit in enough storage to put everything and store our suitcases without falling over them.The free breakfast is great, saves time and money. The breakfast room was busy but we always got a table and there was always plenty of food. They had bread/toast/bagels, cereals, porridge, scrambled eggs, bacon, yoghurt, fruit, pastries, juices and tea/coffee.The staff were friendly and helpful, I stayed here for five nights so I think I probably met most of them!We were able to book a car back to the airport through reception at a fixed rate which was great.
