The car turned up on time - early in fact and we got to the airport without worrying how much the fare was going to be especially as traffic was bad the whole way!

Contrary to what other reviews have stated, this is not a particularly tiny hotel room for New York. I stayed at this hotel last weekend and shared a room with my daughter and son-in-law. We were all very comfortable. If I had any complaint, it was that the bed pillows were too full and firm (I like a flat pillow). Why is anyone spending more than sleeping time in a hotel room in NYC anyway? The hotel serves a filling breakfast - they provide a variety of hot items as well as cereal, rolls, fruit and bagels. Most importantly, the desk clerks were completely charming and very helpful. I can't say enough for them. They directed us to several eateries and were more than happy to give directions when we asked. The location is very good and I would gladly stay there again.

This was our first time in New York ( although have lived in big cities before) and we chose this hotel, as it was modern, new and had a good location. We got a fairly good price compared to similar hotels (all expensive). The room was small but adequate for our 4 days, the only real problem was that there seemed to be odd beds in the room - it was shorter than any other other king bed, and my husbands feet hung off the end (6ft6"). I think this was because the room was so small. We were on a high floor and had a view out our window of the empire state building which was really nice, and there were good places to eat and the location was very central - only a short walk to times square. The breakfast was pretty awful, they kept running out - the dinning room had far to few tables for the size of hotel, the cooked food (eggs / bacon) was very low quality - not what you would expect from this chain. Overall I would recommend staying there.

Great location, helpful staff and reasonable rates. And some of the rooms on the highest floors have a gorgeous close-up view of the Empire State Building. The walls between suites allow too much sound transmission but there's one major problem that management of this fairly new hotel needs to address. There are loud clanking sounds emanating from the elevator shaft whenever the elevator stops. It is especially loud when the elevator stops on the floor your room is on. And it becomes quite noticeable when the 2 elevators start to get used early in the morning. I suspect the sound is caused by a cable slapping against the shaft or at least that's what it sounds like. Staff, who are aware of the issue, say that it is more noticeable on the higher floors. Sure hope management can remedy this problem because I'd really like to be able to recommend this hotel to friends.

We had a wonderful vacation in NYC, if I were to go again, I would stay at the same location. Subway access was very near the hotel and time square and Empire State Building were very close! Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful anytime we had a question. The only thing I would ask is if the breakfast would stay open a little later...6-9:30 doesn't give much time for all guests to enjoy the breakfast. Overall I give this hotel a thumbs up!!

This was my second visit to NYC and my wifes first, so we wanted to have a great experience at a great place and for a reasonable cost. This is sometimes hard to achieve but this wonderful little hotel made all our dreams come true!! Everything was clean, new and the service every where, (except for a couple of persons that help at the breakfast buffet) was excellent! The rooms are great, the beds comfortable, you are just blocks away from the most Iconic places of the city and have plentiful places to dine and shop just next door and everywhere! Dont miss the opportunity to visit New York City and stay in a clean, comfortable, nice and welcoming place virtually near eveything!!!

Yes, it's a convenient location, the hotel is in very good condition and we got a good rate on the room. But this was one of the tiniest hotel rooms I've ever stayed in (see picture, which is the entire room) and the breakfast wasn't much more than mediocre. The bed took up almost the entire room and we didn't even have room for two suitcases. We squeezed one of them into floor space in front of the window (thereby blocking access to one side of the bed) but could only get it to that location by rolling it between the bed and the desk. Fortunately the depth of the desk was so shallow (and not really usable) that we could get the suitcase through, but it cleared both pieces of furniture by about an inch. The bathroom was similarly very small. The breakfast choices were somewhat limited compared to what I think of as a comparable hotel, like a Holiday Inn Express. The sausages were inedible and the staff didn't refill serving platters until they were empty, so guests had to wait for food. We checked out in mid-morning but didn't have a flight until the evening, so the staff agreed to keep our bags while we did a little tourism during the day. When we returned to get our bags, they couldn't find one and I had to go into the luggage room myself to find it hidden under someone else's much larger and heavier bag.

Was our first time in New York and the hotel was perfect for location. All the staff was helpful and eveything in the room was great. Comfort, cleanliness, and very little noise. We even had a view of the Empire State Building.

We had a lovely stay in Herald Square. The rooms were adequate for our needs and the amenities in the rooms were nice. The décor was quite professional. The room, aside from a large hair from the previous occupant, was clean. Supposedly there is a breakfast offered at the hotel that we were not made aware of and a possible fitness center? Overall, I would consider returning if the price is right.

Small, but very nice rooms. Very friendly staff. Breakfast nothing more than expected, but breakfast in this city is a pluss. Beds a little bit hard, but good. Centrally located to trainstation and shopping.

My son and I were in NYC for college visits and general sightseeing. We arrived early and tried to check in around 1pm but no rooms were ready yet. The hotel offered to hold our bags for us so we could go ahead and explore the city. When we returned a few hours later, they offered us a room on the second floor. They accommodated my request for a room on a higher floor and gave us one on the 11th floor. The accommodations were new and super comfortable. It was roomy for NY standards. Location was excellent for all subway lines. They stored our bags even after we checked out since our train did not leave until later in the afternoon. Overall a great experience and would stay again as well as recommend to friends/family.

My husband and I were very pleased with our choice of hotel for our first visit to New York. The staff was welcoming and helpful. We are walkers and the location of the hotel was ideal for exploring New York on foot (and by subway). We took every opportunity to walk through Times Square on the way home from the theatre, Central Park or just to experience the energy one more time. Walking through all the diverse neighborhoods between the hotel and the south tip of the island was fun and the High Line was a pleasant part of the walk back.

My son and I stayed the night at the Best Western, our first overnight in NYC. It took me a couple weeks to bite the bullet and pay the bucks to stay in the big apple and thought the price I paid was reasonable. We parked in a garage a few doors down($43 for 24 hours) and headed to the hotel. We were greeted by very nice staff in a very nice foyer. Our room was quite petite as was our bathroom but very chic and modern. I am 6 feet tall and my son is 6'3" and initially we felt claustrophobic but got used to our tiny surroundings. I would recommend to the hotel that instead of a picture of NYC over the toilet, they could install shelving as there was no space for our toiletries. There was a large, glass walled shower and very nice soaps to use. There is a closet with a ironing board and iron, coffee maker and a tiny dresser. Breakfast is in the basement, a surprisingly large space, and was plentiful. The location is fantastic, just blocks from major attractions and a lot of cabs. We also left our luggage at the hotel and was able to pick them up later in the afternoon which I really appreciated.

Room rate was fair for four adults in a room though room was small, beds were comfortable. Location excellent in New York, near subway, shopping and eateries.Best rate compared to other hotels nearby and rest of Manhattan for this standard of hotel and service.Would recommend this Hotel for New York Manhattan area.

We booked the room several months in advance, even before it had reviews at Tripadviser. New and clean Hotel, excellent location in midtown Manhattan. Courteous service of the staff at reception, luggage storage and a dining room. Room is not spacious but there it is in New York. Good breakfast, coffee / tea for free use in the lobby.

I recently stayed here for six nights and the best thing about this hotel is the location. Many places are within walking distance and the subway is nearby.It is situated on a busy street which my room looked out onto. Despite being on a high floor it was still quite noisy.As everyone says, the rooms are quite small but perfectly adequate. The beds are very comfortable.I had no problem finding a table in the breakfast room and found there was a decent variety of food on offer.The free wi fi was also very useful.

Stayed for 5 nights at Best Western Premier Herald Square and as first time visitors to NYC, we could not have picked a better location. It's on W. 36th street, which is close to everything. Penn St. is only a few blocks away, Macy's Herald Square is two blocks away, and almost all the subway lines can be easily reached from either the Penn St or Herald Square station. Very convenient. The hotel itself is new, very clean and comfortable. Love the modern design and green color theme in the room, which gives a fresh ambience. Yes, the room is small, but after reading so many horrific hotel stories in NYC, we could not be happier with our choice. Good quality linen, Archive personal amenities, free Wi-fi, breakfast, and all-day coffee and tea. All the staff was extremely helpful and friendly, we received a lot of help with directions, the subway and storing of all our 6 bags upon check-out! All in all a perfect choice and I would highly recommend this hotel.

What a great hotel, the staff was great from beginning to the end. the room was always clean. and the breakfast was more than I expected. It was a full breakfast each day, and a great staff, that were happy to get anything you might need. The rooms were tight, but with three in a room there was plenty of room for everything this was very close to everything, only blocks from time square, threater district, we walked to all of these sites. and if you needed a cab they were always near by or out front. I will keep this on my list to stay again

The Best Western Premier (BWP) is a midtown Manhattan hotel. The biggest plus of this hotel is it's great location near Macy's and the Empire State Building. Metro stops nearby and a lot of the tourist hotspots at walking distance. Hotel supplies free WiFi and a complementary breakfast. The breakfast has everything you need to start the day with your choice of cereal, different types of bread and bagels, eggs, fruit, etc.Rooms aren't big, but pretty standard for a Manhattan hotel room. The look and feel of the room is great and rooms are well kept (in part because everything is new). The bed was VERY nice and comfortable. The hotel is located on a pretty quiet street in Manhattan, so city noise is kept to a minimum. Bathroom isn't big but has everything you need.This hotel provided a great stay in Manhattan. I would definitely recommend it!

Good location, nice staff, large and quiet room, good internet connection, reasonable price if you buy it at the last minute. It's midway between the Empire State B and Times Square. I can't complain about this hotel.

The hotel was in a very noisy area. Outside noise could be heard and noise from the other rooms. Rooms were very small, but beds were comfortable. Hotel is new, so everything is in working order. Breakfast was typical Best Western and, therefore, not very exciting. Staff at front desk was disorganized and not helpful

A modern small room with a big comfy bed and a clean bathroom. Great buffet breakfast with tasty food, helpful staff always willing to help you.Right in Midtown Manhattan near Times Square, and all of this with a excellent fair price!

Everything we read about this hotel in TripAdvisor was correct. Very nice, modern rooms, not very large but very comfortable in Midtown Manhattan. The price was very reasonable for N.Y. and the breakfast was ample and well presented. We always found a table but at certain times it could be a challenge. The staff, both at the front desk and the breakfast area were excellent. The room staff also did a great job of cleaning our room. We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to friends. You can walk almost anywhere.

Recently stayed in Sept for 6 nights with my mum, split into 3 nights for each stay as in between we took a short trip to Niagara Falls. The 1st stay had some hiccups. My 1st 3 nights were booked using my BW reward points and upon check in, the front desk insisted that a voucher was needed even though I produced documents that said otherwise. I had to call BW international customer service with my overseas line to get them to clarify directly with the front desk. It was finally resolved that the voucher was not needed. At checked out, I was billed for 3 nights : room + tax (state, city, etc.) around USD110+. I was told they were standard charges. However, only upon pushing for clarification as to what they were meant for, the same front desk then struggled to explain. Luckily, there was another manager (sorry, I did not get his name) around who finally resolved and void my payment. I guessed it is always good to ensure sufficient time for check out and in this case, to review the bill while waiting for our airport shuttle to catch our early morning 7am flight. I can only assume that that front desk personnel was not sufficient trained to work with computer.Thank goodness, everything went well with my 2nd stay. The Hotel is in good location with Empire States Building and shopping streets (Macy, etc.) just round the corner. There are many eateries of different cuisines just down the various streets. The room was small but bed was comfortable and have everything we need. The breakfast was reasonable although dining area was rather small and at certain timing, it was packed. Since we have the time on our hand, we did not mind coming back again at later time. The free hot beverages were great especially for my mum who enjoyed some hot drinks especially during the evening time. Special thanks to the various front desk personnel (Laura, Jeetender and Mustafa) for being most helpful in providing useful pointers on locations, transportation and activities to do. The breakfast crew were friendly and ever ready with their greetings.My past experience with BW in the various regions have been good and I will continue to look for BW to stay.

Great location. 5 to 10 minutes walk to Empire State Building, Time Square, Penn Station and Grand Central. Tube station and Macy's just round the corner, across the street. Felt safe walking around well past mid-night.Excellent steak house (Keen's ), Deli and other eating places just next to the hotel. Friendly, helpful staff. Breakfast while not gourmet was more than adequate to start the day. Tea and coffee making facility in the room and 24 hr. hot drink facility in the lobby.Small , well equipped gym in the basementGood value for money given location. Would definitely stay here again.

We recently stayed four nights at this brand new NYC hotel, and were very pleased to have taken the chance and booked it before it was opened. We usually never go wrong with Best Western hotels, and this one was no exception. The hotel was so clean and fresh, the staff was amazing, so friendly and helpful. The location was great. We had a view of the empire state bldg. from our window! The only suggestion we would have is that a premier hotel should definitely have a small refrigerator to keep a beer or bottle of wine cold for weary tourists returning for an afternoon rest. Also need more than one ice machine for the whole bldg. Breakfast was just OK, but free. We would recommend this hotel to everyone!

Stayed here for 3 nights in September with my family. Got 2 rooms (a king and a double). Rooms are pretty small, but to be expected for a city hotel. Basic and nothing to shout about.Price is expensive (in my view) but cheaper compared to its neighboring hotels.So I guess it must be the location in Manhanttan. Location is convenient if you want to take metro. There is public parking for private vehicles nearby as well. It is also near Macy's, GAP, VIctoria Secret, Empire State Building, Times Square, etcThe breakfast is ok in terms of spread. But the taste of the food is nice (in our opinion). I had problem contacting them in email though, and that is, in my opinion, a lack of service orientation. Check in is quick though I have a room/price issue.

If the rooms were not so small it would be a very good hotel, the bed was extremely comfortable and much appreciated after a transatlantic flight. All the employees were every attentive and pleasant. The wifi connection was not very good frequently lost

this property is new, tucked away in the midst of the garment district, this little gem is a great place to see Manhattan from. Theatre district is a pleasant walk away, Times Square along the way. Subway stops are everywhere nearby to get you to any place you choose. The front desk was helpful. At 6:45am we hired a car service and we were at LaGuardia in 15 minutes. Its close and going against the traffic every morning.Rooms are compact but, clean and new. well appointed and great to operate from.

We chose this hotel from a number in the vicinity that were similarly priced. Convenient location for both local landmarks (Empire State Building, Macy's etc) and also for the subway which we used extensively.The staff were very helpful and friendly and, in our eyes, excelled themselves when we wanted to urgently contact a relative in New Zealand to inform them of a family bereavement. It was only a very quick call but we were prepared to pay the cost of the call. However, they dialled the number for us at the front desk and allowed us to contact our relatives.Would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone else.

This hotel has an excellent location, a five minute walk from both the 5th Ave. or Times Square 42 St. metro stations. It's a 10 minute walk to Times Square in NYC pedestrian traffic. At the same time it's located in a relatively quiet street with two other hotels squeezed together into a small space. The room is small but very comfortable with all the basics: desk, safe, hair dryer, toiletries, etc. Free wi-fi is also available. Excellent place to stay in New York especially if you book one of their great offers.The reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that a little after we got into our room, maintenance came to the door asking for access to change AC filters. Given that check in is at 3:00 pm I think they have plenty of time to do this before guests arrive. It disrupted us a little because we were in a hurry and almost out the door and we had to wait until they did the job and freed up the entrance to the bathroom. The technician was very apologetic and nice but I think it's a mistake of the hotel to send them at this time. The other reason is that although breakfast is included which is awesome, the space to sit is tiny and it's hard to find where to sit. Also, bread and fruit run out pretty fast. Overall, great hotel, would stay here again, just a couple of things to improve upon.

This was our first visit to New York and we were quite pleased with our stay at the Best Western. It is an infill hotel in that it is not overly wide and sandwiched with several other similar hotels. It is located in the fashion district. Our room was on the second floor which often can have a lot of street noise, but we were pleasantly surprised and slept well. Our room was not huge, but it had everything we needed. The location however was excellent being two blocks from the Empire State building, Macy's and the Herald Square subway station and about 6 blocks from Penn Station and an 8 minute walk from Times Square. This allowed us to tour around, have a break at the hotel and then resume our walks. We had only on minor complaint and that was the business center only had one computer which was well used by guests who needed to print tickets and confirm airline/train reservations. The room charge also included a light continental breakfast which for us was a pleasant surprise.

Loved staying in this location - a few of blocks to Times Square. Only 70 + rooms in this brand new little hotel...comfortable new beds, clean. All the basics. Could use some wall mounted shelves and hooks in the bathrooms, for convenience. Got our daily excellent espresso fix at Oren's Daily Roast nearby or caught the Herald Square subway around the corner to go anywhere else we wanted to go. Set-back patio area on the front of the hotel for people watching w/your happy hour beverage from the in-hotel lounge. Price was very reasonable.

We checked into this hotel as it was a lower priced one for New York City and got there before check in time. Our room was not ready and the front staff offered to hold our luggage, which was great! Our first night was terrible, we were on 3rd floor across from elevator and heard elevator noise all night and extreme traffic noise from the trucks,cars and garbage trucks all night. Did not sleep well any night. The breakfast was sitting in pans and dried up pancakes, eggs, and goopy oatmeal. Water was not warm enough for tea. Chairs scrapped along floor and tables on top of each other made for a loud area. However, we were in the centre of action for exploring everything in NYC and that was a blast!

Superior customer service, clean and comfortable accommodations, excellent location to theaters and restaurants, full breakfast--not your typical continental. Booked early enough to snag a decent rate (for NYC, at least). I'd stay there again. What more can I say?

I arrived at this hotel with confidence that my stay would be great. New hotel I chose thanks to Trip Advisor and the great comments it had. I booked a room in July for 3 adults. On Best Western website I could book a room with a king size bed for the 3 of us. I assumed they would not let me book something that didn't correpond to what I needed. I still called the number on my confirmation and got someone on the phone who retrieved my reservation. I asked "There is one double bed, there is 3 of us... Where is the third person gonna sleep ?" I got answered "There is a sofa bed in your room as it is an Executive room".... Fine by me ! The price and location were interesting. I called back at the beginning of September to make a request. My reservation was checked again. I requested a view on the Empire State Building and was told that the type of room I booked automatically had a view on that building. All seemed perfect !!!Then the day came when we got up early in the morning after a cruise, to go take the plane to NYC then take pulic transportation.... we arrive around 5.30pm, tired but excited to discover the city for the first time !We start checking in and the lady realises that there is 3 of us and only one bed in the room. We were also told the hotel was full that night and that they could not accomodate us with another type of room. I told them about the sofa bed..... "We have no sofa bed in the hotel" WHAT ????!!!!! I asked to see the room, there would have been room for an extra single bed but THEY DID NOT HAVE ANY ! What was offered was to sleep in the same bed !!!!!! It was said so naturally that it seems to be something that is offered pretty often ! ONE MORE THING IS that the room we visited did NOT have a view on the Empire State Building when I was told the room I had booked had one for sure !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The guy there was like "We are full, we cannot do anything".... What about trying to check who would have answered me or trying to sort us out in an other Best Western ?? NO instead we were told, "We are full, other hotels are gonna be full as well" .................Well, we went to the hotel next door, that actually had a room with a sofa bed available, breakfast included at a much better rate ! So we just cancelled and went to give money to competition !It was my first reservation with Best Western...... :/What I would like to add is that at 5.30pm they still asked if rooms were ready, that is not showing good hotel management, we were offered 10% discount if we stayed there..... for the 3 of us to sleep in the same bed it would have to be much much more !!!!The way things have been handled was bad, the fact the I was able to book this room for 3 adults is a shame !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! It almost ruined our stay in NYC !!!

This new hotel was clean and modern. The gym was small but with up to date equipment with a good variety for such a limited space. Complimentary breakfast looked ok as I have dietary requirements I didn't eat there but the variety for a free breakfast was good and changed slightly every morning. The rooms are tiny and loud, make sure to request a high floor room and/or away from the street and elevators we heard everything going on in the street and every conversation coming out of the elevators.

This is a brand new hotel with a central location, near Empire State Building. Walking distance to many sites, such as Times Square, Theatre District, Bryant Park, Port Authority, 5th Ave, Grand Central Station, Macy's + many many more.The rooms are quite small, but has everything you need. Comfortable beds, nice decor, nice bathroom and generally both delicate and clean.A free breakfast is included. Nothing special, but enough to get you started.Probably the most narrow hotel I have ever stayed at (literally!), but all in all a very good experience. Pleasant staff and good service.Recommended!

Travelling to New York on a budget I booked the Best Western Herald Square. The hotel is in a great location. The front desk staff was very helpful and checked us in quickly. They also were very helpful in assisting us in getting around NYC. The hotel offered a breakfast which was great and a bit of a surprise to us. The rooms are very small…not a surprise in NYC. They were however very clean and new with a large flat screen TV. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

The hotel is in a good location. The rooms are fine and modern. The cost seems excessive for what you get. The breakfast was a typical hotel breakfast with nothing special about it. The breakfast room was always crowded and uncomfortable. The elevators seemed inadequate for the building. This is not where I will stay next time.

As other reviewers have noted, the rooms are small, but we were only there to sleep. We were across from the elevators but never heard a thing. The location is fantastic, short walk to the subway, shopping, dining. We always slept too late and missed breakfast, but there is a Pure Fresh 2 doors down and they had good breakfast options. The best part of staying here has to be the fantastic staff. Everyone was so just so kind! Twice we needed a taxi/car and both times someone from the front desk went outside with us to help locate one. They gave us advice on negotiating fares, routes. One evening we returned to find a bed had been knocked off it's frame by housekeeping. I called the front desk who immediately sent a very nice young man up. He took the entire bed apart, put it back together and remade the bed for us. No problem. Will definitely stay here again.

When you visit New York, you should generally be prepared for two realities: hotels are expensive and rooms are going to be smaller than in other big cities. This Best Western isn't going to wow you on the size of their rooms (they're small/average), but the price, location and cleanliness are all fantastic. Located just east of 36th St & 6th Avenue, this hotel is a mere 6 blocks from Times Square. Public transportation-wise, this hotel is a 10 minute walk northeast of Penn Station and there's also a subway station one block away on 35th & 6th to get you to the East Village, Brooklyn, the Financial District, etc.Staff were very friendly throughout, whether it be checking in or leaving our bags with the bellhop on our checkout day before retrieving them later.The room we got was right by the elevator so we could here it when people were waiting for or leaving the elevator but it really wasn't a big deal. There are only, roughly 6 rooms per floor so you're not exactly dealing with a lot of foot traffic.Next time my wife and I come back to New York, we're definitely going to try and stay here.

LIKEs: * Brand new hotel that opened less than 4 months ago, which is well located on West 36th Street, between 5th and 6th Avenues, in the heart of Herald Square, with 17-story, 94-room. The hotel was designed with a high-end boutique look and feel as well as upscale amenities. Overall, we find the facilities very clean and good customer services provided. * Perfect location and convenient to majority of Manhattan tourist attractions. Short walking distance to Herald Square and Penn Station subway stations. During our stay, we mainly took subways to our chosen destinations. From the hotel's Midtown location, we were able to walk to Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Empire State Building, Pier 83 (for Circle Line sightseeing cruise of Manhattan), and nearby Time Square. Macy's is only a stone thrown away along with many high-end shops on 5th Avenue. It is easy to maneuver the grid setting of New York city streets. * Great selection of breakfast items served every morning at a room located in the cellar, which include several types of breads, danishes, yogurt, eggs, sausages, pancakes, oatmeal, raisins, bananas and various kinds of dry cereals. In addition, two types of juices, water, coffee and choices of tea bags are available. We LOVE the little croissants and the Denver style egg white patties. The breakfast ladies kept the items decently stocked, and only a short wait for available table during the height of breakfast hours.* Coffee and various types of tea bags service available right by the elevator - we grabbed a cup of tea every night upon returning to the hotel after spending a long day wandering out in town as a nightcap.* Bathroom is well design with great use of space. Glass shower door in lieu of curtain is definitely a PLUS! * Even though our room is right across from the two elevators, we find it to be rather quiet, and can only hear the dings from the elevators or conversations from people outside our room only when we are standing close to our room door.* Floor to ceiling window makes the room airy. Other than a night with police action nearby that we heard police sirens, we can barely hear any noises on 36th Street, even though our room is located below the double digits floors..Slight DISAPPOINTMENTs:* Being Diamond status of Best Western Reward Program, we were placed on a single digit floor, even after requesting for upper floors on our reservation placed over two months ago. We paid over $260 (without taxes and charges) for room with 2 beds. Comparing to the amount posted by other TripAdvisor reviewers, compounding with the fact that their stays are during the peak summer travelling season, paid far less than us and yet have been placed on floors much higher than us, we felt that the hotel is slightly over-priced for our mid-September stay.* Room is on the small side. We need to be very organized with placement of our luggage, and not having toiletries and clothing items spread all over due to limitation of spaces. The beds are also on the short, feet sticking out of the beds even for individuals that are 5' 7" in height. (LOL, cruise cabin is larger than the hotel room)

Relatively new hotel. Boutique style of decor. Excellent location, walking distance to Empire State Building, Time Square, Port Authority, Pier 83, Penn Station and Herald Square Subway stops, as well as attractions located in Midtown Manhattan, Central Park, etc. Good selections of breakfast items including danishes, oatmeal, cereals, egg patties, bagels, different types of bread and pancakes for breakfast, plus coffee, various choices of teabags, oas well as juices. The bed is on the short side and the room is tight with space, however, the bathroom is well layout. Enjoy having coffee, hot water and teabags available at the lobby. Our room is facing 36th Street with ceiling to floor window and find it relatively quiet, even though we are located in one of the single diit floor facing the elevator. Disappointed that the hotel did not honor my request for upper floors, even though I am a Diamond Best Western Reward member. We booked the hotel in end of June for our second week of September stay and paid over $260 per night -- not as fortunate as other reviewers that paid less than $200 per night.

This is a newly renovated Best Western in a great location of NYC (Herald Square). The rooms are small as expected for downtown, but well organized, very clean, very neat and quiet at night. We were pleased.

Located next to Macey's and subway stops this modern hotel was a winner. Have stayed in New York many times, but for the price this was our favourite hotel. The rooms are modern, new and clean. We actually had a decent view from room 1601 which is an executive room and bigger. There were only 5 rooms on our floor. The bed was super comfortable. In room safe and coffee maker, big shower with rain shower head, no tub. Staff were very friendly and helpful. They have good maps at the front desk with subway stops listed. Small business center with a printer. Free breakfast was quite good with cooked eggs and sausage...even cooked egg whites for those who prefer that. There is a nice outdoor sitting area for smoking or people watching or just having your coffee. We found it wasn't a bad walk to Times Square at all and mostly walked everywhere we went. There is also a small quiet lounge/bar off the lobby. We would definitely recommend this hotel and stay there again.

Me and my bf took a weekend trip to NYC. This was a great location, near metro and timesquare. we booked 2 of the 3 nights with the hotel directly and one night under our airmiles. Upon checking in we informed them of this( bc airmiles said they might switch us to another room) and they said it was noted. we ask what floor and casually ask how the view is. lady helping said we have a great view of the empire state building. well we get to our room, our view is a brick wall. whatever. its a room, just going to sleep in it. anyway we do our daily adventure and come night time about to sleep. we heard EVERYTHING . it was difficult to get any sleep and after long days of walking in New York, that's really all you need. we heard doors opening, showers being turned on, telephone receivers being picked up/ hung up. breakfast was good. we definitely took advantage of that. coming down at about quarter to 8 there were no tables available. otherwise it is a very small room, nicely decorated but the walls are paper thin. oh and on top of all that they charged our credit card for that third night. Got our money back but got left with the credit card companies currency transfer rates. will not be coming back.

One of the main reasons I go to NYC a lot is shopping, so I wasn't really looking for a 5 star hotel or huge rooms, because we were not gonna spend that much time at the hotel anyway.This hotel has a perfect location for shopping (5 min walk from Macy's) lol Room was small though, but clean as was the hotel itself. Staff was really nice and friendly. We've spent 3 nights at the hotel and had breakfast every day. It was a very simple buffett but can't complain really. A little bite before leaving the hotel with both cold & warm options and fruits too.The view we had wasn't all that but at least it was a street view (11th floor). I guess one would have to go to the top floor to get some kind of NYC view.Room price was VERT GOOD for that location ($140/night with tax). Unless something better & cheaper comes up, Best Western Premier Herald Sq is the place to stay for my future shopping & sight seeing trips in NYC ;)

A very pleasant stay with this hotel - but it does not feel as though you're staying at a typical chain. The decor and ambiance of the hotel was streamlined and trendy, without being cluttered, and was much more upscale than I expected. The hotel has only 17 floors, and was very quiet on the 13th floor. The view was only of the other buildings from across the street, but the windows were generous in size. The size of the room itself was relatively small, but still comfortable for a pair on a king size bed. What made this place amazing was the location of this hotel. You cannot get a better location than here - literally blocks away from times square, everything was within walking distance, which includes all the tourist destinations (i.e. empire state building, macy's, NBC studios, etc...) but tucked in a middle of a quiet street with not too much traffic. I would recommend this place for those who will be out and about most of the day, but need a peaceful night's rest in the evening. I hope to return to New York and stay at this location again.

We were at the BW Premier Herald Square in september 2013. Service was excellent, parking near (Myers, corner of 36th&5th) with a discount from the hotel (ask front desk - 35$ instead of 49$). Location is close enough to time square, without the ''crazy'' crowd. Nice pub/bar around (Keg Room ++ irish pub), few steps from 5th avenue, 20 minutes walk from Central Park. Service at the hotel was amazing (courteous, polite). Rooms were clean (but small, like every room in NYC). Will go back there for sure.

Stayed here for 2 nights at the end of August.ProsVery good location Check in and out efficientVery friendly bell boyConsTiny uncomfortable room - barely sleptAir conditioning not great - why can a big unit not cool down a small roomBreakfast was a bit haphazard on Day 1 (8.45) but much better on day 2 (8.15)Bar just ok, although happy hour prices goodRoom amenities not replenished despite an appropriate tipI don't think I will be back.

For a 3 star hotel, this was a very nice and clean hotel. The staff were very polite, helpful, friendly and made the stay enjoyable. The rooms were smaller than I'm used to but very nice. The free breakfast and internet were a plus for a NYC stay.

You cannot beat this place for location and amenities and the staff was the one of the best I Have ever dealt with. Subway is 1.5 blocks away. takes about 3 minutes to walk to. This hotel is central to everything. The only draw back is the construction. BUT that is happening everywhere in Manhattan. Value is fantastic!

My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in end August 2013. The hotel was conveniently located and the rooms were well-kept, with adequate amenities so we found this to be of good value compared to other hotels nearby. However, the service was lousy and definitely not something we would expect in a 'premier' hotel. Firstly, when we asked for the front desk staff to help us book a shared shuttle to the airport, what arrived to pick us up was a personal taxi. If the staff had told us at any point that he was unable to book a shared shuttle service, we would have understood. But it was quite clear that he was being dishonest and guests were left with no time to make transportation changes as we had to reach the airport on time.The other poor service we encountered was from this serving lady at the breakfast cafe. We noticed that she would greet guests on the breakfast line, but when it came to asian guests, she would put on an unhappy face. We said good morning to her for 3 days and all we got in return was a nonchalant look. Once, she was topping up the breads section with more doughnuts, and I waited patiently for her to be done. The next minute, she asked a gentleman behind me what he would like and proceeded to serve him. I did the normal thing which was to tell her my request, and she replied "you have to wait until I am done!". Another time, she was topping up another dish, and guests in front of me continued to pick from that tray. When it came to my turn and I did the exact same thing as those before me, she stared hard at me as if I had committed a crime! As a well-travelled couple who is respectful and friendly to every country we visit, we found no other reason to be treated this way except for the way we look.It is unfortunate that the good image of this hotel is tarnished by staff who choose to be dishonest and who discriminate guests. All I can say to the serving lady is, you need to travel more to see the world beyond. And if you were to ever visit my country who welcomes people of all cultures and languages, we will never treat you the way you treated us.

Being almost new everything in this hotel was in great order and immaculately clean.My room was good and of an ok size though I spent most of my time out of the roomThe fitness centre in small. Though I used it twice and I was the only person in it.The complimentary coffee is a nice touch and the staff are very friendlyThe hotel seriously needs to address the breakfast situation. Firstly, ending service at 9.30 in a tourist driven hotel is too early.Secondly the breakfast room, in the basement, is far too small for the number if guests in the hotel with guests queuing for tables each morning I was there Thirdly it's simply unacceptable, in my view, to only provide plastic crockery and utensils and paper cups!The range offered at breakfast is quite good, however, and can certainly set you up for a busy day in NY

New York is an expensive city. This hotel had a nightly room rate (booked through the Best Western on the web) for our stay ranging from $225 to $360 PLUS taxes ranging from $36.69 to $56.60 for an average nightly rate of more than $336.00. This may be inexpensive for New York, but it is not very good value for money. This new hotel is located in what remains of the 'garment district' on 36th Street between 5th and 6th Avenues. It is convenient to both uptown and downtown buses and the subway, each being a two minute walk from the hotel. The street is nondescript light industrial with a sprinkling of restaurants. The hotel is one of three in a row on the street. It is relatively small (92 rooms) and the rooms are extremely small. The bathroom has a shower (poor water pressure) but no tub. For some reason the tap water in our room had a terrible taste about which the management did nothing upon being told of the problem. The bed was firm and the pillows were rock hard. For some reason the air conditioning duct is placed directly over the bed making for an uncomfortable situation. The worst problem with the room was the complete lack of sound proofing. We could hear everything from the room next to us, from the corridor and from the street (and our room was on the 17th floor so the street sounds had to travel quite a way to be heard in the room).Breakfast, included in the price, was adequate for this kind of hotel, but nothing special. The room was crowded each morning which usually meant waiting for a table. The breakfast staff did a good job of replenishing food items and keeping the room clean. The chamber maids did a good job, although they did arrive a bit early on Sunday morning (before 9.00).I doubt we would stay at this hotel again. It was not bad, but there is little to make us want to return.

We found this hotel to be in a good location in Manhattan. The room was small but very clean and brand new everything. The beds were very comfortable. The staff was amazing...very helpful and fun. The view isn't nice but it is a very good value for the price. Would recommend this hotel and would consider staying here again in the future. If you collect air-miles, you can purchase Best Western Gift cards to use for payment and save a ton of money.

The front desk staffs are rude and non- helpful. We asked for help to call a normal taxi at check out to go to the next hotel which is just 2 blocks away. The front desk guy call a limousine taxi and told us the price would be the same price. Turned out it was not because the flat fee of the limousine taxi is much more.

I stayed here myself for 5 days, during the US Open Tennis. I enjoyed my stay overall, very good in fact, but 1 issue stopped it getting excelletn, as I will describe - but firstly the positives -Location is great, 100yards from 34st Subway, also 2mins from Macy's and, 3 minutes from the Manhattan Mall, as well as Old Navy, Sketchers, a Foot Locker, 1 minute from H&M The Staff I dealt with were very helpful and, really pleasant the Manager was a very polite man, who always tried to solve any problems, or questions.Breakfast, was surprinsingly better than referred too previously : included eggs, bacon, pancakes, cereals, toast, fruit, cakes, pastries, coffee/tea, juices & water - so a good selection I felt.My problem came with cleaning of my room, one day it was not done at all. when I spoke to manager and front desk staff, they assured it would be cleaned immediately. When I returned, they assured me it was cleaned, it was not!.. I went back down, and they called the cleaning supervisor who again assured it was cleaned, so the manager and desk staff came with me, to my room..and guess what, they were just going into my room to clean it finally...ao that was a lie clearly, by the cleaning supervisor. I appreciated the efforts to get my issues sorted, and the young lady cleaning was so polite as she was not aware of what was going on. But, I think the supervisor had some problems, that spoiled this place getting a 5 star rating. Also, on one other occasion, I returned to my room at 3pm, and it was not cleaned yet.... so I spoke to the cleaner myself, and by 4pm it had been done. (I didnt report it a second time, as it might end up in her getting fired, the supervisor who was poor to be honest).Finally, the bar was nice, and big screen TVs and a great happy hour selection, also the free Wifi was very useful too. Also, Price was very good around $150 per night. If this issue had not happened it would have been an excellent.I would stay here again though, it was a thoroughly good stay!

This is a very new hotel so everything is new. For the price I paid $150/night it was a steal. It is right off of Herald square, access to subways, close to Times Square, Bryant Park, restaurants etc etc. Would be difficult to find a better location.The breakfast was much better than I expected. It was a hot breakfast with eggs, pancakes etc. Wait staff was very nice and super efficient.Free wifi, small but nice gym, little out door courtyard. This really was a nice place to stay.Rooms are small but very new and clean. In short this is an awesome hotel to stay for a price of close to $150- $200. If it costs more than that I would probably prefer to just spend a little more and stay at a higher end hotel.

Great hotel, friendly staff, awesome location (close to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, subway station and Empire State Building [pickup location for hop-on/hop-off bus]). Could take cab from Times Square for same price as subway for 2 which was nice not to have to wait for subway in hot tunnels. Rooms were NYC small but very nice. Maids did an awesome job with keeping the rooms clean and stocked.

I chose this hotel because it is new, so i assumed everything would be clean & fresh. and the price was fantastic. its hard to find hotels in nyc less than $200-400 per night so this one for around $100 a night was unbelievable. normal rooms for nyc, not horribly small but not big, perfect if your just sleeping there & not lounging in the room. the free breakfast was ok not great. the 24 hour coffee in lobby was a fantastic surprise, the free computer (one only) was nice, a gym included. for the price you cant complain, the staff was very friendly. noise wasnt bad at all typical noises for a nyc hotel.

I had stayed at a Best Western property before (not in New York though), and was expecting the usual low-cost hotel quality, which I would have been fine with as I just needed a place to sleep, not to hang out. I was very pleasantly surprised with this property though. The hotel location is simply excellent as you are right between 5th and 6th Avenue on 36th Street. I walked to Central Park, as well as to Soho, and many other parts of Manhattan. The property is new with cool room decorations. Rooms are very clean. The staff was very helpful and professional. They were ready to answer any questions I had, even when they were very busy. They booked some tickets for me, booked a car to the airport, etc. Honestly, I was very impressed. I have stayed at prestigious hotels before where the service was not as good as this. I will definitely stay here again next time I go to New York.

Brand New, all the employees were very friendly and helpful. Great location for the theater. Can't wait to go back. Easy to find short walk to the subway, Bryant Park. Parking was very easy and reasonable for overnight in NY.

Needed one night stay in Manhattan. Booked end June - great price $139.In terms of the room - a little on the small side though more than adequate for a bed for the night - to be expected for the location. Importantly for me - was clean and quietBreakfast - basic range - perfectly OK - this was the only disappointmentHappy hour useful to relax on arrival. Unlike Sarita53 - I found plenty of good restaurants nearby (2-3 blocks) - indeed - spoilt for choice

I got a fantastic rate for this hotel when it first opened & was very happy with the place. Perhaps because I got fantastic value for money.Location is great with Macys very close along with other great shops. Subway very close as well. I walked to Times Square easily. Rooms very modern & tastefully decorated.Breakfast was average but it was free so I had no complaints.I like that tea & coffee was available in the lobby.

The hotel staff was wonderful, they even changed my room so that I would have a better view. It was Awesome! Can't wait to go back. The location was close to everything. Easy to walk or jump in a cab. The hotel staff will even run down and grab a cab for you if you needed one.

I don’t understand the glowing reviews. The only thing this hotel has going for it is that it is new. If you like being in the hub of tourist New York, then you’ll like this location, but if you want to stay near decent restaurants or away from the tourist craziness, look elsewhere. The rooms are tiny, less than two feet between the end of the bed and the dresser. The lighting in the room and the bathroom is so dim it is hard to read and put on makeup. The windows curve inward making it impossible to see down to the street, but you’ll hit your head trying. The street view is directly into the office buildings across the street. The windows also don’t open, so claustrophobics beware. The ill-fitting curtains don't do a good job of keeping out the light. The bed is uncomfortable as are the large foam pillows. The bathroom has no towel racks, just a hook on the back of the door that already has a bag containing the hair dryer hanging from it, no fan, and no room for toiletries. In the five days we stayed here, they did not replace the soaps once, even when they were down to a sliver - a first in my hotel experience. No cotton balls or Q-tips. The water pressure in the shower is very weak. Housekeeping woke us up at 8:30 Sunday morning (!!) so we never got to sleep off our Saturday night out. The breakfast room is cramped and the quality of the breakfast is poor. There is no security at all which means anyone can walk in and go up the elevators if they look like a guest, and which unfortunately for us meant that they had no resources to deal with the unruly guests who partied all night in the room next door to us - they comped us for our sleepless night. The staff was unimpressive. I was kicking myself because just to try something new I cancelled my reservation at the Hilton Fashion District where we’ve stayed a number of times, which I had reserved at the same rate as this hotel, and which suffers from none of these numerous defects. I’ll know better next time.

This hotel had great decor, great staff, good breakfast and amazing location. One of the cleanest hotels i have ever stayed at. The rooms are a bit small (4 people in the two double bed room) but comparable to other NYC rooms i have stayed at regarding size.

It is clean and a great location for most things Manhattan but especially Penn Station. As long as you are getting up relatively early every day, noise will not be a problem (it was quiet enough at night). If you would like to sleep beyond 8am, you'll need to have experienced cannon fire to manage it. You can hear the massive glass shower doors slamming in the adjacent rooms, the room doors themselves slam very hard, and the laundry chute slams hard and continuously once the rooms start getting made up. The bathrooms are very small, I had to think strategically to manage to not harm myself between the shower door and bathroom door colliding to trying to get at the sink (necessary to close the bathroom door all the time to get at it).

This is a very excellent choice for theater goers and people on the move. I stayed there for one night and my experience was very good. Comfy beds, clean, affordable, and a very nice staff.Great bartender who gave some good tips. Breakfast is great. We had no problems, got a table and took an apple for the road. But, if you get to the free breakfast late, you will not get a table right away. We were lucky! All around excellent experience and would stay there again in a NY minute!

This recently opened hotel is located just round the corner from Herald Square, 5 minutes from 5th Avenue and only minutes from the subway.Each floor only has 5 rooms so it is very quiet. No noise from the hallways and excellent double glazing.The rooms are small but very clean and fresh. The bed linen is new and crisp and the beds comfortable. Coffee maker, iPod dock and large flat screen tv are all provided.The bathroom has lots of lovely , good quality, towels and a large double width walk in shower.In the basement there is a small gym and the breakfast room. Breakfast is included in the rate. Coffee and orange juice are of a very high quality. There are cereals, pastries, toast, jams etc plus bacon and eggs. It's a buffet style service with a cafeteria feel, but ideal for a quick breakfast before exploring New York.All staff are very friendly and very helpful.Within a few minutes walk from the hotel it's easy to find lots of places to eat.Highly recommended and at the price I paid, excellent value for money.

Before making the decision to stay here we read a lot of reviews of many places, and thought this was the best for us, NEW, and well located. In the reviews we noted adverse comments on breakfast, lift time and room size.Overall, these issues in our mind would have come from "fussy" people. My wife a vegetarian had ample choice at breakfast, sure seating was limited, but we only had to wait on 1 of the 7 days for 5 minutes to be seated. I do agree that the plastic knives don't cut bacon that well. The lift arrival may be a little slow at breakfast time, but we did not mind, we are on holiday after all. Our room on the 16th floor provided us with a HUGE bonus, a view of the Empire State building!The coffee and tea in the lobby was a bonus, could get one on the fly while walking to the Metro, or going to your room.The room size was smallish, but what do you expect in NY, all functional with clean modern bathroom and fittings. Nice.The gym was clean and airconditioned. The STAFF, especially Jatinder was SUPERB, as were all the others we had contact with, courteous, helpful and unintrusive; printing off information for the tennis and travel directions, without the need to use the one man station business centre. Wireless internet was fast and easy to setup.

This hotel is quite nice for NYC at the price. It is walkable to Penn Station. The room was adequate, but small. It was very clean and the bedding was comfortable. There was no good task lighting. The exterior was difficult to locate, but it had a little patio on the street. It did not have a tub , but the shower was accessible. You need to check this hotel for the price. I booked it for $112 and later saw it for $249 both at Best Western Home page.

Spent one night here at the end of our trip. Location excellent and the staff extremely friendly and helpful. The room was great - super clean and comfy beds. Quiet and efficient air con and the floor to ceiling windows were fab. Would happily stay here again.

Loved our stay at the Best Western Premier Herald Square!! Will definitely recommend it to everyone. It is a good central location and great price. Breakfast wasn't the best but hey it was free and did the job.

Considering price and location, this hotel is a sound choice for most people. The front desk people are terrific - friendly and helpful. Our room was small but modern, no real view. Everything was in working order, clean and comfortable. The breakfast was basic but sufficient (get there early, otherwise it gets crowded).When I travel, I like safe, clean and easy. This hotel hit the mark, and I would gladly stay there again.

I have to guess that the people who give this hotel 5-star reviews are used to staying in Best Western hotels. As a Marriott and SPG guy, I chose to stay here with family because of the price and location. The hotel rooms at the Best Western Herald Square are small, even by Manhattan standards. Ours was clean, but for a "brand new" hotel, I was disappointed that the shower head wasn't even screwed on tightly, and the shower and wardrobe door hinges were already broken. We ventured to the cellar for the free breakfast once, only long enough to see a small bug flying around in the pastry box, so we chose not to eat there. My guess is that was an aberration, though, as the breakfast area seemed generally clean. The location is outstanding, the beds were fairly comfortable, and housekeeping seemed adequate. The front desk folks were very good.

The hotel is in a great location with access to everything! We stayed there for 2 nights (party of 6) and loved the convenience. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful with all of our needs. The breakfast was a great to start the day so that the kids were ready to go. The rooms were very clean and we didn't hear our neighbors (next door or above us) at all.

We were already to check this establishment out after reading such great reviews, but we were sorely disappointed when we checked in. The pictures on the hotel website show the Empire State Building in the background - sorry, they must have been photo shopped because, although within walking distance, you definitely don't see it from your window. What we actually saw from our window were 3 brick apartment buildings and a bunch of roof vents. When we asked if there were any other rooms available, we were told they were all booked for the evening - okay, it as a Friday; but no offer was made to consider another room when it became available. In addition, the room was incredibly small - very close quarters. This was my 5th trip to NYC so I know rooms are generally small, but this one was exceptional - 2 people couldn't walk by the end of the bed at the same time. When we checked in there was a rubber glove laying on the floor of the bathroom and an empty soap box on the floor, as well. After that, the housekeeping seemed fine - although they had a nasty habit of turning the AC very low, so that every day, when we came back from a warm day of sightseeing, we actually had to turn the heat on to warm the room to an acceptable temperature. The subway was close, but not super convenient. Didn't find the staff overly accomodating - especially the breakfast staff ... really had to work hard to get a smile there. I've stayed in 3 other places in NYC and can honestly say, I don't think I'll be back here. Maybe I'm just too fussy with my dollars.

We were on the 14th floor, with a great view of the Empire State Building (and an alley). The room was small but functional. The décor made our room a relaxing sanctuary from the busy streets of NY. We would take breaks from our non-stop touring and go back to the hotel to veg. The location is excellent. We could get on and off almost every subway line with-in a 5 minute walk. Just my teenage niece and myself traveling, we felt perfectly safe walking around the whole area until the wee hours of the night. There were always a lot of people around. I loved that there is a Duane Reade drug store and a McDonald's a half of block away, perfect for drinks and snacks. We had a repair issue with the plumbing trap door- they immediately sent someone to do repairs. Upon check out, I was delayed on business, my niece was worried about having be alone checked out of the room. Front desk allowed her to stay as a late check out, which I was told is virtually unheard of in NYC- It was much appreciated and the special care made me like this hotel even more. Price was excellent, $260 for 2 nights in Manhattan- fantastic!! The only thing I didn't love was the breakfast, the servers were very friendly, food not so good! I would definitely stay at this Best Western again and have recommended it to my friends!

The Hotel staff at the Premier Herald Square were excellent and very accommodating, the location of this hotel was just great. You will love the oversized shower area, and the room was very clean. I am however still trying to see the "Premier" part of the Hotel get's that standard. It would have been great to have a fridge or micro wave in our room (I guess I should have asked), but all in all, we really enjoyed our stay, we would stay at this Hotel again if we traveled to New York.

The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The room was very clean, and the bathroom was mostly clean (a few hairs in the shower, but nothing horrifying). The price ($188 w/ AAA card) was fair b/c of the location, but I wasn't thrilled about having our room right outside of the elevators (literally) b/c I was worried about the noise. This was actually not a problem. The one problem was that we could not get the room cooler than 74 degrees, and we wound up wasting an hour between waiting for the maintenance men and waiting to see if the room cooled off. They offered us another room, but by then, we were just ready to get out of the hotel, so the manager gave us an additional 10% off. The staff really made all the difference - all quite friendly and helpful.

This hotel is fairly conveniently located near Penn Station (3 1/2 short blocks and 1 1/2 long blocks to the Seventh Street entrance) so we found it convenient when we want to spend a night and two days in town. We can drop off our bag when we get into Penn station and pick it up just before leaving. It has opened within the last year, as have a Hyatt Place next door and a Holiday Inn Express 3 doors down. The rooms are pleasantly furnished (although the pictures on their web site do them more than justice). The staff were exceedingly pleasant and helpful. It has a small exercise room, but better than that of many hotels this size (a treadmill, elliptical trainer, bicycle and weights). The big disappointment was breakfast. It advertised a free hot breakfast, but the items I think were once eggs that had been fashioned into what may have intended to be omelets but looked more like pancakes were almost cold There was little selection of fruit or bread. They had staff serving the hot food which must have been costly unless they figured they coould reduce the amount consumed - I think they would have done better to provide a better selection of cold food - it would probably have cost less and been more pleasant. Pricewise it appears to be a good deal at the moment since the area is new and there is competition.

I stay at this best western a few weeks ago. The room was nice and clean. The location is great. Its near plenty of food and trains.My only problem was the front desk. There was a young woman named Erin. She was very out of it. She was sitting down or outside smoking. How is she helping anyone by being outside on the phone? When I checked in kayla, pardon me if I spelled that wrong, took care of me. She was very friendly and helpful. She was quite knowledgable as well. The hotel would do good to see more of people like Mustafa, kayla, lara and sade, and much less of Erin.

This hotel is probably the best value in Manhattan! Having stayed in NYC many times, I can safely say this hotel punches above its weight. The hotel itself is only a few months old, so everything is new and fresh. Housekeeping kept the room tidy and were a pleasure to deal with, as was the front desk staff. The room itself was small. But by Manhattan standards, more than acceptable. As a comparison, I've stayed at the Royalton and paid twice as much, and the room was no bigger. Besides, you come to Manhattan for everything else - if you're spending a lot of time in your room, I have to wonder why you're in NYC in the first place, this is a town on the move!The location is top notch, just a few blocks from all the action and shopping like Macy's and Manhattan Mall. It's tucked away just enough to lessen the street noise - we slept soundly and the bed was very comfortable. Great restaurants like Keen's ChopHouse and the Keg Room are just steps away from the front door.Breakfast is included in the rate, and while basic, was perfectly fine, and was a great value add. The fitness room is tiny, but the equipment (3 machines and some weights) were all new and in perfect condition. No restaurant service, but with so much choice literally at your doorstep, this is hardly an issue. Part of the NYC experience is eating in all the great establishments in Manhattan, of which there are thousands. Checking in and out was a breeze, and the hotel arranged a great car to take us to the airport. I would stay here again in an instant! Everything about this hotel was great, from the value, to the quality, to the staff. You should stay here if you're looking for great value and a pleasant experience. Well done BW Premier Herald Square! We'll be back!

This BW is a reasonable price, a great location and very new. Rooms are typical NYC sizes, but have nice new furnishings etc. Free coffee in lobby, breakfast, fitness area, all in good condition. BEds were confortable, and showers, tvs etc all new. The location is a block to macys/herald square subway. Lots of options for food within 50 feet of hotel. Staff were also very nice and helpful. If I was on my own budget I will stay here again.

This NYC hotel was tidy, well organized and had a great breakfast and coffee service. The staff was great and we couldn't have done better with the location. Subway stops are easy for both the east and west side. The price, for the area, is quite reasonable and they accommodated our family of four with out any additional charges that we noticed for other hotels.

I stayed at the Best Western Herald Square for a weekend getaway with friends. Location is perfect - located in midtown, a couple blocks from the empire state building, and the train station. The rooms are standard New York Size rooms. Rooms are spotless and brand new. Great artwork is displayed throughout the rooms and hallways. Staff was wonderful and helpful with all our needs. Free wifi and Free continental breakfast were a plus as most hotels in New York charge for these amenities. I highly recommend this place and suggest staying hear while visiting New York

This was the first time in New York City. We enjoyed our stay at BEST WESTERN PREMIER Herald Square. It is brand new only been open about 2 months. And the price is very reasonable. And 2 parking garages in the same block. Short walking to most attractions.

This hotel was in a great location. The room were very small. This hotel didn't have any room with bathtubs. not ideel if travelling with small kids or babies. I requested a mini fridge and that could not be arranged also. the bathroom was dirty and so was the carpets. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was okay. the sitting area was too small and very crowded.

We arrived in the evening and were greeted warmly. There is free tea and coffee in the lobby.The room was not huge but perfectly adequate for our one night stay.It reminded us of a cruise ship cabin, small but efficient. Great location near Herald Square and Macy's of 34th street fame.TV has LOTS of channels. WIFI was free.In the morning the complimentary breakfast was wonderful. Everything you could possible want. At check out the personnel were quite helpful. Gave us excellent advice about how to get to our next destination. We were going to take a taxi, but they told us it was only an 8 min. walk. With Park Ave. closed for a Marathon it was an easy walk.The price of the hotel varies greatly. We got an excellent value, and had a great time. Location was excellent, room was great, and everyone was super friendly.

This hotel is in a great location and is a real value compared to other hotels in the area; a bonus is that it's new and very clean. They offer a complimentary breakfast with hot food as well as the typical continental menu. The staff was friendly and polite. A subway station is only a block away, next to Macy's. Other conveniences are the nearby restaurants and a pharmacy around the corner.

Great value for the area. Breakfast was outstanding for being free. ALL the staff are happy to help with whatever you need. Area is very convenient, although typical NY in terms of hustle and bustle. Subway is a block away, and lots to see within walking distance.

Great place to call home when visiting NYC, close to everything. The rooms are small, but most rooms in NYC are. A full breakfast was included, which is uncommon, and the location is in the heart of NYC! The price we paid for the rooms were in the average range, but again the location was excellent. They have no concierge, but the front desk went out of their way to answer every question that we had about the hotel and the City as well!! Will stay there again next time we are in NYC!!

We stayed there for 4 nights and the room was great but somewhere in the hotel was smoking and it came through the ventilation system. Also, a guest on my floor came back around 3 AM and started yelling at the top of her lungs, "I can't get into my room!" over and over again. I know this isn't the hotel's fault, but it still doesn't leave a good taste in my mouth. I probably won't stay there again.

Great and friendly staff, good rooms and great location. Great value for the price. The parking (just 30 yards away) is a bonus for people who drive in to the city. Overall, a very pleasant stay (special kudos to staff such as Jatinder, Yvonne, Mustafa and Sade).

We stayed 6 nights with young kids and and older parent. This is a great value! The hotel can't be beat for location and the friendly staff (e.g. Yvonne, Mustafa and Sade). Rooms aren't big, (but you don't go to NYC to stay in your room) but they're very clean, new and the beds are very comfortable. A big bonus was the very nearby parking (with special rates fro hotel guests) which is exceptionally important for those who arrive by auto. We've found a new "go-to" place to stay in New York City now! Thanks again!

We were a party of seven sharing 2 rooms (4 adults and 3 Kids)...we stayed 3 nights. I really wanted to make a wise choice about our hotel..my #1 priority was cleanliness...and I was not disappointed! The cleaning staff was great...even knocked on our door to make sure we didn't need anything else....that's another great thing about this hotel...everyone was always making sure that our stay was going well...from the front desk to the wonderful duo at breakfast and themanager organizing transportation....the staff is fantastic! This is not a high class, super deluxe, top of the line hotel, but if you are looking for a nice, clean, friendly, quiet and safe place to rest your head at night...this is it!!!! Walking distance to everywhere...a few minutes to Times' Square...great restaurants...we had a blast!!!!! Thank u!

We stayed 4 nights in this new property and were so glad we did! The room was big enough for our family of 4 -- we were only there to get a little rest and to sleep anyway -- it was very clean and nicely decorated. The beds were very comfortable. Breakfast was included and was really quite good. The highest praise for the staff. Everyone from the front desk staff to the bellman to the housekeeping staff were helpful, friendly and courteous. Can't say enough about how great our stay was. Hotel is in a great location for access to the subway, and there are a lot of local attractions you can walk to. Would love to visit again!

We stayed 4 nights in two rooms with young kids and elderly parents and have nothing but lavish praises for the hotel and staff!! The property is spanking new and an exceptional value for the money. The breakfast buffet is excellent with very helpful and smiling servers. The perfect way to start a morning when away from home!The location could not be better with easy access to metro and attractions. I highly recommend using the front desk to arrange for transporation to EWR or other airports, the hotel has negotiated great no hassle rates with local transportation companies. No doubt that we will stay here again when visiting NY. Overall, we are highly impressed with the new Premier chain of Best Western Hotels and hope that they continue to expand to more cities. Cons - No on-site restaurant, however availability of nearby restaurants and restaurants offering delivery services make up for this. There is only one drinking water dispenser which is located on the lower level, I think the hotel needs a couple more drinking water fountains on the upper levels.

This hotel was opened just 4/5 weeks ago. We had a room on the 14th floor, floor to celling windows,good view of 36th street below. The hotel is between 5th & 6th avenue, so very easy walking for mid town attractions. Very comfortable NEW beds and furniture. Highly recommended and very good value. Will stay again when visiting the Big Apple. :-)

My daughter and i enjoyed our stay at this hotel in July. I felt welcomed from the time I arrived until the time I checked out. The room was small, typical of NYC, but was very clean and everything was new. There wasn't a fridge or microwave in the room, but we didn't seem to need it. I didn't have the breakfast buffet because i don't like to get up early while on vacation, but one was available for free. The room had very decent toiletries and a hairdryer available. I loved the larger sized bath soap and rose scented lotion. You are within walking distance of the shopping on 5th Ave, and a short walk to Broadway and Times Square. There are several Metro stations also withing walking distance. Many eating options are available within the area to include a McDonald's. I will gladly stay here again if I return to the area.

This place exceeded my expectations. We stayed for 6 days and after reading so many reviews about the small room sizes in NY i was pleasantly surprised. We stayed in a king room, it was a decent size with a good sized bathroom, the bed was also very comfortable. It's so close to Macy's, the metro and so much more. The only downsize was where they serve breakfast. There is not enough seating so we had to take our breakfast back to our room at times. Also you can't serve yourself you have to wait to be served which slows things down. Other than that everything was great, would definitely stay again

I've been enamored by the huge 300+room NY hotels since I was a kid. I don't think I'll stay anywhere else after experiencing such a perfect boutique hotel. The new Best Western in Herald Square is going to be the best kept secret in NY! They did a perfect job planning and executing this property. PERFECT. Everything you need and want. FREE WI-FI sure. But the small hotel means NO WAITING for elevators and we always seemed to be the only ones in the elevator! The room was tastefully decorated with very contemporary finishes. Clean functional bathroom with a huge shower. Exercise room in the basement and a VERY NICE breakfast room with generous HOT breakfast included -- not just a simple continental breakfast. Just a few steps away from the front desk is a cozy cocktail lounge with plans for patio seating through the French doors.But remember the real hotel value when you're on the move visiting New York City: you can get to your room quickly. You can get from your room back out on the street QUICKLY!heart of the garment district. Great location.Mustafa and Laura at the front desk! Thank you both for taking such good care of us!

Visited New York City for 4 days. This hotel was in a great location 10 minute walk to Times Square. Rooms were small but very clean.....king size bed very comfortable. Good continental breakfast. Would highly recommend this hotel for a stay in New York.

This hotel was amazing! The cleanest rooms we've been to in NYC! Rooms a little on the small side for a family of 4 but who cares, we were only there to rest and sleep. Location was amazing, close to everything! Staff was friendly and able to accommodate for what we asked for. Plugs in room for phones and iPods! Breakfast and Wi-Fi included...perfect! Thank you for such a great experience. We would definitely go back for another stay!

We stayed in this hotel for two nights. We were very pleased with everything. The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The price was good for NYC! The breakfast was very nice and the workers there were also kind and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone!!! :)

This hotel is new. Very clean, elevators fast and breakfast included. We had a room facing 36th St. Very quiet, parking garage 2 min walk away. Great location in the fashion district 10 min walk to Times Square. Felt safe walking even a night. Coffee and tea in lobby always available. Not much tourist information available ie a map. They had a touch screen computer in lobby and some coupons for various attractions. No tourist info in the rooms though. Smaller room but standard for New York. Overall, great hotel stay!

Rooms on small side, but cozy and you can move around comfortably. They are well appointed, fast free Internet. Staff is accommodating, some hallways noise being heard nut not terrible at this point.
