Hotel is situated in a quieter part of herald sq yet close to the action. It's not the ritz, but I'd consider staying here instead if I was perfectly happy with just a little less space! Recommend

Everything about this hotel was great! The room was a bit tight for 4 of us but the beds were comfortable and everything was clean. The breakfast was perfect and the hotel staff were very friendly and accomodating. They had a room for us to store our luggage after check-out so we could enjoy our last day to the fullest. I would definitely return.

After staying in many hotels in New York City , I found that this hotel to be one of the nicest! The rooms are clean, the location is great, and the staff goes out of their way to be helpful. The breakfast room was slightly crowded and not set up in the most convenient way, but the food was good and more than adequate.

This hotel was clean, quiet, welcoming, and in a fantastic location just a few blocks from Grand Central Station. Breakfast was plentiful with lots of variety. They could use better signage coming from the east, so keep an eye out for it. It's the best place I've stayed in Manhattan.

Staff were excellent. Hotel was super clean Bathrooms are very nice. Shower was excellent Breakfast was nice. Location of hotel was perfect for us. Erin at the front desk and the door bellman were very helpful and courteous

We can't say enough wonderful things about our recent experience with Best Western Herald Square! From the time we walked into the lobby to check in, to the time we checked out- the staff went above and beyond to make our stay a very pleasant one! Our room was perfect, nice to come back to after long, hot days seeing the city. Close to great restaurants and a pharmacy. No bathtub for those with young ones used to baths, fortunately our 2 yr. old adapted to showers. Comfy beds, no fridge so you have to make do- we had medicine that needed to be kept cold, so we put it in ice bucket...ice machine is on lowest floor, we were on the 14th floor. We will definitely stay here again...great job Best Western!

Stayed at Best Western Premier Herald Square in July 2013. The location of the hotel is superb with adequate amenities for a business traveller. If you are lucky you could get a room with a view of the Empire State Building which is quite nearby. All major transport hubs are easy to reach by walk from the hotel. The location also has a number of eating options. Recommend this one anytime.

the hotel room was nice, a little small but ok, no refrigerator, but access to wifi. So no complain, I had a good time, the stuff was really friendly and helpful. The breakfast has been changed, and they had good coffee, the waitress was great and the cook also, all real friendly, we were on the 4 th floor, the hotel is located not to far from Broadway, really convenient

I recently stayed at the Best Western Premier Herald Square on business. Fortuitously, I snagged a very favorable rate, which led me to choose the hotel. It was also convenient to my business meetings in Times Square, though I must say that the walk in 90 degree heat and 90% humidity was daunting.My room was small--typical New York size--but had all of the amenities. Free wi fie is provided and the desk has ample outlets. There are also outlets by the two nightstands. I mention that because I cannot tell you how many times I have been in hotels, including grand ones, when finding a free outlet for a computer, cellphone or appliance proved a challenge. The bath was actually nice sized with very nice amenities, e.g., excellent shampoo and conditioner, mouthwash, body lotion and--to my delight--a decent sized bar of soap, not the ones that are so thin they are hard to handle.The heat was scorching, so I welcomed the excellent air conditioning which kept the room pleasantly cool. It is controlled by a thermostat on the wall, always a welcome change from the window units or the heat pump like units controlled at the unit.Breakfast is included and that, too, was a delightful surprise. There were two attentive staff members to serve the bacon, sausage, eggss, breakfast potatoes and wide variety of sweet rolls. There is also a small fitness center on the lower level with the breakfast room.The location is terrific. It is a short walk to Times Square, over the the Empire State Building and that general area, and to several other neighborhoods. On the other hand, the subway is a stone's throw away, so all of New York is at your doorstep.Like most New York hotels, rate vary widely from day to ay. When I sought to return to the hotel on a return business visit, I found the price double what I had paid the first time. Prices always reflect, I think, supply and demand, season, events, etc. However, I would certainly hope to snag another favorable rate and return to the best Western Premier at Herald Square at some point. I highly recommend it.

This is a great hotel to stay while in NYC. It is clean, New, modern, comfortable, Centrally located, Near subway stations, Friendly customer service. Free breakfast seals the deal and the cold air conditioning makes it a great respite from the heat

Recently my daughter and I took a trip to New York City as a graduation gift. I looked at several hotels and chose Best Western because my previous experiences at BW have been positive. Initially, at check-in, I was put off by what seemed to be an unfriendly welcome and mentioned it to my daughter, who agreed. Our first night was long as we were constantly awakened by a noise in the A/C. In the morning I mentioned it to the front desk and it was attended to immediately. The rest of our stay was wonderful and the staff proved to be friendly and helpful. This hotel was clean and we really enjoyed our stay!!

We had occasion to stay for 4 nights in this hotel during a very hot, hot week in NYC. We were delighted with the accommodations, the value, the newness of the hotel, the location and the service. We would definitely stay here during future trips. It is a few minutes walk to subway lines, Macy's, Times Square, 5th Avenue, Bryant Park, Empire State Building. The rooms aren't large but they are very well appointed with comfortable beds. The complimentary hot breakfast and coffee available in the lobby all the time was a very nice addition.

This hotel just opened in early 2013 and is almost new. As a result, the rooms are are clean and everything (furniture fixtures, etc) are new. The hotel is well located and there is a Starbucks, McDonalds, and drug store within one block. The nearest subway station and bus stop are also within close walking distance. The hotel is just a few blocks from Penn Station and you can walk there in only a few minutes (very handy if you are flying in or out of Newark Airport). The only downside to the hotel was noise. Although my room was on the 12th floor, there was still a great deal of traffic noise well into the early morning hours. Also, the walls between the rooms are not well soundproofed.

Location Location! This hotel was perfectly located a block from all things NYC. So close to Macys, Times Square, Victoria Secret, only a short walk to 5th Ave, Central Park etc etc. Will definitely be staying here again. Basic breakfast included, clean modern rooms with great wifi. Only fault was no laundry like most Best Westerns standardly have. Helpful staff will hold luggage in between check out and in.

I have stayed at multiple Best Western's over the years in NYC, but this has got to be one of the best... why? great location in Times Square, decent parking for the car on the weekend, Staff really polite and are all genuinely interested in your comfort and enjoyment while here. It feels more like a boutique hotel experience than a major chain experience. Free WiFi in room and an iPhone AM FM clock radio to charge up my phone at night is handy. Room size is typical of NYC for a queen size room - ask for a room in the back and higher level and you'll hear zero sounds, yup, zero...

Friendly staff , great location close to NYC subway and waking distance to Times Square . Clean rooms . Just off broadway and very close to some good shopping . Hot breakfast buffet was served complimentary . It is also a 10 minute walk to the Amtrack station , from there we headed to Toronto .

Hotel is brand new. Room is small but uses space super efficiently. View of street from window. The bed was great, firm but not hard. Very, very clean. Close to subway and lots of tourist stuff. We really enjoyed our stay here. The staff was very helpful, courteous and professional. Breakfast was a buffet with eggs, hash browns, bacon/ sausage served hot. Other items were self serve - cereals/breads/pastries. Nice variety. NYC was having a heat wave while we were here and our room's air conditioning worked great!!!! Room was spotless. There was a lounge on site. Only one downside ... you can really hear the doors closing as people come and go. But, HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

I booked this hotel based on the many positive reviews. The reviews were accurate and well-deserved! We stayed one night on July 2. As noted, the hotel is in a fabulous location, but was a bit hard to find - it's wedged in between a Hyatt and Holiday Inn Express - and we had to drive around the block again during rush-hour b/c we passed it. The front desk attendants and valet were very helpful in getting us checked in. Discounted parking was available on the same block. The hotel is only a couple months old and everything is new and clean with a modern, hip décor. Each floor only had 6 rooms and though ours was by the elevator, it was very quiet. Free WiFi and a full hot/cold breakfast were much appreciated. The staff was great!!! Frank was very helpful with advice, subway directions and even looked up the traffic report to alert us of any delays as we were leaving the city the next day. We had no problems, a very pleasant stay and will return to this hotel for our next trip to NYC.

First, let me just say that this is a beautiful hotel with very classy accomodations. Just a great place to spend a night or two in Midtown.We traveled to NYC from North Carolina and spent one night here and were planning on spending the next two nights at a hotel in Brooklyn. Long story short: the hotel in Brooklyn was a dump and we deperately wanted to get back to the Best Western in Midtown.Fortunately, there was a room available and the staff was very welcoming in our return. Frank, in particular, was incredibly helpful in getting us into a room sooner than we expected.Thanks to them for their hospitality. You can feel very secure staying here. It's a great hotel in a great NYC spot!

We stayed here b/c we got a great deal on Hotels.com. It was only $110 a night. We stayed 3 nights. For the price we paid we were very pleased. It is very new so everything is nice and clean and bright. The décor is hip. The pictures are accurate. Breakfast wasn't much to brag about but it was free. If you drive there is a parking lot a few doors down. They give you a coupon for $35 a day. The address numbers are hard to find but it's right next to the Hyatt and Holiday Day Inn Express. The rooms were small but from what I understand all rooms in New York are.

I came for just a night, but would have loved to stay longer. The room was clean, and since the hotel was just built, everything was brand new. Although small, the size was very average for an NYC hotel. The decor was very modern and seamless.The staff was friendly and courteous. Free wireless in-room? That's just the icing on top of the cake.I had no issues, and although I used Best Western Rewards points to pay for my stay, I would happily have paid my own money to stay. The rates seemed very reasonable for the great location and hotel quality. I love Herald Square and the surrounding area (great shopping and not too far from the theatre district)! I was very impressed, and I will most certainly be back on my next trip to the city.

This was my first trip to New York, and I was impressed with the new, clean feeling of the hotel! Friendly staff, especially the blonde lady who checked us out. The room we had was quite small, probably typical for NYC, but clean, clean, clean!!! Loved the decor! The only issue we had, which was small but notable, was that we did not have toilet paper or tissues in the room when we checked in. But to be fair, we did check In early. I did notify the front desk when we headed out to explore the city, although they did put any in our room. I had to call down to have some brought up. But like I said, minor! I would highly recommend this hotel, especially for those who have not been to NYC before. It is very close to Time square and we walked almost everywhere. We did take one of the city tour buses to get around to the lower part of manhattan. I would totally stay here again!

I stayed here on business last week and was just plain impressed. I loved the staff, the location, and the hotel itself. The room was spotless and perfectly sized for a single traveling to the city. Their Wi-Fi was strong enough for me to work seamlessly throughout the hotel. And when work was over, I could visit my favorite store, Macy's but more importantly, I was able to find dining opportunities all around.

My wife and I visited New York City earlier this month (June 2013). It was our first time visiting and we were concerned...very concerned...about where to stay and whether we would be wasting our precious vacation time by staying at a hotel that was far from everything. So we decided to try the Best Western Premier HERALD SQUARE. It was by far the most ideal location we could have stayed at...and I am confirming it in retrospect through this review.As you may know, NYC is an old city with very expensive real estate...including hotel stays that are costly on a nightly basis. It is not uncommon to pay a minimum of $250/night...and that at an average hotel. What sets this hotel apart from other hotels including other BW's in NYC is that the the BW Herald Square is a BRAND NEW HOTEL...just opened its doors in mid-May 2013!! This means that all the rooms and furniture and bedding is new...and it was!!! It was fabulous!!! NYC being an old city with old real estate you will be staying in worn out and tired rooms unless you fork over $800+ a night. As an experiment I checked out the rates at a hotel only 2 minutes walking distance from this hotel: they were charging $450++ per night!!!! And it was a similar class/standard but was NOT a brand new hotel.As for location, we took the M60 bus from Laguardia airport (bought a 7 day pass for $30 at the airport) to Astoria stop, then hopped on the N train which took us to Herald Square station. The Best Western Herald Square was a 2 minute walk!!! We were so happy! It gets even better. The Herald Square station also has several other trains that pass through it giving you great access to so many different parts of NYC...with Times Square only ONE STOP away!!! You just cannot beat that!!! Have fun in NYC when you stay at this hotel.And lastly...the hotel staff is superb!! Kudos and many thanks to Mustafah, the hotel manager who made us feel so welcome and ensured we enjoyed our stay. And finally I would say that if you are a fan of the BW chain...THIS is the one to stay at when you visit NYC.

I was in NYC for business in June. The BWP was an ideal location as I did not want to rent a car. With meetings in Times Square, SOHO, Midtown West, the hotel's location allowed for easy access to all whether by foot or cab. The hotel was new and so everything was in great condition. I was impressed with the free internet (which worked wonderfully) and that the TV remote was bagged and noted as a clean remote. If you read about the dirtest spots in your hotel room, this was nice. The room was quiet. On the downside, it was a bit small, but then again it did have two beds. Also I could not get the room's temp below 67. I prefer it to be colder when I sleep. The other thing that struck me odd, was that breakfast was offered to 10:00, but the first day I was there it was shut down at 9:30. Breakfast is awesome - scrambled eggs, sausage (link and patty) bacon, potatoes, cereals, bagels, yogurts, etc. The hotel is a bargin for what you get. I look forward to my next stay.

We stayed in this hotel the week after it opened, for an introductory price (half of the going rate in Manhattan for similar hotels); at the time there were no reviews to be found anywhere online. Although we expected some minor kinks that would need to be worked out, we were positively surprised: other than some minor issues with the wifi we had no problems at all.The room was very small but practical, and the windows did a great job keeping the noise outside. (It probably also helped that we got a room close to the top floor.) All the basics are covered: usual BW breakfast and wifi in the room are included, coffee machine in the room.Since the hotel is brand new, everything is neat, clean, and bug-free. The staff was friendly and helpful, too. The location can hardly be beat. Unless they become as expensive as fancier places, this will remain to be a great place to stay in Manhattan for a while.

Location, location location...Booked online last minute as we wanted to go to NYC for a night. I wasn't expecting to find such a great location at this low price. (I expect the price to rise as the hotel will get more popular for sure)The Staff was super friendly and helpful, too bad i can't remember their names, everything was clean and fresh. I even wondered if the towels in the room were on their first use. Room is a bit under the standard room size, however it didn't feel too small with the nice big windows.The only thing, which i'm pretty sure it is fixed by now, i would have love to have chairs and tables on the small terrace in front of the hotel.Will go again if the price stays right.

I booked this hotel before it was open so I was a little nervous about what to expect. This is a new building and you can tell it's new inside as well. Front desk staff couldn't have been more helpful from the time we arrived till the time we left. Every morning they asked if we needed help for anything as we were leaving, did we need directions, subway routes, etc.The room wasn't big but then I didn't expect it to be after all I'd read about hotel rooms in NY. It was plenty big and there was room on each side of the king size bed. The closet is really small, like twice the size of a locker, so don't plan on hanging a lot of clothes. Our room was on the 14th floor and faced 36th Street. We had a great view of the Chrysler Bldg and all the happenings along the street. It was really quiet, could hear very little street noise, not sure if it's like that on lower level rooms.The hotel is advertised as being in Herald Square. It is right at Herald Square but the sign on the street said Fashion District. There are plenty of places to eat right around the hotel if you don't feel like walking far. Yes, there is a huge, free, continental breakfast. However, the pricing shows the cost is $10.99. I was told they were doing it free as an introductory special. I wouldn't pay that much to eat the breakfast but for free it was great. A couple of doors down is a brand new place called Pure Fresh. They offer all meals and have a great selection. It's super clean inside as they just opened.The hotel will store your luggage for you if you have a later flight than checkout. No, there isn't bottled water in the rooms but I'm not sure why you'd need it. The tap water tasted good and is safe to drink. There is also coffee, tea, and ice water in the front lobby at all times. There is a desktop computer and printer in the basement. Worked out great to be able to print boarding passes, etc. since I didn't bring my laptop. There is free wifi throughout the hotel as well.

The staff were friendly, helpful and assisted me to find my way. The location is only about 10 minutes from Times Square and subway is close. I booked last minute and got a great rate. Rooms were adequate size for NYC and very clean. Will be happy to return.

I was amazed at how quiet it was and comfortable. It was really easy to get around from this location and the hotel did a great job. The rooms are small like many in NYC but very functional and as it is a new place, exceptionally clean. My only recommendation is to provide bottled water in the guest rooms. I am a Rewards member and really missed that!

Great experience. New, clean. good location. Huge complimentary breakfast. Stayed here with teenaged grandchildren who managed to lock us out of one of the rooms. Laura and Mustafa at the front desk were friendly and very helpful. I did not think it was possible to stay somewhere this nice for the money. Best deal in Manhattan. Try it!

Booked at the last minute and was pleasantly surprised to find a new hotel (three weeks) with everything working,free continental hot breakfast, and two double beds in a great location. Two families in a party of seven was able to travel with relative ease around the city. We stayed 4 nights. Staff very friendly and helpful, with a smile every morning. Everything said earlier was very true, from the small but everything-new rooms to the quiet ac units. Free Internet made it very convenient for the kids to connect to friends back home at night. The linens are so clean and new that is amazing. And the staff is always wanting to help.Our great vacation was a success thanks to this excellent hotelWill look for this property next time I stay in NYC.

Hotel that is new and clean, nice room. Not noisy.Ideally located.Coffee is free at any time. No fridge in the room = less noise.A/C working with a reasonable noise.Location is VERY convenient, between 5th and 6th av.Penn Station at 34st nearby, Empire State next street, NYC bike rental nearby.Reasonable price. Nice people working there. If I have to go back to NYC, sure, I will go there.

This hotel is BRAND NEW which was a positive and negative. On the positive, everything is new, clean and fresh. On the negative, there were still some little things here and there which were missing (outlet coverings). There are two elevators but only one was working the day we were there. We got an excellent price on the hotel and it was larger than a previous hotel we had stayed at in NYC. It is in close proximity to Times Square which was nice and also close to the subway.

Stayed at the new Best Western Herald Square for 3 nights over the weekend. This was my 11th trip to New York City . I usually stay at Thompson Hotels. However, this time, with a great Grand Opening rate, I chose Best Western. Hotel had been open for 2 weeks so everything was new. Some parts of the hotel were not yet open such as the main floor bar & patio. There is also talk of a rooftop patio in the future. The hotel is a new build hotel just around the corner from Herald Square and 6 subway lines. Times Square is a 15 minute walk away; Empire State Building is a 10 minute walk.The Staff were very friendly and accommodating. I was in town the night before for dinner and dropped by and asked if I could see the rooms since there were no photos on the website. The head of housekeeping was proud to show off her hotel. So I got to see most of the room types: They have king rooms; double queens and on the top 2 or 3 floors a larger King room in the same space as the double queens room so much more roomy looking out onto 36th Street. There are 94 rooms on 17 floors so only 6 rooms per floor. The hotel has a small gym with weights; a walking machine, an elliptical and I think a fixed bicycle with a water cooler and towels. It’s on the same floor as the business center – which is just a single desktop in a cubbyhole – next to the breakfast area.Breakfast is included. You have a choice of cereals; bread; bagels; a toaster; bacon; sausage; scrambled eggs; oatmeal; coffee; tea; juices; yogurt. I requested a high floor with a view and received room 1505. The room comes with a great view of the Empire State Building. If you want that view I think you’d have to be on the 14th floor or higher in rooms ending in 04; 05 or 06. However, rooms ending in 01; 02 or 03 have floor-to-ceiling windows. The room is quite small but I’ve seen smaller in New York. However, the room has most things that you need. There is a large flat screen TV (with a genius remote control that gets cleaned every change of client); an iHome Clock Radio with iphone 4 connection; a safe; ironing board/Iron; about 8 hanger in a fairly small closet (we had to take out the ironing board to fully use the closet); and 3 drawers that can be used for storage. There is also a small desk and coffee maker in the room. Bedding was very comfortable but the bed did seems a little shorter than my bed at home (I'm 6' 3"). Towels in the bathroom were surprisingly soft for a budget hotel.The bathroom is also quite small but well laid out with a shower with glass door instead of the usual tub. This is great as those hotel tub curtains always give me the heebee-geebees. There is not much storage room in the bathroom so you end up leaving a lot of your toiletries in the room itself. Bathroom had no fan which is a pity as it’s good for hiding noise when using the bathroom. Fairly nice toiletries were included along with enough towels. There was also a shaving mirror.Rooms seem very quiet to outside noise and we didn’t hear our neighbors except for slamming of doors in the morning. However, with only 6 rooms per floor – we had a fairly quiet time in the rooms. Rooms 04; 05 and 06 are away from the elevators as well so less noise there as well.Climate control is individually operated in each hotel room which is also good.Both the room and bathroom were immaculately clean.There is no minibar in the room nor is there room service but there is a takeout menu for the Keg Room – an upscale Irish Pub directly across the street.Overall we had a great stay with a couple of hiccups - both of which I reported and both which the front desk staff tried to resolve quickly. For 2 of the days we came back to the room by 5pm and the room wasn’t made up but we left for another hour and the room was completed. Also, one day the safe did not work and we had a repair guy there within 10 minutes. Overall, I’d put these down to growing pains with a new hotel and don’t really think it’s endemic. Front Desk asked us about the issues when we left and made notes on it. One more thing - you can store your bags if you aren't heading directly out of the city. I’d certainly stay here again if the same great rate that I received. If the rate is similar to hotels with bigger and clean rooms then I'd probably reconsider.

We booked in the day after opening and we are still here. This new hotel is perfect in all ways. Excellent location to subway, attractions, 6 block walk to Times Sq. Empire State Building we look at out our window just one block walk away. The room is brand new so what can I say it is good size, beautiful, and quiet. The staff are very polite,courteous, friendly and helpful. It's a bonus to get breakfast included as this is not standard in NY. We have an excellent maid Martha, as well as the rest of the housekeeping staff. Also, the lady who takes care of breakfast is very polite and accommodating. I must also add Frank at the front desk is funny and a very happy man, who takes care of his guests. We leave in 2 days and will highly recommend this perfect hotel to all.

Over the course of four years, we've stayed in NYC many time. Truly, this definitely exceeded our expectations not only in the size of the room (it was larger than most), but also in the courteousness of the staff. Thank you!

Had to make a last minute trip to NYC for business and was blown away at the new Best Western Premier in Herald Square. Aside from great location and a generously sized, immaculate room, the staff was super accommodating and friendly. If you are looking for a high quality place to stay in the heart of NYC, I highly recommend the BW Premier in Herald Square. They even had a great breakfast included in my rate, to boot!
